reviews.review: Great experience!. This course really exceeded our expectations, was more than just a cookery school, it was an entire day's entertainment! The food we made was the best we had during our trip! If you are looking for a fun, relaxed day trip with a bit of cooking thrown in- look no further. Email communication with Michel was very easy any replies were prompt. Cannot recommend highly enough- thank you again!!

What an enjoyable day!. I see this is redundant, vis a vis other reviews, but it is accurate! This is really a great day trip. From first communication to drop off at end of day, everything was easy. learned a lot. ate a lot of very good food. laughed a lot. this is a perfect day. don't hesitate.

Great experience. Great experience not to miss. Lovely people, they receive you, you have fun and at the end you eat great home made food and you know how to make it. This course is a way to taste real morocco.

Bloomin' Brilliant Day. Such Fun! We had a great day - being ably looked after and shown how to enjoy local cuisine with Ilham and Michel.We thought it was great value for money for 550D each - which basically includes everything for the day. Michel's sense of humour is ........ interesting (but he is French!) ( I can see him smirking at that comment! LOL) - but seriously - He and Ilham are the perfect hosts and couldn't have done more to make us feel at home and they really cared that we had a super day. Take a few Dirham with you as there is a little shop with good prices and interesting things. We really enjoyed this day and would say that it is a 'must do' for anyone who enjoys cooking or eating food.

A must do if you are looking to have fun and be relaxed. Great accessibility, driver came to us and dropped us off at the location (lovely farm) and brought us back when done.The class was very relaxed, informal and very fun. The environment was very pleasant and relaxing (nice contrast to the busy city centre)Had a fantastic time at this cooking class, definitely a memory that I will cherish forever. Thank you for making it such a fantastic experience.

Great day.. Have come home with a recipe for tagine of beef with pears and candied oranges that I will definitely use. The teaching was doing in a very relaxed informal way which was great fun. The spice workshop was really interesting - albeit highlighting how poor my sense of smell is! Best of all was eating the product of our e endeavours. It was a great day away from the frenetic pace of the medina and I would highly recommend it.
Fantastic day cooking and fun. Beautifull and quiet location just outside Marrakesh. What a gfantastic educational day with loads of fun.Will come back !

Great cooking class. This class was extremely enjoyable. Michel and Ilham provided such a pleasant environment. I learned so much in such a short time. Definitely add this class to your Marrakech to-do list!

moroccan cooking school just outside marrakech. We booked online from home, transport was organised and worked seamlessly, picking us up close to our riad in the medina.Michelle was an excellent host, the day was well planned, informative and fun. The cooking was really well demonstrated and instructions easy to follow, the equipment was good and everything was so well prepared for us that I wish I had this service in my kitchen at home!We were served coffee, juices & snacks throughout the day and then sat down to eat the results of our labours at the end - really good day.

Perferct Day - Cooking Class and Hamman. I booked the cooking class and hamman/massage package and it was just the perfect ending to my Marrakesh holiday. You learn a lot, eat gradually over the day, its very social, well run and heading to the spa post the class was just perfect. Highly reccommended.

Awesome Experience!!. I absolutely loved the experience here. While I do cook at home, this was my first formal cooking class. I decided to book it since I thought it would be really fun and saw that it had great reviews. It was a full day experience from 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM. We were conveniently picked up at a location near our Riad. Along the way they picked up a few others. In total there were about 7 people in the class so it was a perfect size to get the attention and assistance from the two teachers. We switched from cooking our tangine to sitting, listening to Michel's talks and scent-testing various spices to watching demonstrations from Dhlam (the actual instructor for cooking) at the bar on how to make salads and this Moroccan crepe that was to die for.My boyfriend (who absolutely does not cook) took this class with me and successfully made his couscous and tangine. I was actually quite impressed.The instructors are very funny and approachable and made it a very fun and relaxed environment. It kind of felt like we were invited to a couple of friend's home to learn to cook.At the end of the day of cooking we sat together and enjoyed our meal along with the salads and desserts they made. Michel was great with sharing his stories of cooking and food. The actual instructor and demonstrator Dlham was lovely. I had this tea at my Riad that tasted so good so I asked her about it and she shared great tips with me on how to prepare green tea the Moroccan way when everyone was taking a break.I would highly recommend this experience to anyone who remotely enjoys cooking and learning in a relaxed fun environment.

Great Cooking Class. We did a tajine with beef, carrots and almonds. Also we learned how to do the typical morrocan bread and three different types of marrocan salads. The place is quite a bit outside the city (45 Minutes drive). Someone from the Cooking school picked us up and drove us there. The place itself is nice and everyone had his/her one cooking spot. Michel (the french owner) did some kind of quiz with us so that we had the chance to learn about local herbs and spices. Also he shared with us his special tipps for buying herbs and to detect counterfeits.At the end we enjoyed our self-made meal and had the chance to asked Michel and the chef of the kitchen (sorry I don't know her name) questions about Marrocan food and culture. Afterwards Michel sent us the recipes via mail so that we are now looking forward to try our luck with Morrocan food in Germany.

Best authentic Moroccan cooking experience!. Just got back from Morocco and had the best experience with this cooking class in Marrakesh. From the beautiful little farm that their place is on to the authentic couscous that we cooked, everything was wonderful. We learned a bunch about spices throughout Morocco and how to tell the fakes on Saffron and Argon oil. This particular class was intensive as it took over 3 hours to cook the couscous meal but well worth it all! Soo delicious along with the homemade breads and salads we made as well. Cannot say enough about Michel's commentary...he is hilarious and makes the experience that much better! Book this course and you will not regret it at all.

Brilliant taste of Marrakech. A great cooking class in Marrakech. My wife and I booked the trip whilst we were in Marrakech and had such a good time. The owners are really friendly and funny and it was such a good experience. I'd recommend this class to anyone. Along the way to the farm house you see quite a few things you wouldn't normally see. The farm house is in the lovely countryside. We made lamb taglines and bread and saw how they made salad and had some nice morrocan tea. The owners were very friendly and knowledgeable. My wife and I would love to come back if we ever cam back to Marrakech again.

Lovely experience. My boyfriend and I attended this cooking class and we had loads of fun. Michel and the other lady leading the class were both very kind and so helpful. I would suggest this to anyone visiting Marrakech as it was only a short drive from the square. We made some delicious food and learnt really great techniques. The day was extensive, including talking about spices, tutorials on how to make different salads, making bread and making a tagine. We also received a small bag of spices and Michel has emailed some recipes to us, both these things were complimentary. We also had photos taken during the day which were sent to us which was also very nice. Thank you for having us! Charlotte and Ryan

Amazing and tasty!. Our day started at 9:45 with a pick up near our hotel. It was maybe a 20 minute ride outside the city. We arrived, enjoyed mint tea and a chat, and started our cooking. We went on Friday, so it was seven-vegetable couscous. We started preparing the vegetables and the couscous. Each of us had our own station to work from. Then we watched as our wonderful instructor Iylha demonstrated how to make bread and two kinds of Morrocan salads. The couscous takes a lot of time to cook, so in between steps, Michel would teach us about different spices. It was great because we learned how to identify real saffron. We also made a delicious Moroccan crepe for desert. After we were finished cooking, we enjoyed our meal together. It was an absolutely lovely day! We got back to the city around 4:15 (which I'm including because we really wanted to know before we booked).

Excellent programme!. We can't cook but we do it! So don't hesitate if you can't cook too. Everything is easy and a beautiful nice lady show first everything. The pick up was arrive in time, Michel welcomes us, he is very funny and gives much information about the spices and the marrocan dishes. And everything. Really. It is started at 10 o clock and finished at 15 o clock. But there is no time to boring. The place is good, everything is clear, after one meal the employes come and clean everything, its perfect. They give water and fresh orange juice all the day, we don't know that and bring water, its totally unnecessary.

Fantastic. A fantastic cooking class, hosted by a great (and very patient) team.I enquired about this class by emailing Michel, and completed reservations for my wife, two young daughters, and myself, having gone through the weekly schedule received, and selecting one of the different main dishes on offer daily (the least technical, as my youngest daughter is 4).We were picked up from our accommodation at around 09:30, and arrived at their premises an hour or so later. The class, which included the preparation of Moroccan bread (batbout), a main dish (tajine of chicken with red olives), and a dessert (mesemen, later served with fresh fruit and ice cream), in addition to a demonstration for three different salads, and general information on local spices and herbs, was terrific and very enjoyable, and lasted approximately 5 hours.Michel, Ilham, and the rest of the staff, were all very welcoming, and extremely helpful, and were especially fantastic with our young children.Overall, a wonderful experience, which we would be more than happy to repeat the next time we visit Marrakech.

A relaxing, fun day out in a fantastic setting. My girlfriend and I booked onto this class by just emailing Michel. He replied promptly and told us a taxi would collect us from near our riad. The taxi had air con and it took us to the farm house where we were doing our class. It was beautifully done out and Michel was very welcoming. His staff were all very friendly and helpful and provided us with lots of drinks and snacks throughout the day. We learned to cook traditional bread and a beef with caramelised orange and pear tagine which was delicious! I would highly recommend this cooking class to anyone wanting a day trip in Marrakech as it's fun, relaxed and very informative. Only 1 tiny issue is that I didn't feel as though we did that much cooking for a whole day but it was nice to do a bit, have a chat about spices, listen to some stories etc - on the whole it was pretty much perfect! And you can book a spa trip for after the class for a discount (which we did and it was beautiful, definitely would recommend this as well!)

Exceptional. Came for a second time on our visit to Marrakesh and it didn't disappoint it was better, as we were out of season it was just me and mum absolutely brilliant, I now can cook perfect tagine and cous cous, and we had one to one tuition.Great company, great lunch great serviceCan highly recommendPicked up from and dropped back to the hotel all in the cost, plus recipes .

A relaxing and entertaining day!!!. Doing the class at Faim d'Epices was a highlight of my trip to Marrakech. Michel and crew are very welcoming, knowledgeable about local cooking and spices, and entertaining. Michel got us going while we prepared our tagines with music and his bongo! The pace was perfect and includes a blind smell test of spices which was really fun. Learning about the Moroccan food culture and spending the day here was something I'll long remember and I highly recommend the experience! A must do in Marrakech.

Cooking Class: Fun, Delicious, Informative, Friendly. We have taken cooking classes in other cities around the world, and this one, presented in a lovely facility outside of Marrakech, by the owners, Michel and Ilham, was exceptional. Everything is so well planned from the introductions over mint tea or coffee, to the detailed and clear demonstrations from Chef Ilham to Michel's very funny and informative "blind" spice sniffing test, and lastly, to the delicious meal we created, a chicken tagine with olives and preserved lemons, three traditional salads, bread, and crepes. It is all easy with door to door pick-up, and the facility is large, well-designed, and lovely. We were lucky, and we very much enjoyed the company of the others in our cooking group. This is a must do activity in Marrakech.

So much fun!. I had so much fun in this cooking class. The food was great and I absolutely loved being able to buy some of the oils and cooking tools used in the class and bring them back to America with me. I would definitely recommend. The owner also has some pretty great talent on the drums!

Great food & people. This was a really enjoyable day. The itinerary is similar to what others have said but you do get to see and eat more than just the Tagine and bread you personally cook. Excellent staff which really made the day fun and are very hospitable. Food was great. Would definitely recommend.

What a great day!. My husband and I had a wonderful experience at the cooking school and were so glad that we went. We learned so much about Moroccan cuisine and the spice workshop was great. We made several different dishes and it was a great hands-on experience. We learned a lot of skills that we were confident that we could do when we returned home. We ate quite a bit along the way and then once everything was done had a lovely lunch on the outside patio overlooking the olive trees. It was a really fun day and I highly recommend it if you love cooking and want to learn how to make Moroccan cuisine the right way, or just want a fun experience on a beautiful property outside of the medina.

Amazing day with mouth-watering tagine. The booking experience was incredibly easy. Our driver picked us up, on time, from a place very close to our Riad. We were greeted by the lovely Michel, who offered us tea and an entertaining chat. Before the cooking started we took part in the spice workshop, which provided a fun and informative introduction to the spices commonly used in Moroccan cuisine. When it came to cooking, Michel, Ilham and their team worked seamlessly together to provide a great experience. All staff were very friendly and accommodating. The food was beautiful and the al fresco dining experience with the staff was a very nice end to the day.

Beef tagine with pears and candied orange peel. Michel and Ilham are so lovely and entertaining, extremely knowledgable, set on a farm/ orchard approx 20 mins away from Jemaa el fna. The class cost approx 550 dirhams, approx £45 for the whole day, includes transportation from your hotel, a tutorial/ blind test on spices, cooking a 3 course meal accompanied by a solo drum performance courtesy of Michel and off course the finale which is getting to enjoy your meal al fresco. Didi is their adorable dog and is very much a part of their family. Its all very relaxed and a thoroughly enjoyable experience, a visit to Marrakech would not be complete without partaking in a cookery class.

Relaxing new experience!. One of the memorable activity that you will have in Marrakech. We contacted Michel via email, we got the respond same day. They sent you an air conditioned van to pick you up from the hotel ( the time to get to their farm depends on how far is your hotel and how many hotels they are going to pick people from). Once we arrived, we were welcomed by Michel and ilham who were friendly and super nice. They offered us morracon tea and we had a talk. Then we had the spices workshop then we started cooking.The whole day was fun and we enjoyed. The food tastes delicious.Btw. You pay cash only at the end of your day.

A day to remember!. Myself and my girlfriend took part in this cooking class last August and had a brilliant day! Michel and the rest of the group there were the perfect hosts and guided us through creating a majestic feast of moroccan food to be enjoyed at the end! A blind spice testing halfway through while pots bubbled at our individual stations was great fun. The location itself, just outside of the city was beautiful, and the air conditioned cooking area was a bonus! Would definitely recommend and return upon our next visit to Marrakech!

A must do experience!!. This course is an absolute must for anyone traveling to Marrakech! Michel and Ilhame were so friendly that it didn't even feel like a class, but more like hanging out with friends and cooking lunch together. We learned so much! Ilhame really goes in depth into teaching us every technique and Michel teaches us about why each spice or ingredient is important. It was definitely one of the highlights of our trip to Marrakech!! If we go back again, I'd definitely sign up for the couscous course to continue our Moroccan cooking adventure! O and their spices, olive oil, and aragan oil were so cheap that we picked up a bunch of them for our trip back to the U.S. haha. When you go, you absolutely have to try the olive oil! They press it themselves from the olives in their back yard! It's AMAZING!

An amazing experience . I absolutely loved this cooking class and so did everyone I went with. We had so much fun. Everyone there is amazing. They first serve you drinks when you get there and at the end they give you the recipes for everything. It was so great to learn how to make this food, and they did a really great job at teaching us and made it really fun. It's a beautiful atmosphere where you can be yourself. We had a great time joking around with hem as well. They have a little shop area where you can buy some great oils, spices, and more and it is priced incredibly well. If your interested in taking a cooking class in Morocco, this is the one you want to do, trust me.

Best Moroccan Cooking Class EVER!!!. My friends and I signed up for this particular cooking class during our stay in Marrakech. The host Michel and the Instructor IIhame were the absolute best. We had the whole cooking class to ourselves. The introductory spice session was beneficial to understanding the basics of Moroccan cuisine. Ilhame guided us through all three courses with ease. And the end result was absolutely amazing. I would definitely go back again!

Excellent day. I attended this course with my girlfriend to introduce us to the cooking styles of Morocco and we were very impressed. The transport is included and this collected us from very close to our Riad, taking us straight to the farm in an air conditioned private car (the ride itself showing us some lovely scenery). On arrival we were treated very warmly and given time to settle into the lush building with your choice of beverage (these would be topped up/supplemented throughout the day). During the course we learnt in total six dishes (all of which you eat at the end) and had an introduction to spices which was delivered by Michel and a great learning point. The advice to eat breakfast should most certainly be followed as standing around all those glorious ingredients (we even cooked with real saffron) made you very hungry. We couldn't recommend this experience enough and hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

Really enjoyed it. Absolutely fantastic Morrocan cooking experience. We didn't know what to expect and the experience was enlightening and it was done by Michel and his wife who were the ideal hosts. My wife is a good cook and she confessed to learning from the experience. If you are thinking whether to attend this experience then choose to go and you won't regret it. Worth every penny (or dollar or dharam or euro,etc etc)

Relaxing Day Cooking. I spent an awesome day with Michel and his staff learning how to cook Moroccan food. Everything is clean and the house is lovely. I really enjoyed the spice smelling; that was a first for me. Everything is easily explained and the dishes are quite easy to make. I LOVED the olives; I'm still thinking about them! I highly recommend doing this class. It's a great way to spend the day and you'll go home full!

Fun and well organized. This cooking class was super! Everything was very professional, from the pick-up at our hotel, the cooking stations and the VERY friendly and nice staff. If you ever wonder what to do in Marrakech, get great value for money at Faim d*Epices.
Fabulous day.. Had a lovely time. I learnt so much about Moroccan cooking and will be booking again to learn more. Thank you for such a lovely day and amazing food.

Great day out.. Me and my partner had a fantastic time. We met some lovely people and cooked some delicious local food. Transport to and from the centre was organised and straightforward. We were given all the recipes when we left and picked up some pretty things in the small shop afterwards. One of the best outings of our trip.

Educational and fun. We had a great day with the staff of Faim d'Epices. We learned a lot about spices in a fun blindfolded session. We learned to make three salads a desert and of course a tajine dish. Everyone was so kind and the establishment with the garden is lovely to taste your self made food.

Great way to spend the day!. In Marrakesh for a week and this was a great trip for us. Followed the trip advisor reviews and it was a fun day. Hosts are excellent - probably worth knowing there isn't a huge amount of actual cooking - lots of displays and courses but only maybe half or a third is actual cooking. However nice fun day and you don't go home hungry! We were out of town and got our hotel shuttle in which was very close to the pick up point - most hotels drop in the same place so not bad to walk to the post office.
Cooking class . Amazing experience, really fun and excellent service, and of course super yammy food. I completely recommend it.

A must!. Couldn't recommend this cooking class enough! We learned so much and have used the recipes so many times since returning. Our group of 4 felt really welcomed by the owner and his wife and we spent the whole day learning all about traditional Moroccan foods and how to cook them. The tagine was delicious and it was wonderful learning how to make Moroccan bread! This really is a must if you're travelling to Marrakech.

An experience of a lifetime!. If you like authentic Moroccan food and like cooking, the workshops you get here at Faim d'Epices is a real wonderful experience you won't forget during your holiday. We were picked up by the driver in an airconditioned car and after a 15 minute drive we arrived at Faim d'Epices.we were welcomed by Michel and his wife Ilham. She is the chef who gave us the comprehensive course.We started with a welcome with Morrocan tea and Michel explained the program of the day. After that we had a great spices lesson, with smelling of all these flavors. Together with a story about them, facts, history and nice to know things it was a very complete part of the day.After that the cooking course started. Everything was shown by Ilham. Making dough, baking bread, preparing the tajine with chicken, lemon and red olives, making 3 sorts of salades, you can either eat warm and other ones cold. Finally we were shown to made a great dessert and eat all the things Ilham and we had made. All recipes were given along with us, off course we bought some nice spices. There is a nice little shop were you can buy the real stuff instead of imitation on the streets.After that we were brought back to our hotel. The day was already over. Next time we come back for another course. Thanks for a great day Michel, Ilham and crew!!

Great introduction to Marrakech. The best idea I had was to take the Faim d'Epices class to familiarize myself with not only the food in Marrakech but the culture. It was a great class full of energy and fun! You don't have to be an expert cook to take it. You learn alot about spices and cooking in a tangine pot. The meal was exquisite, my only regret was not taking the cous cous class.

I would HIGHLY recommend you do this if you're in Marrakech. I'm not sure where to start with this! Everything was amazing from pick up to drop off! We were collected from our riad at 9.30 on Monday morning and drove to Michel's farm. At first we didn't know what to expect as we were there with a lovely gentleman from Peru who owned his own seafood restaurant and the sweetest family from LA whom had a french restaurant and a gourmet food supplies store in LA- we are total amateurs when it comes to food and cooking! Luckily, we were put right at ease and had no problems at all with cooking our lamb and prune tajine! We started the day with mint tea and a chat to get everyone relaxed, then moved onto the Spice smelling test which was fun and quite interesting! Learned some handy little tid-bits! We then had a demonstration of how to bake the local bread and after that we began cooking our tajine under the watchful eye of Illarm. After cooking the tajine, the bread, making our side salads and pancakes, we sat in the sun and enjoyed our feast!- best restaurant in town! On leaving we got our recipes of the dishes we made and a week later even got emailed more along with some great photos from the day! We decided to avail of the offer that Faim d'Epices ran in conjunction with a local spa, so at 4.30pm when we were done cooking and eating, we were whisked off to a lovely spa where we spent 3 hours in total relaxation- a traditional hammam, an hour long full body massage and then the chance to relax by the plunge pool and drink even more mint tea! We were only fit for bed once we left! A wonderful day, and one that we have been telling everyone about since returning to London. Thanks so much Michel & Illarm!

One of the best days we had in Morocco!. We loved our day at Faim D'epices! What an experience and we learned so much about Moroccan cuisine and more. Michel and D'ilham are extraordinary people. We brought our 7 and 15 year old daughters and they both enjoyed the experience. Our hosts made both our girls interested in what they were learning. The farm and classroom are perfectly set up for an authentic Moroccan day in the kitchen. My husband and I, our daughters would all say that our time at Faim d'epices was one of our best days in Morocco!!! Bravo!

Great fun.....also learnt a few things to! :). We had a great day out here. Our host was good fun and it's was nice to get out of the city to his farm. Learnt lots about spices and how to make a delicious tagine dish. Also learnt how to make the local bread.....will definitely be making that at home!It was really nice at the end of the afternoon to sit outside and relax with our new friends while tucking into the delicious food we all just made.

Truly a wonderful experience, wakes up ALL OF YOUR SENSES, a not to miss venue !!!. This wonderful cooking school is located in a beautiful grove of Olive, and fruit trees in the country. They pick you up near your Riad/Hotel.Bring your camera as the pictures are real keepsakes. I loved making all the dishes and learning about the different spices that are used in Morrocan food. Loved making the bread. This is a full day affair and not only do you participate in making the dishes , you get entertained with drumming music from the director Michel. It was really great to have the conversation with Michel and Ilarm at the beginning as it gave us a great understanding of the Moroccan context...great way to start a great day.Loved the conversation .They also have spices, utensils, and THEIR olive oil you can purchase to take home. Recipes are given to you for all the dishes you make. Thank you Michel and Illarm for the wonderful day. The both of you really made it a personal experience to be remembered.

Fab cooking experience!. Really informative, led by a really friendly couple. We made the coucous with seven vegetables & beef which was time consuming but really delicious! Definitely recommend to anyone interested in food, & anyone who wants to try Morrocan cuisine.
Wonderful day. What a great day we had. Cooked a delicious Tagine and also learnt lots about Moroccan cooking and spices.Our hosts were gracious and lots of fun.

Fresh, fun and fantastic. What a way to experience an introduction to Morocco. Food and spices and a little education along the way.
A fantastic journey in sights and smells as we got to prepare our own meals, chat with other guests and sample Michel's humour and illham's patience.
A great location in the countryside and a wonderful first day in Marrakech.
Highly recommended!

A delightful day full of treats for the senses. We came to this class after having done other Moroccan cooking classes (and been turned down from a few, as we were bringing our 4 year old, along with our 12 year old son). This one was our favorite - relaxed, warm and inviting, we also learned a tremendous amount - in blind spice sniffing 'tests', making our own tagines and Moroccan bread, helping with salads and dessert... Then enjoying the fruits of our labors in a garden looking out onto an orchard of fragrant trees! The staff even had set up a station for our youngest son, and helped him with attention and care to make his own kefta. This was a delicious experience my family still raves about -- and we can actually recreate the recipes we learned here at home for our friends!

Amazing Cooking Experience . I picked up this tour from Trip Advisor for a test of cooking experience, it turned out to be something that I will do again. The site is very nice quite farm with well equipped farm house, lovely team including locals. The class is well organised, quiet informative and along with the instructor's tips would lead for a nice dish. I therefore recommend it for a exceptional day experience in Marrakech.

Amazing Moroccan Experience!. A group of girlfriends and I went to Marrakech to celebrate a friends 25th birthday. The birthday girl loves cooking (along with the rest of us) so we booked Michel and his wife Ilhame Moroccan cooking class and spa experience. Let me just tell you, we LOVED it! The cooking class and spa day was the highlight of our trip! We cooked, danced, and ate with Michel and Ilhame. They are a beautiful couple and passionate about cooking. The class set up was perfect, we literally learned how to make everything the bread, salads, and tangine dishes. They even did a sweet birthday dessert for my friends. They had transportation take us to the spa and that was as luxurious as it gets. The woman bathed us for 30 minutes in black soap, washed my hair, and we all had an hour full body massage. Tea and desserts were served after. I love it. I highly recommend this for people traveling to Marrakech looking for a fun, cultural activity. Can't wait to come back :) Thanks Michel and Ilhame! We miss you all already!

Fantastic cooking class - would highly recommend. The whole team were brilliant and the class was exceptionally enjoyable and informative. The food and location were great and the whole event had a fantastic atmosphere from start to finish. Was also, by far, the finest Moroccan food I have ever tasted. I cannot cook but the event was so well planned that we were able to create a fantastic meal that we enjoyed in fabulous surroundings. Well worth it!

Truely exceptional cooking class!. My girlfriend and I signed up for the cooking course and spa combo. It was an truely exceptional experience.Michel & Ilhame conducted the 6-hour multi-course class with a lot of fun. On top of the comprehensive and in-depth introduction about Moroccan cuisines, there are many interactions with the participants. From the basic spices to a wide range of common dishes. The courses are well prepared, with trained staffs supporting participants at all time. I would recommend this class to any travellers!

Great Food/Relaxing Experience. My husband and I attended the cooking course on May 23rd, which included the lamb and prunes dish. We really enjoyed the class. It was a very chill and relaxing environment, with only 3 people in the class, which was a good size. The preparation instructions were simple and straight-forward, and easy enough to make at home. The food turned out absolutely delicious!!! Almost couldn't believe I made it myself. The staff were pleasant and we had a good time. Overall, it was a very nice class and a completely different vibe than being in the heart of the city. I would definitely recommend this course.

Highlight of trip!. Booked beforehand via email with Michel. Transport and day was very well organised. Amazing day learning the Moroccan Cuisine and spices. Michel and staff were extremely friendly and it felt like we were with family. Enjoyed eating our food in the outdoors and sharing knowledge with the staff. Overall would definitely recommend this class and spa package! Mythic oriental spa was very relaxing and well worth it! This was the highlight of our 5 day trip!

Highlight of our trip. This was easily the highlight of our trip to Morocco. Not only were we picked up and dropped off by the business, but the entire day felt like an experience, not just a cooking class. Michel took an interest in every single one of us and made us feel like family hanging out, cooking together.The class moved seamlessly between instruction and executing what we just learnt with refreshments throughout the day. Ilhame was a fantastic instructor who answered all of our questions and went at a nice pace.It wasn't just a cooking class, it was an introduction into Moroccan cuisine and I HIGHLY suggest you consider this one of your activities whilst in Marrakech.
Just amazing. Wife and I had an outstanding time learning to cook traditional Moroccan dishes today. Outstanding! Highly recommended!

Cooking country side!. After spending some time in Morocco, we decided we wanted to learn to cook the local food. We did some research and found this course more interesting and affordable than other classes. We are actually very happy we choose this one. The owner is french and the teacher is Moroccan. The location is really nice and the atmosphere really adds to the enjoyment of the class.The blind spice "tasting" (smelling really) was lots of fun and also instructional. It was really nice to do especially because spices are very important in Moroccan cooking. We really enjoyed the cooking class and the completed meal (we made cous-cous, other meals rotate daily) although way too big was really delicious.Their locally made olive oil is out of this word and would have taken more home if we had enough space in our luggages. Definitely recommend for the food, lessons and overall experience.

Not just a cookery course - but a real entertainment!. What a great visit this was. Michel and the whole team are so efficient, everything ran smoothly. The venue is immaculate and very well equipped. There was a lively cross-section of people on the course which was informative and great fun. Michel proved to be a most amusing host. The 'Name that Spice' challenge was very interesting. The demonstrations were clear and we were guided expertly all the way with our own efforts. The food was delicious. I shall certainly be trying my own efforts at home! Thank you so much Michel and the whole team. This was a lovely way to spend my last day in Marrakesh. Highly recommended. And extremely good value for money.

Faim d'epices. We were very keen to try a cookery course in Marrakech and chose this one because it offered spice tasting along with cooking and it was out of the city so it appealed. The day could not have been better. Michael and his wife run a very well thought out cookery course. They time is thoughtfully divided up between cooking, spice tasting and demonstrations. We learnt how to make a seven vegetable couscous with beef (or not for the vegetarians). It is a time consuming dish to make but the time was broken up really well.,alongside demonstrations and learning about spices we sampled olives, nuts, various interesting jams, etc. It was a very friendly, informative day and we could not have been more welcomed. Michel was able to take in another person at short notice and was delightful throughout. At the end of the cooking we all ate our meal outside in very convivial company and cats and dogs. A truly memorable day.

A highlight of our visit!. The cooking class was a great day to escape the craziness of Marrakech. I really enjoyed learning about the spices. The food tasted great. I was surprised at how great my tajine tasted! I really enjoyed my day here.

More than an ordinary cooking class. We are passionate about food. Once in Morroco we were very eager to learn more about the local cuisine and signed up for a cooking class at Faim d’Epices. Michel and Ilham introduced us to the wonderful heritage of Moroccan food and the fascinating world of spices. Their passion, knowledge, sincerity and humor are a unique recipe for an unforgettable experience. A day fulfilled of blind tastings, interesting stories, reasonable explanations and of course lots of cooking – to us much more than just an ordinary cooking class. The great hosts introduced us to Morocco’s cuisine, culture and lifestyle. We will definitely try these recipes at home – might our senses brings us back to this wonderful day.

Best day out. The service was 2nt to none, I attended alone on my solo trip and didn't for one minute feel bothered. warm friendly staff and the man himself was wonderful. I had the best wine and ice cream I've had in a very long time, and I left with skills that I will always treasure and use. My tagine skills are impressing my friends! very informative and enjoyable day. definitely worth cash, time and experience.

Wonderful!!!. My husband and I have been traveling the world for a couple years and this class made me feel like I was at a friend's place making dinner and playing with their dog. Since we really haven't been able to do that for so long it really felt amazing!! Michel and his beautiful wife were amazing!! It was such a great experience for my husband and I both. It was the best thing we did in Morocco.

Highlight of our stay. We had such a great time with Michel and his wife that day. Very warm welcome and funny chat with them all. There was still something to do even if we were not cooking (herb testing, cooking and instrument demonstration). We were laughing the whole time and everyone was caring and helpful. I would encourage everyone to visit this cooking class as it was an experience to be remembered!Lovely moroccan food, of course.Tomas & Nela

Great Moroccan Cooking Class!. I went to Faim d'Epices with my parents when we were in Marrakech. It was a great experience. It was fun and informative. The hosts were really friendly and the class was so well planned-a little bit of knowledge, a little bit of chat and enough cooking time. The location was also beautiful and made the experience really special. Definitely recommend this!

Fantastic!. Seriously, if you are in Marrakesh, visit Faim d'Epices! An easy pick-up from the center of Marrakesh and a short drive took us to a LOVELY farm. We felt immediately welcomed into the family. We had a fantastic time spice tasting, got some great tips about purchasing, and then proceeded to cook for ourselves (with much assistance) the BEST meal we had in Morroco (and we ate some great food previously, but nothing could compare). Already we are trying the recipes we learned!

Excellent traditional Moroccan cooking class and farm experience. My wife and I booked the combo cooking class + spa day with Michel (and Mythic Oriental Spa in the Medina). Transport to and from the farm took about 20 minutes by van and was conveniently arranged by Michel. Michel's farm and kitchen classroom are very nice and he made everyone feel right at home. The class is given by his talented partner Ilham (sp?) who took us through making traditional Moroccan bread, veggie and beef cous cous (my wife is vegetarian and they readily accommodated for that), Moroccan crepes, and Moroccan salad. We tasted Illham's home made olives, which were spectacular. Interspersed in the cooking class was a spice class by Michel which was quite fun and informative. We ended the day with lunch on the terrace looking out on the orange and olive groves. Best day in Morocco! I highly recommend this experience.

Worth the time to visit. A fantastic day. Picked up from your hotel, a full day of local cooking and knowledge. Get to eat your own cooked meal at the end. Shop to get your bits for home, probably one of the best meals I had on holiday! Michele the host is a laugh a minute. Great day

WOW! WOW! WOW!. What a day! We absolutely loved the cooking class, you couldn't have asked for a better location either, situated amongst rows and rows of orange trees, the most wonderful back drop of the most wonderful day. The kitchen facilities are superior, offering every 'cook' their own work station. The cooking lesson is broken down in to stages so even those who cannot cook can do this. During the lesson you are supplied with fresh orange juice, olives, nuts and bread. Once you have cooked your meal you are invited to take it out on to the terrace and enjoy eating your own cooked meal in the glorious sunshine. It is a definite must!

A day worth waiting for. We'd been in Marrakech for a week, and had a couple of days left. Then I'd the idea of doing a Morroccan cookery course. Found the ad on a the side of a map I was using.Got rep to make the phone call and it was all organized, we were going cooking.We were picked up from the hotel and delivered to the cookery course ( on a farm ).I have to say, Michel was a star!!!!, he put everyone at ease with his chat and jokes.Then we had a blind spice test, not tasting just smelling. Amazing how many I got wrong, we're so used to cooking at home, we don't smell the spices just put them in whatever we are cooking.After that we were taught step by step to cook using a tagine, how to make Moroccan salad. How to make bread ( by hand ). We ended up cooking a whole meal, then sat on the patio and ate it.I have to say it was the best day of our holiday, thank you Michel. I would have no reservation in recommending this to anyone, even if they can't cook. It was was a pleasant relaxing day learning something new, and yes I've even cooked the same meal at home since ( and I've only been home a week ).

A Perfect Day!!!! Excellent Cooking Experience. We so enjoyed our day in fact it was the best day of our holiday , at this beautiful cookery school,has a orange grove which was in bloom when we went,lovely surroundings.Day Started when we were picked up at our hotel on time , when we arrived michel was there to welcome us , and we were offered coffee and orange blossom tea , orange blossom picked straight from the trees.You have your own work station and supplied a apron for the day , Michel then takes you through the wonderful world of spices which was really informative, and his lovely wife showed us how to cook a Moroccan chicken Tagine,bread,salads and Moroccan pancakes , Michel was there making sure we all had a good time , giving us fresh orange juice , even a little light entertainment lol.After you have cooked your meal , you are taken outside to eat your efforts of the day, i was really happy with my meal tasted great .Top Tip do buy some of the spices they have for sale , i wished i had bought more ,i have used the chilli power, and its amazing ive never tasted chilli power like it and do put it in little by little till you have your desired taste cos it packs a punch.The Ras El Hanout again is amazing , never going to find anything like it here.Another tip , we found this cookery school by mistake , it was advertised on a map which we were given , we asked at the hotel about it and they arranged it for us , so do ask at your hotel , or phone michel , they also have different days for different levels of cooking , If you leave your email michel will send you more recipes and pictures of the day , which we have received and also a momentum certificate .Thank you Michel For a lovely day , and will be back next year oh and we got the tagine back safe and sound and its been used lol Linda And Bob

A great day of food, learning and fun!. I would highly recommend this cookery day to all visitors to Morocco. The environment is beautiful and the teaching is well structured and fun. The day caters for participants at all levels.Michel knows the spice world very well- you will learn new skills without knowing that you're doing so! It's a great way to take a piece of Morocco home with you

Fun and informative. We enjoyed a great day of preparing and cooking our own tagine lunch, in a small group while learning about spices. The atmosphere was relaxed and fun. We picked up and dropped off at our Riad.

Best cooking class experience. This was such fun. The spices workshop, learning to make bread,salads and a tasty tagine. Felt like Masterchef Morocco. Good teaching and excellent humour. I highly recommend this.

great fun and very informative. This is a great way to learn alot not just about food but about Moroccan cultureThe teachers are superb and the environment and cooking facilities are really thought through

Fun Day, and I'm no cook. Spent the day here at a cooking class, something my family would never believe. It was lots of fun. We had people from all over the world speaking different languages, and Michel made it all work out in a fun low key way. We learned about spices, made several complete meals, depending on your taste. I chose vegetarian including bread from scratch. Then came the the best part- sitting in the sun on the patio and enjoying eating lunch with all our new friends. Really fun and easy. My cooking station partner was from Spain and had a food blog, so radically more experience than I cooking. She seemed to find it lots of fun also- so it worked for cooks of all levels. Kitchen was very clean and modern and easy to work in.

Perfect Day :). I would heavily recommend a visit to Faim d'Epices. I went back in February, and every aspect of the day was wonderful.From the spices workshop, to the cooking process itself, to the group lunch at the end - I had a great day out. Such a lovely place.You will learn a lot, and you might be introduced to a few ingredients you'd never heard of and will end up loving (hello, brined lemons!)A particularly well-deserved shout-out goes out to the staff, and especially Michel and Ilham, who are super friendly and go well out of their way to make you feel welcome at all times, with excellent humour. A perfect day with some special unexpected treats. I will have this fond memory for a long time.A real highlight of my trip in Morocco. What more could you want?

1st Cooking Class. The cuisine in Morocco was so unique and delicious that I was inspired to taking a cooking class so that I could replicate the dishes at home. At Faim d'Epices, you get a full introduction into all of the spices that are commonly used, and most importantly, you get hands on instruction with the guidance of a native Moroccan. With the assistance of the chef, I was surprisingly able to create a meal that was palatable! At the conclusion, you're provided with a recipe of what you've cooked wrapped nicely in a neat little scroll. I truly enjoyed the entire experience, the grounds, the staff, and the sweetest little puppy "Titi." I would recommend this class for all expertise levels.

Amazing hospitality and amazing teachers!. Had an absolutely amazing time with Michel and Ilham learning to cook Moroccan tagines. The food that we learnt to cook ended up being the tastiest that we had in Marrakech!!! We've already been using our tagine to practice what we learned. You will not regret the day, worth every single penny, when we return to Marrakech we will return to faim d'Epices

Great experiance!. Very experienced people! Not only the cooking was great, but they also knew how to take good care of the childring so that they also had a fun day. There was very much to learn about cooking, there where music and laughter all day long! Very inspiring and motivating.

Great day out. Great hospitality, great food.It was nice to meet other people from all over and just have a good time cooking, eating and talking.We happened to go for the spa offer as well which saves you a good deal of money and was absolutely fantastic.

Highlight of Morocco Trip. As the title states, my girlfriend and I both agree that our day spent at cooking and learning at Faim d'Epices was a highlight of our time in Morocco. The shuttle pick-up and drop-off at our Riad made getting there effortless. We were greeted with delicious mint tea (avec or sans sucre). Following this we learned to bake delicious bread. Next was a blind smell test of spices and ingredients common in Moroccan cooking. Michal offered his extensive knowledge and gave us all tips and tricks for finding and purchasing the highest quality ingredients in the medinas of Morocco. Following this we made a tasty tagine of chicken with preserved lemons and red olives. We were shown how to make three delicious salads and how to make the famous and delicious msemen bread. All of this was great fun, but the best is saved for last when we ate the fantastic food we prepared out on the terrace of Michel's fantastic farm in the warm Marrakesh sun.

A fun day at Michels' farm. Marrakesh is a very busy place and after a few days in that colourful, loud, messy city we thought it would be a good idea to book a cooking class and spend some time 'on the countryside'.Michel, who's the owner and Ilhame, the teacher are both very nice folks and made is have a great day at Faim d'Epices.We were a group of 6 so Ilhame had enough time to look after everyone. We each prepared a tajine, baked bread, made pancakes and were taught how to make some traditional salads.In the end, we all had lunch together on the terrace and got a surprise desert.Fun day, definitely recommended.

Fun (avec) d'Epices. My friend and I booked this cookery course (along with a spa afterwards). The van to pick us up was right on time and we were brought all the way out to the orchard and rustic setting of the kitchen/ cooking school. Michel and Elham were fantastic hosts, entertaining guides and above all, patient and helpful teachers. They guided people of all levels of cooking expertise, to help prepare something authentically Moroccan. The spice workshop beforehand was also very interesting and entertaining. We left there full of enthusiasm and ready to prepare the food we prepared there for our family and friends. We also very much appreciated the follow-up, the photographs, certificates, spices and recipes.
Such a great day. Really good fun, really well run and some great food. Nice to get a day away from the madness of the city as well! Really worth a visit even if you can't cook!

Best Day in Marrakech!. This is a must do activity for people who love food and love cooking! My partner and I are both professional chefs and we had so much fun and learned some valuable techniques from the gorgeous charming Dlham, and Michels extensive knowledge of spices. The facility is well appointed and a wonderful mix of demonstration, hands on cooking, occasionally listening to a little music with Michel playing along on his drum (nutter!) Everyone has their own cooking station to participate. Of all the things we did in 8 days in Morocco this was my favorite! Thank you so much to the staff for making us feel welcome and also challenged to learn new things about Moroccan food and culture. Absolutely recommend this for a fun whole day out. Michel picked us up around 9 and we were back in town by 5. So happy we chose this class!

Funny, interesting and educational . I love cooking classes and this one was no exception...it was laid back and easygoing and we felt comfortable the whole time. We only had 6 in our group which was lovely. We learnt how to make bread, all about the spices used in Morocco and to make a Tagine. We are travelling on a budget and this was a little outside of it but we decided to do it as it is a full day and a memorable experience.

fantastic day out. We had a wonderful day out learning about, cooking and eating some Moroccan food.We were a family of six and were all catered for as we had a couple of vegetarians.Fantastic hosts that kept us amused and made us feel at home. It was also great to get out of the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh, see some of the countryside and escape from the heat. I also think it is amazing value for money and would recommend to anyone.Thank you also for the lovely photos that you sent afterwards. A lovely gesture.

The best day of our holiday. Michel and his lovely wife Alham were just brilliant. Michel is totally nuts and his lovely wife is clearly long suffering. A really lovely couple who have a well thought out and fantastically planned business. A great location a little away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech in a beautiful orange and olive grove. it takes place in a purpose built building that is perfect for the course. The day starts with a lovely cup of mint tea or coffee and a run down of proceedings from Michel who is clearly the front man in the business, Alham does most of the cookery teaching with Michel providing translation when needed and refreshments throughout the day, it all finishes with a meal that you have cooked out on the patio with the rest of the class. We followed the course with a lovely Hammam and massage which was perfect after our days 'work'. A thoroughly enjoyable and illuminating day, my husband who doesn't cook, also really enjoyed himself in spite of his initial reservations about doing a cookery course and said he would gladly do it again. Highly recommend this attraction to anyone wanting a good laugh with good food and company.

One of our trip highlights!. This was a half-day experience which was both knowledgeable and so much fun. You are taught to make your own bread, tagine, salads and Moroccan pancakes, with a great structure which allows you lots of hands-on time as well as ample demonstrations. There is also a Spice Test which introduces you to Moroccan spices and sets a solid foundation for the rest of the day. All this was made so much better by the hosts, Michel and Ilham who were lovely, entertaining and take such good care of you. We did the spa package which comes along with the class and have to also give it top marks!

A brilliant day. We had a really enjoyable day at the Faim d'epices cookery school. Lovely facilities, lovely people, and great food. I learnt a lot about spices in the spice workshop, and then we used them making a delicious Tagine. There were 13 in the group, which was good number, and help and explanations were clear . We concluded by eating our lovely meal on a sunny terrace, by which time everyone was chatting and friendly. We left with a full collection of recipes, and inspiration to recreate the dishes at home. (I bought the ingredients this morning!)Collection from and to our hotel was efficient and on time. Highly recommended, and excellent value for money.

Top Moroccan cookery course. I thought I had booked on a food tour, but just before my hotel host asked "Are you ready for your Cookery Course?" Gulp! Anyway - I needn't have worried. About half an hour outside Marrakech Medina we arrived at out hosts for the day at Faim 'dEpices.We baked bread, made salads, blind test our spices knowledge, and then made our own tagines...all under the excellent guidance of the lovely Ilham, who first demonstrated and then encouraged/assisted us with our own creations. We finished off with a meal outside in the sun...eating our own tagines and bread!Lovely, welcoming atmosphere, great facilities and a thoroughly enjoyable day. Only 3 of us cooking today, but they can take up to 20, I think. Three was perfect!

I can see why this is the top thing to do in Marrakech. Really lovely experience. Very laid back and exceptionally well thought out. They really have taken care of every detail. It is very informative. Great value for money. It truly is an experience that you will remember. Thank you for looking after us so well.
A great day out. A superb day. All so welcoming. We enjoyed cooking. No stress, los of help and super food to eat when finished. This is a must do if you travel o Marrakech.
professional fun learning experience. What a nice experience visiting this place. We enjoyed being in good hands and at the same time having fun.
Great day and amazing food . It has been such a great day with lovely people, sun and amazing food. Michel was great and knew his stuff. Even the rest of staff was very helpful. Thank you.

Tagine-tastic. Thoroughly recommend this as it's not only a cooking class but you also learn a lot about individual spices. Making a lamb tagine and bread, being shown how to make various traditional Moroccan salads and then sitting down for a meal outside amongst the orange trees was a great day, and a great contrast to the hustle and bustle of the medina. We were picked up from near to our hotel so there is no negotiating with cab drivers or public transport required! You leave with comprehensive recipes and a confidence in your ability to reproduce the dishes in your own kitchen!

Best Day of the Holiday. Wanted to learn about Morrocan Cusine and Spices when this School was recommended ! Jumped at the chance and ended up being the Highlight of the Holiday!Michel & Ilhame made you feel at home in their spacious beautifully Decorated School.They were so funny and made listening a lot more fun.Learnt a lot and had the pleasure to dine at the end ! A very social way of learning.Going back on a different day very soon.

Private cooking course. We have had a really nice day with lovely food! The owner had lots of humor and does his very best to make you enjoy your day. We made a tajine and bread, both very much fun. A nice twist to the course is the spices test, where you are blindfolded and have to smell all kind of spices. Only negative is that we have waited 30minutes at the pick-up point. After we went back to our riad and called the owner it turned out the computer had a crash and the date was switched. No panic, he picked us up within the hour.

A fun afternoon in beautiful surroundings. I had a fun and inspiring afternoon! Michel has a great place and lots of space for the cooking classes. I love that everyone has their own cooking stand with all the remedies needed. Everyone prepares their own food whilst being guided, and overall it was a happy and great afternoon. I came alone and felt welcome and connected with the rest of the people in the group. I loved that we got some snacks as well, nice nuts and olives in-between the cooking lessons. A lovely day that I highly recommend. There is not doubt that I will be back again!

Cooking with all your senses. We had heard great things about this class from a friend who had taken it a couple of years ago so our expectations were fairly high going into it.The whole experience was incredible. Michelle and Ilham were such a great team and their little puppy just added to the whole experience.We learnt how to cook some delicious food from Ilhame and were thoroughly entertained the entire time by Michel. Our favorite part was the blindfolded spice identification workshop run my Michel which was very unique.We could totally see the passion and creativity with which Michel and Ilhame run their business.We would highly recommend it and would definitely be back in a heartbeat if we visited Morocco again:)Good luck with everything Michel and Ilhame:)Preethi & Vitten

Very tasty. Interesting. Well organized.. I highly recommend this cooking course if you want to do something different in Marrakesh. It was perfectly organized from the pick-up to the way back. You learn a lot about Morrocan cuisine, especially the ingredients, as the course includes a little workshop about morrocan spices. Everybody works at it's own cooking station and you participate in a complete menu. Our teacher was Ilham and she did a great job !It was a fun day and my highlight of Marrakesh !

A great, memorable day. I don't want to repeat too much what other reviewers have already said. My husband and I had a great time - it was a really memorable day. Everything was very slick, from the booking process (e-mails through Michel - he was very quick to reply), the transportation (very punctual) and the day itself. Michel e-mails the recipes through afterwards which is a nice touch. I would describe the cooking style as "rustic" and will definitely be trying out some of the recipes at home, particularly the bread, salads and pancakes. I already have a jar of lemons pickling away in my cupboard. I enjoyed Michel's talk on herbs and spices and the blind "smelling" he did for us. Fun and informative. The woman who lead us through the recipes was a delight - charming, patient and instructive. On the day we went, everyone was in couples. Actually my husband had not wanted to join in, but ended up enjoying himself as much as I did. (It is possible to be present as a non-participant, but the fee for this seemed high and you would need a really good book). A great day, highly recommended for creating Moroccan memories.

Sitting outside feasting on our creations in the sun- HEAVEN!. It's true most Brits would be happy just to eat the tagine and wolf down a few salads but Michelle and his lovely wife have achieved perfection with this cooking school. The moment you arrive you are greeted with mint tea and begin your culinary journey. It's something you'll never forget. From the 'spice game' to the 'bread boxing' this day will rush by because all of the fun you'll be having. Make sure you take lots of pictures and watch out for Michelle's drumming, it's great fun!

Great cooking class. Me and my partner visited Michel's cooking class on the 27th December. They had a few cancellations so we ended up being the only people in that day. Although the atmosphere probably would have been more lively had there been more people there, it was brilliant that we were able to spend one on one time with Michel and staff. The whole day was absolutely fantastic! We learnt about spices, cooking various Moroccan dishes, as well as hearing about Michel's experiences of the culture and lifestyle living in Marrakech. The whole day was very well organised and you can tell how passionate Michel is about the business he has created. We bought the package deal which included the spa in the evening and it ended up being a perfect last day to end our holiday. Thanks Michel!

If you like to cook and enjoy food GO!. I spent a wonderful day with my friend at Michel's (and his wife's) cooking class. To be honest it was the most relaxing and enjoyable thing we did in Marrakesch. The Driver picked us up and drove us to a beautiful countryside house where the cooking course took place. The garden was beautiful with its orange trees and their little dog. After a short tea/coffee break we started cooking, tasting, enjoying... Really, if you have enough of the hurly burly loud City just take a cooking class and enjoy. The owner and his wife did a very good Job you feel that they aren't doing this just for Money - they love what they do. Big thank you to Michel and his wife. Jasmina & Antje

Fun and relaxed cooking class. My husband and I were in Marrakech over the Christmas period and I booked this cooking course as a surprise Birthday present for him as he loves cooking.It was a great day - lots of fun and very informative. We were picked up promptly and taken to the purpose built building. . The cooking school is located in a citrus grove and the amenities were spot on - there are individual workstations and on the day we went it was just us and a family of 6, so we could go at a pace that suited us all.Michel is a great host and put everyone at ease. The spice workshop at the beginning was lots of fun - trying to guess the smells whilst blindfolded. We then learnt to make traditional Morroccan bread; a lamb and prune tagine; 3 Morroccan salads and a Morroccan desert. The chef/cookery teacher Ilhame was wonderfully patient and great at explaining and breaking down each dish. Throughout the day, Michel kept us well refreshed with delicious fresh orange juice, olives and snacks. When we'd finally finished cooking we enjoyed the fruits of our labours whilst sitting outside. I booked the joint deal here after the cookery course you are taken to a beautiful Hammam back in Marrakech where we had a very relaxing massage to finish off the day. Definitely recommend.

Welcome to Alibaba's kitchen !. A little outside of Marrakesh (the transfer is included in the event), the very friendly and competent team of Faim d'Epices welcomes you in a very nice place surrounded by orange trees.In a group of 8 people we spent a wonderful day exploring the secrets of the Moroccan cuisine: after a short welcoming tea and an overview of the agenda, the preparation of the meals was at first shown by a cook of the Faim d'Epices team and then prepared by ourselves. Everyone had its own cooking platform which really enabled everyone to participate and learn actively. With a lot of humour and talent, Michel introduced us to the great variety of spices and gave hints on how to purchase the best ones on the local souks.Having cooked and baked bread, tajine and msemen (the traditional Morroccan breakfast pancakes), we savored a delicious meal on the terrace in the sun :-)As we had booked the package including a visit of a hammam after the cooking session, we drove back to the city center where we experienced a Spa as in Thousand and One Nights. The spa is hidden in a fully refurbished riad with a water basin in the courtyard. Especially after the massage, it felt like a rebirth ! Try it and you will never ever want to leave Morocco again !

Superb! . As much as I'd like to read another of Michel's hilarious responses to negative reviews, I simply cannot fault this course. We were picked up bang on time and taken to the picturesque venue. Once there, we were treated to a day of demonstrations, blind spice smelling and refreshments. We cooked our own bread and tagine, and learned a lot about the Moroccan culture over a lovely and well-deserved lunch outside.Both Michel and his staff were all very professional, welcoming, informative and have a brilliant sense of humour. It was a great day and I'd recommend it to anyone.

Amazing cooking class. This was an exceptional cooking course. I've done a few in different countries, and this was by far the most interesting and well though-out course I've done. Not only do you get to try hands on cooking, you also get demonstrations and a lesson in the various spices and oils used in Morocco. It really feels more like an actual class. The facilities are amazing, clean and well equipped and Michel and his staff are just amazing, friendly and very knowledgeable. A really great way to learn about Moroccan cuisine and get a chance to make some. Highly recommended.

Fun. A great way to spend the day away from the souk. I've been twice now, and Michel and his team have made it so entertaining that I'd go back a third time. Try the class/spa combo...it's a great deal.

Fun cooking class. We took the class on a Monday and got to cook a lamb tagine witch we both loved. The chef was fantastic and the atmosphere fun and relaxed. The cooking is quite basic but still good fun. The pickup and drop off was smooth and on time. We had a really good time and I would definitely recommend this class.

A great day out!. I really enjoyed our day here. Michel and his staff are great hosts and provided us with an interesting and informative day. The food was delicious and while we learnt a lot the format was very relaxed and jovial which made for a great holiday day out. I would thoroughly recommend.

Relaxed, entertaining and informative day out. Faim d'Epices was a short drive out of Marrakech, and on arrival we were greeted by Michel and a small puppy named Titi. After refreshments and a very informative talk on spices, we got going making our tagines and breads. I think most of the other 'Excellent' reviews on here have covered what I wanted to say. I would definitely recommend this experience.The hosts were extremely welcoming, and eating our meal at the end of the course was a nice way getting to know both the hosts and our fellow guests.

Entertainment and cooking too!. Michel and Ilham (sp?) made our entire very multicultural group (French, Dutch, Phillippina and American) feel welcome. It was a nice mix of demo, hands-on and theory. I especially enjoyed the spice workshop where we had blind "smellings" and learned how to distinguish fake saffron and argan oil from the real thing. And the food we made was delicious! You might want to take a few notes during or immediately after the class because the recipes that are handed out afterward don't include all the details.Oh, and they are very accommodating of gluten and lactose intolerance.

Delicious fun in the sun. This was a great way to end our trip in Morocco. We were welcomed by Michel and the team who made us feel at home. Making the bread and lamb tagine while being entertained by Michel playing a drum was great fun. Our teacher was lovely; she demonstrated how to prepare the dishes (including Moroccan salads and messemen). Lunch was delicious: we sat outside in the sun getting to know the other travellers.Would recommend :)

Tagine Tango in Marrakesh. On a recent visit to Marrakesh our group of ten did a cookery day at Faim d'Epices and we were not disappointed From the moment we were collected at our hotel till our return it was fun and educational .We learned all about the spices we used and their origin,we cooked a fabulous beef tagine ,traditional Moroccan bread, salads and delicious pancakes.Michel is a wonderful host,provided us with constant refreshments and entertained us with his wit and music.At the end of the course we ate outside in the lemon grove.We were given all recipes and he emailed us more on our return home.I would highly recommend this course

Great. Thoroughly enjoyed our day here, ended up in a great group and all enjoyed the day.Lovely food and company. I recommend the joint offer with the massage and make a full day of it.I would recommend to anyone.

Excellent morning of cooking!. Michel was a great host, making our day a really good cooking experience yet getting to know the rest of the group. A blindfolded spice smell test got the juices going before we cooked a delicious lamb and vegetarian Tagine, bread and salads and then sat down to eat it in the shade of the 30 degree heat.A definite for marrakech. Thanks Michel, Phil & Jess, London

Great way to spend a day, fun, informative, and hands on !. Booked this for my wife and I whilst in Marrakech, based on the positive TA reviews. We were not disappointed. Michel is clearly in his element, and has put together a day that has a very good balance of learning, cooking and fun. We were in a multi national group of 10, which seemed to work well, the day passed very quickly. Pick up and drop off at the hotel were both on time. Well worth doing if you can spare a day on your Marrakech trip.

A wonderful cooking day - funny, informative and delicious. It has been a perfectly planned day. We were picked up at our hotel and brought to a nice farm in the green surroundings of Marrakech. We learned a lot about spices, the traditional art of cooking and got several tips for preparation of the meal which we enjoyed together at the end of the course on the beautiful terrace. Michel is an exceptionally gifted entertainer, and preparing the meal never seemed to be work, it was rather fun and affectionately guided experience. And by the way you will get prepared for your shopping tour around the souks: How can you find out if the argan oil offered in the bazar is of good quality? Is there a simple test which can prove if the expensive saffron is really pure saffron and not mixed with tinted hay? - Check out with Michel!

Not to be missed if you are in Marrakech. I am a massive foodie and most of my holidays revolve around food. When we chose our destination, I just had to make sure it involved a cooking workshop- I was not disappointed with my choice! The class is set on a lovely little farm on the outskirts of Marrakech- such a welcoming and wonderful setting. Michel was very charismatic and instilled a lot of fun into the 'learning' processes. We learnt all sorts of tricks (the BEST technique for finely chopping onions I've ever seen) and the final outcome was just so good. Loved baking the bread from scratch, something I will definitely make again. The tagine was delicious and well spiced (if I do say so myself!). The spices workshop was a great touch too and worked as a good icebreaker for the group. There is also a little shop that is actually cheaper than the souks so I'd recommend getting your spices, mini tagine dishes etc from there.

Fun day out in Marrakech!. Our first day in Marrakech it was pouring down with rain so we decided to look for a cooking course - and although we booked the class very last minute, Faim d'Epices were very accommodating and picked us up 15 minutes later to take us to their atelier.The course took around 6 hours: introduction and complimentary tea, cooking class (divided into small sessions: bread, tajine, salads, desert), a very fun and original spices workshop where we learnt loads and then a lovely meal, eating what you have cooked, seating and chatting with the rest of the group. We had such a fun time and we came out with loads of little tips and tricks that we will definitely use at home.In addition, the host and the main teacher are very lovely and make you feel at home from the beginning of the experience.We would definitely recommend it!

A fantastic experience and a must do in Marrakech. I was recommended to try the cookery course at Faim d'Epices by my daughter who had been previously. I am glad she did because we had an excellent day with many laughs, interesting talk and authentic Moroccan food. My husband, who doesn't cook much, had a really enjoyable time too, and was quite proud of his achievement. A tip for future travellers. Go to this course at the beginning of your holiday as we did. The amount you learn about Moroccan food, spices, oils, and culture are invaluable and add to the enjoyment of the holiday. Thank you Michel and Ilhame

Perfect day. The cooking class at FAIM d'Epices is funny, full of very well presented information. The host Michel as well as all the other people working there are lovely. Form the tasting of spices and "baking" of bread and the mixing of salads to the preparation of a typical moroccian dish - everything perfect!Not to miss, of you like cooking and eating

Great day out. Fun way to learn about spices and to get the basics of Moroccan cooking under your belt. The lessons covered bread making, Moroccan salads, breakfast patties and then the process of making a Tagine using locally sourced and grown food, Michel and his team made the day an enjoyable treat leaving us with some simple skills to take home and practice. Highly recommended.
Enjoyable Cooking Class in Marrakech. An enjoyable day at Faim d'Epices cooking Moroccan cuisine & learning about the different spices used in their cooking. Michel & colleagues were excellent host!
Brillaint Cooking Classes as well as a lesson in spices. An excellent way to learn about the Moroccan culture through food. The hosts are knowledgeable and friendly

Cookery lesson in Marrakech. I highly recommend Faim d'Epices as part of your Marrakech experience. We were picked up at our hotel and taken to a most beautiful spot outside Marrakech for a fun and lighthearted but informative cookery lesson and after we had cooked a tagine of beef ,pears and candied oranges we dined in the garden by the lemon grove. Would definitely do this again if back in fab Marrakech.

Best day of our Holiday. This is a 'MUST DO' on everybody's list when visiting Marrakech. A very hands on cookery class with your own work station. We were guided through step by step. Michel was great at entertaining us while we learnt in a fun environment. I learned to cook a beef tagine, Moroccan bread, Moroccan salads as well as moroccan crepes. After a great day of cooking it was nice to sit outside overlooking the farm and eat the food we had been cooking throughout the day. Thank you to the recipes that we were given at the end of the day - I managed to re create the Tagine and cook it for my family back at home which they all throughly enjoyed. I will certainly be trying a few of the other recipes we were given. Thank you Michel and colleagues for such a fabulous memorable day full of laughter and joy that I will never forget.

Wonderful Day. Thank you Michel & crew, I so enjoyed our cooking day! I am now looking to buy a tangine in New Zealand so I can continue cooking with my new found skills!I declared the spices at customs in NZ and they allowed them through. Would have bought more if I had known. Go the All Blacks!

Incredible day. This was a great day. We were picked up in the square near the riad and taken to a location outside Marrakesh. We did a hands on class where we made batbout (bread baked on a stove), patties msemen (similar to crepes), and tanjine beef with orange and pears. We did all the preparation ourselves in a large room with individual preparation stations. Michel is the director and Iihame is the chief and they were great instructors. Iihame make Moraccan salads to compliment to beef. We ate on the patio after all our cooking. We received the recipes and got further recipes emailed when we got home.

Amazing day filled with fun laughter and learning - not to be missed. We've just returned back from a great day spent with Michel and his team at the most amazing farm where we learnt morrocan cookery. This is a day trip you shouldn't miss because not only is it really fun to learn but also Michel made it so much fun! It's like having your own entertainer for the day! We learnt some great recipes and walked out feeling several stone heavier and met so many amazing people. The course was good value and there's a chance to purchase some genuine spices at the end!
