The class was mixed male and females so a really good activity for all. It's a full day almost and you can get a spa package with it afterwards. They give you the recipes after the class. There were 14 of us in the class today and we all got personal attention! Don't miss out on this one! Trust me you'll remember the day with a big smile! Thank you to Michel! We loved it! Sit and Rita with the chilli flakes!

The best day ever in Morocco. My day with Michel and crew is a day I will always cherish. Hospitable, charming, witty, professional and above all a great performer, Michel allowed me to experience true Moroccan cuisine. From the early pick up to the taxi home from the spa, this day is hard to beat.

Cooking lesson & Spa in one day. We spent a beautiful, funny and interesting day at Faim d'Epices.Special for us was the workshop about spices.We learned "simple" dishes like bread but all in the old original way…it isn't that simple at least.The tajine we made was one of the best I had during our honeymoon at Marrakech.The atmosphere and the team is great.We really can recommend the package together with the Mythic Oriental Spa…first you work and after the delicious lunch with the group they bring you to the Spa.It was an amazing day for us

Great day. We visited the faim d'epices last week and had a great time! We were collected from a convenient location in central Marrakech and driven out to the cookery school. The place itself is remote but beautiful and very, very clean. The host is good fun and kept us entertained all day! The food isn't complicated and the recipes were easy to follow for everyone (my boyfriend has only ever cooked bacon and eggs but managed the lamb and prune tagine and to bake his own bread!) and the end result was delicious!! All in all, if you have a few days in the city and feel like a change of pace for a bit, I would really recommend faim d'epices.

Relaxing cooking class. For the second time back at the cooking school of Michel and his dedicated staff. They pick you up and bring you back. You can choose from various types of tajines. If you want to learn about Morrocan cuisine and spices in a nice, relaxing and joyful way you must go to Faim d'Epices. I also already advised some friends to go and they were enthusiastic as well !

Informative and fun day!. I attended this workshop with my daughter and friend and so glad that we did. We were picked up and dropped back to our hotel by Michael. He made the day particularly fun as he obviously enjoys what he does and is an excellent host. After preparing the food we settled down to a late lunch which is taken under an awning overlooking the farm gardens. If you're thinking of doing something different and enjoy cooking then don't hesitate to book this cookery workshop.
Great would go again!. Provided a great experience and great food. As well as eating loads got to learn about the spices and food of Morocco!

Loved it. Really informative but done in such a fun way. Learnt lots, ate lots and met lots of lovely new people. Staff were great and picked us up from outside our hotel, the food was really amazing and I learnt a lot about the traditional food and spices.

So much fun, even for the less-abled cooks!. I'm not the best of cooks, but I really enjoyed the day. The people that organise it are so friendly and so welcoming. They are very accommodating, no matter what level you can cook at. I just enjoyed every aspect of it (especially since this one of the better organised activities to do in Morocco, i.e. a car to pick you up/take you back, solid timings and recipes). I was well inspired by the cooking and even find myself experimenting more now that I'm at home. 10/10 would recommend.

Cooking, the Moroccan Way!. After being picked up around the corner from our Riad, we were whisked away on a short 20 min ride to the Faim D'Epices farm for our all-day Couscous cooking class. Upon our arrival, we were greeted with the warmth and hospital we had experienced throughout our travels in Marrakech. The entire staff was top-notch. My wife and I were lucky enough to have a private class, which was truly a treat!Over the next 3 hours, we learned innumerable tips and tricks about Moroccan cooking, spices, and life. Not only do I now know that there is a market for fake saffron but I'm also an expert on spotting it in the markets! If only I had access to spice markets at home in NYC.At the end of the adventure, we had the opportunity to eat the riches of our hard work. I know a home-cooked meal is usually better than it's restaurant counter-part, but this cousous was truly a two-steps -- maybe more -- above any we ate in Morocco. And the best part is that we can always recreate the experience back at home!If you are at all interested in eating authentic Moroccan food on your vacation, I highly recommend investing the time to visit Faim D'Epices as it's a great experience with amazing food!

A great experience for anyone interested in Moroccan food!. It's one thing to just eat the local food, it's another to learn about it - the spices that go into it, the history, the recipes, etc. We had a great time, it was both educational and fun, and I was able to buy some argan oil and know it was actually 100% pure! Thanks for everything.

Really fun day!. Me and my boyfriend attended this cooking class during our visit to Marrakech, and it was one of the highlights of our trip. It was a wonderful way to get to know the culture and cuisine of Morocco, while making some new friends and having a delicious meal together. I highly recommend Faim d'Epices to those visiting and residing in Morocco alike. Thanks for such a great experience Michele!

One of the best days in Marrakech. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our day at Faim d'Epices cooking the beef, pear and candied orange Tagine (plus breads, salads and Msemen). Having done other cookery courses before, this was by far the best as it was hands on, each of us with our own cooking station, following the directions of the instructor in easy to follow small steps.The day was lovely and laid back with a good mix of cooking, other activities such as a spice lesson and entertainment from Michel who was a fantastic host. The recipes were simple, Moroccan home cooking with ingredients that we can easily get back home so no excuses for not trying them out on our friends and family! Plus the taste of our finished cooking was fantastic. One of the best meals we had during our whole trip ( if I do say so myself haha!).

Relaxed, informal introduction to Morroccan cuisine. This day out creating a lamb and prune tagine among other dishes was great fun. Michel and his wife were fantastic hosts and really mad us feel at ease. Michel's dry sense of humour was really great - made it more of a holiday trip rather than too serious. We learnt some good tips and were given some spices at the end which was a really lovely touch. Really enjoyed the pace of the day and the fact that we moved around a lot which kept us interest. Well worth doing - on of our favourite things to do in Marrakech!

“A Fun and Delicious Experience!”. The FAIM D'EPICES Cooking Class in Marrakech was one of our favorite experiences during our trip to Morocco. Being our first trip to Morocco, My wife and I wanted to learn about the food and culture of the region and felt that a cooking class would be a great way to do it. We searched the many food classes and tours on TripAdvisor and felt drawn to Faim D’Epice based off the strength of the many reviews. Our host Michel, picked us up at our hotel and dropped us off later in the day which was very convenient. Michel is a very dynamic person with a fun and very colorful personality. He first taught us all about spices which came in very handy when knowing how to spot fake Saffron or Argan Oil which are both highly marketed in the region. His wife was our chef instructor that taught us how to make fresh local bread, the famous Moroccan Tagine of Beef and for dessert, Moroccan Crepes with homemade Cactus Pear Jam and Ice Cream. By the end of the class, we were all enjoying the food, the wine and the new acquaintances. I would highly recommend this if you are someone who likes to do something beyond visiting the typical "tourist traps." Once we returned home, I couldn't wait to try out the recipes from the class and use all the spices and new tagine pot I purchased.Thanks Michel for a great time!

Such a Beautiful day. My husband planned our trip to Marrakech down to the smallest of details. We experienced not only the luxurious parts of morocco but also gained perspective by visiting the mountains and the berber people. One of my favourite days would have to be at this very farm where we had the nicest day possible! We were picked up from our hotel, welcomed by the funniest guy Michel and he took care of us so well with such a warm personal touch. From start to finish we were taken care of with snacks and drinks as well as being allowed to enjoy our dish outside with our lovely group in the sun. We learnt so much and cooking with your partner is such a lovely experience. We were not rushed or put under pressure. Michel was very entertaining and he made our cooking class one of the best days we had in Morocco. Thank you so much and we will be back next time we visit. Please pass on my regards to your wife as well.

We had a lovely day.. Michel picked us up from the centre of Marrakesh and took us out to the farm, where along with some lovely others we cooked up a most enjoyable feast! Michel was entertaining and the day was fun and informative, my mum had a badly sprained wrist and everyone was really helpful towards her so she could enjoy her day too and not feel left out. All in all a really enjoyable day, I came home enthused with Moroccan cooking and have already re-created some of the salads, tagine to follow shortly! Good value for money, I would recommend it and go again myself.

What a fantastic day. We were met by Michel who was, from the start, very funny and made everyone relaxed. The course was easy to follow with the help of Ilham, Michel's wife, who taught us how to make some great dishes, bread, hot and cold salads, pancakes and of course our chosen tagine which were all delicious and how to cut an onion into small dice without a chopping board.Especially interesting was the spice workshop were we had to guess which spices and oils Michel held under our noses, not as easy as you think. Michel was also very informative about how to spot fake oils and spices in the souks.At the end of the day we sat out on the verandah and enjoyed our home cooked food, everyone chatting and complimenting ourselves on what we had achieved. Very relaxed and happy, I even took home my bread which I couldn't finish. Michel gave us all a bag of spices and a recipe of our chosen menu and promised to forward more Morrocan recipes by email.All in all it was a great experience, well organised and informative, lots of fun. I would definitely recommend Faim d'Espices. Don't forget to buy their own olive oil wich is delicious and I forgot to mention Michel is pretty good on the tom tomsWill definitely go back xxx

Interesting experience. After dithering between choices, I plumped for this one because of the fab reviews. It was a birthday present for my two daughters and daughter in law.We particularly appreciated the pick up from the Riad and drop off. i chose what I thought was the vegetarian option of couscous with 7 vegetables as my eldest daughter is vegetarian but we discovered it contained meat! Nevertheless, hers was made the same as ours but without the meat - they are quite happy to accommodate. We also appreciate that they made a separate breadfor my daughter in law who is diabetic.The day consisted of a leisurely chat with a drink then down to work preparing our chosen dish. The whole thing was quite complicated and not something we would really do at home as it would just take too long. However, we learned some different techniques and background info. Instruction was friendly and easy to follow. The day was broken up with a blind spice 'smelling' session and demonstrations on how to make bread, salads and pancakes. Having a bit more input rather than just watching might have been nice as it's harder to remember how something was done by just watching.We were all inspired to make the bread when we got home and loved the onion relish that went with the dish. Sorry though michel, we all thought the final dish wasn't that amazing. I have to add though that I don't think that's necessarily the point of cooking courses as we all enjoyed ourselves, learned new things and had a fab time. We had also sampled rather too much of the pan fried bread and nuts that were put out so when we finally sat down to eat, we were already pretty stuffed. Could have done with a doggy bag!!Do go - it's a great experience and presented very well. I was a bit worried about the 'slaving over a hot stove' thing especially in the August heat, but it was very relaxed and enjoyable.Recommended.

This is not for people who are intelligent or have ANY cooking skills. No challenge: don't take this course if you're an intelligent person with cooking experience...!!! Location is ok, but not close to the city. Michel, the owner treated our groep like we were children. He acted like a clown that needed to entertain us. Everything was already prepared and all you had to do during the course was copying the instructor. It was like: 'And now take the next cup and put everything that is in there in the pot. Now close the pot.' I was with my mom, we are both intelligent people and cook on daily basis at home. This was not interesting and the worst thing was: because you had to follow the instructions very strictly, at the end, it didn't even taste good. It took 3,5 hrs to make couscous and the instructor was very irritated all the time because we put more spices in to make it taste better. While the pot was cooking we had to watch the instructor making bread, watch the instructor making salads... BORING! Michel learned us about the Marroccan spices while we had to sit in a group wearing blinded sunglasses. Everyone was bored, I learned nothing, It tasted awful and it was a waste of time.

So much fun!. I booked this after reading great reviews on tripadvisor and went with my cousin in September. Michel is funny and really keeps you entertained throughout the day. The spice workshop taught me alot and made me realise I recognise more smells than I thought I did. The whole day is incredibly informative, relaxed and fun. I loved learning how to make the yummy msemen breads that I had been enjoying everyday for my breakfast at my hotel (I miss these now!). And how to make the tagine and salads. It was a good way to meet other likeminded people and I thoroughly recommend booking the deal with the Mythic Oriental spa to finish your day off relaxing at the spa. Amazing! Thanks Michel and co xxx

Fantastic Experience - Highlight of our trip.. We got into Marrakech the night before, had a good sleep (it was a long and difficult journey), and woke up early to go to our cooking class. As such, we hadn't seen any of Marrakech at all. And it was perfect. Michel and Ilhame were so perfect, and made us feel like guests rather than students. We had a fantastic time learning how to cook a variety of Moroccan dishes, but also getting to know these lovely people. We feel that we now have friends in Marrakech, which is just great.We were picked up promptly at our hotel, and driven out to the farm for the class. We were welcomed at the door by Michel, who immediately offered us some mint tea and made us feel at home. We were lucky enough to be alone on this particular day - another group had cancelled - and so we had their full attention.I won't go into the particular details of what we did - other reviewers cover that pretty well. But I want to stress how nice and personable Michel, Ilhame and the rest were. We made a great meal (I can't quite believe I made something so delicious), and ate it out on the terrace with our hosts. We chatted about many things, food and otherwise, while enjoying the accommodation and the peace of the garden.Overall it was a fantastic experience. This place is number one. And all for a very reasonable price.PS - make sure to buy their olive oil from the shop. It is from their own farm, and it is heavenly.

Really enjoyed this day. If you want to have fun and learn some Moroccon cooking go to this. The "guess the spice" game run by Michel was fun but a great way to learn. Good information. The cooking caters well to a variety of experienced and inexperienced cooks, possibly a bit too simple for really experienced cooks but the humor kept the fun flowing so it probably won't matter. Highly recommended.

Entertaining and interesting . Michel and Fatih were a great hosts and very interesting. A very welcoming, warm and fun experience. We happily recommend it for a few hours out of the hustle of the city with a nice lunch to finish. Merci beaucoup Faim d'Epices, pour un jour joyeux!Stuart and Marta

Fab day, great fun. My husband and I went on the cooking course for my late birthday present - I have been on three or four cooking classes in the past on our travels together but this was the first one my husband had been on, and we both had a great time. The course is held a little way out of Marrakesh, but free transfers are arranged from your riad as part of the course, and in fact it's rather a relief to escape for a few hours from the bustle of the city - we had deliberately chosen this course because we weren't interested in those interminable market tours which seem to be a given for most cooking courses. Michel and his wife were lovely, funny, and friendly, and we had great fun and much hilarity cooking some delicious dishes and learning lots of great cooking tips, before tucking into the fruits of our labours. I would definitely recommend this to anyone, great fun!

Vegetable and beef stew and couscous. My wife and I booked this lovely experience with michele and elam.We loved the experience and the mysterious quiz hosted by michele.Elam is a fountain of knowledge which my wife thoroughly appreciated.Great day and great experience. Number one for a reason.Abbas and Sarah

We went to fair d'Épics after doubting between many other cooking classes, but I'm absolutely sure we've chosen the best. We had a warm welcome and a lovely time at fair d'epices. Michel is a great host and Fatiha is an amazing cook. Really inspiring and nice to do with a mix of experienced and inexperienced cooks.

Must do: Cook your own Moroccan meal with Michelle Faim D'Epices. This was one of the highlights of our week long vacation. It was informative and fun. We met other travellers and shared experiences and ended with a delicious authentic Moroccan meal. Michelle is a great facilitator of the day. Highly recommend. We visited December 2013 - just a bit behind on my 'to do' list. I had to say September 2014 however - it was the furthest back I could go.

Superb!!. Very interesting day and topped off with the superb meal at the end.Highly recommended! I just spend the day today cooking for 13 people the meals I learnt from here. A great way to really take something away from your trip to Marrakech.

Highlight of our trip. We would thoroughly recommend this day! The location is lovely. Michel picked us up from our riad in Marrakesh and dropped us off at the end of the day so transport was not an issue. The day was quite long but rewarding. You learn a lot about morroccan cooking, cooking in general, and Morrocan life and culture. We did this at the end of our stay, but i would recommend it near the beginning as it will give you a good insight into everything going on around you. Michel's english is good, so he's helpful for any questions you might have! You take the recipes back with you and they catered well with a vegetarian.

Highly Recommend It. this was a lovely escape from the blistering moroccan sun. i thought the food we had at our road was good but the tagine and crepes that we made at Faim d'Epices were absolutely delicious. The tagine was nicer than any tagine i tasted in a restaurant and the crepes were simply devine.
a really nice experience. It was a nice and instructive time at Faim d' Epices. Everything is Planned and organized perfectly, definitely recommend.

Cooking course. We had an absolute lovely day at the farm! Michel and the other staff were so informative and the course was really beneficial!Loved that he gave us spices on our departure! I'll definitely be trying out the recipes... The flavours were amazing! If highly recommend this course! What you see is what you get!

A MUST do in Marrakesh. This was a fabulous experience. From the on time pickup and the quick responses to the fabulous day spent with Michel, his charming and funny wife, and his team, my husband and I could not have been happier. Since I am not the cook of the house, I thought that I would be bored throughout, but not only was Michel engaging, but he set up a great environment for people of all ability levels and interests. I highly recommend doing this class. As well, you come away with great recipes and ideas! We also had a vegetarian friend with us and the team at Faim d'Epices was really wonderful and accommodating to him!

Cool day at Faim d'espices . We had a great day at the cooking class and in general I do recommend going, you learn quite a lot. I would have liked to cook even more on my own rather than only watching. Cool would also be if there would be different main dishes cooked by the different people so there would have been to try more stuff. Still, all in all cool day with lovely people!

Very relaxing and enjoyable day!. A thoroughly relaxing and enjoyable day in the company of Michel and his staff. Importantly our two boys had a great time too (9 and 11 year olds). From pick up to drop off we were well looked after. I'm not a cook but was able to easily follow the instructions and demonstrations and produced a meal that I was proud of!

Fantastic day!. My girlfriend and I love to do cooking courses in different countries we visit, and this was one of our favourites! Our host Michel was an absolute pleasure and really made the day with his humour and hospitality. The cooking lessons were really well done and informative but allowed us all the freedom to prepare and cook the dishes ourselves which we much prefer to other experiences that we've had that were less hands on. The lessons on spices and oils were also very valuable as many of the goods in the souks are fake and this taught us what to look out for when shopping! All of the staff were incredibly kind and a lot of fun, and the food was fantastic! It was a great relaxing day out from the fast pace of Marrakech, couldn't have asked for anything more. We were even emailed recipes for additional dishes that we didn't cook on the day. Would highly recommend this course to anyone… Thanks Michel!

Absolutely Faim-tastic! . From start to finish the small team of host, chef, and assistants were seriously good! So welcoming and accommodating, me and my boyfriend were so happy we booked this day, especially near the end of our stay so it was lovely and relaxing (we did the spa/cooking combo, not to be missed!) Final comment on the ease at which they catered for my bf, who is gluten intolerant, they got a special blend of flours so he could also make bread with the rest of us. Loved the whole thing and always recommend it to anyone who says they are thinking of going to Marrakech ☺️
Brilliant day. Brilliant experience cooking a Moroccan meal here, if you are interested in cooking then I would definitely recommend, lovely place and lovely people made this trip very memorable

Great day:). Had such a great day cooking delicious food! Michel was a great host and Fatiha an excellent teacher. The place is located a short distance out from the city, which was nice and very tranquil. The bus collected us from our Riad so there was no hassle finding it. We learned about all the different spices, and how to make a number of dishes. Michel was very accommodating, helping us to tailor the dishes to our own preferences. We had a lovely meal at the end. Michel even followed up a few days later with more information in an email. Really enjoyed the experience:)

What a fantastic day. My friend and I booked a cookery course before we left for Marrrakech. I suggest you book before you go as it is so popular. Michel and his staff are the loveliest people and make the instructions really easy to understand. We learn't loads of facts regarding all the different spices, which was really interesting. The day was really fun and met some lovely people. A must do

Fun, delicious food, and very accommodating. Would highly recommend -- one of our highlights in Marrakesh. The price was very reasonable and included the pick-up and drop-off in town. Michel and the rest of the staff were fantastic. We learned a lot about Moroccan spices and how to cook a bunch of different dishes. We also got to snack throughout on delicious Moroccan food that was made right before our eyes.
Worth trying to find. Nice place -- difficult to find, but you will happy that you did. It has a lot of good stuff and we were glad we finally found it!

Fun, delicious and informative!. A great experience. Michel was a great host, very entertaining! The Cook was fantastic and the cooking instruction was easy to follow. Lots of hands-on preparation and created delicious food with recipes you can replicate at home! Very worth while if you love cooking and eating great food.

Cooking, Learning, and Laughing. Spend a day in Michel's world--you won't regret it. In a bright and clean kitchen, you will learn about spices, cooking technique, and the importance of a cooking to the soundtrack of West African drums. Fathiha (I really hope I'm transliterating correctly) is a fantastic teacher: patient, kind, and great with a knife. Despite entering the class with a bit of tagine fatigue, my wife and I greatly enjoyed our meal. If you are a fan of cooking, eating, or fun, then you will enjoy this class.
Great relaxing day. Great experience. Everything was well-organized, Michel and his wife and also the instructor were all extremely nice and friendly. Strongly recommended.

Fantastic!!. Cannot recommend this more. The course itself was fantastic and coupled learning and cooking with a lot of entertainment and fun. Those running the course were great and very welcoming and ensured we all had a great time. Would definitely recommend you do this course!

A fantastic day out!. We thoroughly enjoyed our day at this excellent cook school where we learned to make delicious lamb and prune tagine, home-made bread and salads. It was a great day out away from the chaos of the medina. It was lovely to sit down at the end and enjoy the food we had made. I would definitely recommend it!

A must do in Marrakech. My girlfriend (USA) and I (UK) were recommended Faim D'epices by a friend who had visited 2 years prior, and we are so glad that she did.Michel was fantastic and picked us up from our rented apartment . The class itself offers so much more than just a how-to, step-by-step instruction (which it does extremely well). All round it was a extremely fun and informative day with spice testing/smelling, delicious food and great company.By the end of the day I (who you could not classify in any means as a cook) had put together a delicious tagine which I could not believe had been created with my own hands. I would recommended not letting the opportunity pass by whilst you are in Marrakech - and also it is worth tying it in with the Hammam - Mythic Oriental Spa (combo deal was offered at the time) which was a luxurious and relaxing experience (even more appreciated after hearing some horror stories at other local Hammams). Do not miss out!

Great break from the city. My boyfriend and I signed up for this course, recommended by his brother. Our expectations were exceeded! We liked having our own cooking stations and Chopping the vegetables, meat etc instead of having everything pre- prepared. I got a great tip for cutting an onion without a cutting board! The meal itself was tasty although it is not something I would try at home (candied orange peels are a bit fancy for my daily cooking). However, I would like to try other taking recipes based on the skills I acquired! Marrakech is a bit chaotic, so it was great to spend a day out in the countryside, surrounded by orange and olive trees.

Great class for the entire family.. This was a great way to spend a day in Morocco. Did the class with our two children (15 and 12) and they had their own station. Everything was both professional and relaxed. Informative and funny at times. Must do this if you want to learn about Moroccan cuisine.

Best part of my trip. I absolutely loved everything about this cooking class! I even wrote an entire blog post on my experience on my cooking blog ( http://theconscientiouseater.com/faim-despices-moroccan-cooking-class/ ) with pictures and details about the day. I don't eat meat and they graciously allowed me to make a vegetable tajine instead of the beef tajine scheduled for the day. Michel was hilarious and Fatiha was an amazing chef and instructor. All the food we prepared was spectacular and the day was scheduled perfectly so that you were always cooking or learning or laughing. It's a must!!
Awesome time !. We spent a wonderful day with Michel and his colleagues, discovering the wonders of Moroccan cuisine. We definitely recommend it !!

Fantastic cooking experience. Having spent most of our holiday in Marrakech enjoying the amazing variety of food it was lovely to spend a day learning how to cook it.We went on a Friday to cook 7-vegetable couscous. We were picked up promptly at our hotel and driven out to the villa where we would be spending the day learning to cook Moroccan food. The villa has been beautifully done up to enable the cooking experience for a group. The tuition was excellent, Michel was very welcoming, and we spent a wonderful day learning how to make a variety of Moroccan dishes - including those lovely pancakes that abound all over Marrakech! I will certainly never make couscous the way I used to ever again.My partner is vegetarian and we were very well taken care of in terms of food options and amount of food. Although we chose to do the Friday option, we were advised that they could make vegetarian options on any day.Excellent value for money - you will have a wonderful meal in beautiful surroundings, you will have learned to make everything for yourself, and you will leave with all the recipes for the food that you made on the day. Once we had returned home, we were also sent photos of the day, and a little certificate of completion.

Lots of fun!. We had a great time with Michel, one of the best days of our trip!
This is a very accessible course, so don't expect to be taught advanced skills. What you can expect is a relaxed and fun environment, where you will learn important basics of Moroccan cooking.
Thanks for a great day out Michel!

Highlight of our trip. Had a great day with Faim d'Epices learning the art of Moroccan cuisine. Had heard about it through some fellow travellers, and wasn't disappointed by their recommendation. Owner Michel was very personable, and our teacher Fatiha was lovely. Enjoyed having personal work station to cook own dishes. Made Moroccan bread, lamb and prune tagine, and Moroccan pancakes, had an interesting spice lesson, and learnt how to make a variety of salad dishes. Very impressed with our efforts when we ate them at the end of the day!

Exceptionnelle . A wonderful day learning all about the art of Spices and Moroccan cooking. I even got to practice my very rusty French. I learnt to make delicious Moroccan bread, incredible salads, beef caramelised orange and pear tagine which was just amazing and we finished with crispy butter soaked pancakes with ginger, mint the and saffron ice cream small scoops. It was the best meal of the week along with great company. As a solo traveller I was made to feel very welcome. Thank you to the fabulous Michel and his wife and to Fathia who was such a great teacher. I will be back next time I visit Marrakech. Please go if you get the chance. Super day!!!

Great Cooking Class. Great Cooking ClassWe have just returned from a two week trip to Morocco and if you want to learn how to make a tagine dish, then you should sign up for the cooking class at Faim d'Epices while you are in Marrakesh. Michel, the owner, is extremely personable and takes care of every detail. We were picked up at a central meeting spot very close to our riad and driven to a farm outside of the city and had not only a great cooking class, but a great meal and just a delightful day. The cooking stations were set up in a semi circle around Fatiha, our marvelous instructor. She was patient and explained the various techniques required in preparing a Moroccan meal. We were taught about the various spices used in Moroccan cooking, how to make bread, three different salads, and the chicken or fish tagine. It was one of the highlights of our trip.

Fabulous way to spend a day in Marrakech. We decided to do something useful on our short break to justify leaving our husbands at home and going off to Marrakech for a few days. This was perfect. Michel is bursting with energy and is always smiling and Fathia made the cooking and baking seem so easy. I'm rubbish at cooking in general but they were so helpful that my lamb tagine was the best meal I had on the whole hols. It's ever such good value for money as you learn lots of stuff, you get a good meal, recipes, transfers from town and we got a bag of ras el hanout to take home. And this morning I got an email with more recipes and a cute certificate with a photo. If I'm ever in Marrakech again I'll definetly do another one.

Really enjoyable experience. The cooking school was well run, from the pick-up all the way through to dropping us off at the Hammam afterwards (we had booked the special offer which included a spa experience at Mythical Spa). Michel was a fantastic host, and really interesting to talk to, not only about Moroccan cuisine, but also about his life in Morocco. Fatiha was a great teacher, making us feel at ease from the very first thing she taught us (which was the Moroccan bread which looked really scary to make, but was actually quite easy with her guidance).Would highly recommend this cooking school to others visiting Marrakech.

Cooking lesson in Marrakesh. It was a wonderful experience from start to end. My friend and I took this cooking class with a collaboration of a spa experience at Mythical Spa so it was a great combo deal. Michel was a very good host and entertainer while Fatiha taught us how to cook a traditional beef tagine and bread from start to end. Cooking wasn't too hard as long as you follow directions. I really enjoyed the spice lesson where we were blinded to figure out the scent of each spice. It was a little long but definitely worth learning and educating yourself if you don't have a large knowledge on spices. There were some lessons that is definitely handy and helpful for future references (ex: learned how to tell from real saffron vs fake).

Moroccan feast. I was truly delighted to discover the wonders of Moroccan cooking at L'atelier Faim d'Epices. The location outside Marrakech is lovely and the cooking facilities were perfectly designed for learning how to prepare a traditional meal in Morocco. Our host Michel and our chef made the entire experience fun, interesting and informative. The class is very well designed so that you're doing fun activities while the food is cooking. I thoroughly enjoyed the day and came away with recipes to try at home.

Moroccan Cooking Class. Highly recommended. Very professional and informative but mostly fun. My friend and I recently spent three weeks travelling throughout Morocco and were very keen to try a cooking class as we both love the food. We found this course by Googling with no prior knowledge and were both very impressed - it was a highlight of our trip! Michel, the owner is friendly and funny and Fatiha, the chef is patient and kind. The company takes care of all transportation (20min bus ride out of central Marrakech) which makes it very convenient too. The recipes are for dishes we had enjoyed during our travels and the take home printed copies are easy to interpret to re-create back home. We additionally did the Hamman spa offer they had and it was a wonderfully relaxing finish to a great day.

Great activity. We loved this cooking class. It's very professionally done, set out of the city on a farm in a room with personal stoves. Fatiha the chef, who is unfortunately leaving soon was amazing! Such a fabulous chef and a great teacher. Incredibly multilingual. The owner is a bit strange but it doesn't detract from the experience. If you are in to learning a new cuisine this is the way to do it!

Amazing. My partner and I visited marrakesh for a week, it was a wonderful holiday made only better by our day with farm d'epices. I would recommend this cooking experience to anyone. Came away with some exciting new cooking techniques, great recipees, and authentic saffron. They are both wonderful teachers. We went to the farm on are last day in morocco. It was the best way to wind up are holiday, especially since we booked the deal including the spa visit. Also wonderful, finished the holiday relaxed and happy. If you do anything in morocco do this!!!

Great time and food!. I was not sure if is good idea to spend any part of my holidays on cooking class, especially for that price. We went there, and.... it was great! Very good time, fun and delicious food.Testing spices was my favoriet part, you will be suprise how hard is recognize spices using only your nose! I can really reccomend this course, it was very, very nice.More protos and my opinion you can find here (in polish): http://backpakuje.pl/kurs-gotowania-maroko-marrakesz/ <- relacja z kursu i zdjęcia. Enjoy!

Cooking day. Second visit and still as enjoyable as the first. Definitely the best cooking day I have attended and you do actually get to cook a variety of foods. The day is finished eating your meal outside on the veranda with your small intimate group. Excellent

Fantastic Experience. We spent the day with Michel and Co. whilst visiting Marrakech and this was definitely one of the highlights of our trip. Michel has mastered the art of combining fun with education and then tops it with a great meal at the end too! Well worth the visit.

A great day out. Really enjoyable cooking class making excellent food which we then enjoyed out on the terrace. Michel, Fatiha and all the staff were great creating a good class which was also fun. Will go again if we return to Marrakech!
well worth a visit. A great way to spend a day with Michel and his staff. Learn to cook a tangine, great food, plenty of discussion and gossip...most enjoyable

Professional, informative, solid value and enjoyable!. My mom and I had a wonderful time at this cooking class. From our arrival to the very end, everything was professional, enjoyable and informative. My mom was concerned with it being a full day class but we both felt the time went by quickly because of how enjoyable it was. We were impressed with the professionalism and staff (both in front and behind the scenes) that makes sure you can have a good time learning to cook without any of the mundane activities. The purpose built building is located on a quiet and scenic path of land about 30 minutes outside of Marrakesh. The spice class was very informative and interesting. The Madame who taught the class was kind, put us at ease, and gave us attention to feel special. Michel, is a comedian, easy-going and made us relax and enjoy ourselves more. The facility is modern and comfortable. I am not a cook but enjoyed the challenge and attention I received in learning how to make this dish. The food was delicious and abundant! Really overall a great value. Both of us felt almost anyone would enjoy an experience like this! Two thumbs up!

Excellent cooking and spices course!!. This is probably the nicest and most original cooking class We have taken. The lovely Fatiha showed us how to make the best couscous we ever tried and the welcoming Michel showed us what is to know about Morrocan spices and oils. The pace and the environment is very relaxing focusing on having a good time rather than learning many dishes.Shuttle will pick you up and take you to the faim d'epices (about 20mim drive from Medina in a calm field of trees)Merci Fatiha, Michel et famille!

Slick operation. Great day spent on farm grounds cooking with Michel and others. Key features were: stylish and modern premises; laid back atmosphere with time to talk to others on the course; entertaining host, Michel; lovely farm grounds setting; all ingredients pre-bought and set out; good range of dishes; great shop selling tagines, spices, bowls etc and follow-up with recipes.

Great fun, great food. This was a welcome break to the craziness of Marrakech. Informative, fun, relaxing and most of all, delicious. Michel and Fatiha were great hosts and the whole day was extremely memorable. We look forward to attempting their amazing recipes again at home!

excellent experience!. My daughter Aalia and I had a wonderful experience at this session. The pick up was punctual and we arrived at the venue in the middle of a farm area. We were not sure what to expect but from arrival till the end we had a fabulous and memorable experience . Michel and Fatiha were very organised, friendly and very professional in their session. It was light hearted yet very educational. I really enjoyed the session on guessing the spices. In the end the whole spread of the meal was mouth watering and we all over ate I am sure.I would recommend this to everyone and would like to thank my daughter Aalia for taking me there. I learnt a lot of tips on cooking. Shenaz

Absolutely wonderful, must visit!. We visited this past weekend as part of my friend's hen party. It was recommended to me by a friend and I'm so glad we decided to go! We were collected from our hotel at the agreed time and greeted by Michel, who is a funny quirky French guy and a great host! We sat down and had a little introduction and a chat with mint tea before being introduced to the lovely Fatiha. Then we were given a little test on our spice knowledge and given some info on each one before the cooking started. We were given demonstrations on each dish before we the cooking commenced. There was music and drums and soft drinks and snacks and at the end we all sat outside to eat our tagines and bread and the lovely salads that were made by Fatiha and the team behind the scenes. The whole production is well thought out and fun, and I would definitely love to visit again! This is a must for every Marrakech visit! It's also great value for money. Thank you Michel, Fatiha and all the team for a great and memorable experience!

Fantastic experience from start to finish!. Absolutely fantastic experience! We loved the entire day - you are always kept busy, there is always food, and you are taught how to make lots of things, not just the main course dish (eg Moroccan breakfast pancakes, salads etc). Would DEFINITELY recommend!! :)

This is a wonderful cooking experience in Marrakech. We had a really great time and learned so much. Extremely well organized. Each person has their own cooking station. Michel and Fathia were extraordinary teachers. The food was delicious and the other people in our group were so much fun. A really wonderful day

Great day out. Worthy of number 1 spot on courses (didnt do any others to compare in RAK but left very happy). Pick up was prompt and transfer to farm was quick. Michel is quirky and perhaps an acquired taste to some. He does keep the atmosphere light and friendly, and (although he wouldnt admit it) was very helpful at times during the day when Fatiha was busy and we needed direction with the cooking. Fatiha is an excellent teacher: engaging, entertaining and helpful. The course offers a variety of teaching and learning mediums - smell test, watching, replicating, seeing and doing. I am a very tactile and kinesthetic person and prefer to have my hands on everything and be doing everything myself, but I can see why some parts are done just as demos. The way it is at present probably caters for a larger audience. I highly recommend emailing Michel and ensuring your spot with the Faim Despice team while you're in Marrakech.

What an experience indeed !!!!. When we arrived at Faim d'Epices we were not sure what to expect except some great reviews. The entire experience with the cooking and Michel was a memorable moment. The place with the farm in the background and the clean atmosphere was inviting. Michel was not only educational but kept us entertained the entire time with his wit and charm. I am so glad to have spent the day up at Faim d'Epices and will certainly recommend this to everyone I know.

Great Start to Our Moroccan Adventure. What a wonderful day we had cooking with Michel and Fatiha. I've been to a lot of cooking classes all over the world, and Faim d'Epices is right up there as one of the top. Great value for your money. Great meal. Michel is very entertaining and it is clear he loves his job and his chefs-in-training. I will be making the menu very soon for my American friends.

So much more then just following a recipe. We were lucky enough to book a class with just one other couple, so the conversations and lessons were very intimate. More so than just teaching recipes and techniques, Michel and Fatiha gave invaluable insight into Moroccan ingredients, culture, and people. By the end of the day, we really felt like we had spent a leisurely day on a friends farm, and gained so much experience and knowledge while doing it.

Great activity!. The best day we spent in Marrakesh by far! Michel and his team are really excellent teachers and make the day a real pleasure. Easy pick up and drop back close to our riad and a whole day away from the noise and clamour of the city - a very welcome respite. I visited with my teenage daughter and we both had a great day, learning a lot and eating the results of our labours together was a bonus. Highly recommended.

Great day. Great food.. Easy to book, quick response. Was great fun for us both (neither of us have any cooking ability). Michel kept it up beat and witty and Fatiha the instructor made it all so simple. Had a good time eating our dishes with others on the course. Definitely a day well spent!
Fantastic experience. We had a great day at Faim d'Epices. Michele, the owner was excellent host, and tagine cooking was a wonderful experience followed by spa.Fantastic way to end our vacation.

A wonderful experience!. We had a great day at L'atelier Faim d'Epices. After eating in Morocco on holiday, it was great to learn about the spices and ingredients that make the food so special. Brought my husband and two boys (ages 11, 14) and we all loved it. Michel is a passionate and fun host and made the day very special for us. We learned a lot and ate a wonderful meal. A highlight of our trip to Morocco for sure!
Great Experience. We decided to go on the cooking course on our final day in Marrakech. It was a fantastic way to end our holiday and I highly recommend it.

Couple. My husband and I did this course because the reviews were so good. It was worth it. Loved cooking in a tajine and want to experiment more.Michel is very prompt. The pick-ups are scheduled well. Part of the fun is meeting the other participants in the class. We had 12 students from all over, so as we drank mint tea, we shared about our travels.The course is well structured to enjoy the day. Not sure if we can get all the ingredients in the states, but will look for substitutes on-line.A cook demonstrates the cooking and she is amazing to watch. She is so fluid and comfortable with cooking that you just have to watch her. It is not as easy as the cook makes it look, but it is not intimidating either. We had fun trying to imitate the motions.You have your individual work station. Loved this. We made a lovely chicken and vegetable dish. Everything was provided. Eating together afterwards on a porch next to an orchard is a nice touch.Michel will also email additional recipies after the class so

Highlight of our trip to Marrakech!. Had a wonderful day. Michel is a perfect host and very entertaining. Fatiha was an excellent teacher - she explained and demonstarted everything very clearly and made it fun. Our daughter said it was the best day of our holiday!

Awesome experience. The whole expierence was amazing, we were picked up on time and the journey was quite picturesque. We were welcome in a truly Moroccan fashion the mint tea which i must say is very refreshing. Michel is friendly and quite witty, Fatiha was amazing and very patient with us all not to mention her smiley and encouraging attitude. We had an amazing experience, one which we will cherish forever.

Well-Organized, Fun Experience!. This cooking class was an amazing experience. Everything about it was well-organized- email contact, transportation, the schedule of events, etc. Michel was a very entertaining and kind host, and the food we prepared was delicious! I live in Morocco and would definitely recommend this experience for both vacationers and ex-pats living in Morocco.

Fun Educational Day Out!. After the hectic experience that is Marrakesh we enjoyed a lovely day with Michel and Fatiha in Faim D'Epices, we learnt a lot about Moroccan cuisine and more importantly it was fun experience! The booking process was painless and Michel gave a very good indication of what was involved in the cookery course. We were picked up bang on time close to our Riad and as we were heading home that evening Michel even dropped us to the airport after our course - fantastic service! Michel was a fabulous host and great fun and Fatiha was lovely! The course itself was very well paced and was very interesting, we would have no hesitation in recommending Faim D'Epices to anyone visiting Marrakesh!

Great Value / Price. I went there with my wife and we both learned a lot and had a great time. The spices workshop is really worth it.Pick up and transportation went smooth and punctual and the staff at the farm were just great.Everything is really well prepared and conducted.Definitely a MUST DO

Captivating fun and friendly experience. I booked this experience for my very first day in Marrakech and I can happily say it really was a fabulous experience.From beginning to end Michel and his team were amazing. The booking system was easy and communication was fluent and fast answering my questions and preferences to cooking and eating vegetarian food ( which was delicious ).As a solo traveller and my first time in Marrakech this was the ideal day to ease me into the Moroccan culture . After a very eventful and slightly stressful morning getting lost, alone in the madness but amazing Medina , making myself late for pick up Michel was so helpful to get his driver to come find me even thou I was over an hour late. This really help ease my worries from the day and continue with one of the most enjoyable days of my travels. Arriving at this amazing space of tranquility , colour and land we was greeted with smiles and laughter whilst sipping mint tea, coffee and getting to know each other. I was captivated and educated throughout the day with the information, history and skills of the Fathia who was our brilliant chief for the day with Michel providing entertainment in the form of jokes and bongo playing which adds to the authentic feeling of the day.The food provided throughout the day was full of flavour and plenty to go around , even giving us a goody bag to leave with including recipe of what we cooked.I also booked the deal with the spa after which was the most relaxing and beautiful end to the day with the Mythical Ortient Spa . Thank you All

Cooking and then eating in the sun at Faim d'Spices. Just back from Marrakesh, our first day we had booked this cookery course. It was great and such fun. Went with my daughter and young son who is 15. We all had a great time and sitting out in the sun eating our lovely meals was just the icing on the cake.Would recommend this to everyone, you learn a lot about spices and Michael is a great host, go and have some fun!!

Great day out of the city. Faim D'Epices is a great day out of busy Marrakech to relax and enjoy making tasty Moroccan food in a fun and social environment. The spot that you go to is out on a farm and the kitchen is spacious and well resourced. My favourite part was the blind sniff test with the spices and learning about how to know what you are actually buying when you shop in the Souks. A great day that I would recommend to all.

A great way to spend a relaxing day away from the craziness........ My sister recommended this cooking class - which she did about 5 years ago. It was brilliant - the whole day was well organised, in a friendly and relaxed atmosphere. Michel is a perfect host but Fahita was a hidden gem. Her teaching of each dish was easy to understand. I would definitely do this one again. We also did the special spa evening deal - which was also amazing.

Great day with fantastic food. Michel's cooking class was certainly one of our Marrakech highlights. The food is great, the recipes are really tasty and still down to earth - you can easily cook them at home. Michel and Fatiha are great hosts who know a lot about Moroccon food and spices. It was a really fun and nice day!

Nice Fun Day . Attended with my wife. After a bit of confusion down to collection time we we met by Michel, our great host and driver, to took us to his farm house and where the class would be conducted. It was great fun day who we both enjoyed greatly. We learnt about different spices and herbs, how to cook fresh bread, Moroccan salads and of course a chicken tajine. Michel and his staff were so welcoming and he creates and great relaxed atmosphere for the group. Thanks to Michel and to the other staff.

Hidden gem in Marrakech!. Such a fun day! Michel and his team were excellent hosts... Michel was really accommodating with my arrangements for participation, which I appreciated. The spice workshop was conducted by Michel with excellent flair and Fatiha always had a twinkle in her eye as she walked us through the steps for cooking. After the "hard work" of cooking, we had a lovely relaxing lunch outdoors in the sun... One morning + afternoon might seem like a lot of time to spend on a single activity but a cooking course at Faim d'Epices is definitely worth it!!! This was one of my most enjoyable activities during my stay in Marrakech.

Excellent experience, fun day with Michel and Fatiha!. Michel and Fatiha were by far one of the highlights of our trip to Marrakech. At first it seemed like a ways to go from the Medina, but transport (individual pick up) was super easy and it was well worth the fairly quick drive. Learning how to cook one of my favourite dishes (traditional chicken tagine with olives and preserved lemon) really made my day. But honestly, Michel and Fatiha were such wonderful people and characters, I'd pay just to hang out with them again. Don't hesitate, book this experience!

Awesome Day of Cooking and Culture. My friend and I had a wonderful introduction to different Moroccan spices, meals and breads in this class. The location, about 20 min outside of Marrakech, was a nice reprieve from the busy city. Michel and Fatiha were good instructors and entertaining chefs. The food was excellent and the day was a great way to start our time in Morocco. Highly Recommended!

Really good fun!. We aren't really that into cooking, but wanted to do something a bit different while we were there & saw the good reviews.We booked this as part of their combined Mythic Oriental Spa package & wasn't disappointed!We were picked up outside our hotel & taken there, with a good view of the area en route. There were a few other couples there, who were all really nice.The day was spent watching, learning & then putting it into practise yourselves. Really informative & great fun. Then enjoying your food at the end of the day, with snacks & drinks along the way.If booked with the Spa package, you are then driven there & guided in.Well recommended!

Fun day. We had a great time at Faim D'epices. The class itself is located on an orchard a little ways out of the city, which is a nice break from the craziness of Marrakech. Everything in the class was well-organized, and I enjoyed all the different elements: there was a blind spice test in which Michel taught us about how to recognize real and fake spices, and of course different cooking workshops with Fatiha, who is incredibly talented as a chef and also as a teacher. Both she and Michel were delightful--he's the class clown and facilitator, while she is the serious one (but also very warm and friendly). They made sure our meals turned out to be delicious, and it was lovely to sit outside and enjoy the fruits of our labor at the end of the day. Highly recommend this if you have the time to set aside a day in Marrakesh!

A welcome break from the hustle and bustle of the city. A relaxing and fun day spent learning the tricks and trades behind traditional Moroccan cooking. Both Michel and Fatiha were great fun and provided entertainment as well as sharing their cooking knowledge which made the day go so quickly. The journey to the farm took us to the other side of the city and was quite enjoyable looking at the Marrakesh city periphery. All in all, an enjoyable day that broke up the weeks holiday nicely.

Great day out. Had a great time thanks to Michel and Fatiha! Was a friendly and personable experience from the offset. We were picked up and dropped off at our Riad. There was lots of information about spices, their uses and origins, then a brilliant workshop into our lamb tagine and Moroccan bread. Plenty to learn but easy enough for an amateur chef like me! I would highly recommend to anyone!

Great fun. What a fun day!! From the moment Michel picked us up at our Riad until 6 hours later when he dropped us off we laughed so much!! The wonderful Fatiha helped us cook delicious food whilst Michel entertained by playing the drum. Great value for money too!

Excellent escape. It was a fantastic day and great escape from the hustle of the city. The cooking was amazing and the spice class added something extra. I like how there was an optional meal. We combine d it with the spa retreat for a perfect day. Purchased the orange blossom water and was happy to get some secret spices. Highly recommende Michel and his crew as excellent hosts and linguists.

Fabulous experience for our family!. Our hotel, Riad Menzeh, organized this culinary class for our family, and it was a highlight of our trip. Michel Paillet, our host at Faim d'Epices, made our children (ages 10 and 7) comfortable and safe, while entertaining and educating all of us. The day was delightful, the food we made was delicious, and the experience of cooking and learning together was unforgettable. We have even been inspired to try our recipes at home! I highly recommend Faim d'epices for their professional level of service with a completely personal touch.

A Relaxing day of Cooking and Merriment! Yum Yum!. My partner and I had a fantastic day cooking with Michel and the wonderful Fatiha. It was a 09:30 start and finished at 16:30. We were collected by a friendly driver for our 20 min. transfer. We enjoyed the drive away from the medina, taking in the sights and sounds a long the way.Our knowledge of Moroccan cooking was limited so this was a total introduction to a new food sensation. We arrived to a lovely welcome with a drink and time to relax and meet the other people on the course. It was nice to have Michel ask us all about where we were from as an ice-breaker. Already we felt at home and looking forward to food journey.For me, receiving instruction from Fatiha was the highlight. She was concise, demonstrated the techniques with flare, a brilliant teacher. She had a great sense of humour so it made the cooking delightful and fun. I really didn't stop smiling and learnt so much. Michel added the light-hearted fun to the day with uplifting music and rhythmic drum playing. He was always on hand to check the progress with our cooking and adjust any mishaps.We made a tasty tagine of chicken with red olives with Moroccan bread (batbout). My partner and I love food and cooking. Being able to learn together in this lovely relaxed atmosphere was pure pleasure. We loved our day with these great people. A big Thanks to the people behind the scenes doing the preparation and cleaning up. It was seamless, merry, carefree and an amazing highlight on our visit.

Very enjoyable experience. Very well organised, lovely setting and great fun. Fatima is a good teacher and taught us to cook a delicious meal. Michel is a great character and everyone enjoyed themselves immensely. Would highly recommend

Excellent fun. Unfortunately I was ill and unable to go to the class but my husband and adult children did and they loved it.They all said it was the highlight of our trip and they laughed all the way through the class thanks to the humour of the host.I have seen the photos and it looked great.From an organisational point of view I booked the class via their website and everything was easy and professionally dealt with.We've since been emailed with more recipes and a fake certificate with photo - a great touch.Well done to the whole team!

Great day out!. My boyfriend and myself had a great day with Michel and Fathima at the start of our trip to Marrakech. The pick up was seemless and once we arrived we were offered mint tea and coffee with the rest of the group (around 10 people). We learned how to make Moroccan bread, salads, pancakes (msemen) and a lamb tagine. We also had a class on spices which was good fun and informative. At the end of the day we ate everything that we had made outside in the sunshine which was lovely and relaxing. At times there was a bit of waiting around but Michel and Fathima were great hosts. Make sure you have a good breakfast as you don't eat until late afternoon! Definitely a must if in Marrakech!

Yum Yum. Had a wonderful introduction to Moroccan food and spices with Michel and Fathima on Monday. It was our first day in marrakech and a great start. We were collected promptly and met about 10 others at the school which is situated on the outskirts amidst orange and olive trees. We made delicious bread, though I say it myself, a great tagine of lamb and prunes and then learned how to make mesna a local layered pancake which the moroccans eat at breakfast. We ate our lunch on the terasse in the sunshine whilst being entertained by our very affable host.We learned a great deal, met some lovely folk and generally had a very memorable start to our holiday

Great experience, fun and learing ;-). My daughter (14) and myself went in mid February to Marrakech and participated on a Monday at the cooking course of "Faim d'Epices". This was one of the best days in Marrakech, we learned a lot (Tagine d'agneau with prunes, made bread, leared to do traditionnal salades) and at the same time had great fun (starting with rose blind glases during the spice testing ;-). Organisation was very easy, Michel picked us up at the hotel and brought us back in the evening. The cooking "school" is very well equiped, the explanations were very clear, so that even my daughter without cooking experience could produce a delicious Tagine ;-) and the group of people from 5 other countries was great. So a) I'd absolutely recommand it to everybody who likes "doing things" without having to be a great cook and b) a great thanks to Michel and his team for offering to us such a great day. By the way, we also took a cooking lesson at the "Maison Arabe", which is located in the Medina and which has a very modern equipment which turned out a good experience, but, gave us the feeling to be run as a somewhat more "chain" tourism attraction. If you have the choice, I'd personnally prefere the "Faim d'épice".

Great day, great food!. We had a brilliant day with Faimd'Epices team, learned about spices, cooked and ate great food. We chose the lamb tagine day, and cooked our own bread and pancakes as well as the tagine, which was absolutely fantastic - probably as good as the best tagine we had all trip. there is a bit of waiting and killing time but the grounds are nice and we sat in the sun for a while waiting for tagines to be cooked. We also went on hammam and massage with a Spa linked with Faim d'Epices which was a great treat.

A great day out! . My boyfriend and I have just come back from a day cooking with Michel and Fathima, we cooked beef tagine with peas and artichokes, made the traditional bread, crepes and saw how to make the many moroccan salads! We also had a lesson in moroccan spices which was very educational and interesting. Everything tasted delicious and the day itself was fantastic, lovely hosts and great food! Highly recommended.

An outstanding day. Had a truly magical day from start to finish. Was picked up from my hotel and made a couple of other stops to pick up others. There was an enjoyable trip out to a farm outside of the city. Michel is an excellent host and kept us entertained on the journey. We did a blind testing of key Moroccan spices and other ingredients and Michel talked to us about each ingredient. Our chef for the day Fatiha was fun and encouraging. We learnt how to cook Moroccan bread and a lamb tagine made with prunes. We then cooked our own. We were also taught how to make a variety of Moroccan salads and Moroccan pancakes. At the end of the day we sat together to eat our self-prepared meals. We were also surprised with a lovely desert of a trio of ice-creams, fresh fruit and Moroccan pancakes. We also were served water and orange juice throughout the day. There is a small shop were you are able to buy dishes, tagine pots and ingredients such as saffron and orange flower water at reasonable prices. At the end of the session you are given recipes to take away with you. A week after I returned home I received an e-mail from Michel with further recipes and photos. At the end of the day you are either driven back to your hotel or there is also the option of the spa package at the Mythic Oriental Spa, which was very good too and good value for money. I would recommend this day out unreservedly and hope to be able to go back for another visit soon. Many thanks Michel and Fatiha!

relaxing and fun!. Fun experience - loved all the spices and new recipes! They picked us up at our hotel, and also offered a package with a spa after, and gave us a ride there. High quality, relaxed, beautiful, clean - Highly recommended!

A 'must-do'. We thoroughly enjoyed our day at the Faim d'Epices. This was more than just a cooking class, we learned about spices, techniques and Moroccan culture in a friendly sociable environment. Really worth it! Thanks to Michel and Fatiha for a memorable day. Have already had a practice run at home which was well received!

Fantastic day activity. My partner and I had a fantastic day at Faim d'Epices. Michel and Fatiha were such great hosts and teachers! I would really recommend this if you have a spare day in Marrakech. Its so much fun and a good laugh as you get to chat away to other tourists and find out what they have been up to. We have already cooked out first tagine at home! (although the tagine pot we brought back was a little too small) So glad that we got to take the recipe home with us. It will definitely be a regular dinner party dish! A great day out and a must!

Lovely escape. This day out is worth the time and money. Michele is a lovely, gregarious host and our cooking instructor for the day was amazing.Learned plenty about spices and cooking techniques in a friendly and relaxed environment.Thanks Guys.John and Ollie.

Superb day out. My wife and I had a truly excellent day with Michel and Fatiha at Faim d'Epices. Michel is an incredible host and has an abundance of energy that kept us entertained throughout the day. He taught us some tricks of the trade when buying spices down the Souks and was clearly very passionate about cooking and eating which rubbed off on all of us guests. Michel delegates the cooking instruction to his superb assistant, Fatiha, who guided us through making bread, chicken tagines and salads. Everyone then made their own bread and tagine which was eaten out on the patio at the end of the course. I must say that the food was absolutely superb. Overall this was an absolutely fantastic experience that I would highly recommend.

What a great experience, don't miss this opportunity!. This will be one of the highlights of your visit to Marrakech. Michel is a fun and outgoing host with a passion for Morocco, food and people. He did a great job educating us on the spices, oils, ingredients and techniques used in Moroccan cooking. Our instructor, Fatiha, has a wonderful smile and warm personality. She guided us step by step through the process of putting together an outstanding dining experience, possibly the best tagine I have ever eaten (beef & pear w/candied oranges) wow, was it good! The special desert at the end was an unexpected treat and another chance to use our skills at identifying spices and flavors. I highly recommend Faim d'Epices as you experience the beautiful country and people of Morocco.

Great cooking day. Highly recommend Faim d'Epices! We had a great day learning about the spices and cooking methods which culminated in cooking a fantastic tajine of lamb with prunes and almonds. The spices play such a large role in the Moroccon cuisine that it was very interesting to learn more and we've been able to utilise the new skills at home.It's a beautiful location just outside Marrakech and Michel will drive you there if you are staying in medina or nearby.

Lovely day, with lovely people!. Even though we had travelled to Marrakech full of Flu, and not the man flu kind, we had an awesome day! Michel took care of me, laising my tea with remedies and potions to relieve my suffering! We made bread and Tarjiines and salads (with a frying pan) and ate the fruits of our labour out in the garden! Thank you all for a wonderful day!!

Brilliant cookery workshop!. My daughter and I had an excellent day cooking with Michel, Fatiha and the team. We made tagine, breads, and enjoyed the blind spice appreciation. Fatiha demonstrated the salads. Even though I say so myself the lamb, prune and almond tagine was divine, as good or even better than the ones we had in the best restaurants in Marrakech. Fatiha kindly gave me gluten free flour to make my own special bread ( I had mentionned this in advance). We spent the whole day there and ate the products of our work as a late lunch in the sun with the other participants.I totally recommend this workshop as a great day out!

We are junior Moroccan chefs!. Marrakech is a full assault on the senses and a day spent out with Michel and his wonderful chef and helpers gave another dimension to the whole experience. He is a charming sociable host who sets his guests at ease before setting them up for a fulfilling and thoroughly enjoyable practical lesson learning about the typical flavours and techniques for a classic tagine with breads and salads. Leaving the hustle and bustle of the medina for the relaxing surroundings of orange trees and greenery was also a lovely contrast and of course sitting out in the beautiful winter sun eating our dishes with fellow students was very satisfying.

A fun day cooking and eating. Our day at our cooking class was greater than our expectations, myself and sister had such a great day cooking and meeting new people ,we had so much fun and our host Michel is a warm and welcoming guy it made us none chefs feel very comfortable and relaxed, our chef was amazing and she made everything seem very easy and uncomplicated , the whole day is a must if your looking to take in some culture and knowledge of the country your visiting and you get to try and recreate the food at home with the help of the recipe you get given at the end of the day, We loved this day ,I highly recommend these guys to everyone

Fantastic day cooking and meeting new people. This is a really fun day out, you are picked up by their driver and taken direct to the cooking building which is set in a beautiful fruit ad veg garden. Michael is great fun from the beginning and the ladies are lovely and helpful too!As well as learning to cook traditional Moroccan food, the knowledge Michael has about Marrakech is amazing and really helpful! I have recommended this course to friends who are planning a trip to Marrakech, one of my holiday highlights!

A Treasure in Marrakesh. We booked both, the cooking class and Spa. Both were very enjoyable and we had a lot of fun during the day. Michel is a very nice guy who made a lot of fun with us. And of course we learned a lot, not only about Moroccan food. If you are in Marrakesh and have a free day, don't miss it out. Oh, i think its wise to book it in advance ;)e

Great experience, but quit far from the Medina. My husband and I were so excited to learn to cook the Moroccan way and this was a great introduction. Michel and his staff were wonderful and made us feel welcome. The other participants were from all over the world and it made the experience even more enjoyable. The only drawback for the day was a long drive out of the city to the school. Although it was a lovely setting, I had no idea the time it would take to travel to and from the facility. It was, however, a wonderful day and one that I can recommend.

A fun day with lovely people. As we were staying in the heart of the Medina we had to walk to the edge of the Medina to be picked up. We were due to be picked up at 9.30am and our lift arrived at exactly 9.30am, we were off to a good start. When we arrived at the venue, we were met by Michel who instantly made us all feel at home. After a few days within the souks, this venue was idyllic. We had drinks and got to know each other a little and then we were introduced to Fatima, who was just as lovely and charismatic as Michel. I love cooking but too often make excuses at home for not cooking as much as I would like. Michel and Fatima have awakened my love of cooking. My friend is not a big cook but she instantly fell in love with the whole concept and we both spent the day smiling and laughing. The food we ate on the patio at the end of the day was delicious and most of it was prepared and cooked by the group. I cannot think of one negative thing to say about the day. Michel even dropped myself and my friend off at the supermarket on our way back so we could buy some supplies. A brilliant day and definitely worth the visit.

Can not recommend enough - book your place now. The cookery course at Faim d'Epices was offered as one of the recommended trips at my Riad. I can not praise the day more highly. Faultless pick up and transfers, excellent peaceful location, high quality, clean cooing environment, expert, engaging and most importantly fun teaching and the end result a fantastic meal sat outside in the beautiful sun and some new skills to take home. The follow up to the day has even been excellent - I have been sent some photos of the day (great to have as I had gone by myself) and all the recipes for what we cooked along with some bonus ones too. The day offers amazing value for money based on the amount of food you have, the quality instruction and the transfers all included. I would happily book this day again and have been raving to all my friends about it since I came home!

Treat for all the senses. My partner and I had a fantastic (Christmas!) day at Faim f'Epices. Michel and Fatima are a lot of fun and the large kitchen is a delight. The setting among orange and lemon trees is peaceful. We enjoyed the blind smelling of different spices and preserves, and the meal we made was delicious. Highly recommend the combination with the spa afterwards. A memorable and hugely fun day. Learned and lot and laughed a lot too.

Super fantastic. I have been dying to take a cooking class during my travels. I finally did it, and I am worried I am ruined for all other courses. Michel and Fatiha are so charismatic, and made the experience phenomenal. The space they have created is quite exquisite as well. Fatiha is very patient and an excellent teacher. They have created an experience for their visitors that welcoming and homey. I loved every minute, and I think my boyfriend (who I dragged to the course) even enjoyed himself. That is impressive.
Loved it. We had a fantastic day at L'atelier Faim d'Epices - met some lovely people, learnt a lot about the food, spices and the country and now know the secrets of making a beautiful Moroccan meal.

Fantastic!. I would highly recommend this cooking course. You will learn a lot and eat delicious food. The host, Michel is great and the chef Fatiha is wonderful, knowledgeable and very patient. Enjoy!

Wonderful experience. The cooking class I took at Faim d'Epices was probably the best experience I had in Morocco. I think most of the other reviews speak to this, but I wanted to add that Michel and Fatiha were very charismatic and welcoming, which really created a great atmosphere. I'll definitely come back and learn another dish the next time I'm in Marrakech.One tip - do contact them in advance to see what's on the menu. There are different possibilities, and if you want to make something in particular, it's best to check their schedule.

Great day. We originally came to Marrakech to look at the souks but I am so glad I booked us something alternative to do for one of the days and so glad it turned out to be so good. Michel is an excellent host full of local information. The lady cooking was very friendly and easy to follow. The food we made, beef tagine with pears and the bread, all turned out really good and we have managed to replicate both at home since. A really good day out, highly recommended. In fact go before you go to the souks as Michel has some very useful information that could prove invaluable when buying spices.

A brilliant day cooking Moroccan food - lovely surroundings and good company.. A day cooking traditional Moroccan food in the surroundings of an olive grove. You are collected in the morning then driven to the cookery school. After some mint tea your senses are tested with a spice test - then onto cooking. We cooked a beef, artichoke and pea Tagine with flatbread. All made from scratch - and with demonstrations from the chef. We made Moroccan pancakes for dessert. After the cooking we ate lunch outside - a real sense of achievement!! The host was very friendly and good fun - the day was a real joy- learning new skills and attempting a different style of food.There is an option to team this up with a booking for spa treatments - you will see this on the webpage. I recommend it - we finished our day being pampered and the whole experience was well worth it.

Fun, instructive and yummy. Following great reviews on Trip Adviser I decided to book this for my partner and I and am so glad I did.
