It was a great day out- we were picked up from our Riad by the host Michel, the most friendly Parisian I know. At the cookery school we met the other eight participants, had mint tea or coffee and then watched a Tagine being made before learning about spices used in Morrocan cuisine. Then we made local bread and started our Tagines. We also learnt how to make Morrocan breakfast pancakes and salads. When all our Chicken and preserved lemon dishes were ready we all sat in the sun to enjoy the fruits of our labour. Delicious!!!A great day well spent. Thanks Michel.

MUST DO, I MISS YOU GUYS EVERYDAY <3. I visited with a group of friends and by far this was my favorite day in Marrakech. The host and his wife are adorable. Staff are brilliant and awesome teachers, so much positivity. I will visit again without a doubt. Miss you guys a lot <3

Great Morrocan Experience!!. Michel picked us up on 'Morrocan' time but this did not spoil the day at all!! Was an amazing experience from start to finish. A great insight into Moroccan cuisine and extremely informative. This class will tantalise all 5 senses. A must do whilst in Marrakech!

The best cooking class in the WORLD!!!!. I have done quite a few low-key cooking classes (Thailand, Vietnam, Japan, France, America, Morocco) and this one tops them all. With L'atelier Faim d'Espice's great host, detailed instruction, local knowledge and a great food, you will not be disappointed. This will definitely be a highlight of your time in Morocco.

Hats off to the chefs ;). A great day on the outskirts of Marakech. Attention to detail of owner and the staff was fantastic. Highly recommend to anyone wanting to cook and learn moroccan dishes and those who want to eat!

One of the best experiences in Morocco!. You should definitely try and attend a cooking school if you're in Marrakesh, particularly this one. Not only do you learn from Michael and Fateha the art of Moroccan cooking, but also about the spices themselves. My husband and I had so much fun cooking the best tangine we've had in Morocco ( and we were here for 10 days). You have an option to buy a package of Mythic Orient Spa (hammam) and cooking school for a full day experience; we opted to wait til Fes for our hammam to make use of more time exploring Marrakesh.

Faboulous Experience. Booked the day course cooking experience. Pickup very punctual. All team members very friendly and pleasant environment. Bit out of Marrakesh, so despite the pick up and return a bit of a hassle. Overall great fun, obviously also driven by the people who share the experience with you! Booked the combo with the Mystic Oriental Spa which was OKissh, but compared to other Spa experience, such as in the Mosaic Palais not top notch

Fabulous day of cooking. Booked the course based on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. We paid about 45euros each for the day.We were collected by Michele at 0930am nearby our hotel and he drove us to the restaurant/kitchen in a beautiful location.The day consisted first of a nice menthe tea, followed by a demonstration on the bread we would be cooking later on. We then took part in a spices smell test which was thoroughly enjoyable. After this we moved on to preparing our bread which was ever so fun.We were then shown how to cook the bread, before making our main course which was a lamb & prune tajine (Vegetarian option available) which was gorgeous. A demo of three different salads followed as well as how to make the Moroccan crepes before we ate our food.Michel then gave us each a copy of our recipes before taking us back to the hotel around 4pm. Overall it was a really enjoyable day offering great value for money. Even if you aren't experienced in the kitchen, go along and give it ago, both cooks are ever so helpful and won't let you go wrong. Thank you so much to everyone involved!

Perfect for foodies and fun-lovers. We loved our day at Faim d'Espices.The high-energy cooking day was a perfect balance of learning to cook authentic Moroccan dishes and having a nice social time with fellow travelers and local people.Will definitely take away a new love for Tagines and memories of a fun day out in beautiful setting. I would certainly recommend this day trip to friends and families who enjoy cooking and eating!One thing I would advise is eat a big breakfast before as we ate our lunch quite late (about 3/3.30). Michel and Fatima were perfect hosts and provided drinks and snacks but I would still advise eating a good breakfast beforehand.
Amazing. This day trip was amazing Couldn't fault anything. Both teachers could not be any better A must do !

Faim d'Epices and Mythic Orient Spa day package- really nice!. I decided to book the day cooking course with Faim d'Epices and follow-on hammam and massage at Mythic Orient spa and it was really great. I paid about 100 euros but it was a packed day lasting from 10am until about 8pm (10am-4:30pm at Faim d'Epices and 5pm-8pm at the spa). I loved learning how to cook tajine/local bread and my partner was accommodated with a vegetarian option even though beef was the menu of the day. The spa was great too- I'd always been afraid to try a local hammam and the spa version was the perfect combo of traditional hammam and modern privacy, anyways a great intro. The massage was WONDERFUL! Anyways, recommend either or both!

Sensational experience - yet again!. We first met Michel 3 years ago when we booked a combination of the Tagine lesson and Hammam massage. The experience was so good that when we decided in November to visit Marrakech for a few days of sun before Christmas we looked to see if we could do it again. We were greeted like old friends and had another fabulous time, collected from our hotel by Michel and taken to his farm. We learnt how to prepare a beef tagine this time (it was lamb previously) and we made fresh bread to go with our lunch. I rarely do any experience twice but we left wanting to do it again and I expect that we will. Later in the afternoon we were transported to a fabulous Hammam in the centre of the Medina which completed our day perfectly. Unusually the weather in Marrakech was variable but it did not matter, my winter break was made by Michel. I rarely complete reviews but when I find a reliable, enthusiastic and competent Frenchman who consistently delivers what he promises I will make comment. (Having read my review I should point out that I have only met Michel twice, 3 years apart)

Very nice day. We enjoyed the whole day. The day started, we were picked up at our hotel on time. During the ride we had a nice conversation and got to know more about Marocco. We arrived in a beautifull place. Very nice and helpfull people. Getting to know the spices is very nice done, cooking was big fun. Compliments for all of the team. The place is clean and hospitelity is hudge. Language was not a problem, I had enough time to translate for my mother. Thanks to the patience and explaining she didn't miss a thing.

A Moroccan Thanksgiving. We were in Morocco for thanksgiving and figured since we weren't home this would be a fun alternative. I truly enjoyed the experience. We started with a demo on how to make traditional bread and moved to learning about spices what they are and how they're used. We cooked every aspect of our meal and it was a blast. I really would recommend anyone who is in Marrekech and you want to learn how to cook Moroccan food to come here.

An enjoyable day. I had a wonderful day. I enjoyed the spices and.would highly recommend this course to anyone coming to Marrakesh. Michel and his team were a delight and it was informal and funWell done!!!

A must do in Morocco. I am sorry this is so late, we were hoping to try all the recipes again to see if we can re-create them after a wonderful day but so far so good! This place was highly rated on TripAdvisor and i can see why - great staff (who dropped us back at the airport!), great food, nice and relaxed on the hottest day of our trip, and recipes to recreate on our return that actually work. We enjoyed everything that we cooked and it was lovely to sit outside in the shade, all the group together, enjoying our work, with a glass of wine. All i can say is sign up now!

A great experience!!. We had a fabulous time doing this cookery course. It was informative but most of all, it was a load of fun. Michel was a fantastic host with a great sense of humour. The Moroccan lady that thought us (Fatima?) was very good and quite stern at times, which was needed as most of us were talking all the time. I bought a tagine on the premises and we have already used it to make a kefta tagine. It turned out really well.All in all we had a fantastic time and if we ever go back, we would like to do the advanced course. Well done Michel & staff!!!!!!!

Wonderful day with tajines, breads, salad and fun!. I spent about five hours in early November 2014 at the cooking class for Moroccan cuisine. It was a Monday, so we prepared lamb with prunes tajine. The class was full of funny but also serious students from around the world and the instructors were excellent: thoughtful, but also demanding and helpful to students, like me, who were less skilled than some of the others. Rolling dough for various breads was a challenge, but we all prevailed. Highly recommended for its teaching skills, information about Moroccan spices, good company and a delicious lunch. It would make a wonderful family outing: kids would love the dough challenge and everyone would enjoy eating the results of the day's labor. There's also a small shop where visitors can buy authentic saffron, many other spice combinations, and cooking utensils (like tajines). Don't miss it!

Fabulous!. A great cooking class by people who are passionate about food and make cooking s fun experience. We were picked up on time in the morning and it was about a 40 minute drive to the farm out of Marrakech. We were then introduced and shown how to cook bread, a variety of salads, a tagine and moroccan pancakes. Along with this, we were given an overview of the spices and ingredients often used in Moroccan cuisine.Michel and the chefs were hilarious, very knowledgable and made us feel welcome on the farm!
Cooking Class. We had a splendid time in the cooking lesson, it was an open heaven experience.The team were exceptionally professional. They were bubbly and very friendly.

Never been on a cooking course before, and if they're all like this then I've been missing out!. After 3 days exploring Marrakech we needed a relaxing activity and this turned out to be perfect. Transported out of the city to a peaceful countryside location, learning to cook mouth watering Moroccan dishes but above all having a lot of fun.The host, Michel, is very welcoming and entertaining making you feel instantly at ease. The chef we had, Nezha, made Moroccan cooking look easy, and explained it so well it felt easy. Would whole heartedly recommend to anyone who's visiting Marrakech.

Good overview of food and culture. More than a cooking class - learned about spices, the local agriculture in lovely environment. If you just want to cook and nothing else, then I think something in the Medina would be better. This was more of an intro to Morocco class with 70% cooking.

Best day, don't miss it. This was without doubt our best day in Marrakech. Michel is entertaining and informative, making the whole experience really enjoyable. The tagine we made was the best we ate during our stay. We also did the hammam and loved that too.

Mouth watering entertainment. Already expecting an exciting interactive course from the reviews, it lived up to expectations. Learnt so much about blending spices together to get the perfect mix of flavours. Nothing bring food together like the "Morrocan special spice"

A must do in Marrakech. I can't say how much my husband and I enjoyed our day at Faim d'Epices. Michel created an informative yet fun and relaxed day at his farm. Cooking instructor was awesome. I have been to other cooking classes and the format of this cookery school is great. Everyone tries their hand at all the dishes and you also see great demonstrations. The farm is approx. 20 minutes from Marrakech and it is a beautiful location. I nice break from the busy streets of the Medina.

A terrific end to a foody holiday. Joined this cooking class when I had finished doing a food tour and loved the approach Michel took. The spice class was great fun and tips about freshness and fakes were great - something worth doing at the start of your trip for sure. The making of the breads was educational and helped put a level of appreciation into the morning msemen that I had been enjoying throughout the trip. The cooking of the Beef and pear tagine was great fun and absolutely delish! The atmosphere is fun and relaxed, with good music to shake the hips to as you prepare the meal (or maybe that is just something crazy I like to do!). Michel was a great host and very accommodating, dropping a member of my group to the airport on the way. Very enjoyable and the recipe at the end is a great keepsake to feast on at home!

The highlight of an incredible trip. Everything about L'atelier Faim d'Epices is incredible. Michel, the owner, picked us up at our riad in the morning and drove us outside the city to his atelier. We learned about spices and the Moroccan culture and were then guided through bread-making, the subtlety of a great tagine, and finished it off with Moroccan crepes. Fatiha (sp?), our teacher, could not have been more lovely and gracious. I plan on coming back to expand my knowledge and abilities. It's a great value, and it was honestly the highlight of a very special trip. The warmth and hospitality of the people of Marrakech is second to none. I couldn't recommend this experience more highly.

A thoroughly enjoyable day out. Based on recommendations, we were already expecting an informative and interactive day learning about Moroccan cooking and flavours, however Michel's fun personality and joie de vivre made it one of the most fun days of our week's holiday and the food we cooked was amazing.The herb and spice discovery session was fun as well as informative (and helped inform our souk shopping!)We will be trying the recipe again when we get home and hope to wow our friends and family with our new found culinary skills.
Enjoy Moroccan cooking course, great. Really great cooking day.Entertaining, fun and tastfull day.Highly recommend.Fun for everyoneDutch, visit with my wife and mother.
Fun cookery day. This is great fun and really well organised. A good sociable activity to do away from the bustle of the city.

Fun Foodie Experience. If you have an interest in food you'll love this entertaining cookery class. Even as a non-cook I managed to make bread and a delicious beef tagine! The spice session was really useful and informative. The whole day was great fun and the highlight was sitting down to enjoy the lunch we had prepared. It was lovely to meet Michel, his wife and the whole team. A worthwhile experience.

Entertaining & Educational. We were highly recommended by a friend not to miss Michel’s cooking course when visiting Marrakesh. The whole experience was amazing and a welcomed escape from the busy Medina. Michel was hilariously entertaining whilst the rest of the team showed us how to cook delicious Moroccan cuisine. Highly Recommended!

Wonderful way to spend a day in Marrakech. We had a great day out at Faim d’espices. Everything was excellent - the team has developed a day that seems to perfectly cater to what the people want. The spice demonstration was something different and was good fun. The food was delicious and it is definitely the most enjoyable cooking class I have ever done. The little extras including spice mixes, recipes and photos were just the icing on the cake. Such a good day. Book now!
Enjoyable Day. We spent a day cooking tagine and bread plus learnt about spices in a relaxed and friendly atmosphere. It was a welcome break from the hustle and bustle of the souks.

Educational and relaxing day. Everything about this experience was enjoyable, and I found it an excellent value. Michel is a fun and enthusiastic host who brings energy and joy to his presentation. He was right on time picking me up in the medina, and my adventure started there as he navigated the tiny streets and the crazy Marrakech traffic. Upon arrival, the guests spent a few minutes chatting and getting to know one another, then we dove right in to the spices course. I appreciated the hands-on learning, especially for making bread. I will incorporate the Moroccan style of onion-chopping into my cooking at home now too! The beef and candied orange peel tagine with pears that we made was one of the best meals of my trip. As a solo traveler, it was lovely having a day to connect with others in such a warm atmosphere. Thank you for a beautiful memory!

Excellent. I honestly don't have anything bad to say about this course. It is a nice relief from the ruckus in Marrakech. They pick you up and drive you to their beautiful farm. The food was delicious, the teacher was good and easy to follow and the atmosphere was nice.

Tangine cooking and friends. A wonderful day away from the madness of the medina. Our host, Michel and his team were one of the highlights of our trip. We made new friends, laughed a lot and enjoyed a wonderful meal and great conversation. Absolutely recommend it!

Great fun. On the last day of our holiday in Marrakech, I booked the workshop just the evening before. My wife and I, 2 kids of 13 and 15 and their grand parents had a great day. We were picked up on time, learned a lot about baking bread, spices, salads and of course Tajine and were dropped at the airport afterwards. The teacher was very nice, instructions clear and the food excellent! Thank you Michel and team!

Great memories. This experience had clearly been worked out with great detail to ensure everyone had a fantastic day. From the pick up to the drop off there is nothing I would change. We were picked up on time, clean car, great driver along with some of the other guests. We were greeted with mint tea or coffee and had fresh orange juice and nibbles during the morning. The session on spices was fascinating with bite-sized facts. The demonstrations were great to watch and easy to follow when it came to your turn. Michael was born to entertain and Nezha clearly a very accomplished cook. To then sit and eat our tagines in the wonderful garden whilst chatting to everyone was lovely. If you are thinking of doing this stop reading now and book - you will not be disappointed. A holiday highlight.

The best cooking classes and fun!. When my friend told me he wanted to book this class. I thought ' great I hate cooking ' However this was made really fun and I learnt loads. The class is very laid back and fun ! Being a vegatarian I hardly had any good food in morocco, however this was my favourite meal, even better that I cooked it. Thank you for everything ! We went for the massage after and it was lovely!

Lovely day away from the hustle of the Medina. It's was a day well spent in the company of Michel and his team! The day was full and interesting , we made new friends, learned a few cooking tips and enjoyed a lovely meal in great company ! Highly recommended !!
Great day!. Well worth doing, great fun and learn't loads, Michel is hilarious and his team are very professional. One of the highlights of my trip to Morocco.

What a lovely day. We were entertained by Michel from the moment we arrived to the minute we left. Nezha helped us to make some local bread, lamb tagine (nothing like we try to make at home - much more delicious), salads and a Moroccan pancake. Then a lovely lunch where we ate our endeavours. Nezha was very patient and Michel regaled us with stories and we listened to his musical talents whilst we cooked. He also gave us a very instructive lesson on the spices used in Moroccan cookery. What a lot of fun and we learnt something too - definitely worth booking. This is easy to do via email before you even fly there. Do it!

Highlight of our trip. My husband and I joined the cooking class together and we were picked up near our hotel and taken to a farm outside the city. We were met with other people who joined the class. Michel the owner welcomed us with mint tea and gave us an introduction on the programme. We learned about spices in morocco and learned to make Moroccan bread which was the most fun part! We also made a tagine which was delicious and saw a demonstration on Moroccan salads. Overall the experience was fun, educational accompanied with delicious food and people! Thank you Michel for giving us a wonderful experience!

A great day. My husband and I recently visited Marrakech and went on a one day cooking workshop at Faim d'Epices. Michel picked us up near our riad promptly and entertained us all the way to the farm. We found the lessons very good with an excellent teacher. Afterwards we got to eat the fabulous food cooked during the day and we really had fun with the other participants. I would recommend this trip as it was nice to get away from the very busy city for a few hours. For what we got the day was extremely good value.

Fantastic!. My boyfriend and I recently took a cooking class at Faim d'Epices and absolutely loved it! We were picked up and dropped off right near our riad in central Marrakech. Michel was very welcoming and great fun, and Nezha was a friendly and talented cook (and linguist...our group was made up of French and English speakers and she switched between the two languages easily!) The spice session was really informative and fun. We then made some delicious and authentic dishes, which we enjoyed eating on the patio in the sunshine. There was also a great range of tagines, traditional ceramics and spices to buy, which were much cheaper than we had managed to barter the sellers in the souk down to the previous day! All in all, a great day, with a great atmosphere and we would thoroughly recommend it to anyone visiting Marrakech. Thanks Michel :)

Best cooking workshop ever. Being entertained the whole day and learning lots about spices and the Moroccan cuisine was the best combination ever for a cooking workshop.Michel and his staff made this day a memorable one and I can highly recommend this course to everybody who likes cooking.

Outstanding food course. Brilliant instruction by Michel. He was a brilliant host. Nezha was a brilliant cook who had time to show us every step involved in making a delicious tagine.The location is perfect and truly representative of Moroccan luxury.

Very informative and entertaining!. My husband and I took this class in mid-September and had a wonderful time. We had never done a cooking class while traveling before so weren't sure how we'd like it, but were pleasantly surprised. We had been in Marrakech for a few days and had tried to pinpoint some of the spices used in the food we had eaten so we really picked up on a lot during the spice lesson. Nezha and Michel were very friendly and organized. We enjoyed learning the cooking methods and the food was delicious! We will definitely try to recreate some of the recipes at home and recommend the class to anyone who is interested in cooking and learning more about Moroccan food.

Fantastic!. Highly recommend spending the day at Faim d'Epices. Everything was professionally run and well organized. Learning about the spices and how to cook Moroccan food provides an interesting appreciation for Moroccan culture. Michel is a fabulous, entertaining host and really makes the experience fun for everyone.

Delicious food in a relaxed but educational class. My wife and I took the class together. During the class we learned not only the basics of moroccan cooking that will allow us to cook similar dishes at home, but we learned how to buy saffron, argan oil and spices without being conned into buying fake goods - since we took the class at the beginning of our trip, this was especially useful. Michel was our teacher for the day, who had a great sense of humor, and was fun to spend time with. Overall, this was a great way to spend a day relaxing, enjoying great food, and learning to cook in a tajine!

Brilliant day. My boyfriend and I went to Faim d'Epices on my birthday at the end of September as I make a lot of Moroccan food at home and wanted to learn some authentic recipes.We had a fantastic day. We were picked up my Michel who is a really funny and enthusiastic host and driven out into the countryside where they have a beautiful purpose built cooking school.The spices workshop is really good and Michel gives good advice on how to shop for spices in the Souks.I really loved learning to make the Batbout and the whole meal at the end was deliciousIf you do one thing in Marrakech do this course - great fun and great value.

Fabulous from start to finish!. The class is extremely well-organized and, no need to say, delicious! No doubt, the best mint tea I tried during my two weeks in Morocco was that prepared by Michel, and the tastiest tajine was my own creation ;-) Michel's tip how to tell real saffron from a fake came in most handy later at a souk - I dare say I felt like an expert! Many thanks to Michel and his team for the fantastic kick-off of my Moroccan journey.

A beautiful place to learn the Art of Moroccan Cooking. We can't say enough good things about our cooking class at Faim d'Epices:- The staff were energetic and fun- The structure of cooking class was well set up and it was easy to learn- The food was delicious- The classroom is clean and bright- They keep the number of participants low (max class size was 10)- The spice workshop was a great learning experience

Exceptional!!! Would absolutely recommend if you're in Marrakech!. Fabulous!!! Very easy to set up via email. They happily accommodated my food request (vegetarian). Transportation was also handled well - picked up at a main attraction super close to my hotel, and was on time. The actual class was awesome, from start to finish. When we arrived, Michel welcomed us with tea (or espresso), and made us feel very welcome and comfortable. (Side note: Michel is positively hilarious, and kept us entertained the whole day with fun stories, cooking tips, and just general great conversation-- never a dull moment with that guy). We crammed lots into the day. We learned about spices, how to make traditional Moroccan bread, crepes, three different salads, and a tagine. There was a good balance between watching the pros do it, and having hands on cooking. Also, Michel took pictures throughout the day and emailed them to me a few days later. And the day ended with a wonderful meal out on the terrace, complete with wine and good conversation. I have no complaints, it was a great experience all around!! If you're in Marrakech, I would absolutely take this class again. It was by far the highlight of the trip!!!!!!!!!!!

Definitely the top attraction in Marrakesh. I understand why this cooking class is rated so highly. From pickup the experience and service was nothing short of excellent. We were picked up at our Riad by the owner Michel who gave us a Moroccan cultural lesson on our way to his location. He was informative and funny at the same time. At the class we learned how to select spices, prepare the tangine of the day and make Moroccan Bread. After it all we were able to relax on the terrace and eat our meal. Overall the entire staff was very friendly and engaging. Other major positives 1) they grow their own vegetables 2) Michel has paintings etc for purchase from local artisans at a very good deal. Bought a Tangine which I can't wait to use. Would highly recommend to anyone visiting Marrakesh.

Wonderful day spent learning authentic Moroccan cooking. We had an excellent day at L'atelier Faim d'Epices. From the time we were picked up at our Riad the learning began. We learned how to decipher and select local spices in the market, prepared a delicious tagine, accompanying moroccan bread, and desert. We also learned how to prepare various Moroccan salads. The team spoke very clear English and made sure everyone was engaged and enjoying themselves all day. There was a wonderful gift shop with very affordably priced spices and trinkets (I was please to purchase my very own Tagine). A few days later, the owner emailed us additional recipes for various tagines. All around, it was a wonderful day! Highly recommended.

A great experience. A definite highlight in my trip to Marrakech! Michel (the host) and the team at Faim d'Epices created a fun and easy to follow cooking class that takes you through the basics of Moroccan spices and cooking. My class was filled with people from all over the world, spanning different age groups. I had the best time getting to know them as much as I did learning how to cook. My advice would be to book this for the middle of your trip, as you can trade travel stories with the other students and get great tips from them as well as Michel on how to navigate Marrakech. My friend and I opted for the cooking class + hammam deal, and it ended up being one of the best days of our trip.

excellent, great day. A great day, went with my mum as a break from lying in the sunMichael the host was great very entertainingThe cooking course was carried out by a great lady, who gave really good instructions, We made beef with pears which was delicious, and some flat bread, as well as demo's of salads and crepes.We all sat down to eat together and the end of the course which was a lovely way to finishWould really recommend this, and the fact you get picked up and dropped off makes it all so easy.

Highlight of our trip. We can't recommend this fun day enough. Michel is a great host and we had a really enjoyable experience. The kitchen was well equipped, clean and well laid out. The lady chef (whose name I have forgotten) spoke fantastic english and instructed us well. We made our own traditional bread, beef tagine and traditional pancakes. We were also instructed on making Moroccan salads. Everybody worked together at a steady pace and my husband who is not a cook really enjoyed the day. We ate our own cooking afterwards. We were picked up from our riad in the Medina and taken back at the end of the day, all as part of the package. Thank you to Michel for the photos of our day. Karen, Herts.

Cooking class. We had a really wonderful day learning to cook different Moroccan dishes at Faim d´Épices. The team was excelent, as well, as the food. It was great to the able to do the food, learn about the spices used, and enjoy the meal. Congratulations! Keep up the excelent work

Perfect day and delicious food . Michele is a funny guy and hosted the event perfectly. We learned a lot about the marrocan cooking and had a lot of fun. Poorly we made the course on our last day.. He teached us about the difference between real and fake spices.. So maybe we bought the wrong stuff ;) Highly recommend for the first days!

A really fun day!. Thank you so much to the team at Faim d'Epices, me and my friends had a wonderful day. I couldn't recommend this activity any more to everyone, even people like me that don't really enjoy cooking at home (and can't cook very well). I was amazed at the food I produced. The course was set at a really good pace with other good activities to keep you entertained throughout the day. It was really handy having a free transfer from the hotel also.Highly recommend.

I wish this was how I cooked everyday. Don't think twice. Just book it and go!Such an excellent day! So much fun! I arrived home yesterday and had to cook on my own. It was so boring as Michel and his team were not there to entertain and help me! I won't say much more as I don't give away the secrets of what will be the best cooking course you will ever go to - because you read my first comment and just booked already!I will also add that we did the deal with the spa - which was also amazing. Generally, I just want to go back and relive that day!Book now!

Cooking class . An excellent way to spend an afternoon/morning in morocco!! Absolutely worth every penny!!! Wonderful learning experience, a good chance to experience the best of Moroccan cuisine in a relaxed and friendly atmosphere. I really recommend this if you have the time..

Great cooking and heaps of fun. We had a fabulous day! Michal is a great host, very entertaining and welcoming. We made Tagine with lamb and prune as well as breads and salads. All turned out delicious, one of the best meals we had in Morocco. The school is out of town but this was no problem and transfers are included in the cost. It's actually nice to get out of the hustle and bustle of the city. I highly recommend Fiam d'epices it was one of our favourite days of our trip!

Such a great experience!. We had such a wonderful day learning to cook different Moroccan dishes at the farm. We saved an entire day for this experience in Marrakesh and it was definitely a highlight of the trip. It was very easy to book and we were picked up and dropped off at the times promised so it was easy to organise our trip around the day. The team at the farm were very attentive and kept us engaged. They taught us a lot about different spices as well as simple cooking tips you wouldn't ever think of. I highly recommend this course!

Highly recommended – relaxed and fun. This was a really enjoyable day out. We went to the cooking class as a couple and there were a few other tourists there. Transport was provided from our Riad in the medina, and was included in the price of the class. The price was very reasonable and there are no hidden costs or pressures to buy souvenirs which was refreshing! Both the owner Michel and the cooking instructor Nezha were informative, friendly and helpful and their passion for food was clear. They also both spoke English very well. The level of cooking is not too difficult and it was great to learn about the traditional ingredients and cooking styles of Morocco. (We made lamb tagine) The teaching style was very easy going, and varied between demonstrations and hands on cooking. There was a very interesting session of learning about spices too. The school had a very warm, relaxed atmosphere and the class was a lot of fun. The classroom area is very clean, spacious and modern and well equipped with individual cooking stations. Snacks and soft drinks were provided during the day too.We finished the day by sitting down to dine on the food we had just cooked, in a beautiful sunny garden where much of the fresh produce for the class is grown. If you are looking for something different to do in Marrakech, I would highly recommend this.

A lotta fun... A super fun and really informative course, really well structured, and Michel made it all rather entertaining too.. Also loved that a lot of the ingredients we used (if not most?) were grown right in the backyard. We did the course as part of the spa deal which was great, but I'd definitely recommend it on its own too.

Fun day at the farm. Enjoyable day at Faim D'Epice - we made bread and Tagine (of course) and then got to eat it all! Michel and his team are extremely knowledgeable about Morrocan cuisine and the spices that go into it. We've already had a go at cooking one of the recipes we tried out on the day

Enjoyed every minute. Is it wrong that of a week long holiday my favourite day was spent in a classroom in the middle of nowhere cooking my own lunch?! That's not to say we didn't enjoy the rest of the trip because it was great but the highlight was definitely the day spent with Michel and them. We were picked up promptly at 9.50 as promised and driven to the class where we were given mint tea and coffee on arrival. The day was exactly as explained on the website, detailed demonstrations followed by us then making our own version. The whole day ran like clockwork, the team were super efficient and very welcoming. Michel is a fabulous host and very entertaining. His enthusiasm is infectious and really brought the class out of themselves so we were all getting along well. Nezha was very patient and explained everything very clearly in English so no language issues. Best of all everyone had a delicious meal at the end that they had cooked themselves. I am very glad that our friends recommended this to us and we would highly recommend it to anyone else.

A really fun day!. My friend and I did the beef and couscous class and it was a fantastic day. We learned how to make couscous from scratch, which was a long but rewarding process, and made a few other treats and meal staples. It was nice to spend the day away from the Medina and learn how to cook some of the food we had been eating. The transfer was relatively easy, we weren't sure if we were in the right spot but the van had very clear marking so we just followed it down the road. Michel was great and was a very entertaining host. Our chef was highly attentive and made sure to check everyone's progress so everyone would get a meal at the end of the day. Even if you're not great in the kitchen I would recommend taking a day to visit Michel and Faim d'Epices.

Our best experience in Morocco. Brilliant day. In fact probably our best in Marrakech. It was lovely to spend the day away from the business of Marrakech and relax with other travellers whilst learning how to cook Moroccan food. The food was delicious and staff were friendly and welcoming, especially Miguel who evidently loves his job and makes you feel at ease and has a good sense of humour. We would highly recommend it - definitely worth the money.

a wonderfull experience whilst in Marrakech. I did this class with my mother and a friend whilst spending a week in Marrakech. What a great day, from the moment of pick up to being dropped off in the afternoon. Michel was a wonderful, charming host. The team were accommodating and many laughs were had. Absolutely worth doing and highly recommended.
Great day. Really enjoyable day and Michel was a great host. Good layout in the 'classroom' - demonstrator at the front and students around to follow. Very interactive throughout. Highly recommended.

Great experience in Marrakech. My husband and I took the cooking class on our last day in Marrakech - if we had one more day, we would have gone back again! This place is an oasis in the midst of Marrakech mayhem. Michel was very accommodating to our requests (changing beef to lamb as we don't eat beef) and providing snacks as well. We had an amazing feast that we prepared in the beautiful garden at the farm and Michel served up some delicious icecream for dessert as well. Absolutely worth going!

Best day out. A lovely day spent with Michel and his team learning how to make a Tagine with all the spices. my daughter booked this for us after visiting last year. The whole experience was very good from beginning to end. The instructions were very clear and the blindfolded spice testing was helpful in identifying which spices you could use for various meals.The team looked after us well and we ended the day eating our meal sat on the terrace with Michel sharing a bottle of wine . I would recommend it to anyone wanting a good experience around Moroccan cooking.

Amazing Experience, Highly Recommended!. I can't compliment this course enough. We booked through our Riad the day before and were so glad we did. Pickup and transport to venue was perfect, only 20 minutes from the main square and was interesting to see neighbourhoods outside the city on route. We were welcomed by the owner Michel on arrival and offered tea/ coffee while we chatted and learned about what we were going to be doing for the day. The course is held at a beautifully decorated purpose built premises with chill out area, small shop, clean toilets and fully kitted out work stations for all guests. We could tell straight away that it was going to be a great experience, Michel is an amazing host, very funny and laid back and he put all of us (3 young couples from Ireland, England and Scotland) at ease straight away, which can be rare in Marrakech! The main chef, Nezha, is also lovely and a great teacher, she gave just the right amount of clear instruction and was very patient. Throughout the day we did a blind spice test (good fun and very informative), made Moroccan bread (was glad we got a demo first before taking a stab at it ourselves!) pancakes and a lamb and prune tagine. We were also shown how to make a range of Moroccan salads and crepes. We were happy to hear that the oil and a lot of the vegetables we used came from the gardens on site. We really enjoyed Michel’s bongo playing while we were cooking, it added to the atmosphere! We also appreciated the water, nuts, and orange juice we were given to keep us going until dinner. When everything was ready we ate on the beautiful outdoor terrace. Afterwards we had the crepes with a variety of unusual ice creams and fruit, yummy! The food was out of this world and filled us up for the rest of the day, by far best food we had in Marrakech. We enjoyed every bite and it was really enjoyable to chat with Michel, his wife and other guests while eating. Michel was very friendly and happy to give us advice about Marrakech and was genuinely interested in hearing our stories. It is obvious he is a people person who is truly passionate about what he does and this really made the whole experience very personal, relaxing and pleasant. After dinner we were offered more tea/ coffee while filling out a short feedback form and were delighted that Michel gave us a copy of the recipes to take home:) There was absolutely no hard sell to purchase extras or shake down for tips which was really refreshing after a few days in the souks. We were actually sad to leave at the end of the day, would go back in a heartbeat! Thank you so much to Michel and Co., we will never forget the experience, I am already using some of the cooking tips we learned at home, the Moroccan way to chop an onion in particular! Don't even think twice about booking this course, it is worth every penny and then some, just book it and Michel and his team will look after the rest! Enjoy!

Real Moroccan Cultural Experience. Best day of my Marrakech experience and I loved Marrakech, the team is really welcoming and friendly and did everything the could to make our day a real Moroccan cultural spice extravaganza cant wait to go back and have another amazing day with Michel and his fabulous Team :-D

My favourite day in Marrakech. What a fantastic day. Everything was so well organised and Michel was a wonderful host. The young woman who actually taught us how to make the tagine, bread, salad and crepes was a joy. We then ate everything we made outside in the sunshine with the other people on the course. It's a must, even if you think you don't like cooking. I would go again in a heartbeat.

Great Day. Easy to arrange, nice to have a day out of Marrakech. Transfer worked well and Michel was a great host. The cooking experience was well thought out and great fun. We had our 18 year old daughter with and she thoroughly enjoyed (not bad as she is not a foodie!). Good value and a really interesting day.
Wonderful Moroccan experience. We had a great days cooking with Michel and all the team. I would highly recommend the spa experience combo what a day. Thanks againIan and Avril

Fantastic Cookery class and spice recognition. My daughter and I are in Marrakech/High Atlas Mountains for 10 days and booked a cookery class before we left the UK. I'd always tried to cook Moroccan food but failed miserably. We had a fantastic day learning to make local bread, a crash course on recognising spices by smell (not sight) and cooking a delicious beef tagine. We then ate 'en famille' and al fresco and enjoyed the fruits of our labours. Michel and all the staff were great and we've come away with a much better insight into the culture of Morocco, what to watch out for and a new found confidence in cooking tagines and accompanying dishes. This is an experience that no one should miss.

Highlight of my trip!. Had a wonderful day with Michel and the team doing blind testing of herbs and spices, then learnt how to make a beef tagine, bread, salads and crepes. Then sat out on the shady veranda and ate it all, washed down with a glass of wine and some lovely home made ice creams - fantastic! Was picked up from the square in their minibus at 9.45 and got back at 5pm. Learned a lot about choosing and storing spices and enjoyed Michel's entertainment on the bongos as we cooked our bread! Bought a large pottery bowl (in the hopes I might find time one day to have a go at bread making at home), not thinking about the fact I'd have to carry it around and get it back to UK, but it made it home safely and is a lovely souvenir of Faim d'Epices. At the riad next day, we got chatting to a man from London and told him about our experience and he booked immediately and had a really great time too. If you are in Marrakech, don't hesitate to try out this cooking school, I thoroughly recommend it. Many thanks to you all for such an amazing day!

Faim d'Espices. My friend and i recently returned from a 10 day trip in Marrakech, as well as enjoying the sun and doing a few local excursions we attended a Faim d'Espices cooking class.It was recommended to me by a friend of a friend and we were not disappointed.Being a terrible cook myself i really thought this would be a bit of a wasted event on myself but my friend seemed hopefully and i thought I'd go along anyway.It was a great day from start to finish, everyone at the class got along. Michele and his staff were all fantastic and i actually learned a few things.We got collected in the morning from our hotel and took a short drive out to the cook school. We were greeted by a very friendly driver in a branded people carrier (very important when you are two girls alone in Morocco and getting into cars) once we arrived we were greeted by Michele who was entertaining from start to finish, we were offered refreshments on arrival. Shortly after we were taken over to watch and learn how to make all the traditional dishes on th emenu that day.In between this we were taught all about spices and picked up some tips on how to use them and how to look out for fakes.After we cooked our meals - which had intervals of laughter inbetween ( I was accidentally cooking my wooden spoon-i told you i was a terrible cook) we enjoyed all our dishes outside near the olive trees with a refreshing glass of wine.An absolutely perfect day, with tips and receipes to take home to continue the learning process - especialy for me.Highly recommended.

GO HERE NOW. Absolute wonderful day spent at a gorgeous location with wonderful people. Not only do you get the chance to learn some fantastic Moroccan cooking, but you learn in the ins and outs when to serve each dish how to serve the salads and at what temperature to appreciate the smells and the uses of spices , how to survive in the souks with some fantastic tricks on how to pick up real spices, and if that was not enough you get to cook with world class chef accompanied by some fantastic drumming from your host. Had the most amazing time here learnt a wonderful amount about Moroccan cuisine and culture. Just a great day out BOOK IT BOOK IT NOW

Can't recommend this enough!! . I was recently In Marrakech for my 21st birthday and wanted to spend the time doing special things. As I had read such wonderful reviews I thought this was something I very much wanted to do and therefore booked the course with my mum. It was one of the best days we had in Morocco and it was 100% the best food I had the whole time I was there (and I made it!!) The course is suited to anyone, at all levels and abilities, if you are looking for a good day out! The location is beautiful and all the staff are incredible friendly, patient and helpful! If you have some time in Marrakech and are looking for something to do this is it!

Great fun & learnt lots. My partner and I really enjoyed the full day cooking course on the Monday. We have always been interested to know how to cook in the tagines and what spices we should use. Not expecting to learn too much from the course, we learnt quite a bit about Moroccan cooking techniques, the use of spices and the elements that make up each of the special dishes.We were picked up and dropped off at our hotel, the farm was neat, clean and our cooking benches were set up ready for us to play. After a fascinating display of making traditional tea and then enjoying a glass, we were sent on our way with great teaching and support to make our fabulous meals that we got to enjoy at the end of the experience - in a great setting.Will definitely recommend this to our friends heading over to Marrakech and well worth a visit again. Thank you Michel for your friendly hospitality and support throughout the day.Andrew & Sallie

A must in Marrakech - Highly recommended great experience. We booked our cooking course before we left the UK it was really easy a couple of emails and it was all sorted the cost was 50€ each for transport and the course we were there for 5 hours. We were collected from our hotel in a mini bus with the cooking school logo.When we arrived we were informed that we were the only people having a class which was lovely.The whole experience from booking to completing the course was fantastic Nezha the teacher was exceptional, friendly and patient and taught us so much about cooking in Marrekech.We cooked couscous from scratch with a wonderful fragrant stew of meat and vegetables it was delicious. Along with the cooking Michel taught us so much about spices.The venue is perfect on a farm with wonderful vegetables and fruit growing outside the windows.Don't hesitate to book your place on this wonderful cooking course you will not regret it. Even on our return Michel sent us photos of our experience and more recipes.Thank you to Michel and the team for a wonderful experience.

Fantastically enjoyable experience. Here is my very, VERY late review..! My boyfriend and I visited in March 2014, having read reviews on Tripadvisor and booked ahead. Firstly, it was easy to book and Michel seemed very well-organised. We were picked up from a meeting point two minutes from our Riad, and were driven to the location. Here we were greeted with mint tea and a very welcoming Michel, who was very entertaining! The cooking demonstrations, cooking practice and other activities were all so much fun and the food was just incredible. The whole thing was so well organised and of a very high quality. Nezha was so lovely and helpful, and such an amazing cook! We both had a fantastic time and would highly recommend such a unique and fun experience, especially if you enjoy food, cooking and learning new things.Hannah and Daniel, Manchester

Excellent day out. My mother and I recently attended this wonderful cookery school outside Marrakech. We booked it based on the positive reviews on TripAdvisor and I can honestly say that it deserves all those reviews! Michel, the host, was hilarious and so much fun throughout the day, while Nezha, our instructor, was helpful, patient and just lovely in general :)We were collected from outside the post office in Jma el Fna right on time and safely transported in a nice air-conditioned vehicle to the school, about 15-20 minutes outside Marrakech. We loved the school from the moment we stepped out of the car – it’s located in the real countryside and the craziness of Marrakech seems a million miles away. Michel grows some of his own produce on the farm so it was nice to see the olive trees up close, as well as pomegranate tress and aubergine and tomato plants.Inside the school is equally impressive – the building was bright, cool and airy. We were offered tea and coffee upon our arrival and then were shown to our work stations. We were given a demonstration by Nezha on baking traditional Moroccan bread, before making it ourselves at our work stations. We were next treated to a lesson in spices by Michel. We were given dark glasses and had to depend on our noses to guess which spices Michel was showing us. He gave us some very interesting information about the spices too - the most interesting for me being how to tell the difference between real and fake saffron. After the spice lesson, we moved on to main course of chicken tajine with olives and candied lemon. The ingredients had been measured out for us so were able to concentrate better on Nezha's technique. We were given copies of all the recipes at the end too, so didn't have to worry about taking notes on the day. While our tajines cooked, we watched Nezha make three different salads - eggplant/aubergine, tomato and Moroccan. She also demonstrated how to make traditional Moroccan pancakes called msemen. Refreshments were provided throughout these demonstrations, so you weren't starving during the day. We had just the right appetite built up by the time it came to eating our food :) We ate on the outside terrace which was nicely shaded. It was wonderful - the company was good and the farm is in such a peaceful location! And the most important thing - the food was outstanding! I couldn't believe I had cooked something so delicious - it was very satisfying :) The pancakes came served with fruit and probably the best ice cream I've ever had - it was homemade on site and came in a variety of wonderful and exotic Before leaving, we looked around the lovely gift shop that is on site. I'd recommend buying saffron here because Michel gets it from a very good (and unusual) supplier. Plus you are guaranteed the real deal. My mother also bought a tajine (which we got home in one piece in our hand luggage!). Michel also gave everybody a sachet of spices to bring away, along with copies of the recipes in cute glass tubes! To summarise, it was an amazing day out for so many reasons! I'd recommend it as a must-do activity in Marrakech. Wonderful wonderful experience. Thanks again to Michel, Nezha and the rest of the staff :) I hope the recipes turn out as good now that we're home :)

Couldn't recommend more. Everyone visiting morocco should spend a day cooking with Michel and his team. The staff are extremely welcoming and friendly. The food we made was delicious and we can't wait to use our new skills at home.

We cooked a mean tagine!. A relaxed day out of the blazing African sun.We were picked up from our hotel, taken to the farm and well looked after all day. We met Michel the owner and were taught by a female chef whose name I cannot remember! All staff were very accommodating and the whole day they aimed to please. First of all, we were tested on our spice knowledge. Then we watched a demonstration and then we made bread, chicken and olive tagine and Moroccan crepes. The day we picked would usually be a fish tagine day but we were given alternatives which was fantastic as I'm not a big fish fan. Communication was excellent as we were contacted by email beforehand to check our requirements and tell us the pick up time and we have received follow up emails since our return. We recieved pictures of our day and follow up recipes that we can use again and again. If you love cooking you will love this! Thank you

Most fantastic day in Morrocco. If you do one thing during your visit to Marrakech then a day at Faim d'Epices is a must! From the moment you are picked up to the moment you leave the staff are excellent, knowledgable and friendly. Michael is a crazy breath of fresh air after the bustling jostling madness of the Marrakech medina and clearly loves meeting people from all walks of life who want to experience a little of what Moroccan cuisine can bring.We spent the day making batbut, chicken and olive tagine and delicious Moroccan pancakes (I will be making these very soon at home) and learning all about the spices used as staples in Moroccan food. An especially entertaining part of the day was when Michael tried to get a bread kneading rhythm going in the room by bringing out the bongos! Not your usual "lesson" environment.The facility and surroundings are lovely and peaceful and it was fantastic to sit with the other people on the course and enjoy the delicious fruits of our labour....along with some additional touches from Michael and his team. A must on your travels.

Fantastic cooking course. This was by far the best experience we had on our vacation in Marrakech, and I can absolutely recommend it. Great hosts, great food, great day. Everything was clean and tasteful, the instructions where easy to follow and we learned a lot. It is a nice and romantic thing to do as a couple, and both the mother/dauther couples and friends cooking together seemed to enjoy themselves as much as we did. Thank you for a holiday memory that lasts in my kichen at home!

Fantastic cooking experience !!!. A great day making something different in Marrakesh. Michel and his charming staff introduced us in the fascinating world of Morocco récipes. We learn how to cook bread, salads, tajine and crepes. We finally eat all the food we had cook before. An unforgettable day, making new friends while cooking. Do not miss it !!!Thank you !!!

An experience not to be missed!. This was an absolutely wonderful day all round. We were picked up close to our Riad in the centre of Marrakech and driven out to the country, where we were met by Michel and the staff at a really spacious establishment all laid out ready for eight people at their own "work station". We started the session learning about the spices used in Morrocan cooking (with a blind smell test which was fun), We were taught how to make Morrocan bread, salads and a main tagine dish. In my case a beef dish with pears and oranges, while my wife prepared and cooked a vegetarian tagine dish. I really did come away thinking that I could do this type of cooking at home. The whole experience was light hearted and lots of fun! There was no rush, no pressure and everything was so laid back and easy going, but at the same time we learned so much! At the end of thr session the eight of us (four couples) sat to enjoy our food with a glass of wine. Such delicious food it was too!!This is an experience not to be missed when visiting Marrakech!

Well organised !!! - Highly reccomended!!!!. Lovely Oase was waiting for me close to Marrakesh. Beutiful tee area to chill and it has aircondition too! The course was fantastic, I learned lots of new things although I lead cooking courses myself too! Our host were lovely and very funny people and made this day unforgettable! Thank you !!!!!

Wonderful class & day!. This cooking class was one of the highlights of our trip to Morocco. The staff is entertaining, informative, warm, and they do a great job of actually teaching you cooking techniques. They are also very kind about accommodating any dietary restrictions. My sister and I are vegetarian and they were so nice about adapting the menu for us. The class is in a beautiful, sunny room on a farm and every person has their own station. Michel is very funny and educational and our instructor Nezha was the perfect mix of patient and hands off. Her demonstrations were clear and easy to follow and she was absolutely there when anyone needed help and she oversaw everything, but she would definitely let you take a stab at things before stepping in to help. We learned so much about Moroccan spices and cuisine and had a relaxing and interesting day at the farm. Finally, the meal we ended up cooking ourselves was one of the best meals we ended up eating in Morocco. Highly recommend this class!
Excellent Cooking Class!. Very friendly staff! We made our own tajines, bread, salades, etc... The atmosphere was very relaxed and we learned a lot about the Moroccon cuisine!

I want to cook all the time now. The Faim D'Epices was definitely one of the best experiences of my visit to Morocco. I hardly cook so this was new for me but i loved it. Michael is very down to earth, informative and entertaining. The demonstrations are very easy to follow and they even help you out if assistance is needed but they let you do it yourself so you feel great self accomplishment. My dish was delicious and had me pleasantly surprised that i could make something so nice. The experience is engaging all the way through, my girlfriend and I are even competing to see who can make the best Moroccan dish now that we are back home.

Amazing day. My mother and I took a cooking class and had a wonderful experience. We loved the hosts and the group of people we took the class with. We recommend the experience to anyone who has a full day to cook and enjoy yourself!

Great Fun for the Family!. Faim d'Epices was a great way to spend our first day in Morocco! We learned about Moroccan cuisine and culture, while preparing and indulging in a delicious meal. Our boys (18, 15, 11 & 9) were all equally engaged and entertained by Michel and his friendly & helpful staff. We made bread, salads, a tagine of beef, pears and oranges, and crepes as well. It was a perfect introduction to Morocco and a pleasant, relaxed day for our family.

Best Experience in Morocco!!!!. If you're travelling to Morocco, please visit Faim D'Epices! We had the best experience, booking two days in a row. We learned to make a variety of dishes including couscous, a wonderful beef dish, Moroccan bread, crepes, salads, and a delicious tagine over the course of two days. Michel also led a great spice seminar and provided us with very useful tips for choosing and purchasing spices. All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The location is beautiful and air conditioned with CLEAN bathrooms! We were picked up outside our riad in the medina. We were offered snacks throughout the day and finished with the delicious meal we were taught to make, accompanied by the different foods that were demonstrated throughout the day as well. The whole day was very well organized and Michel is so funny and friendly. It was also really nice to come back with an experience we'll be able to share with our family and friends... and of course ourselves again! I highly recommend anyone and everyone visit Faim d'Epices!

Superb cooking course!. We had a fantastic day at Faim d'Epices. We learnt a lot from the spices lesson and the well presented and easy to follow demonstrations. There was a great fell to the course and all the teachers were brilliant. It is definitely worth taking a day to go and do this course! We made good food which tasted incredible, and the facilities were also a good standard. Thank you again to Michel and his team who made the day so enjoyable. We highly recommend this cooking course to anyone travelling to Marrakesh, make time if you can to go on this course!

Great Cookin'. We had a wonderful day at Faim d'Epices. It was lovely to be in the countryside and Michel and his staff were great. The facilities were excellent- very clean and bright. The mix of instruction and hands on cooking and tasting was perfect. The spice course was fun and insightful. We enjoyed sitting outside and feasting on our cooked tajines etc and the lovely wines. We highly recommend the class.

Moroccan cuisine unlocked!. A thoroughly enjoyable day and great experience with Michel and his team! From the ease of booking, to collection at our Riad to drop off later, everything was extremely well organised. The food we (especially I :) ) made was fantastic under the guidance of the team, and even our 13 year old made something delicious. I have read comments about there not being enough food or drink being made available prior to sitting down and eating our creations, a fact I entirely disagree with as there were ample snacks and drinks available. Michel was a wonderful and amusing host who kept us throughly entertained and looked after us at all times for the 6 hours we were there.If you have an interest in learning a new cuisine, then we would all ( 7 of us) recommend a day at Faim d'Espices.

A must-do in Marrakech. As a group of four girls, we had a wonderful experience at Faim d'Epices. From booking to collection from our riad, to an educational spice course all the way through to preparing a beautiful tajine, this was a day to remember. We chose to also book the spa package and this was a perfect combination. Thanks to Michel and his team for their hospitality, professionalism and energy. The spice gift and recipe to take away topped off a fantastic experience.

Brillant day. Absolutely brillant day. The staff were really fun, passionate and attentive. We really enjoyed eating our food at the end of the day and they even gave us a glass of wine and a posh dessert to go with our cooking. I was extremely impressed with the service and Michael even contacted us after the day with photos/recipes which was a lovely touch. Many thanks for a great day

Make this a priority during your stay in Marrakech. The madness of Marrakech can be overwhelming and if you only spend your time during your visit doing the touristy things, you can miss out on great experiences such as a day cooking Moroccan cuisine at L'atelier Faim d'Epices. My wife and I arrived on a Thursday, contacted Michel that same day by email, and by days end had booked our day with him and packaged it with a traditional hammam experience at Mythic Oriental. The cooking class was amazing. You are treated warmly by Michel and his staff from the moment you arrive. A different meal is made each day of the week. My wife and I got to make beef tagine with pears and candied orange. In addition to preparing that dish, we also got to make traditional Moroccan bread and witness cooking demonstrations on making other traditional side dishes. You also get to learn about the variety of spices used in Moroccan cooking through a blind smell test, and then at the end of the day, sit down and enjoy your meal outside on the patio overlooking the tranquil garden. It is money well spent and a day you won't soon forget.

Highlight of our trip. We had a fuss-free and unforgettable day out on the farm with Michel and his wonderful team. So nice to escape the heat and hustle-bustle of the Medina to this cool, calm and quiet area just outside of the city. The farm provided smiley transport to and from our riad which was comfortable, safe and punctual. Michel himself is larger than life with a huge smile and we really enjoyed his company and learned about so much more than just Moroccan cuisine. The day was very well organised but still had a very relaxed feel. The facilities on the farm are top notch and the cooking lessons made us feel like we were Michelin star chefs! Very thankful for such a fun day, and such unbelievable value for money. You won't regret it. Not to be missed.

Very good, but eat a lot for breakfast. We really enjoyed our day learning to cook Moroccan cuisine. The food was delicious and very easy to make. However I was not expecting that we would only eat anything at 3pm - by this time we were absolutely starving. I didn't really enjoy the last hour because of this-so would recommend a large breakfast or to take snacks. Other than that, very relaxed and fun experience

Fantastic!. Well organized from the convenient hotel pick up, through the demonstrations, hands-on cooking, and delicious lunch (including wine!). Really enjoyed Michels sense of humor; his hand drumming was a nice accompaniment for when we got down to work. We got a very good introduction to Moroccan herbs and spices, and learned to make flat bread, salads, Moroccan-style 'crepes' and a beautiful chicken tagine with lemon and olives. Best part was enjoying it all on the terrace at the end of the day. Very nice way to spend a day in Marrakesh.

Wonderful experience. Me and my partner booked the cooking course due to the great reviews on tripadvisor and really enjoyed the day. The food we made (chicken with lemon and olives) was amazing, not just one of the nicest meals we had in marrakech but that we've ever eaten. I can't wait to try the recipes at home. Also the team are very generous with their time and giving extra tips/recipes/advice etc and made it even more worth it. Really glad I did it and would highly recommend to anyone visiting marrakech.

Shhhhh!!!. I should keep this one quiet or might be seriously overbooked when I want to go again. Had a fab day here Michel was a charactor and a great laugh. Cooking instruction was superb and I have even bought a tagine to replicate the recipe (plus the others Michel gave us). No reason not to go as they will pick you up and drop you off at the end of the day. If you are not a cook you will be taught in a fun way that if easy to follow, if you are a 'chef' then there lots of tips on spices etc. GO, go, go

Brilliant Day. My partner and I thoroughly enjoyed our full day Moroccan cooking class run by Michel. The day was filled with quirky humour and great techniques across a variety of dishes. Our efforts were rewarded with a very tasty feed in a peaceful environment. Thanks for the great recipes which we are cooking at home.

Fun and educational-also tasty!. Great way to learn how to cook a Moroccan meal. Everything from the tagine to breads and accompanying salads. Was also taught about herbs and spices. As an avid cook there was still a lot I learned and it was set at the right pace for everyone there. Small group of 6 people meant there was enough attention and guidance. Service offered very professional with collection on time from my riad, to being made to feel welcome on Michel's farm. Eating our own made food on the terrace of the farm with Michel and his wife was the perfect end to a great day. This was a great experience for all the senses.

Wonderful way to take some of Morocco home with you!. My 13 year old daughter and I enjoyed this class immensely. It was a great way to learn a bit more about Morocco and take some skills and flavors home to share. Michel and his team were professional and fun.

Great day. This was a great way to spend the day. I would recommend it for anyone who enjoys learning about food regardless of your skill level. I found it to be an excellent introduction to Moroccan food and spices and enjoyed our prepared meal. The blindfolded spice workshop was a good way to get acquainted with the essential spices and ingredients. We made khobz (Moroccan white bread), chicken tagine with preserved lemons and olives and crepes. The menu changes daily so you can pick what suits you best. Everything was delicious! They also supply the recipes; however, I would recommend taking notes on technique. Your mise en place is already done, although you do learn to cut an onion in the Moroccan fashion without a cutting board. I look forward to trying the recipes at home. Make sure you have a good breakfast as lunch is served a tad late. I found it very easy to make a reservation and the pick-up was on-time. They even include a picture of the van that will you pick you up.

Great way to spend a day in Marrakech. The service was excellent. We were picked up from our Riad in the morning. Upon arrival we were served tea and an intro to what to expect during the day was given. It was an enjoyable day. The location was beautiful and peaceful. We thoroughly enjoyed the spice test and the cooking. Michel and his team were very friendly and hospitable. At the end we enjoyed the fruits of our labour outside on the veranda. The table was set beautifully and it was a great way to end the day. Michel was a great host who kept everyone entertained throughout the day with his quirkiness. I would certainly recommend everyone to this as it's a good way to spend a day in Marrakech. Really enjoyed our day.

Wonderful day. We had a wonderful professional day with lots of fun and delightful foodMichel was a great host and Nezha the chef was full of tips and recipes to produce a delicious Moroccan lunchThe course was in English which was a great relief as is this French speaking city This course will work both for the experienced and new to cooking personI wish the team a will deserved thumbs up. Sue & Eddie

An amazing day! Highly recommended!. My wife and I were in Morocco for our honeymoon and booked this through their website (via email) before we went. From the initial emails back from Michel to the very end of the day this was a great experience. Michel was a fantastic, bubbly host and turned everything into a game.After being picked up from our hotel and chauffeured to the farm, the day started with a traditional mint tea or a coffee where Michel detailed what we would be doing throughout the course. The spice test was very tricky (with a few red herrings thrown in for good measure). I have learned that I need to do some swatting up on my spice identification!With the expert guidance of our multilingual chef, we managed to cobble together some very tasty Moroccan food which we will definitely be replicating back at home (we have already bought all of the spices that we need).The day ended drinking Moroccan wine and enjoying the fruits of our labour outside on the veranda looking out onto the olive farm and orchard.As I said in the title, I would highly recommend this to anyone who has even a slight interest in food.

Fantastic day!. From start to finish, I loved the day with Michel (host extraordinaire) & Nezha the wonderful cook! I was picked up right on time, enjoyed tea with my new classmates, and was surprised by how badly I did on the spice test! The cooking instruction was very simple and easy to understand. We had a bilingual (French/English) class which they handled with ease. The food was pretty yummy and I can't wait to try the additional recipes they sent us - as soon as I buy a tagine. In addition, Michel went out of his way to to accommodate my crazy schedule and get me to the train station just in time to make my train back to Casablanca airport!

Great Cooking Team!. I can strongly reccomend to have a cooking class with Faim d'Epices. I have decided to join a cooking class just 2 days before we have left Marrakesh and Michel was so fast emailing me back a day before and gave me accurate information all around the course. I have visited many cooking classes arround the world as I also teach cooking myself, and I must say it was really well organised and entertaining. It was great fun, relaxed atmosphere, very kind and funny team!Thanks all of you!

More than just cooking. Michel collected us as he said he would. He acted as an informal guide providing humorous anecdotes en route. This set the tone for a light hearted but professional day. We explored spices and learned how to use them in making a beef and pear tagine with candied orange peel. We also made Moroccan bread (Batbout) and crepes (Msemen). And then we all sat down outside and enjoyed the food. This day is suitable for those who know how to cook and those who don't. It is about enjoying food and in the company of Michel and Nizha. Since returning home we have successfully made Batbout, a tagine and some salads. Would book it again without hesitation.

Great experience to learn about Moroccan food. I booked this for something to do on the first day in Marrakech and am so glad I did. I was picked up from the Hotel at exactly the right time, and transported from the noise of the centre of Marrakech into the tranquil setting where I had a really good day. Michel and the teacher were both really welcoming and made the day fun. It was well structured with little 'treats' during the day and I was very pleased with the food I had cooked up on the day.Highly recommended as a fun way to learn about Moroccan cooking whether on your own, in pairs or as a group.

A great way to spend a day in Marrakech. This beautiful location about 25 minutes from the centre of Marrakech, provides a unique opportunity to learn about morrocan cooking.Michel is an excellent host and Nizha a great cook and very good teacher. We learned a lot and had a lot of fun. We cooked Chicken Tagine, Morrocan bread and crepes. At the end of the day we had our meal sitting out in the terrace enjoying a nice glass of wine. Great experience, wonderful people and something not to miss when visiting Marrakech

Tagine-tastic!. Michel arrived to collect us when & where he said he would in the company car. We then spent the day learning about spices, making Moroccan bread, crepes and a beef with caramelised onion and candied orange tagine. The best bit? Sitting together with the group at the end to enjoy the meal we'd cooked. We booked the class as part of a joint day with Mythical Oriental Spa, and after the cooking day had ended, Michel drove us to the spa, which we wouldn't have found ourselves!Thanks for a fantastic day!

A perfect day in Marrakech.. I love food, I love cooking. I consider myself being a foodie. Recently I fell in love with the Moroccan cuisine and when I planned my trip a cooking class was a must.My cooking extravaganza started with a pick-up service close to my Riad. The place where to class took place felt quite rural and a little outside of the city limits. Michel was a very friendly and personable host with great people skills. Amazing!!!! Besides that extremely knowledgable. He gave us a crash course in spices and herbs. We then proceeded with the actual cooking; traditional bread and chicken with preserved lemon tajine. Great fun and delicious.And if that would have not been already close to perfect, the day wasn't over here. Spa time! Book the combo! Highly recommended and very enjoyable.I loved it and would book it again in a heart beat!Have fun!!!!

highly recommended. Perfect Day with lot of fun: everything well organized from pick up - to cooking class - Michel and his staff is very nice - we learned a lot - nice atmosphere, perfect place, best teacher and world best entertainer...Don't miss it...

The Swiss group of Riad Idoine in Marrakech. a great experience in the 'Atelier Faim d'épice' in Marrakech, with a wondefull staff in a nice setting!Thanks for a unforgettable day!Hans and his boys of the Swiss group Riad Idoine

A change from the usual tourist path. A really fun day in Marrakech! Everything was organised perfectly, the venue is impeccably clean and our host, Michel, was delightful. We enjoyed the cooking course very much, but for me the highlight was the spice workshop, because we learned so much.Having cooked our Moroccan meal, the group sat outside and ate our tagines, bread and salads in a very relaxed and convivial atmosphere.Definitely recommended!

Incredible day and incredible food- a definite must-do!. Just got back from doing the class- what an amazing experience! When I booked I was told a pick-up time and place and was picked up right on time. We were then driven out to the Faim de'Spices farm, (about a 20 minute drive) which is a beautiful escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. Michel was waiting to meet us when we arrived and was super friendly and welcoming. There are different menus on different days and today we learned how to make bread, crepes, 7 vegetable cous cous and two types of moroccan salads, and also learned a lot about different spices and cooking. Make sure you eat a decent breakfast because we didn't eat until about 3.15, with a few nibbles (nuts, raisins and fresh bread with olive oil) while we waited for our cous cous to cook. Finally we sat outside and ate and it was all so delicious! Such a great experience and introduction to moroccan food- would highly recommend!!
