Great fun!. My wife and I went to Marrakech for our honeymoon in October and I'd already found and booked to do this online.It was definitely the highlight of our honeymoon. Michel was so enthusiastic and passionate about food, he created such an amazing atmosphere. Not only did we have a lot of fun, but we learnt so much!The best part, after all the cooking and little activities, was sitting outside in the sunshine and eating everything with a glass of wine.Would definitely recommend this to everyone!

Interesting and enjoyable. Faboulous food in a relaxed environment. We really enjoyed our day at the Faim d'Espices. It was lovely to get away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech and learn more about Moroccan cuisine in a relaxed and friendly environment. The food was the best of our stay due to Nezah's excellent tuition. The day was around 6-7 hours in total (including travel). Our hands on cooking tuition was interspersed with demonstrations of bread and salad making and a lesson on various spices and ingredients used in Moroccan cooking. We finished by eating our lovely meal in the garden.We thought the activity was good value. As well as learning a lot about Moroccan cooking and spices we had a great meal in a lovely environment and with good company. It was particularly refreshing not to be pressured to buy extras. In fact it was quite the opposite. After we returned home, Michael sent us photos of the day and some extra recipes. A lot of companies running activities of this kind would take the opportunity to charge extra for these.We are looking forward to trying out some of the recipes at home.

Relaxed, fun day. Chilled out day cooking and learning about local food with friendly and charming hosts. Even an exceptionally novice cook like myself managed to make a delicious meal. We ate about 3pm so if you are going make sure you don't skip breakfast.
Very fun very good. Very good enjoyable day in very good company. Learning at last to cook tagine and using the spices. Will come again on my next trip to Marrakech

Fantastic day activity: informative, interesting and enjoyable!. We had a very enjoyable time at the cooking class followed by the Hammam in the afternoon. It was such a great deal, very affordable for the things that you learn and get on the day. We learnt so much from Michel and his staff. The style was very relaxed and professional at the same time. The set up is very good and the quality of the ingredients are high. Michel is a fun character, very accommodating and interesting. The pick up and drop off is service back to hotel is great. The property is very nice and the well looked after dogs were a change to the common stray cats scenery around the city. I strongly recommend to do this activity first thing when you visit Marrakech because you learn so much about the food, language, culture and more. We are so excited to apply our learnings at home and looking forward to using more spices in our cooking and making Morroccan food. Highly recommended!!!!!

Fun, tasty and valule for money!. Both myself and my boyfriend really enjoyed our day out here. The pace of the day was relaxing but never boring. We learned alot about Morrocan food, which we then used throughout the rest of our trip when trying to understand menu's and pick dishes. The final meal outside was delicious and we enjoyed chatting to our fellow cooks. My boyfriend had not expected to enjoy it, but we both agreed this was the best trip we did all week.
Excellent. Wonderful cooking class. Relaxed, comfortable environment. Goof mix of information, demonstrations and cooking. Would highly recommend

Great first day in Marrakech!!. My partner and I visited Faim D'Epice on May 1st 2014.We were met right on time by Michel at Jamaa el Fna Post office and after waiting for other people for nearly half an hour (who never arrived) we were driven to the farm. This was our first day in Marrakech so it was nice to see a bit of the less touristy city/countryside along the way.After a short drive (and a local geography lesson) we arrived and were quickly greeted with Tea, Coffee and Mint Tea and had a quick look around until the other people in our class arrived. The cooking class and the spice testing was all very lighthearted and interesting... My one and only criticism which has NOTHING TO DO WITH FAIM D'EPICE is that 1 or 2 times it was a little boring for us, simply because we (being ignorant Kiwis) only speak English and at times we would have to wait whilst Michel spoke to us in English and then to the rest of the group in French. My partner and I had a great time, we learnt a few traditional morrocan techniques and thanks to Michel and Nezha had an enjoyable afternoon cooking and meeting new people. Our food was delicious and we will certainly be recycling the things we learnt in our own kitchen.I would happily recommend this lesson to anyone (if not for the knowledge gained then simply for a nice relaxing day of food and bad French banter ) Michel may not be able to cook but he certainly made us feel welcome and set the tone for what was a great time in Marrakech.

Excellent day out, AMAZING food, and a good laugh. Michel is a french guy who runs the place, and he has a morccon cook that speaks reasonable English (and improving). The pick up was very punctual, we were literally 2min late and everybody was already in the car (just another couple, and Najeeb on the look for us). Michel welcomes you with his lovely spirit we felt at ease at once. He kept checking everybody's here by name which was nice and subtle way to get to know each others. The cook was absolutely brilliant and exceptionally skilled although she did not study that, but these are the kind of skills that a life long experience comes more valuable than a degree. I have not tasted as good a tagine as the one we cooked under her instructions. There was a spice workshop as well that was fun and informative. Although the space felt very safe, you should know that there is no lockers / a specific place for your bags etc. For the price it was a money well spent. I definitely highly recommend.

A great way to start a trip to Morocco!. Faim d'Epices was one of our first experiences in Morocco (we had arrived just the day before) – and I think it served as an excellent introduction into Moroccan food and culture for us. We were picked up exactly at the agreed time and warmly welcomed by Michel upon our arrival with traditional Moroccan mint tea and coffee. As it was Saturday, the main recipe of the day was chicken tajine with preserved lemon and olives, but we also learnt how to make Moroccan bread and layered crepes (msimmen). The atmosphere was relaxed, yet very positive and helpful. We also learnt about Moroccan salads and took part in a very nice blind-test of spices – both of which came in handy later in the souks and local restaurants. We took advantage of the special offer that combined the cooking class with spa – an excellent arrangement which we enjoyed very much. One of the best experiences in Morocco!

Great craic, great food and we even learned something too!! . I stumbled across Faim D'Epices on tripadvisor and from my first email to Michel booking the course until the time we were dropped back to our hotel, everything was brilliant. Undoubtably a great way to spend a day while in Marrakech. Michel is a great laugh and put us all at ease. Nehza, the cook, was so good at teaching us all how to make our own bread, crepes and the most amazing tagine. I shall never chop an onion the same way I have been doing again!! :) Both myself and my wife had great fun. The farm is maybe 20 minutes from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech and is a great place to find a little oasis of calm and quiet if you've been a couple of days wandering the medina. Sitting on the terrace and chatting with people from other countries while eating the food we had prepared finished the day perfectly!! Highly recommended and we will definitely go back when we are in Marrakech again.

Amazing cooking experience in Marrakech. My favorite day spent in Marrakech!! Michel has created an inviting, and extremely fun, atmosphere to learn to cook Moroccan style. He encourages a relaxed environment and before you know it, you're joking and laughing while cooking with your fellow students. Nezha was probably one of the most patient teachers I've ever encountered and I learned so much in a very short amount of time. We made a great meal, including salads, bread, tagine and dessert. And I learned so much more than just cooking the actual meal - they taught us about spices (what they smell like, what they're used for, how to buy them), different cooking techniques, why/how you use each of the various cookware pieces, the nature of the ingredients you're using, etc. I had been very eager to take a cooking class and this class exceeded all expectations! An absolute must in Marrakech.

Great cooking experience in nice surroundings. Because of the good reviews on Tripadvisor I booked this cooking class and I can only say it is absolutely worth wile. Michel and his team did a great effort to learn us some Moroccon skills. You also get a spice workshop which you can use during the lessons. Every day of the week there is a different menu. It is a nice and relaxing day. You are being picked up and brought back to your Riad/Hotel. I can very much recommend this day in the country side.

Highlight of our trip!. We had a lovely day at faim d'espices. This was not simply a cooking class, we were entertained for the whole day. It was the small touches that made it an amazing day. When we arrived, we were sat down and given traditional mint tea and met the other people attending the class. We then learned to make Moroccan bread and played the spices game. We also made tajine of beef and artichoke and msemen. The food was lovely. Michel is very interesting and funny. We were given recipes at the end and sent more via email. It was the highlight of our trip and I would strongly recommend it.

A day of fun!. What a wonderful day! One of my best in Marrakech! Michel and his crew make u feel great! What a great enviroment, staff, the way how they conduct the class, the place, everything fantastic! A 10 for Michel and L'atelier Faim d'Epices!!!

Educational and Relaxing. The first full day of our holiday and we left the madness of the Medina behind us... This is about as relaxing a day as you're likely to have, along with my wife and 10 year old son we were picked up outside the post office and whisked of into the country side. Michel is an entertainer, he put everyone at ease and as the day progressed we found the general noise level in the room rose as each group relaxed and everyone started to talk together (around 16 people in total). My son easily accomplished the same level of cooking as all the adults in the room (surpassed me) thanks to the attention Nezha and Michel gave him. When the testing of spices, the baking and the cooking was over, we sat out in the beautiful garden and enjoyed the fruits of our labours! Now to attempt it again at home....Many thanks guys for a wonderful day!

Amazing - a must when visiting Marrakech. This was a fantastic day for all our family. We were picked up from the hotel and taken to the farm where we learnt to make bread, a tagine, morrocan salads and crepes. Our three children (aged 15, 14 and 11) all said they thought it was amazing and loved every minute of it. Learning about the spices was very interesting and the day finished off in a lovely setting eating everything we had learnt to make. Everyone at L'atelier Faim d'Epices was very welcoming and friendly and they made the day a must for anyone in Marrakech.

Would recommend to anyone!. Whatever you had planned in Marrakech, don't do it. Do this instead. You absolutely won't regret it. It's a chance to meet some great people, and create some wonderful food- which you then get to eat! Thanks Michel, Nezra and the rest of the team for a fab day.

A grand day out!. Not sure what I can add to the 771 excellent reviews that someone hasn't said already, but this was a really enjoyable day and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone. We have cooked Moroccan food previously so are familiar with the basics but still found the day taught us new tips and recipes. Michel was a very entertaining host with lots of useful insights into Moroccan ingredients, the spice workshop was particularly interesting and I imagine more useful than the trips to the market offered by other cookery classes would have been. Michel and the team have created a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere, there were lots of nice little touches which made the experience feel that bit more special. Book it, you won't regret it!

Wonderful day and wonderful people. During a short trip to Marrakech with my best friend a couple of weeks ago, we were at a loss for what to do, and following advice from trusty Trip Advisor booked a day at Faim d'Epices on the spur of the moment.It was without a doubt the best decision we made all trip, and we had a really wonderful and memorable experience with Michel and the other guests.The food was really delicious, and Michel kept us all giggling with his brilliant sense of humour. The pace was perfect and it didn't matter that we had no experience of cooking Moroccan food - they make it nice and easy to follow.I would recommend this activity to anyone visiting Marrakech who wants to take home a knowledge of Moroccan cooking and some brilliant memories. Do it!

Couldn't cook can now!. What a great experience of taste, smells and fun, all in a relaxed atmosphere created by Michel, Nezra and staff!! When in Marrakech this is a definite must do - you don't need to be a foodie, just enjoy!

Amazing Food and Atmosphere. My boyfriend and I took a cooking class at Faim d'Epices in January. We were picked up at our hotel and brought to the class. After having a cup of tee or coffee Michel introduced himself and his team and we began to bake some bread. The whole day was very nice. We had a spice workshop and everything we cooked was explained very well. The food was just amazing! Better than anything we had eaten in moroccan restaurants. We would definitely recommend everyone to book the course. There is no better way to learn about a different culture than by cooking traditional food. We had a great day and made wonderful memories.

Super cooking class and spices enlightenment!. This truly was an efficiently run day trip full of fun and learning. Was picked up from hotel, taken to the wee farm. Atmosphere was relaxed and owner Michelle kept us all laughing. We explored loads of spices and cooked at our own little stations. Finally we got to eat!!!! Mmmmm feel like a Moroccan master chief!
The Welsh Tajine is born.... A brilliant day. Can strongly recommend it. Nice to get away from the hustle and bustle for a while and spend a day being creative.

Good food and a change of pace. This is a wonderful way to learn the Moroccan language of food and have a relaxed fun filled day. The class is set for success. Everyone will create a final product that is delicious and come away with an appreciation for the food and spices used. Our classmates came from several different countries and were a pleasure to get to know. Michel keeps the group actively participating while being entertained and informed about food and customs. This was the perfect change of pace day and venue to learn more about Morocco and enjoy good authentic Moroccan food. The provided transportation was wonderful and the olive oil we got there was exceptional.

Go to Marrakech...if only to visit faim d'epices for a cooking experience!. Marrakech is full of sights, sounds and colours.....but the aroma of the spices is something that will always call this city to your mind.Build on this sense, and make your visit totally memorable, by taking one...or more, of Michel's cooking classes.We have nothing but praise for this attraction. You will meet a charming Frenchman and his delightful team of staff. The venue is charming and welcoming. The organization and timing of the experience is without fault. There is a range of components to the day. One can be collected from a designated location close to your accommodation. Your return is also catered for as part of the cost.This is a professionally run school, the work stations are well set out and the progress of the day runs smoothly. You will learn a lot about the traditional elements of Morrocan cuisine and in this hands on environment you will gain the skills to recreate the menu at home! You will be missing something truly memorable if you do not do this. Both the course and our fellow, budding chefs contributed to an unforgettable experience. Thank you.

Amazing Moroccan culinary experience. This was a wonderful experience. My fiancée and I wanted to do a cooking class in Morocco but left our decision making process a little late. After emailing Michel we received a very prompt response and had a booking within a day. Picked up by a very friendly driver just beyond our Riad, we were whisked out to the countryside. From here we had a lovely enriching day learning how to make couscous and a variety of Moroccan staples. The facilities were spotless, the farm picturesque, the staff were wonderful and spoke excellent English and French. Michel was the perfect host, and I was sorely tempted to book the entire week of classes. Each day has a different menu, and I highly recommend this is worth making time for in your trip. I would just book a little further in advance then we did so you guarantee a spot, this is not something to miss, especially at such a great price.

Great Day. I went on 05/04/14. Was a bit apprehensive going on my own but soon got engaged in some really interesting conversations with other guests and Michael on the way. On arrival I met the other people,who were all very friendly and good to be in company with.The day was slick, enjoyable, informative,well managed with a casual relaxed atmosphere. I learnt a lot and was given the menu of what we had cooked, the chicken tagine and other dishes.The best part was eating my own tagine that I cooked.This was definitely the highlight of my trip. I went on the recommendation of other guest of TA.

The highlight of our trip!. From start to finish this was a great day and absolutely worth the money.The spice workshop was fun and informative.The cooking tuition was well delivered and we both feel confident that we can make this meal again for our friends and family when we return home.It was exciting to taste such a delicious meal that we had made ourselves using so many spices.Our host, Michel, was fun with his drumming and jokes.The delicious snacks and drinks keep you going whilst your tagine is bubbling away in front of you!A wonderful day for our 10th wedding anniversary!

Absolutely fantastic day!. I can’t recommend this cooking class enough. The day is simply wonderful from start to finish. I won’t go into too much detail of the day as I wouldn’t want to spoil the surprise of the experience but I assure you it is brilliant and not to be missed. The food is fantastic, the setting is gorgeous.Michel is the perfect host. Nezha is a brilliant teacher and you will learn many new skills in the art of Moroccan cooking.Thanks once again Michel and Nezha for making this day so much fun Nicky and Andy x

Don't miss it if you're in Marrakech!. In the price it's included: transport to the farm (around 20 mins), introduction to the moroccan spices and a quiz, cooking demos for bread, moroccan pancake (msemen) and salads performed by a cute assistant of Michel (nice french accent) and then the cooking itself, where they teach you from A to Z how to cook bread and tagine. And of course lunch, when the tagine is cooked (apart from what you cook yourself the team is preparing some salads and dessert).But don't overlook the relaxed atmosphere created by Michel, he is a funny guy and knows how to entertain his guests, he always has a story to tell and when you're in the middle of preparing your dish he even tries to set the rhythm by beating the drums :).I was impressed by the taste and aroma of my tagine (it was the best meal I had in Morocco) and since Michel gave us the recipes I will try to cook one at home (I will ask him for tips if I fail). At the end of the day I felt that I owe Michel for arranging such an interesting day for us and if I ever go to Morocco I will visit him again for sure!

Highlight of our week in Marrakech. We had a great deal to stay in Marrakech for a week in a Riad at the end of March. By day 2, I was tired of how busy it was, haggling, hassle, traffic, pollution and lack of cleanliness which seemed endemic....and then we went to our cookery day (we did not go for the spa option).This was what got me through the rest of the holiday. Collection and drop off was on time and as agreed. Facilities, food and drink at the cookery school were excellent.My fiance and I had such a great day and really didn't want to leave at the end. The whole experience was excellent, food we prepared superb (under the watchful eye of our tutor) and atmosphere really great - it felt like we were learning a great deal but it was very relaxing and enjoyable. We loved the meal together at the end outside in the warmth of Marrakech (but in the shade thank goodness) and would definitely do this again. The icecream was amazing too...We came away with some spices and a recipe for the Beef and peas we made on the day and have since had some pictures and additional recipes sent through by email from Michel. Everyone was in a couple on our visit and both men and women alike really seemed to enjoy the day.It seems quite expensive when comparing it to Marrakech prices for food etc but it was something we would definitely do again and was in line with other trips offered - we also didn't need dinner that evening either. All in all, well worth the money and highly recommended by us both. Thank you

Beef Tagine - Easy when you know how. we had a lovely day with Michel and the team. We were picked up on time from near our Riad and transported out to the farm. After a lovely welcome an introduction we got down to business.With some great instruction and an education of spices we were set to work. Michel and the team were on hand to help and advise, but we all had the space and tools to make our own Lunch.After we 'slaved over the hot stoves' we had our relaxing meal in the garden. A great choice to get out of the city

Brilliant day. I attended this course with my sister in February,it was a very interesting, entertaining and an enjoyable day, and I would highly recommend it. We made beef, candid orange and pear tagine, which was not difficult, the cook Neezha was really lovely, so knowledgable, warm and helpful. and Michel was very entertaining and funny. It was all very straight forward to book, I made contact with Michel, via email, from the UK about three or four weeks before we were due to go to Marrakech, he got back to me a few days later via email, and I booked us on the course. We paid for the course on the actual day, which for me, I liked the fact that I didn't have to transfer money before hand or give out card details, it cost 55 euros each, or you can pay in dirhams. the actual day was great, Michel picked us up from our hotel in his mini bus, and dropped us off later at the end of the course. the day was a great mix of hands on cooking,observing Neezha cook and eating! at the end of the day we sat outside in the sunshine and ate all the delicious food with a glass of wine. It was a fab day and I would not hesitate in recommending this course, it was for me one the high lights of my holiday in Marrakech.

Great experience!. I came wanting to learn to use the tangine. We learned that and lots more. I took two classes - one on making a meat dish and the second was the Friday class on cous cous. Both were great! Michele's staff is fist rate - I couldn't have asked for a better teacher. Michele is not a cook - and he readily admits it, but keeps the day moving and entertaining. He did give us a session on spices that was really helpful, and an unexpected bonus!

Fab cooking experience. We spent a lovely day at Faim d'Epices learning to cook a beef tagine.Lots of tips from a real Morrocan cook and a really enjoyable experience ending in a delicious meal-what more could you ask! Highly recommended.

Yellow Strawberries!!!. My boyfriend and I had a wonderful day here, learned so much whilst having an enormous amount of fun in a relaxed and welcoming environment. It was the highlight of our trip!We were picked up with little hassle by the driver and were driven about 30 minutes out of the city to a gorgeous location, Michel greeted us with mint tea and coffee and we began with introductions to each other and to Moroccan cooking and lifestyle.Michel has a great sense of humour and throughout the whole day kept us entertained, the spice test was interesting and really useful, worth doing before a trip to the spice markets as he gives you some great tips about identifying fake/below standard products and an idea of what you should be paying for them as well as teaching you about how each flavour is used in Moroccan cooking. Neezha (the chef) was clear, helpful and friendly throughout the entire cooking experience. We made a typical Moroccan bread, a tagine and pancakes and she also taught an additional 3 moroccan salads to complement your meal. The food (though I may be biased at this point) was absolutely delicious, we sat outside on a beautiful sunny day with Michel and the whole group from the course, enjoying our meal with homemade ice creams and fruit with a glass of Moroccan wine. We were lucky to have a really fun group of people and Michel and Neezha were so relaxed and entertaining the whole experience was a huge success. At the end of the course we were given the recipes for the dishes we had made (beautifully presented) and the workshops own special blend of Ras El Hanout (a blend of 63 spices) which were both lovely touches. When I come back to Marrakech I will definitely be booking another course here.It's worth mentioning that this course was very easy to book - I emailed Michel about 5 days before enquiring and he replied promptly explaining everything. I was able to request a vegan alternative to the beef tagine with no fuss whatsoever and what I made was as delicious and interesting as the other dishes. We chose the full day experience with the spa afterwards where we were dropped off, again by the driver, which was also delightful! I'd investigated other courses but most of them looked to be more rigid/not as well rounded as this one.5* all the way!

Relax and enjoy a real taste of Morocco. My husband booked this course for us after reading so many good reviews and we weren't disappointed. We were picked up promptly close to our riad; after picking up the other guests we had time to get to introduce ourselves and enjoy some of Morocco's beautiful countryside on the journey to the cookery school. We made the couscous with beef and seven vegetables; the caramelised onions that top this dish are totally delicious!!! Michel explained that they were cooking genuine Moroccan food with less oil and using a blend of spices that gave a full flavour to the food. Nezha was excellent at demonstrating the recipes and showed us how to make bread, pancakes and Moroccan salads while our meal was cooking. Nezha's natural skill at cooking and cheerful, friendly way of encouraging everyone to use the correct techniques (eg. no stirring the meat and veg while they cook, you must shake the pan so that the vegetables stay whole) created a warm relaxed atmosphere. Chopping onions Moroccan style was great fun, as was preparing the tomato - I've never used either technique before but will certainly use them now to give super speedy results at a high standard to my cooking at home. Michel took us through a couple of short, fun sessions identifying spices and kept us well provided with snacks, fresh orange juice and water while we worked. Our session ended with us all enjoying our meal on the sunny terrace chatting with Michel and the other guests. We finished with mint tea/coffee and left with a beautifully presented copy of the recipe that we had made and a free package of Michel's special blend of spices. Wonderful food, lots of fun, great company - one of the best days of our all to brief holiday in Marrakech.

The best tagine of the week. My daughter organised this day because she knows I love cooking and six of us, 3 mums and daughters went on the first day of our short break in Marrakesh. After the hassle of haggling with taxi drivers at the airport on our arrival the day before, to be picked up in a smart minibus very punctually from our Riad was an excellent start to the day and it just got better. Nab and Heba were there on the same day and I would echo everything they said. The tagine we produced was the best we had in Morocco and Michel gave us lots of useful tips about using and buying spices in his own inimitable style. As well as being very entertaining he was also extremely efficient and true to his word sending us more recipes by email when we got home. I'd love to go back and do the couscous day!

Great time. Highly recommend.. Michele set a relaxed, fun tone, picking us up at our hotel first thing in the morning. He described his journey from Paris to Marakech, sharing his love of Morrocco. The class itself was well run, kept moving, and provided an opportunity to spend time with an interesting mix of people, while we swapped various travel stories and cooked up a storm. We learned a lot about spices and local cuisine. A great time for a couple or individuals. Don't think about it, just do it!

A MUST DO in Marrakesh. My wife and I are from Australia and we went on a holiday to Morocco in March. We decided to try out the cooking class as it looked like a bit of fun. We attended the class on 17 March 2014.We ended up having a fun-filled day, cooking delicious food with great company. Our hosts, Michel and Nezha, really made the day. They were both professional and entertaining. They taught us a lot about Moroccan food and spices. The lamb tagine we made was more authentic and fresh than the restaurants we went to during our stay in Morocco.If you only spend a few days in Morocco, I would recommend you spend one of your days doing this cooking class. It was great value for money. Michel also followed up with an email containing recipes and pictures from the day. Excellent customer service!

Moroccan cooking is a fun affair!. Loved my day spent cooking tagine, bread and salads. Then eating them in the sunshine! Completely satisfying and delicious. Highly recommend this. Michel is fantastic, and loved the bongo drums to get us in the mood for cooking! Loads of fun

Brilliant! A highlight of our holiday in Marrakesh. I had booked the cookery course for my husband as a surprise as he loves to cook. We had so much fun but also learned a lot about spices and also had demonstrations - and cooked ourselves - several traditional Moroccan dishes. We then sat in the side on the terrace and enjoyed a lunch of delicious food that we had prepared ourselves.Michal, our host, spoke excellent English and had a wonderful sense of humour. The cookery tutor that my husband calls "mini-Nigella" was absolutely lovely and gave a great deal of detail during the demonstration and then watched over the 12 of us while we put into practice what we had learned. It was all very informal but so efficiently executed by the staff. Our work stations were replenished with cookery utensils and food/spices while we were watching demonstrations and Michel kept checking our tagines while we were shown how to make crepes. We were really impressed by the organisation of the day. We were picked up in central Marrakesh and taken by minibus to the school which was about 20 minutes outside town. In total there were 12 on our course, mainly Scandinavians plus an American couple and us (Brits).To be honest, because I felt the course was inexpensive, I had no great expectations for the day. I was truly mistaken. We were given refreshments throughout the course and received some really useful information about a large range of spices and oils - all in addition to the cooking experience. I would recommend the day to anybody who has an interest in food. If you have any allergies, then Michel will cater around these. Since arriving home we have received photos of the day and some additional recipes to try. Brilliant !!

Food, glorious Morrocan food!. My boyfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed our day at Faim d'Epices; in fact it was perhaps my favourite day of our trip to Marrakech. No problems with pick up or drop off. There were only 6 people in our group, who we got along really well with. The day was a well-balanced mix of demonstrations and hands-on experience. Michel, the owner, is an engaging host, slightly offbeat(!), but he made the day really fun and the actual instructor was just lovely and clearly very skilled. There was a really friendly, relaxed and warm atmosphere. I'm a keen cook and the day showed me how easy it is to cook flavoursome authentic Morrocan food. We can't wait to try the recipes out at home; in fact we're going to buy a tagine! The tagine of lamb with prunes and bread that we cooked on the day as well as the salads that we watched being prepared were absolutely delicious and it was lovely sitting outside eating the food and chatting with the rest of the group with a cheeky glass of wine afterwards. We took the recipes of what we cooked home with us and Michel has since sent an email with more recipes and photos from the day. Little things made the day something special, like the fresh orange juice and nuts that we were provided to keep us going, the unexpected dessert after our lunch and being given a little packet of spices to take home. And Michel suddenly playing a bongo while we were cooking our bread!A wonderful way to spend the day (and it is a whole day), especially if you get a day when the weather's not so nice like we did. Well organised, a nice setting and good value for what you get. A great insight into Morrocan food culture. Recommended without hesitation!

An extremely enjoyable and informative day. We recently spent a day at Faim d'Epices and it was definitely one of the highlights of our stay in Morocco: brilliantly organised and a really fun day out.All the staff were very helpful and they kindly accommodated a wheat-free diet. We were picked up and returned to where we were staying after the course and were given a copy of all the recipes which we had learned to cook during the day. Since arriving home, we have received an email from Michel with photos taken during the day and some more recipes to try.We would certainly recommend the cookery workshop to anyone looking for a slightly different day out.

What a fantastic day from start to finish. What a fantastic day from start to finish. The spice game, wonderful company, good hosts, plenty of laughs and excellently prepared food made this an occassion to remember for a long time. The finale of our meal outside on the verandah made a feast for the senses and was truely an international event with British, Dutch, French, Moroccan and Italian input. Strangers at the beginning of the day were friends by the end. Well thought out cookery day with an attention to detail that makes this a Moroccan must do!

Brilliant full day cookery class. A friend and I had a great day out at Faim d'Epices .From the start e-mail communication was excellent, we were collected on time at the agreed point in Marrakech and taken some way outside the city to the very well equipped kitchens where we had our lessons and demonstrations.I hope Michel, the French owner and boss, wont mind me saying that he is slightly crazy, in a nice way of course and he is very knowledgeable and made the day great fun. He speaks excellent English and kept the banter up throughout the day which kept us amused.The real star is Nezza our superb instructor for the day ( and if I can embarrass her,she is absolutely gorgeous,oh to be 30 years younger !) who dazzled us with her gastronomic skills.In the West we use so many machines, recipes, tools, instructions etc, Nezza does it all by eye, no weighing or measuring, no reading instructions and with the minimum of tools and mainly with her hands. Watching her knead bread or making Moroccan crepes is to watch an artist at the height of her powers...apologies if this sounds a bit overdone but she is so skilful it puts us amateur cooks to shame.We made a tagine of beef with seven vegetables with couscous and we were given very precise instructions so there was no risk that anything would go wrong.To be honest there was rather too much faffing around with couscous than I would have liked, developing some other skills e.g with bread making would have been a better us of our time I think, but this is a trivial point really when we had such fun making our lunch.Michel tried to keep us guessing with the spices, oils and herbs we had to smell to identify ( blacked out sunglasses were provided to avoid peeping ) again great fun and a useful knowledge base for using Moroccan produce at home. For anyone reading this who has not tried Argan oil, please do so,it may be expensive but is delicious.Eating our lunch was a real pleasure and a dessert was whipped up by the staff to complement the tajine before we were taken back to Marrakech with recipes to try at home.All in all a great day and thoroughly recommended

education can be fun!. Excellent way to spend a day...just outside Marrakech..... pickup and return included.Michel and all his staff were friendly, helpful and most importantly professional and yet still fun!We visited today with a group of about 8 others. No one was rushed or overlooked and everyone seemed to enjoy eating their achievement!Well worth booking to go and have an enjoyable day, away from the crowds and hustle within the Medina.

Yum Yum. Great day out and away from the norm of Marrakech. Great staff and Michael. Learnt a lot, didn't know much in the first place but very interesting. I would recommend to any one that first loves food ha! And had a remote interest in cooking. Cheers you guys great day.

Wonderful day. We have been in Marrakech in January and maybe the "off-season" was our luck because there were two free spots in a cooking class suitable for our time schedule. I have to mention that I emailed Michel the evening before the class (very spontaneously) and he got back to me not even 15 minutes later. He was very well organised and friendly. The pick up at the big square was on time and the weather was perfect for a day outside of marrakech. It may be a cooking class with a less difficulty level, but that does not make it bad or boring. I read the bad reviewa and all I can say is: depends on you what to make of it. I found Michel quite amusing and he cracked me up. Nezha was a very good teacher. When I came home from Morocco I made the whole thing for my family and they absolutely loved it. People, I don't think it's right to go on bad about another's existence just because tastes and styles are different. That's what humans are made of. If I were to visit Marrakech again I would definitely visit the farm again for another wonderful day.

The best memories from Marrakech!. Cooking class with Michel was the best experience in Marrakech. We spent an amazing day in the countryside learning about Moroccan cousin, spices, cooking techniques as well as had an amazing meal at the end of the class. The atmosphere was very relaxed and even though I am not the best cook, but had the best cooking class ever!

do try this at home. Had a wonderful time at Faim d'Epices with Michel and his staff. It was fun, relaxed and really educational. You learn about the typical ingredients of Moroccan dishes and how to tell fake saffron and Argan oil from the real stuff (very useful information before shopping) . The cooking was hands-on. Following the clear instructions of our chef, we made bread, pancakes and of course tajine. Our chef also showed us how to make 3 Moroccan salads. Back home I tried to make the same dishes and they turned out just as delicious as in Marrakech. So thank you!

The essence of Moroccan cookery. Michel and the team really make the spices of Morocco a journey to remember The cookery classes and eating afterwards are a really enjoyable and worthwhile experience Some of the little tips are so simple but truly inspirational Highly recommended we went back for a second try They pick you up and drive you back to your Hotel well worth the modest price

One of our Morrocan Hightlights!!. Michel is a great host with a very laid back casual approach which we liked. Fun and not at all serious. it is well organised right from email communication at the start while booking right though to the recipe scroll given at the end which we thought was a really nice touch. The menu isn't too complicated and I now know how to cook a full moroccan feast from scratch with bread and salads. I even learnt that I knew more spices by smell than I thought I did!!!!!! We also made some friends and it was altogether one of favourite memories in Marrakesh. Thank you Michael and Nehza xx

Fun cooking experience. My mom and I decided to take this class to learn to cook Moroccan food. We had a blast and learned many recipes that I will be making when I get back home. Michel and his staff are friendly and welcoming. I fully enjoyed my day cooking and learning to make a beef tajine, breads and salads. Transportation was provided; pick up and drop off to your hotel. Price was reasonable. Michel was great...he even had us dancing at one point in the class. Very fun!

Fabulous! Best part of our stay.. My two daughters and I were keen to learn to cook real Moroccan food and after reading many reviews and being put off by courses that gushed on about touring the markets "where we choose our chicken which is quickly dispatched in boiling water"!!! I called up and was assured by Michel that I wouldn't have to look in the eye of what we were going to be cooking, nor wasting time at the market, I signed us up.We were picked up the next morning and taken into the countryside where Michel – a delightfully eccentric Frenchman - has a lovely facility surrounded by orange trees. He served us glasses of Moroccan mint tea and introduced us to Nehza who would be taking us through the steps of preparing a tagine of beef with pears and candied oranges - yummy! But first we had to "awaken our senses" and guess the spices Michel held under our noses while we wore blacked out glasses. He then explained a little of each of the spices and how they are used, how to tell real saffron threads from the fakes and real Argon oil from one bulked up with added vegetable oils.We then had a demonstration of how to make Moroccan bread by Nehza and then made our own. We then moved into the kitchen and prepared our tagines following along with Nehza’s demonstration and assistance while Michel serenaded us on his African drums. While our individual tagines cooked, we learned how to make 3 different Moroccan salads and their yummy square pancakes.Soon our tagines were ready and we were all delighted with the results. When we lifted off the lids of our tagines, the fragrances were divine! We then got to eat them, our bread, salads and pancakes with surprise icecreams in the sunny courtyard. The day flew by and soon it was 5pm and time to head back into town to the hammam we’d booked as part of the deal with Faim d’Epices, at Mythic Spa. Where we were treated to a steam bath, grommage (body scrub) and 1 hour massage. We arrived back at our Riad exhausted and very clean at 10pm!The tagine we cooked that day was the best food we ate in Marrakech and I can’t wait to get home and make one myself.

TIP TOP. If you dont find this cooking day a great experience go back to your analyst and ask him for a refund. AT 50 Euro its much better value then others on offer, You get a pick up and drop off.You bake a local bread .You learn how to make three salads. And a great tagine of meat or fish which you eat. Yoir host Michel is a fun guy who supplies mint tea, wine with lunch and much chit chat. ,If we had had more time we would have done another day.

wonderful experience. My daughter & I went on March 2 and had a delightful time. Michel is so knowledgeable and Nezha clearly knows her cooking stuff. I'm making a modified tajine tonight for my family back now in the US. Price was acceptable; they provided all transportation. We were put onto Faim by our hosts at Riad Badi in Marrakech.

We can cook the real thing now !. We booked the cookery course, complete with the Hammam to follow, and it was such a memorable day. Michel is a real entertainer and excellent host. The cooking guidance from Nezha a delight.... and at the end of it a delicious meal cooked by our own fair hand. We were so inspired we have already cooked the meal again now that we have been home for 2 weeks. You learn to cook a tagine and some Moroccan bread ( for dipping in those lovely juices) and then eat your creation for a late lunch. It is fun, the teaching is almost foolproof. Yep, anyone can learn to cook if they attend here. Go for it.

Redeemed Marrakech for us. We debated using an entire day of our trip to Marrakech for a cooking class. But after covering the entire city in one day (and feeling a little disappointed) we decided to book Faim D'Epices. This day redeemed Morocco for us! As everyone else has reviewed, you won't regret doing it. It was a really great day and really great education on the basics of Moroccan cooking!

Fantastic experience, great fun!. I booked the full day cookery course for my partner's 40th birthday and went, as a surprise, with two other friends. We joined a family group from Hawaii with three kids and everyone got involved and cooked the same recipes - the (very!) technical cous cous with seven vegetables. You see it on menus everywhere but it will never taste as good as it does when you've slaved over a steaming pot of cous cous for four hours!Michel was the perfect host: helpful, obliging, charming, welcoming and with a very Parisian sense of humour. Nezha, our tutor for the day warmed to our sense of fun and we all laughed and joked our way through what was a fantastic learning experience.Nezha coaxed and cajoled and encouraged to make sure everyone was progressing well and, in the end, even the kids turned out perfect dishes they could be proud of.Hugely enjoyable, great fun and, combined with the spa experience at Mystic Oriental Spa it's incredible value for money.Thanks Michel and Nezha for a fabulous day! And, remember, butter...flour...fold...butter...flour...fold!

Farm d'Epices deserves the hype. We had an amazing day at this cookery course in early February. Despite being a mixed group (2 cooks and 2 non-cooks), we all had a brilliant time. The course is fun and informative, the recipes are easy to follow, the food is delicious and Michel is an excellent host.

Just book it: you won't be disappointed.. What can I add to the reviews you will find below, apart from that you shouldn't hesitate, but immediately book this day out! It is fun, it is interesting and it's lovely to sit outside at the end of the course, eating the things you have cooked before. We had an absolutely splendid time and I can assure you you won't be disappointed!

Brill, fun day out!. Michel and his team were excellent and the day was great fun! The cooking course lasted the whole day, where we cooked,watched, ate a gorgeous taging we made and a lovely aubergine salad! We got to take the recipe's home and Michel was even nice enough to email us some more, and photos of out day - yum yum yum. Keeping banging those bongo's Michel!

The Highlight of Marrakesch!. I purchased this as a surprise 30th Birthday gift for two of my best friends and they were so happy with the experience. They were picked having no idea what was planned for the day and were pleasantly surprised. I am told that it was a very relaxing day and that they learnt a lot about spices and cooking techniques from the talented Moroccan chef and all the while being entertained by her charming French collegue.

A must if you like food & even if you don´t. Not much to add to the previous reviews.I chose this cooking class because of all the reviews here. It´s all been said and I can confirm that we had a great time! My only concern was that we will spend 5-6 hours there in a cooking class and thought that this might become kind of boring. It doesn´t! It is very well organised, interactive, fun. You learn a lot and time is flying. Michel is a lovely person. He does not only introduce you to the marrocian kitchen, but also to the marrocian life. He is (probably the funniest) French person and if you want to understand a bit about the culture you can ask him any question and he gives you some insight. A lot of people end up in tourist restaurants being served a ¨traditional tajine¨. The one we cooked here was the best we ever had - and our fellow ¨classmates¨ said the same! Go there and I am sure you will enjoy it.

A very enjoyable day. Were picked up on time from our hotel and taken out to the farm. Building and location is excellent, stunning design inside. Michel is interactive and engaging, the other workers are very efficient and the whole system works very well. Beforehand we weren't too sure about the 50 EUR price but by the end of the day decided that it was worth the money! Only comment we would say is sometimes there were moments throughout the day when it seemed we were just sitting around which could possibly be used in a more profitable way.
Best day. Just an amazing and funny day. Everything is great from the cooking to eating with the owner Michel. He's worth the visit just himself :). A big thanks to the whole team.

The best day of our trip. We had a great day at L'atelier Faim d'Epices. We were picked up from Place Moukef, just a five minute walk from our riad. The journey was nice and the driver was very helpful and safe. Once we had arrived we were introduced to the rest of our group and given some mint tea or coffee. Throughout the day we learned how to make chicken with lemon and olives, bread, moroccan pancakes, and 3 salads. We were taught about spices and flavours typical or morocco. We sat outside in the sunshine and enjoyed the dishes that we had prepared along with a glass of wine. We were then provided (which was delicious) with ice cream of unusual flavours, more pancakes and fruit. I throughly enjoyed the whole day and thought it was amazingly good value for money. We got even more than we were expecting and came away feeling like we had learned a little about the food and culture of morocco whilst having a throughly enjoyable and relaxed day. I strongly recommend this course to anyone visiting Marrakech.

A "Must Do" in Marrakech!. We visited Marrakech at the beginning of February for four days and one of the highlights of our trip was without doubt Faim d'Epices. 550 dirham or 50 euros is fantastic value for what is a very interesting, fun and tasty learning experience. Michel is a fantastic host and makes you feel very welcome and makes sure the whole day is fun and entertaining while still being educational with regards to Moroccon cuisine and the different techniques and spices used. The real chef as her describes her, Nezha, is fantastic as well, she gives clear instructions and makes cooking Moroccon food easy to understand. We made a delishes beef and pear tagine and Moroccon bread as well as seeing demonstrations on different salads and Moroccon pancakes which are delicious. We also did a blind smell test on different spices which was good fun! We were also picked up from our hotel and taken home which is a nice bonus.All in all if your in Marrakech only for a short trip and feel that maybe a whole day at a cook school would take up too much time then your wrong, it was a fantastic experience and you learn so much and it has given us the confidence to cook more Moroccon food at home.

Fun and interesting day - and a great lunch. Or family with teenage children booked a day at the cook school. We all enjoy cooking and have done some cooking classes in the uk. We were not disappointed - Michel is a real character and makes the day fun, and we learnt a lot too. Sitting in the afternoon sun enjoying the fruits of our labours was a real holiday highlight. Great value too.

A unique day out in Morocco. I booked the combined cooking lessons and spa package for myself and two friends. It was a fantastic day out, a really different experience to contrast with the whole medina and sightseeing experience in Marrakech (which was also amazing in a different way!)Michel runs a very professional ship, and the whole day was seemingly effortlessly run (I happened to look over my shoulder when we were learning how to make pancakes to see staff hurrying round to clean and tidy our cooking stations for the next section of the course!)The day was perfectly rounded off by an outside sit-down meal where our own efforts were complimented with salads, ice-cream and wine. we didn't want to leave!

Delicious!!. My husband and I took the Faim d'Epices class our first day in Marrakech. It was so much fun, and I highly recommend it! We learned to make a lamb tagine with prunes, and it was possibly the most delicious dish I had the entire time in Morocco! We also learned to make several salads (although you don't make these yourself), and made our own bread. There's also a fun blind test of spices, and a lesson on what they're all used for. It's kind of idiot-proof... if you don't know anything about cooking, don't worry... if you do, you still get something out of it. The entire team is funny and nice, and we enjoyed meeting the other class participants as well. We did the package with Mythic Oriental Spa, which I would also highly recommend. It's a really nice way to spend a day.

Best part of our trip. This is an absolutely wonderful day out and a must for your trip to Marrakech! Michel picked us up from our Riad and we arrived at his beautiful farm with the other guests. We were given mint tea and Michel explained how the day would work and what we would be doing in his very charming and comical manner! Throughout the day a lovely Morroccan chef taught us how to make authentic morroccan bread, lamb and prune tagine (both of which we then made ourselves), delicious morroccan salads and finally crepes! It's so well demonstrated and explained that you leave genuinely feeling you could go home and make it yourself again, and it would be just as delicious. As well as the cooking there is of course a spice test which my boyfriend found to be his favourite part - he loves to test his sense of smell and this sure did that! It's such a fun exercise and informative as well, as Michel taught us some very interesting cultural and food related facts. The great relaxed day is rounded off by all sitting outside on the sunny terrace together and enjoying the delicious food we have cooked.This is such a wonderful escape from the bustle of the city and Michel absolutely makes the day - he is a great guy who loves what he does and it shows!

Excellent. I would recommend this to anyone visiting Marrakech and interested in the cuisine. Pick up & drop off from our Riad was easy. The teaching was fantastic and the recipe, Beef, Artichoke & Pea tagine was amazing. I really learnt a lot about the art of cooking tagine, had a lot of fun and got to eat some incredible food. Thank you Michel & your brilliant team.

Highly recommended.... Two friends and I booked the cookery course and spa package...the reviews were good and we were not disappointed. The whole day was fun, well organised and educational! With a mix of culinary skills we were not sure what to to expect, especially when donning the blackout glasses to identify a range of Moroccan herbs, but Michel and team were friendly, helpful and relaxed. The sessions were easy to follow and it was a delight to sit outside at the end, in the sunshine, and tuck into our very own beef, artichoke and lemon tagine with homemade bread... We then went from the cookery school onto the spa which was also fantastic. A great option which really added to our few days in Marrakech

A great investment for your skills - Get inspired. Faim d'Epices was for us surely the best way to escape the city for a day and bring some valuable knowledge back home.The team of Faim d'Epices like what they do and made the day very enjoyable. I'm back home for 3 days now and already prepared 2 tagines for my boyfriend that stayed in Germany. I already recommended the excursion to other tourists we've met and I will do so to friends that might visit Marrakech.

Excellent experience. What a great day! From start to finish, very well organised and every last thing thought of. A fantastic way to learn about cooking Moroccan cuisine and the spices. We learned how to cook our own beef tagine, flatbread and at the end of the day sat down and enjoyed our work with a glass of wine in the sunshine. Perfect. Thank you for a lovely day!

Cooking in Marrakesh!!!. After reviewing a lot of resources about cooking classes in Marrakesh, and reading Trip Advisor reviews, my friend and I decided that this looked like the best deal to provide us a sophisticated cooking experience. Over the years, I've taken many cooking classes -- at home and on vacations. Without a doubt, this is my favorite class so far! The class is suitable for beginner level cooks or those with a lot of experience. (Usually, its hard to find a class that spans a broad spectrum of experiences but our couscous class did.)Our instructor was excellent, the cooking set-up was very comfortable, the facility is charming, The place is immaculate and charmingly decorated. The owner, Michele, is relaxed with a sly sense of humor. He gave us lots of tips about shopping for spices and other things Moraccan. He also recommended several restaurants which we later enjoyed. Additionally, we lucked out and had classmates who were really fun, which added to the overall experience.The school has a nice van that is clearly marked with the school's name and logo (useful when you are standing in Jema Al Fna square and drivers that go by tell you to get in their car!). I'd suggest not making afternoon plans following the expected class end time because if you are having fun, you and your classmates will want to linger longer. That's what happened in our class. Also, don't plan on a big dinner later that night. You'll be full from consuming your cooking! I bought three bottles of the olive oil made on site (the school is in the middle of an olive grove.) It is awesome tasting and made great gifts. Wish I'd bought more.Overall, it was a really fun experience. It gave us a lovely experience of Marrakesh that was a peaceful contrast to the hectic Medina. And we learned how to make a lot of delicious things.

Perfect!. Easy to set up. Fun to learn. My 7 year old daughter did most of the cooking! Michel picked us up and dropped us off from the square. day started at 9am and finished at 5pm. Highly recomended.

Highly recommended! An amazing day!. A great and fun way of learning moroccan cooking in a lovely enviroment. I have visited Marrakech before and came home with alot of spices but no way of knowing how to use them. This is a great way of getting an idea of how to blend the spices and learn the cooking techniques. The host was welcoming and entertaining and the food delicious. I would love to come back again next time I visit Marrakech.

Highly recommended experience. So glad I booked this experience - worth every penny. Our driver picked us up from our hotel on time and was only a 20min drive to the farm. We were greeted by the friendly and humorous Michel, and given an intro with tea/coffee. The "guess the spice" game was lots of fun but also very informative. We then went on to learn how to make bread, delicious salads, Moroccan pancakes and the most amazing chicken tagine with preserved lemons and olives, accompanied with a freshly squeezed mandarin juice and nuts and dried fruit. Michel kept us all entertained with his jokes and drumming and Neeza was a fanatsic teacher, very warm and helpful. After, we sat down to eat our dishes out in the sun with a glass of chilled white wine, and to top it all off we were served a beautifully presented desert of 3 different homemade ice-creams and fruit..AMAZING! A nice extra was learning some little tips, like how to spot real saffron/argan oil and tips for chosing a tagine. To finish we were given the recipes of the dishes we cooked and a little bag of "68 spice". The farm also sells their own personalised tagines for a very reasonable price (a quarter of the cost we were offered in the souks!)…we felt alot more confident buying theirs than the souks!A truly enjoyable and rewarding experience and a great way to gain an insight into Moroccan cuisine.

Amazing Experience!!! Delicious. What a great, GREAT day!! I found this adventure online and I am so glad we booked it. If you want a unique experience in a foreign country, to meet nice people, work hard, learn a lot about Moroccan food and culture - DO IT! Our driver was amazing - on time, safe, reliable. He even returned my friend's phone!!!! We got to the farm - the staff was so gracious, we had coffee, intro'd , chatted. We then embarked on an amazing day of learning and delicious eats!! I really enjoyed the spice challenge and Michel was amazing and very accomodating. We learned a lot regarding prep, some cooking skills, Moroccan food and ate a feast. I enjoyed taking breaks out side and would reccomend this to anyone. My food was amazing, I am nerovus I won't be able to recreate!!! I will try though. All the best!

A most wonderful learning experience!. I really enjoyed my day at the Faim d'Epices and learned a great deal about Moroccan food,spices and cooking. The instruction was fun and professional. The hospitality was warm and exceptional. I definitely look forward to attending another class on my next trip to Marrakech.

Very nice indeed!. We had been so glad of our choice: pouring rain outside and a cozy setting in this nice cooking "school" 20 min away from the centre of Marrakech. Michel is a very entertaining host and able to harmonize the different people in a compact group while Neeza is an efficient patient teacher. We cooked a very good fish tajine. Well spent money indeed

Wonderful class & fun day. There is no better way to immerse yourself in a new culture than to immerse yourself in its cuisine. Our day with Faim d'Epices was an absolute highlight, not only in learning about the regional spices and how to cook the dishes, but with the friends we made. I've since made several tangines at home to the delight of my family!

Great introduction to Moroccan Cooking. We had a great time, and came away with some Moroccan culture/cooking that I have already incorporated into my cooking at home (since this was my goal I'm quite happy). The Staff was a delight, Michel was the perfect host, and our instructor was very helpful and attentive.If I'm lucky enough to go back to Marrakech I would go back to L'atelier Faim d'Epices to learn another dish.

A Moroccan Feast. We attended this in course in January, and we just had so so much fun! Everything was spectacularly organised, we were picked up near our Riad by Michel and arrived at the farm ready and eager to get cooking.I can honestly say everything we made tasted absolutely incredible. Matt had never made bread before and yet it came out perfect thanks to Michel and Nezha's help. They helped when we needed it but not so much that it felt like they did it for us. It was one of the best meals I had in Morocco - the setting, the ingredients, and the fact that we made it ourselves!! We made the chicken tagine with olives and lemons, and it was so good there was not even a trace left in my tagine!Good vibes all around. Definitely recommend.

Birthday Treat. We came to L'atelier Faim d'Epices as a 21st birthday treat for my daughter. The five of us had a great day with Michel who was humourous fun, vibrant and mad the day. We learnt alot in a fun filled enviroment thanks to Michel and his wonderful staff. He gave my daughter a Tangine as a birthday present which was so nice. The combined massage was great for us all. Long fun day highly recommended. He LOVED my ALL BLACKS jersey so much and we teased each other mercelessly all day long - but he got the last laugh with photos of my lovely ALL BLACKS jersey desecrated with the le Coq sportif covering the Silver Fern. So if you want fun fun and more fun I recommend this. Thanks Michel and co.

Disappointing. This course is fine if you want to be entertained more than you want to cook. The level of cooking is quite basic and aimed at a novice level, but I wanted to learn new things and unfortunately this did not really extend my skills. The spice identification session and the introduction were too long and although others enjoyed Michel playing the drums I did not. If you want to fill your time in Marrakech and fritter away a day this may be the place for you.

Unexpected Highlight of Marrakch - Family Cooking at Faim d’Epices. We are a traveling family of 4 and we decided that we would take a cooking class while visiting Marrakech, Morocco. A friend of ours had just taken a class with Faim d’Epices and highly recommended it. When I contacted them and asked if they allowed children (9 &11), they said sure. My hubby and children were unsure of an "all day" cooking class and were worried about missing out on other activities. The class from pick up to drop off is approximately 9:30 - 4:00.We wrote all about our experience on our blog, so if you want more details and photos that is where to find them. The class is located out on a farm in a gorgeous building equipped to hold cooking classes. The entire family was dazzled by our host Michel and the full day of activities. This isn't just about cooking, it is learning about the ingredients, the history and Moroccan culture. That was an unexpected treat for us all. Not only did we learn but there was an element of fun and playfulness throughout the day. We danced to music, we snapped photos, we cooked bread, 3 salads, a tajine main dish as well as Moroccan crepes. Our day the main dish was a choice of chicken or fish, so we chose 2 and 2. Check out their site for all of the dishes that are offered each day.I was amazed at the care they took with the kids, for me it was hands off and the kids did great. They even provided a lower cooking / prep station for them to reach. I think they loved boxing the bread dough. I would recommend for age 9 and up (depending on maturity) as they do handle knives and chop vegetables.The best part... you get to eat it all. Our class of 12 all sat down together and enjoyed our creations. It has been a week since the class and the kids are still raving about it. They want to make the dishes at home on their own. :-) The price is great for a full day out and a wonderful meal. You can also add a Hammam and Massage to your package. After the cooking day, they will take you on to the next services. We didn't opt for this, as the kids wouldn't have enjoyed the massage. I can't recommend this experience enough. The entire family learned so much and is eager to cook and try new things. We plan to share a video or our experience on our youtube channel later in Feb 2014.

Great Fun to End Our Trip. Having had a somewhat 'interesting' time in Marrakech itself, we wanted to try something a bit more different to end our trip in November 2012. We couldn't have chosen anywhere better!Booking was very easy and transport to the farm is included in the price of the course.The whole course is set up in the best way possible, with a perfect balance of tuition, practice and fun games revolving around food knowledge. Michel is unbelievably friendly and lovely to learn from and chat to. He even dropped us off at the airport afterwards!We really couldn't recommend this place more, it was just the most wonderful experience and such a change of pace from Marrakech itself.

Discover the flavours of Morocco. As part of our visit to Marrakesh we booked a cooking day at Faim de Espices It proved to be a great day not just a cooking lesson but with entertainment thrown in and a meal to follow.Michael and his team were full of useful advice not only about cooking but also on the best ways to source the best spices and oils. Following Michaels recipe we cooked a very nice Tagine at home tonight which brought back happy memories of our trip to Marrakesh. We would recommend you book a day at Faim de Espice

Great day's entertainment. My wife and I visited Faim d'Epices in May 2013 for the cooking experience as part of my wife's 30th birthday celebrations. We were picked up at our hotel by the owner and had an extremely pleasant conversation with him until we reached the venue. I won't spoil the experience by revealing the specifics of the course, although I will say that after conducting extensive research into activities for our trip, this was the most enjoyable. The food we cooked was extremely tasty and being Vegetarian, I was appreciative of how I was accommodated. All in all, a great experience, and one I would classify as a 'must do' on any trip to Marrakech.
Best tagine I had in Marrakech.... ...and I made it! Brilliant day spent with Michel and his team learning about and cooking Moroccan food. Can't wait to try and recreate some of the dishes at home!

Excellent glimpse into Moroccan cooking. We did this course as a couple and thoroughly enjoyed it. We had done some Moroccan cooking so were looking for tips and techniques, which we got aplenty. We cooked the classic chicken and lemon tagine, but the approaches we learned to apply really lifted the flavours. The day was really well organised from pick up at our Riad, to sequencing of the cooking, to eating our meal (with nice wine served) and wrapping up. Michel was a fun host who kept things moving along and we enjoyed the guess the ingredient activity. This course runs in a dedicated cooking class facility and will appeal to the who want more than just a 'watch what I do' type of experience. This is a professional undertaking that shows in all respects. You get recipes that are cooked on the day, plus other momentous of the day. If you crave something different to remember your stay in Morocco by, then this is a great choice!

Fantastic & fun cookery school. We had a great day at the Faim, with Michel and his team. Michel tells many funny stories and is a great host. Learning how to make a lovely tagine, bread, salads, crepes and then eating your dishes. Good set of people and a lot of fun. Hopefully the recipies will taste as good at home!

Great fun. We spent our first day in Marrakesh cooking beef and pear tagine. (The menus are available on the site - so select what you would like to cook and eat). The pick-up/drop off was painless and took 20 mins. Michael is very entertaining and we enjoyed the bongo drums....he is happy to answer any questions and to share his knowledge about Marrakesh/Morocco.Lunch was late so eat a good breakfast. Hands on cooking, together with demonstrations - a tagine, local bread, pancakes, various salads and information on the local spices...then lunch; our group all enjoyed the food and company.We took the offer package: cookery course, followed by the Mystic Spa which was fabulous.For the non-McDonalds fans who want an in-sight to life in Marrakesh and to learn about their food, cooking tagines, bread and salads; we would recommend a day at l'atelier Faim d'Epices.

How to waste time making the inedible. An interesting and enjoyable day, but Michel (the co-owner) likes to string things out and in the end we were bored stiff apart from when we were actually cooking! The spice identification "game" was twice the length it should have been. had we started cooking sooner then we'd have had lunch at lunchtime and not 3pm! Everyone who I know thats been there has cooked the bloody chicken and olive tagine. If it's you too, avoid the ransid butter - it stinks and makes the tagine bitter and virtually inedible. We ended up picking at the chicken and eating the bread we made to stave off the hinger. Fortunately we got back in to the city and were able to locate a McDonalds soone enough. Never has it tasted so good.Nevertheless it was a fun day, just long and tedious at times. Its about 30 mins outside the City so be prepared for a long transfer there and back. Quite why Michel needed to play the bongo drums in the middle of cooking is for another reviewer. I've said enough.

Disappointing. The cookery school is a fair way out of Marrakesh so be prepared for a longish ride. We were a group of 9 friends and other than one other couple, were the only participants of the course. To be honest, I was disappointed. If we hadn't been in a group out to have a fun day out, the day would have been very dull. We baked bread on a stove and then cooked a Chicken tagine. Michel, the owner, didn't do any cooking with us - it was left to the lovely Nehza who was great. I'm not sure why Michel was actually there!!!! However, the food we cooked tasted disgusting (not only mine but all of us). I think it might be an idea to adapt the recipe for non-Moroccans - the rancid butter ingredient spoiled the whole taste. There was too much unnecessary banter from Michel without which we could have done the course in half the time. Would I recommend it - No. I'm sorry I can't be more positive but I'm sure there are much better cookery schools in Marrakesh where you might actually learn something. I will say that Nehza was great and a true professional.

Cooking ala Moroccan styley. When my gf booked this i was wondering what it was all about - however it turned out to be a great way to spend the day and was made lots of fun throughout - when we finally got to taste what we had all cooked, it was delicious :)))

Fun and interesting activity.. We really enjoyed our cooking course at Faim d'Epices. Michel was friendly, informative and welcoming. The location and building they use for the course is ideal and is just outside of Marrakech (transport to/from is provided by them).

Informative, engaging and fun.. Have you ever been to a party where the host is cool but friendly guy, intelligent yet still earthy and mysterious? - that's Michel. Have you ever been to a bar where the barmaid's eyes share the tenderness of the world and you instantly trust her? - that's Nehza. These two run a cookery course for every one and offer an experience that rises from understanding the ingredients to culinary magic. You'll learn recipes and techniques, master spices and tagines, in the grounds of an olive and orange farm. You'll be picked up in excitement and driven back satisfied at a day well and wisely spent.You'll be picked up in excitement and driven back satisfied at a day well and wisely spent.

A great day. We saw the recommendations on trip advisor and compared the different cookery courses available. We were very pleased that we went to Faim d'Epices. Michel was an entertaining host and we were made to feel relaxed right from the start. We were given expert tuition throughout and were able to sit out in the sun on the terrace with the other people on our course and enjoy our wonderful tagine of lamb and prunes with all of the salads to accompany it. We were ferried to and from our hotel with no problems. We thoroughly recommend this day out. If you come to Marrakech you must book this course. It made a perfect break from the hustle and bustle of the souks! Richard and Marie-Joelle, England

Excellent day out. I thoroughly enjoyed my time at the cookery school and when I go back to Marrakech I will return to the cookery school.Michel makes the day interesting and ensures that everyone feels involved. It is a very interactive experience and a good opportunity to talk to new people along with learning about Moroccan food. Neesy (spelling?) our teacher was brilliant and very knowledgable.Definitely do this course if you have time on your holiday.

All the Magic of Morocco Bubbling Under the Lid of Your Tajine. Michel and his crew at Faim d'Epices have designed a masterclass in homestyle Moroccan cuisine, wrapped it up with a fun and a frolicsome flare, and set it in a gorgeous small-production farm amidst olive and citrus groves. If you've managed to make it through their doors and found yourself stationed behind one of their tangines…you might just be holding the key to the best souvenir Marrakech (and perhaps all of Morocco) can offer. Pick-up and transfer is seamless, as Michel practically arrives right at your riad's front door to whisk you out of the medina. From there, Michel breaks the ice with a riotous game of "blindfolded" guess the spice (can you find the rancid butter?) and offers tips on how to spot fakes in the medina (argan, saffron). There are several fantastic demos on how to make all those swoon-worth Moroccan salads, and the class even gets to their hands at making "batbout", or pan-cooked flatbread. Then comes the main course.For us, that was beef tagine in a sauce of candied pears and oranges. If that sounds ridiculously delicious to you, multiply your notion by 100 and you will come somewhat close. THIS is what Morocco tastes like, these are the smells you've caught wafting up from the souk spice markets and from deep within the riad kitchens across the medina. If you want to understand the methodology of how the country's best cooks draw out the full complexity of flavors on offer, start here at Faim d'Epices. As you enjoy the lunch you've just prepared out in the orchards with a glass of red or white, you'll be forgiven for trying to figure out how exactly you're going to squeeze a giant terra-cotta vessel into your hand luggage so you can cook like this again!

Fantastic!. We went to marrakech on our honey moon and decided to do the Faim d'Epices course.And we surely made the right choice! Very innovative and fun way to spend your day in a country like Marrakech.The place was very very clean, organized. We felt like at home at all times. Michel and all the staff were great.We loved it!Joao and Priscila (Brazil)

A brilliant way to spend a day!. We read about Faim d'Epices on tripadvisor and all 6 of us had a great day with Michel (owner/host) and Nerza (sp?) (chef/teacher) learning to make bread, chicken tagine, a few different Moroccan salads and Moroccan crepes. Michel is a real character and made the day, both in terms of being so easy to deal with on the phone to arrange a pick-up (and later drop off at the airport) and a lot of fun on the day. The tuition was clear and well-paced (in English with French translation if needed)... by the time the meal is ready you will be starving and desperate to devour it!! We ate outside in the sunshine and were even offered a glass of wine with our meals and given crepes, fruit and home-made ice cream for dessert. Everything has been thought about - you are given beautifully-presented copies of the recipes and a small package of spice to take away with you, as well as a full and happy belly!
