Highly recommended - would suit solo travelers looking to meet other friendly people as well as couples/groups. Cost in January 2014 was EUR 50 per person or 550 dirhams: great value for a whole day, with no extras/hidden costs.

This place is a must go!. This was the best experience that my wife and I had in Morocco. The place is off the beaten path but they will send a car to pick you up from your hotel in downtown Marrakech. You will laugh and learn a lot during this class. Michel is a great host/comedian and Nehza is a great teacher of the Moroccan cuisine. You get to smell and sample every ingredient that you will eat later that day. The staff is so welcoming that you will feel like you are at one of your friend's house. A must go or anyone who goes to Marrakech. It will be a highlight of your trip.

Phenomenal. This class was an absolute highlight of my trip to Morocco. The manager, Michel, was efficient and entertaining. The school was beautiful and well-appointed. The chef, Nehza (sp), was patient and informative. There was nothing more pleasing than eating bread and tagine that you mad If you are in Marrakech, you must good to this school. I can't wait to try what I have learned at home.

A highlight of my trip!. I loved this day from start to finish. It was extremely well organised, good value for money, nicely paced and very enjoyable. Michel was a great, welcoming host who made everyone feel at home and helped the group to gel well. As a solo traveller I really enjoyed meeting the others in the group and being able to relax and speak English again after the hard work of using my very rusty French for the previous two days. I hated cookery lessons at school but the teacher here was skilful, patient and helpful and I would definitely go on a Faim d'Epices course again. Thank you!

Fun at the Faim!. We had a brilliant day learning to cook the yummy tagine, salads, bread and pancakes. It was really fun being tested on the spices and learning a bit about how they are grown, mixed and what to look out for when purchasing in the markets - very helpful lessons! Would highly recommend. It was a great experience and would recommend going for a massage afterwards!Thanks again!

Fun activity and good food. Michel has a great concept here!Extremely well organized class with instruction combined with a lot of hands on cooking. I feel like a learned a lot about how to make Moroccan food. However, I must admit I was a bit chocked about how good rancid butter can be in a tajine! Michel is also a bit of a comedian so there is not a dull moment!This is really a one full day activity and not a half-day as advertised. Not that we mind!

entertaining and educational. One of the highlights of our trip without a doubt. Very organised right from the beginning with regards to getting picked up at our hotel. Michel, the host, is very welcoming and a good laugh and also very knowledgeable so i would definitely recommend doing this trip at the start of your time in Marrakesh, if for no reason other than to give you a better chance of not getting ripped off in the souks! The cooking might be too basic for some but im sure everyone would learn something especially when it comes to the blind smell test of the spices! Excellent value for money as you get to eat a lot throughout the day too.We were on our honeymoon and Michel very generously gave us a wedding gift just to top off an excellent day!Cant recommend it enough. Entertaining, educational and nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of the old town! Thank you.
Fantastic. A fantastic day cooking at Faim d'Epices. Michel does a great job as host/tutor/comedian. Remember to buy some of their home made olive oil.

A Highlight of our trip. We did a tour through Morocco and had 2 days allocated to Marrakech. There is actually not too much to do in Marrakech (souks in other cities are much nicer and cheaper). When I consulted trip advisor this came up as the number 1 thing to do in Marrakech. My husband and I booked for the cooking & spa combo. After reading some of the reviews our expectations were very high. This place did not disappoint. Extremely professionally run from the branded van that picked us up, to the printed recipes and entire set up of the cooking school was incredible. The food was the best quality we had in morocco in our whole trip.

Excellent in every way.. We booked this prior to our arrival in Marrakech for the cookery class and spa deal. This was a brilliant dayfor a taste of Moroccan cooking and the ultimate in relaxation at the spa afterwards. Michele was great and very inclusive in the day at the cookery school. Picked us up bang on time at our hotel. The cookery class was great- lots of fun and really relaxing. Having returned home now we can safely say the food we cooked here was the best we tasted in the week we were in Marrakech.... I would like to think that's because we are great cooks but I think its more to do with the brilliant guidance we had in home cooking! We did lamb with prunes then ate it in the evening warmth before we were taken to have a Hamman in Marrakech. I would recommend this to anyone wanting to taste proper home made Moroccan food. Since we returned home we have had recipes and photographs of our experience sent to us. Brilliant. A long but very relaxing day. x

OK, but a bit disappointing. I'm a bit bemused why everyone else has given this such great reviews. Might just be me, but I didn't think it was all that.The good bits:It's well organised. You are picked up from your hotel, taken to the farm and dropped off back at your hotelThe lady who demonstrates the dishes is very good. When it's your turn to recreate the dishes, she's very clear and patient which isn't easy to do when there's a fair number of people in the classYou'll find out some interesting things about how to assess the authenticity of saffron and argon oilLearning how to chop an onion morroccan style was greatThe disappointing bits:The host Michel feels that he is the entertainment. Whilst very pleasant, I found the 'hamming" it up an attention seeking a bit tiring (playing the bongos whilst we were kneading bread was a bit much for me)Might just be me, others found him fun, but he certainly put everyone at ease. The cookery is basic, so if you want to do something a little more challenging, this won't be for you.I thought the food we cooked was very bland. We also cooked it to death, so it was overdone and slightly burnt at the bottom.....it's not great when you have to eat your efforts.Would I recommend it to others? If you're only in Marrakech for a few days, no, you could spend your time better elsewhere. But if you're in Marrakech for a while and want to do something different and you're not a real foodie or cook, then maybe

Great experience!. This experience was a great way to spend a day away from the hustle and bustle of the medina in Marrakech. The staff were very friendly, good humoured and welcoming. There was 10 of us in the class and they took time out to check that we were ok with the food that we were cooking and offer a helping hand when we got stuck! We made a lamb and prune tagine which was delicious and we enjoyed this along with our moroccan breads and salads outside in the sun (though it was a bit windy!) amongst the orange trees and olive groves. If you have a day to spare in marrakech, I would recommend this worthwhile and enjoyable experience. Looking forward to trying out the recipes at home!Visited November 2013

Great way to spend a day in Marrakech!. We had an excellent time learning various Moroccan dishes with Michel and the rest of the staff at Faim d'Epices. They were engaging and educational -- and the food was delicious!! The class we took really was an all day experience, so just know that going in.

The most fun you can have in Marrakech. I have attend cooking classes in many countries/cities and this was the best organized and most fun. Every aspect, from the hotel pick-up to the meal (which we helped prepare) was absolutely first rate. Michel the host/owner who is a real character and Nadji the chef/instructor were obviously concerned about the enjoyment the guests realized participating in this fun experience.Did I say at $60 USD, this is great value ..........when next in Marrakech, get out of the Medina for a day and go enjoy and wonderful afternoon in the countryside.

Fantastic day spent out of the Medina. I booked Farm d'Epices because of the reviews on Tripadvisor - and I wasn't disappointed. The staff were very welcoming, funny and pitched the class at just the right level. They were very amenable in regards to specific dietary requirements, adjusting recipes where needed. The food at the end of the cooking class was absolutely delicious - potentially the best food I ate out in Morrocco (even if I do say so myself...)I'd highly recommend doing the class if you want something a bit different and a break from the Medina

Worthy experience. The cookery class is totally worth it. I learned a lot of things about the spices and herbs used in a typical Moroccan dish, and also how to prepare one. Also the organized transport to and from the farm is a great convenience for tourists not familiar with the chaotic Moroccan streets, such as us.

Definitely worth it!. <English>We had a great time at Faim d'Epices learning how to cook tagines! The driver picked us up from Jemaa El Fna's post office and we were excited for the cooking course and the spa afterwards. (It was a set deal about 100 Euros per person) The menu was "tagine with veal and artichokes" accompanied by flat bread and Moroccan salads. Michel was a great host and explained us about spices and helped us throughout the course. The artichokes are extremely difficult to peel, but the dish we made was one of the best tagines I had in my trip! It was great sitting outside under the sun in December (as we traveled from Denmark) eating tasty food surrounded by great company. We also did a spa afterwards as mentioned before at Mythic Oriental Spa which took about 3 hours in total. We were out the whole day from 9:30 to 20:00 so prepare for a long day and do eat breakfast before attending the cookery course. We assumed we were eating at around 12:00ish but we ended up starving and ate around 15:00. Overall, if you have a whole day to spend in Marrakech, this cookery course is a must try!<Japanese>こちらの料理教室では、日ごとに変わる様々なタジンと平たいパンを作る事が出来ます。モロッコ風サラダ３種とクレープも講師が作る様子を見せてくれ、実際に食べる事が出来ます。講師は英語（もしくはフランス語）で料理の作り方を丁寧に教えてくれます。私たちが参加した時は「牛肉とアーティチョークのタジン」でした。アーティチョークを剥くのが非常に厄介でしたが、全体的にとても面白く、スパイスについても学べ、フナ広場からの送迎込みでこの値段は素晴らしいコスパだと思います。朝９時半から１７時頃まで拘束されるので、長い一日になる事を覚悟しておいた方が賢明です。お昼頃に料理を食べると思いきや、食べだすのは１５時頃なので朝食は絶対食べておいた方が良いと思います。教室の周りでは野菜やフルーツを栽培していて、オーナーさんが色々説明してくれます。１２月頭で２３度近く有り、外のテラスでオレンジの木々を見ながら食べるタジンは最高でした。なお、料理学校＋スパ（ハマム、垢擦り、マッサージ）のパッケージに参加しましたが、値段は１人１００ユーロ弱でした。マラケシュを訪れる際は是非、参加してみてください！

Wow your Moroccan acquaintances. I attended the course in August and had never taken the time to write a review!Today however - was presented with some morrocan pancakes for breakfast and I felt a real sense of pride when I said I could make them :))I have successfully done the couscous twice at home (and remembered all the little tips given by our very patient teacher Nezha) ... I now have to prove my knowledge with the pancakes!The day was really nice - we spent our time cooking and eating. The surroundings are lovely, great interior too and I really felt pampered!So if you like your morrocan food and spices, and want to impress and learn, do visit Michel and his team and you'll feel like you've really spiced your life!Highly recommended!

A must do in Marrakech. We had a fantastic time at Faim d'Epices. Michel was great fun, everything was well organised and the end result was delicious! The cooking area was set up well and we were able to see everything clearly. The farm itself is in a beautiful location and it was very relaxing to sit outside whilst we devoured our fish tagines, Moroccan bread and incredible salads. Faim d'Epices is well worth a visit... and don't leave without a bottle of their homegrown olive oil!

A great day out. We had a fantastic time at the farm. It was a pleasant break from the hectic atmosphere of the medina to spend a day in the quiet of the countryside. Michel and his team were great hosts and the time flew by. A must do day out and good value for money too.

A highlight of our Moroccan trip. We had such a good time with these guys! French Michel is such a laugh, and you can tell he really enjoys and takes pleasure in his work. The chef was professional, friendly, clear and really helpful. The cooking area and surroundings were beautiful, a really nice surprise.The recipes were interesting and challenging but we all managed to make a tasty feast we were proud of. We found the spice workshop very useful and were thrilled to learn how to make msemen!!Eating our food in the garden with tea and homemade icecream was a fantastic end to a fantastic day. We would highly recommend Faim d'Espices, and we think it was a very fair price for the great day we had.Thank you :)

Really good fun!. We had a great day at Faim d'Epices. It was well organised - we were picked up and dropped back at the main square near our riad, and the class ran smoothly from one interesting activity to the next. There was an interactive spice workshop with a blind guess-the-spice game, and we had demonstrations of how to make a variety of salads and yummy Moroccan pancakes, as well as the main lesson in cooking a tagine and bread. Nezha was a lovely teacher - there were 12 of us in the class and she gave us all individual attention - and Michel created a lively and laid-back atmosphere. I had never been to a cookery class before and appreciated the fact that they were good-humoured when I hacked my artichoke to pieces,losing most of the good bits in the process! And it was all topped off by a delicious meal that we had made, eaten in beautiful surroundings overlooking the orange and olive groves. We were also given a bag of spices and some recipes to take home as souvenirs. It was one of my favourite parts of the trip to Marrakesh, and I would definitely recommend it.

Good day out. I really wanted to do a cooking course in marrakech when my husband and I were there for our anniversary in November. I love cooking, especially "exotic" food for eg. Indian, Mexiacan, Asian, and now I can add Moroccan to that list. The blind test of spices was very interesting even if you know which spices you are smelling, you are sure to learn something about how it is grown, or its origin etc. Both hubby and I thouroughly enjoyed this day out. Very well organised from pick up from riad to the paper copy of the recipes given to us at the end of the day. It was a bit chilly to eat outside on the day we were there and so I strongly suggest warm clothes and perhaps even (the only improvement I could suggest) blankets could be provided for the meals outside in the winter months...

It's not about the recipe.. but the people. Face it, for those of us who cook regularly, tajines are not hard to figure out. Between so many resources online and in print for cooking tajines, one can figure it out really easily. If it can be made on a make shift grill in the middle of an open square, it can be done in an well-equipped personal kitchen with Internet access. This class is about the experience. It's lovely to be able to sit down and get lectured on spices. I love the smell test- I would have failed if we were graded- but it really brings out an appreciation of the nuances and flavors. There's a sense of being at home as soon as we walked in and were greeted by Michel. And to get the insider scoop on prices or tips to shopping was a bonus. The facilities are gorgeous and well made. Eating outside by the garden was just the way to enjoy the climate. I lucked out in having such a cheerful group of classmates. I could let my guard down and not worry about pretending to ignore people shouting at me "You! From (fill in the blank with a random country)?" or "Madam! Hello! Where from? Come see tanneries" and mingle with other people. I appreciated that we started with demonstrations, then got to try, especially in making bread. Overall, it wasn't really so much on how to cook, but to just have fun and enjoy the day over food. The lessons were presented well to appreciate the Moroccan cuisine as well and but easy to know how to apply the techniques and recipes to your own home kitchen once you leave. My main take away lessons from this class: - How to slice an onion! - How to knead bread- And I covet a massive clay plate like theirs for breadmaking!

A Great-Tasting Learning Experience. A great experience from start to finish. Learned about Moroccan cooking, spices, and finished with a lovely meal in the garden. The techniques taught for the taggine are excellent and the food delicious. I will never cut an onion the same again!

No better way to learn about Moroccan cuisine. I have spent a fantastic day and enjoyed the hospitality of Michel and his team at Faim d'Epices. Very well organised, flawlessly executed, highly informative and enjoyable cooking class. We had demonstration on salads, bread making, crepes and an interactive "workshop" on spices. Then we cooked a delicious beef tajine and enjoyed all the food in the garden with a glass of wine. Michel is an excellent host and made all of us welcome and entertained for the whole day. If you are interested in moroccan dishes / cooking, do not miss this class when you are visiting Marrakesh.

Amazing Cooking Class & Hammam. We booked the cooking class and evening hammam package, and it was the absolute highlight of our time in Morocco. We made an incredible Tajine, bread, salads, desert and learned so much about spices. I am gluten intolerant and they worked with me to ensure I could be part of the group and eat almost everything we made together. I would highly recommend Faim d'Epices!

Highlight of Marrakech!. Had an excellent day at this cooking class, learnt heaps and had loads of fun. Michel is great and made the day very entertaining. We learnt how to make bread, 3 morrocan salads, a lamb and prune tagine and morrocan crepes. All the food was fantastic and I look forward to getting home and cooking authentic morrocan food for my family and friends. We also got to learn all about the spices used in morrocan food. All in all a wonderful day, highly recommended!

A must must must do in marrakech. Wow where so I start.. what an amazing day. We were picked up by the lovely Michel from the medina sqaure and taken out to the farm. The atmospherewas so fun and chilled. We cooked the tagine which was delicious. We were taught lots of hints and tips that I am defiantly going to use now I am back home. All the stafg were ao welcoming. We got to sut and relax in the garden at the end of the day and eat out food which was gorgeous. Michel is a fabulous host. Guarenteed to make you laugh. Was definitely a highlight of the trip and I would recommend anyone to do it. It really is not to be missed. Just check out all the other reviews. Thank you once again for a super day Michel and the team. Gem and dave xx

Excellent Fun!. I booked this for my husband and I whilst on a short stay in Morrocco. We were collected on time from our hotel and we had the most amazing day. Michael and his team were so lovely and we made the most amazing food in a fun environment. Thank you for a lovely day Michael!

Definitely recommend this............... My son (15year) and I took part in this incredibly day which involved cooking, investigating spices and having fun! We booked this trip because of the reviews on Trip Advisor and this exceeded our expertations . Well done to Michael and his team. They made us feel at home and shared their wealth of experience with Morroccan food. Each day focused on a particular dish and I would love to take part in another session. Great way to engage younger family members.10 out of 10!!!

Perfect Day. I thoroughly enjoyed my day spent at Faim d'Epices, Michel was an excellent host, the cooking was well demonstrated and fun! The spice test was informative especially as I did not recognise any of them. Our cous-cous with 7 vegetables was eaten outside by the olive groves with excellent company. What more can I say... Thank you.

Wonderful, relaxing day. Recommend whether you cook or not.. A lovely day with a great team. Relaxed pace, good food and a bit of knowledge thrown in of spices and cooking. Nothing too difficult! And recipes to bring home. Wonderful.

Best excursion I did all holiday - great fun!. If you only do one day excursion during your time in Marrakech I would strongly recommend it should be this one. The owner and organiser Michel is a very nice and very funny man, who had us laughing throughout the day. He picks you up from your place, and takes you to the farm, before giving you a lesson in Moroccan spices. Cooking is taught by Nezha, who shows you how to make Moroccan bread, salad, crepes and tagine with expertise, then helps you attempt to recreate her work. There are a few good surprises along the way, and the day ends with the chance to eat all the food outside in the beautiful gardens. Thoroughly enjoyable from start to finish. Merci beacoup Michel! BenP.s. I think it cost 50euros, and unlike almost everything else in Marrakech, there were no hidden extras (e.g. the coffees etc are complimentary). This was a welcome change!
Fantastic Experience. Great experience, would recommend to anyone travelling to Marrakech. From start to finish, the host and the food were exceptional.

Best food in Morroco. As foodies we went to Morroco mainly for the food and we're thoughly disappointed. It appeared that vegetable couscous and lamb or chicken targine were the staple offering for the tourists. However Morrocan food is much more than this as we discovered at Faim de'Epices. Michel the swave Frenchmen, our host, and Nezha our chef/teacher for the day were outstanding, entertaining and made our day. To be completely honest the food we cooked here was the best food we sampled in Morroco and we ate in some supposedly renowned restaurants that at best we're average and expensive for Morrocan standards. We would not hesitate to recommend attending this cooking school for an educational, fun, value for money day away from the hassle of the Marrekech people who are endlessly trying to rip you off.

If you do one thing in Marrakech do this!. We had such a great day at Faim d'Epices it's easy to see why this is the number one thing to do in Marrakech. They pick you up and drop you off taking the hassle of finding it yourself away!Extremely friendly staff and Michel is particularly great. Having eaten a lot of mediocre food in Marrakech during our stay the lamb tagine with prunes and almonds was by far the best meal we've had (and we cooked it ourselves... With a bit of help!).The price is really reasonable for a whole days activity and we really cannot recommend this highly enough.Just book it, you won't regret it!!

A* friendly, fun, welcoming and informative - BOOK IT NOW!. Following excellent email communication a few days prior to our visit we were collected promptly from our hotel and taken to Faim d'Epices. We had an interesting day learning about and preparing Moroccan food - at first I felt a bit nervous - (think combination of British Bake Off and Generation Game) but in fact no one was made to feel foolish and assistance was offered where needed. This is a very welcoming, friendly, fun and informative day. Michel and Neska were wonderful and there was plenty of behind the scenes people to make it all run smoothly. I don't want to reveal all but you can glean from the other reviews how good it was. It was great at the end to be able to sit down and enjoy our meal with everyone else. My daughters (16 and 20) loved it.We did this in combination with the spa offer - great time had by all.

Much more than a cookery lesson. Has a fabulous day at Faim d'Epices learning about and cooking some delicious Moroccan food. What made the day though was the Michel's humour and enthusiasm, you could not ask for a better host. We had loads of fun, learned a bit about local food and even surprised ourselves with how nice our tajine was.All in all an excellent way to spend a day in Marrakech so thank you Michel and Nezha

Such a fun day cooking. I went on this trip with my girlfriend and we both thought it was one of the most fun and interactive days we had in marrakech. Michel, the french man was a brilliant host who's passion toward moroccan cuisine had everyones attention straight away. Everything from start to finish was just superb and am really glad to have been along. Im looking forward to putting my newly learnt skills to the test in the kitchen.

Worth the trip and the time. The driver picked us up very punctually at 9:30. Along the way 2 more couples joined us. The trip from the Hotel Du Golf took 1 hour, through the old city, through the new city, past a huge olive plantation and finally down a very bumpy dirt road. The interior of the house was pleasantly cool and cleverly arranged. The 6 of us had our own cooking stations and individual attention. After learning about spices, we watched how the bread dough is prepared. Later, we had a chance to practice what we learned. Made our own bread, prepared our own chicken lemon tagine and watched how to make 3 different salads. We ate what we had cooked on the back porch overlooking the lemon grove and were served a lovely wine and an interesting dessert. It was past 5pm when we got home after a very fun day that was well worth the 550 Dh

Great day!. We really enjoyed spending a day at Faim d'Epices cooking school. The tagine that we learnt to make was delicious and it was interesting to see how they make their bread and the delicious little pancakes. Whether we'll be able to recreate them at home is another matter. if you want a day out of the souks then I would highly recommend doing this.

A what an excellent day!!!. The cooking class was such a welcome break from the husle and bussle of Marrakech. We were greeted with welcoming smiles. We learnt how to make bread and tajine. We was a great balance of hands on and demonstration. The spice workshop was excellent. I learnt so much. We all sat down as a group at the end and enjoyed our food together. Highly recommend!

A reluctant great day in Morocco. Being a chef didnt really want to spend my vacation at a cooking school but my lady was pretty insistant so we booked it. From start to finish Michel and the rest of his entourage made this an incredible day. Far better than MK which is overpriced and although very good not great value.  Michel is a self confessed liar . (But he is not) which makes him very entertaining. The cooking was relaxed, percise and spot on . Lots of fun. In our search for the best Moroccan food this was by far the winner. We ate at many excellent venues and had great food every time but no meal compared to this one. Three cheers.

An enjoyable day out. We recently got back from a short break in Marrakech, and spent one of our days at the farm of Faim d'Epices. It was an enjoyable day and would recommend it for some insight into Moroccan cooking.We were picked up from our riad at 9.30 and took about an hour to get to the farm once we had picked up the others. Michel, the host, is very entertaining and our cook was very sweet. We watched a few demonstrations before having a spice test, which was really fun - it's amazing what you think you know about spices when you can't see what you're smelling! We then learned to make bread which was rather entertaining, and made our tagines, before watching a few more salad / crepe demonstrations and finally all sat out together to enjoy our meal at the end of the day. We were out from 9.30 and got back to our riad at about 5pm, so make sure you book with spending the whole day there in mind.As a fairly seasoned cook, I didn't find the course too difficult, but it was an interesting insight into traditional Moroccan cooking. I will definitely take the recipes away and try them at home.All in all it was great value and a fun day.

Highlight of our Marrakech experience. My husband reluctantly agreed to accompany me to this cooking class (he works in the food industry). We were both very pleasantly surprised from the moment we arrived on the property (we were picked up at our riad), to first meeting Michel, to commencing our class and to eating what we had cooked ourselves. We were skillfully guided through each step, so that our recipe of fresh Moroccan lamb tagine served with vegetables, bread and salads (with a little wine), was successful. So much so, that that meal became our standard during the rest of our stay. It was by far the best meal we had in Marrakech, including a very expensive, exclusive one at Riad MK! Michel was enjoyable and entertaining, the facility (farm) beautiful, the class itself was fun and relaxing. In particular, Michel's honed recipes and spices are a perfect blend that are memorable. The little souvenirs we were sent away with at the end of the day, were an additional professional touch. It is clear a lot of thought and planning went into this entire enterprise. Michel got it right and clearly loves sharing it. We highly recommend taking this class as part of your Moroccan experience. It will surely go down as one of your highlights. Tastefully yours from Canada!

Great experience. if you wish to learn about the real thing well thats where you must book without hesitation. the team Michel/Neezha is fantastic - great explanation and very friendly way to feel being a great cook ! Definitely a very nice memory from our stay in Marrakesh Best regards from Malta/Marseille/Uk :)

Brilliant day out. I'm not one for cookery classes but went along to this with 3 girlfriends while we were on a short break to Marrakech but I had a brilliant time. Michel has a great sense of humour and made everyone feel relaxed. The cooking demonstrations were easy to follow with some interesting tips. The surrounding were very tranquil and sitting eating the lunch outside chatting with the group was lovely. Finished off the day with the spa treatments. All in all a very good value for money event.

A great day out of the city!. We had a very enjoyable time at Faim d'Epices in what was a much needed getaway from the hustle and bustle of the city. We were picked up from the door of our Riad and taken to Michel's kitchen (based on a farm) outside the city making the whole day hassle free. I am not normally a cooking enthusiast however really enjoyed my day and that was largely down to the personality of Michel himself and his excellent cook and demonstrator. This is not only a chance to cook some delicious, fresh Moroccan food, it is a good opportunity to learn more about the ingredients and about Marrakech in general as Michel was happy to discuss anything we asked. Would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone travelling to Marrakech as this is exactly what is needed after a few days in the Souks!

fantastic cooking experience. this is a great experience learning the ways of cooking Marrakech style. learnt a lot about the spices . Michel was very informative and very entertaining.overall you spend a great day in a beautiful environment and very worth it.

L'atelier Faim d'Epices. Fantastic experience - from the moment we were collected and brought to Faim d-Epices through to the whole cooking experience and enjoyment of the meal towards the end of the day. Michel was brilliant - entertaining, knowledgeable and funny - the perfect host. The menu was well planned and interesting and the spice test was fun andintriguing. The package was excellent value for money.I had an amazing time and will certainly be returning for the advanced class. Thanks Michel and team!

Our favourite day spent in Marrakech. Of all the sights and smells in Marrakech, our day spent at Faim d'Epices was by far the most memorable. Our host Michel was great and always entertaining. Both of us are avid cooks and while this was not difficult cooking, most of the techniques were new and the spice workshop was invaluable.We had an entire week of classes to choose from and decided to make our booking on a day when we could make the Lamb Tagine with Prunes. This was an incredibly tasty dish which we recreated to great oooh's and ahhh's within two weeks of returning home. I do not hesitate in the slightest to recommend Michel and his team at Faim d'Epices. A great day out with unbeatable value for money.All the best

Fun, great way to learn about Morrocan food, nice reprieve from the hustle & bustle of Marrakech. Great for those who want to learn about Morrocan food and cuisine in a fun and relaxed environment. (The other obvious option would be La Marison Arab - which we stayed at - although I didn't attend a cooking workshop, I was able to see it in action. It looked very professional but not more sterile and serious.) Even for those that are not accomplished cooks (as with my partner Mr N and one of the other visitors in our group from New York), it is still a very enjoyable way to spend your day. Even Mr N, who can barely boil a packet of dried pasta, was able to execute a perfectly tasty lamb and almond-stuffed figs tangine. The venue is actually some way out of the Medina, but the transport is organised in advance and is comfortable and punctual. It turns out that being away from the hustle and bustle of central Marrakech was an unexpectedly nice surprise. As exotic and alluring as the Medina is, after spending a few days there, it is refreshing and comforting to be able to spend a bit of time in the country away from the chaos. The host, Michel, is enormsly friendly, caring and loads of fun!

Tasty and entertaing day out. Booked this on the internet as a surprise for my wife after reading the great reviews on here. I wasn't sure she'd view spending a day cooking as a great holiday activity but she loved it! Picked up in a nice vehicle, on time and near our Riad and after picking up another couple drove about 10 miles out of the city into the surprisingly green countryside. Was greeted by Michel, the cool Frenchman who runs the place. The instruction was given by a lovely Morrocan lady (sorry, I've forgotten her name) who was extremely patient and instructive. Michel hovered in the background assisting and entertaining. In the middle of our cooking the radio came on and Michel started on his bongos! Surreal but very entertaining and apropos!We cooked a beef tagine with veg, bread and a sweet and later in the day this was consumed eagerly on the cool veranda overlooking the fields. Michel is a very interesting 'joker'. He will have a 'pop' at English cooking (okay with me as I'm Welsh;-) but is just as quick to mock aspects of 'Frenchness'. Had a great conversation with him out on the veranda.Since returning to Wales Michel has sent our 'certificates' translated into Welsh...how thoughtful is that!!! A great day out and a complete contrast to the madness of Marrakech. Bought one of Michel's lovely tagine dishes and with the recipes provided by Michel am looking forward to putting my new 'skills' to the test.Merci / Shokran Michel and crew for a great day out!

Cooking to drum by. Let's face it to the average western foreigner Marrakech, especially in the old city, is a cultural shock. So any chance you get to experience what is in fact an amazing place with the assistance of a guide (that happens to also be quite the entertainer) is paramount. Important though is that the experience isn't too removed from what makes Marrakech, Marrakech, in this case food. This and more is the experience Michel and his team at L'atelier Faim d'Espices offer. It's an experience to treasure and remember every time you attempt to repeat it back home. Be it recalling the smell of herbs and spices, combining beef with pear and orange (something this naive chef would never have attempted beforehand and yes that means that your cooking ability is irrelevant) or doing it all to the accompaniment of live bongos! Ok enough spoilers from me. Do not leave Marrakech without doing this class! Alison and Michael from Australia

Fish Tajine Uncovered. I'm a food enthusiast and love Moroccan food in particular. On my latest trip to Morocco, I took this love to a new level: booked a cooking class at this 'top ranking cooking class' in an optimistic attempt to learn the basic intricacies of Moroccan cooking. Booking the class on a day they were teaching Fish Tajine (different dish everyday) was easy. I was picked up on time from a designated place by the Medina not far from the Riad I was staying in. It turned out to be a great day overall. Marcel was a warm and welcoming host and teacher, so were the rest of the staff. Among other things, I learned how to make Moroccan bread, salads, and the fish tajine! I certainly uncovered the basics of Fish Tajine, unfortunately I also uncovered my lack of Moroccan skill (or experience) to cook one. But how fun the process of discovering this! Overall, it was a wonderful, enjoyable day. All is not lost - after all, practice makes perfect.

Anyone can do it & then savor it!. I started this tour a bit anxious not knowing if I would have something at the end considering my nonexistent cooking talent… but this ended up being a lovely day and lunch was delicious.I wrote some more details about our activities and added photos to my website ZigZag On Earth (www.zigzagonearth.com/the-therapeutic-power-of-cooking-moroccan-bread/).My favorite was punching and stretching the dough for the Moroccan bread… I felt so much better after it!ZZOE from ZigZag On Earth Travel Blog

Brilliant fun and informative!. This was a fabulous way to spend some time whilst in Morocco and, having already had some traditional Moroccan food by the time we took the class, it was a great way to finally uncover the secrets of the tagine! Michel and his staff were brilliant - making the day hugely enjoyable as well as educational. Not only do you get to learn how to make the traditional salads, bread and, of course, a tagine, but you also get to learn more about the spices used in Moroccan cooking (as well as some useful tips when shopping for spices in the souks!).The cooking class itself is well led, with all the information and help you could need provided, delivered at exactly the right pace. The atmosphere is fun and relaxed with everyone just enjoying the experience. It is all topped of by being able to taste the fruits of the days labour - eating the meal you have just prepared in the peaceful olive orchard on the farm. I would thoroughly recommend to anyone visiting Marrakesh to make time in the trip to take this class.

Greatest time in Marrakesh!. Not to reveal much, as it is fun to have a surprise - this cooking class is the best thing that you can do in Marrakesh. Not only will you learn how to make tajines and other, but also you will spend awesome time with fun people who give you the most positive Morrocan vibe :)Totally and 100% recommended and worth the money!

finally...the real cous-cous!!!. I can't help confirming the positive comments already given by other users. Michel and his staff were really nice, warm and helpful. The teacher was fanatasting and made cous-cous preparation the easiest thing I've ever cooked! They provided us with whatever is needed to make this experience something to remember and to recommend to whoever is going to visit Marrakech and is open to learn something more about Moroccan food.Well done, Michel!!!

Great chicken tangine recipe!. My husband and I attended the cooking class during our 4 day stay in Marrakech. Although there is alot to do in Marrakech, I highly recommend the cooking class for 3 reasons. First, it provides the opportunity to get out into the outskirts of the city in order to learn about tangine cooking and the typical spices used in Moroccan cooking. Second, the hands-on experience of making the various dishes is important and Michel is an excellent teacher. Finally, the class ends with eating the meal and it is absolutely delicious,,,(better than what we had eaten in some of the better Morrocan restaurants.) The added bonus is that Michel is truly passionate about his work and makes sure everyone has a great experience.

Lovely enjoyable experience. This was really good fun day with a group of friends, we learnt a lot about spices, and Moroccan cooking. Making local bread and our lunch for later. Michel and his staff were excellent, and all the information and demonstrations were done at the correct pace. We were given a small present on departing of Moroccan spice and recipes. On returning home we received a couple of emails with further recipes. A must when you are in Morocco.

Good fun. Me and my boyfriend took part in making a chicken tagine. It was good to finally learn an authentic tagine recipe because they are hard to come by! It was good fun and the day went so fast. The ice cream at the end topped the day off! It was lovely tasting new flavours. Would recommend the spa package too!

There is a reason why it's tripadvisor's No.1. My husband and I did not regret taking this course, it was so much fun and we actually got to learn a lot about Moroccan cuisine and Morocco in general. The staff is super friendly and very accommodating. It's a great deal for the price they charge, do not hesitate taking this course!

The perfect introduction to Moroccan Cuisine, loved every minute. One of the main reasons we chose Morocco as a destination was for the food and what better way to learn about it than to cook it? Based on the positive reviews I read, Faim d'Epices seemed to be a logical place to start and the experience exceeded our expectations. There was something for everyone, our group included a vegetarian and another who is not an enthusiastic cook as well as keen amateur chefs and the patient guidance and demonstration by Nehza ensured that all our dishes were correctly cooked and tasty to eat. The spice workshop was very informative and Michel's easy going manner made it loads of fun. It is definitely worth making the time to attend a class here, a big thank you to all at Faim d'Epices for making our day!

A must do in Marrakech. Now I did this cooking day 'cause the boyfriend wanted to have a cookery lesson in Morocco, and friend's recommendation, ( like why waste time in a kitchen was what I thought....?!), but was won over by the welcoming sense of individuality, organised set up and even if I say so myself...delicious fish tagine ( you could choose different meals on different days) and handmade bread that we made! It feels homely rather than corporate and was a welcome fun reasonably priced experience in the often mad bustling in-your face Marrakech. Don't hesitate.

Dish of the holiday!. My daughter and I spent a day at L'atelier Faim d'Epices in early September 2013 and had a brilliant day. My daughter is vegetarian so it was great that she was catered for so well in the cookery lesson. Michel and his team are knowledgeable, helpful, skilled, warm, friendly and have a fantastic sense of humour. As we shared the day with a slightly dizzy bunch of 'young upwardly mobile professionals' the humour came in very handy.The knowledge we gained was extremely valuable and although my daughter and I have been cooking for many years, we learned a few new, very useful tips and techniques. The atmosphere was fun and relaxed and the back room staff quietly efficient. I can wholeheartedly recommend this venue and if you do decide to book, don't buy your oils, spices and souvenirs before you have visited - wait until you get there as they are very reasonable and better quality than you may find in the souks

Brilliant day. Me and a friend booked this whilst out in Marrakech a couple of weeks ago and we both had an absolutely fantastic time.We were picked up on time from our hotel and taken to the farm, altogether there was 8 people in our group. Michel does a great job welcoming you, making you feel at home and getting everyone introduced and feeling relaxed!The day was perfectly planned out and everything professionally set-up, we learnt a lot from the spice workshop and enjoyed all the great demonstrations and cooking we got to do!It was amazing to learn to cook something new and to be able to enjoy eating it sitting outside with a beautiful view! Definitely was a treat :)Thank you to Michel and everyone else for being so friendly and welcoming, an exceptional day and a firm favourite, I would recommend for everyone!Roxane

Moroccan Flava !!! The Best :). I'm from The Bay Area in California, USA! Which means a melting pot of diversity! And I'm proud to say, "I've had training from the best in Morocco!" I'm confident that this class has taught me how to tease my Moroccan food loving friends to join me at my house for the love of food! I found the class easy to follow, mainly, because the instructor spoke good english and was very patience! My friends, that I was traveling with decided to take a camel ride to the Argan oil trees and when they returned, the same day! We talked about our adventures and I discovered Michel (the owner of Faim d'Epices) gave me information about Argan Oil that my friends had not received on their tour! He explained true Argan Oil verses watered down Argan Oil! I think I got the better deal, lol ! I plan to return to this part of world, so "Michel" I will see you again at some point in life! Keep the business alive :)I forgot to add! I took a portion of my meal with me to share with my friends and the owner of the Riad Bamilike in Marrakech! They loved it !!!! Michel also had this display of leather belts from his neighbor, I bought 2 of them! I can't stop getting compliments on the belst! I feel like a superstar when I wear them, lol !!!All praises and blessings to your business Michel ! I can totally see your passion to making great food!!!

Entertaining, informative and an excellent way to spend the day... Highly recommend. We were lucky with a nice small class of 6 and so got amazing attention from the team. The team we had consisted of Michel (owner) who was a classic man. Very smiley and made you feet al very welcome from the moment you entered his place. The chef ( whose name completely escapes me so am sorry about that) was authentic and was very passionate about her cooking and passing on the information to us. The main goal of the course was to create dishes that were in the typical Moroccan home as opposed to the fusion you can find out in the restaurants.All in all we were there for many hours but the time went very quickly and of cause finished off with eating the food we had "slaved" over and a delicious desert that we didn't!!Plus......we are also now all pro at making bread and crêpes...boohyah!! Thanks to all for the great day and wish you all the success you deserve.Henry & Liz

Brilliant Day!. Me and my husband did this as a break from the crazyness of Marrakech. It was such a fun day! We were collected on time and the place where it was held was gorgeous! Everything is explained clearly and you don't feel rushed at all. We were with a really great group of people also which helped :) Would love to do this again!

Cookery school. We were collected on time as arranged. Fantastic day out. Michel was a very good host. The spice identification to start the day was very instructive. We made several Moroccan dishes including bread and a lamb and prune tagine. All we needed to produce fantastic dishes was provided, we had excellent instruction to enable us to produce unbelievable food. We were supplied with mint tea and water all day. A table was laid outside and we all sat down to eat the fruits of our labours, together with a very welcome glass of wine.It was an excellent day and we would recommend it to anyone.

Most memorable time in Marrakech.. After a few days in Marrakech, me and my husband decided to go for the cooking class. It was on our wedding anniversary and we were so glad we were together, cooking, learning, having lots of fun in the workshop. We both love cooking, we both love Moroccan dishes! It was very important for us to know what ingredients going into the dishes and the main cooking techniques. I usually do not eat much couscous, but after learning the proper way to make some from the beginning, it became very spiritual. Handmade couscous taste much better than 5 minutes instant ones. I was so pleased with myself in the end of the class~Michel was great host and his team in L'atelier Faim d'Epices were all excellent! The Studio was very clean, team members always look after us after every stage of cooking. Michel talked through all different spices, let us know a lot of them. It was very educational. Now me and my husband can confidently make our own Moroccan dishes at home.It was great time to spend outside Marrakech city, chill out in the countryside. Cooking, laughing and relaxing.Thanks to L'atelier Faim d'Epices, gave us such memorable time in Marrakech!

Great day and experience!. Myself and a friend attended the cookery day. We got picked up and taken to the venue- very easy! The cookery aspect was easy to understand and we were taught and helped by a lovely Moroccan lady. We learnt about spices it was very interesting. The setting was lovely and the day and activities flowed well, there was no hanging around waiting. We both said our Lamb tagine was the best we had whilst in Morocco!! A great day out and would definitely recommend this for anyone who wants to learn about Moroccan cookery. Thanks Michel!

Wonderful. It is very easy for me to see why the cooking class at Faim d'Epices is rated #1 on TripAdvisor. The location where the class took place was lovely and they picked me up and dropped me off which made transportation very easy. The staff was so kind and helpful, and it was a pleasure to spend the day with them. I learned how to cook fish tagine, Moroccan bread, three types of Morrocan salad, and Moroccan crepes. At the end of the day, we had a lovely sit down meal to enjoy what we cooked. I hope to apply the cooking skills I learned back in the States and am very grateful to Michel for his hospitality.

What a great way to spend a day in Marrakech!. Spent my 1st full day in Marrakech attending the cooking school.Everything was made easy by the staff. Picking me up at my Riad,stress-free day at the school (no rush, no hurry, just relaxing).I would recommend this fun day for couples or singles~and even families.Thank-you Michele.

Fun day for all. Myself and my family attended the one day cookery course and we had such a fantastic time. The transport to and from the course was seamless, the staff were really friendly and good fun. The cookery lessons were really fantastic and suited to all abilities and most ages. We learnt a lot but at the same time had really good fun, particularly eating all our food at the end! We would strongly recommend doing this class whilst on your holidays.

One of the highlights of our holiday. We had a fantastic time. They have managed to get the participation element just right.The people were great and lots of fun.We were picked up from our hotel and safely returned again at the end of the day, loved it.Do recommend you give this a try.LOR

Great family activity.. I attended the cooking course with my entire family of six. We had a great day and the children really had a lot of fun making their own tagine and then eating.It was great that we were picked up from our hotel and the service was super.The class was at just the right pace and the teacher was clearly passionate about cooking.All in all well worth doing.

Marrekech Cooking Day. My best friend and I did this whilst our husbands played golf. We thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience, especially eating what we cooked at the end with a nice glass of complimentary wine. Our teacher was fantastic, and Michel made our day fun and memorable. We made cous cous from scratch with a lovely beef and vegetable stew. We also learned to make Moroccan Style crepes and their bread, and Moroccan salads. We also spent time smelling and learning about spices of which we were given a complimentary tube of 27 mixed spices at the end which was a lovely touch. There was a little shop inside the building which we loved and bought a lovely cooking dish, some candles and lovely fresh olives from their garden. A very enjoyable day and would highly recommend giving this trip a go.

Most fun in Marrakech. My boyfriend and I took this cooking class together and it was fantastic. We had a lovely time meeting other people in the group, chatting, learning new recipes and cooking new foods. I love to cook and to eat so really what could be better?! Michel, the host, is really lovely and great at running the course and keeping a fun atmosphere throughout the day. The cook who did the demonstration (whose name I can't quite remember) was lovely and a great instructor. We made absolutely delicious dishes (salads, fresh bread, a tagine, etc.) and ate it all at the end. We went home very happy. Highly recommended.

You learn, you have fun, you eat, you have fun - fantastic day out!. From the moment Michel picked us up outside the post office in the main square we were entertained, informed and welcomed. Once we arrived at the farm it got even better - great fun, nice people, delicious food (even better as you make it yourself) and delightful setting.You learn about spices, cooking techniques, gets lots of help and have lots of fun.We loved every aspect of our day out and in the 4 days we had in Marrakech this was by a long way the best experience we had. Could not recommend more highly - just do it!!!!!

If you do nothing else do this!. Wow. A fantastic day. Michel and the staff were so friendly, welcoming and knowledgeable. The setting is lovely and peaceful too. The tuition was set at just the right level and they made sure as a vegetarian I was looked after well. Also a great opportunity to meet and chat with travellers from all over the world. Sitting down to enjoy the fruits of our labour at the end finished the day off brilliantly. You have got to try this!

Fabulous day out!. We very much enjoyed our family day cooking lesson and spicemaster class!Our pick up was on time from the raid, and we were driven to the Faim D' Epices and met Michel where we firstly enjoyed a glass of mint tea then relaxed into the day. This was our favourite day of the week, and a must if you are in Marrakech. The tanngine we cooked was the best of the whole holiday, thanks to Nisha who was our teacher for the day. The cooking course itself covered how to make Moroccan Bread, Lamb Tajine(depends on which day) and we were also shown how to make different Salads and pan cakes (which are yum!). Everything was explained very well throughout and we were well looked after all day with drinks, nibbles etc. So if you want a day full of humour, fun, drum's, (added bonus!) great hospitality and fantastic food then this day is for you! Great value for money!

Great day, great food. My husband and I had such a great day on this course. We were picked up near our riad by Michele who was amazing. Super guy- very knowledgeable about anything we asked him about. The food we cooked was amazing- probably one of the better tajines we ate on our trip to Morocco. I think you'd be happy with any of the menus though. The cooking is not challenging,. and Nezha, the cook, walks you through each step, so no worries if you don't actually know what you're doing. In the class you learn how to make your own bread, by demonstration, then go at it on your own. Pretty cool process and it's interesting to see that they cook the bread on the stove top rather than in the oven (easy to do back home!). You then learn about local spices- this was very informative. I cook quite a lot at home and thought I would know every one, but once you are blindfolded it's amazing to see just how little you know ;) Michele spoke at length about each spice- we learnt a lot about saffron and argon which was very interesting. I didn't know much about either of these items and was happy to have been educated. You then watch a demonstration on how to make salads. I would have preferred to do this on my own...or in small groups. I am very hands on and the cooking was not at all challenging, so it would have been nice to try my hand at another dish. This is an excellent company to go with- I was very happy with my decision. Great communication via email as well.I cannot wait to try the recipes on myown at home. If they turn out half as good I'll be delighted. One recommendation- it would be fun to do a small amount of time in a local market. I can see the logistical issues with this, but it is still fun to have a guide walk you through how the locals shop.

Really enjoyable day. This was a really great start to our holiday, useful market tips and some really good food to give us a good measure of the food we went on to have. The staff are all great and communication was prompt via e-mail (only method I used).

FANTASTIC.. we had a really wonderful day with Michele. picked us up on time, took us to his location, which is surrounded by plants and trees. the location was nice and cool, a welcome respite in marakech in july. Nezha, the cook, was patient and sweet, a super-human feat since it was ramadan and we were all eating and drinking around her. we learned a lot about spices, argan oil, saffron, etc, and we made bread, tajine, and crepes. my tajine came out great! michele was a funny and gracious host and played a mean bongo. we thoroughly enjoyed the cooking class, and the spa treatment which followed; my massage was so nice, i actually fell asleep halfway through! all in all, a great day with michele & co. i booked it as a surprise for my partner and he loved it, too.

Excellent Experience. What a great day!!! The driver arrived promptly at the Hotel to pick us up. This was my first cooking class and I was not sure what to expect. But Michel and his wonderful staff made us feel so at home. It was such a friendly, fun and stressless experience, that this will not be my last cooking class. I choice to started with the Marrakech traditional drink, Mint Tea, just love that tea. While sipping, we all chatted and got to know each other. Michel then introduced us, through a fun blind sniff test, to the Moroccan spices and blends that we would use to cook. I failed miserably but learnt a lot. Then we moved on to our individual cooking stations all prepped and ready to go. We observed how to blend, punch and pull the flour to make the bread and then it was our turn. Making the bread was just hilarious, watching each other punching and pulling the dough was comical. Step by step we all prepared our Tagines, some did chicken and others fish. While they were cooking, we learnt how to make the side dishes that would compliment our finished Tagines. We followed Michel to his private farm at the back and enjoyed a cold drink and the cool breeze. When we returned, the table was set and awaiting our finished Tagines. I must say, we all did a great job, they looked and smelt amazing and tasted delicious. Thank you Michel and staff for a wonderful Marrakech experience, as promised, we will take another class when we return.

Relaxed, fun, and delicious!. I'm not much of a cook at home but love experiencing other cultures and cuisines and after all the great recommendations on TripAdvisor I thought, why not immerse myself in it for a day? I'm travelling by myself and was picked up from my riad in an air-conditioned people mover where I met the other people joining the cooking class that day. We were a mix of Australian, American, Canadian and Mexican. Michel greeted us and was our host for the day. He's really funny and a joy to listen to and have a laugh with. Nehza was an amazing teacher. We learnt to make Moroccan bread, salads, tagine, and crepes. All at a leisurely pace so it was a cool, relaxing, and productive day. And my tagine was delicious! Despite my lack of cooking skills. I didn't even need dinner that night I was so full afterwards. The reviews are all correct, definitely give this experience a go. You won't be disappointed. I can't wait to go home and try to recreate it for my family and friends!

Fun, chilled out day. This was a fun, enjoyable experience with a knowledgeable team and very friendly group. It was a well thought out day which we thoroughly enjoyed and we loved eating our delicious food.I booked it last minute when I arrived in Marrkech and Michel's comms were great, so it was easy and stress free.

Highlight of our Morocco experience. The cooking class at Faim d'Epices was a highlight of our Morocco experience. Michel was incredibly awesome and welcoming. We strongly recommend the class to anyone visiting Marrakech!

The day when we become junior Moroccan chefs. My husband an I were coming to Marrakesh for our first wedding anniversary and wanted to do something different that the standard 'touristy' attractions. We found this cooking workshop and decided to go for it. From the time of booking, we felt that we will have a great day with Michel and Nezha. We were picked up from the agreed location in Medina by a signed transfer car and we knew we are in safe hands (a photo was provided what car will pick us up). We were driven outside of Marrakesh to the beautiful farm where we were very welcomed by Michel.A workshop was well thought through and very well delivered. It wasn't too long or too short, but just perfect timing. We learned how to make authentic Moroccan bread, crepes and beautiful salad. The main dish of the day was 7 Vegetable couscous. We chose this day in particular because my husband never enjoyed having couscous for lunch/dinner at home and we felt that after this course he might change his mind. And so he did. He said that this was the best dish he had in Marrakesh for the duration of our stay. We also enjoyed spices workshop (we were not very good at it but had lots of fun guessing). Michel was amazing at explaining the difference between the real 'thing' and fake. We also bought some argan oil and saffron from the trustworthy source - their in-house shop for very generous price. At the end of the workshop we were provided with all the recipes and a little present - their own unique combination of spices. I must say that i have cooked some beef at home and used the seasoning - it is amazing! I would highly recommend to visit Michel and Nezha and learn all they have to give and take it away and use it. You will not be disappointed. Have fun!Neringa

A fun foody day. I came across this cooking course with the help of Trip Advisor. I was not disappointed and loved the humour, knowledge and culinary skills that were bestowed upon me. I had fabulous people in my group and there were many laughs. Michel, the owner is a hoot and the ultimate Spicemaster. All the other staff were welcoming and very helpful. My food was delicious and I cooked it!

Brilliant and highly recommended. We learned a great deal: how to cook several dishes, but also lots about Moroccan cuisine, and about the country's life and culture in general. More than that though, this was just great fun from beginning to end. It did not feel like being at school... I must make particular mention of Michel - the host - who achieved the perfect balance of being supremely professional and highly entertaining at the same time. I have rarely enjoyed an event like this so much and it was a bargain to boot. Don't hesitate!

Amazing day!. My wife and I discovered L'atelier Faim d'Epices through a review of the Mythic Oriental Spa and decided to join the package cooking and spa day. It was wonderful, to say the least! Michel and Nezha split the class into small, very easy to absorb sections. There is an incredibly fun spice lesson where we get the opportunity to practice identification with nose only. Demonstrations are given by Nezha, who makes everything look extremely easy, but also will help you out when it is your turn! At the end of the day, you have learned some knowledge of preparing a full Moroccan meal. If you need a break from the hustle and bustle of the medina, this is a PERFECT excursion!

Fanastic day out!. I was travelling on my own in Morocco and was recommended to do this cooking class by a friend. Booking in and organising a pick up is easy. All the staff are friendly and knowledgeable not just about Moroccan food, but also other aspects of culture. On the day I went, I learnt to cook a beef tagine with pears and candied oranges. We also learnt about breads, salads and spices. It is great fun and the environment is so calm and comfortable that the whole group was chatting and sharing their stories of their travels thus far in Morocco.

Experience Not to be Missed. After seeing the reviews on Trip Advisor, I decided to book a day at Faim D'epices with my friend. The whole experience was really relaxing, and thoroughly enjoyable. You do not need to be an expert cook or come to think of that a cook at all. You just need to be in the mood for a good time and be able to stomach the food you cook...as that will be your lunch! Michel picked us up from the hotel and it set the scene for the rest of the day. He was chatty, full of lots of facts and very friendly. We earnt about spices, cooked breads, parathas, a fish tagine, salads and learnt an easy way to chop onions! I would thoroughly recommend this as a great day to break up your holiday and its good value for the price you pay.

Great Day. We had a great day and enjoyed making fish tangine. The day is broken up into units and passes quickly learning several different recipes. All the recipes are provided at the end so you dont have to remember it all. The facility is clean and a nice break from Marrakesh.

Best part of our trip to Marrakech. Following the rave reviews on Trip advisor, my friend and I decided to book ourselves into the one day course at the beginning of our 4 night stay in Marrakech and it was for me the highlight of our trip. Michel came to collect us from our hotel and took us out of the city to this little oasis. Where we not only learnt how to cook wonderful food, and eat it afterwards on the terrace but we had a wonderful spice smelling session using blacked out Ray Bans!! Great and very entertaining way to learn a lot about Morrocan life. On top of that though Michel and his lovely wife gave us lots of great advice and tips of where to eat and where to avoid in the city and we had our best fish supper on the main square thanks to them. We came away feeling really prepared to hit the souks the following day and were so grateful for all their help. We were also given the recipes to take away afterwards and I have made the tagine and aubergine salad a couple of times since with rave reviews this end from family and friends. This really is the best day trip and well worth every penny!! Thanks so much to you Michel and your fabulous team!! We will be back!!

Fantastic!. If you book this cooking course you will not be disappointed! We had a fantastic day with Michel and Nisha at Faim d'Epices, we made a lovely chicken tagine which tasted amazing and got a valuable lesson on spices. The atmosphere was friendly and relaxed. Couldn't have asked for more.

#TopExperience. My Fiancee and I booked the combination deal with Faim d'Epices + Mythic spa this as it had both of the main things that we wanted to do while we were in Morocco. We called and e-mailed Michel and he was very prompt with his responses and ensured that we were completely aware of the proceedings for the day. On the day we were collected on time near our Riad in a clearly marked Van which was good and gave us a good peace of mind. We then picked up a other couples and made our way to the farm, There we were greeted by Michel(owner) and Neezha(cooking instructor) and treated to a mint tea. The cooking course itself covered how to make Moroccan Bread, Lamb Tajine(depends on which day) and we were also shown how to make different Salads. It was explained very well throughout and we were well looked after. We had also the opportunity to eat what we had prepared and later were driven to the Spa. The Spa was a perfect way to finish an overall amazing Day where we learned a lot of things and were made to feel very welcome by Michel.

I still think about this experience..... My boyfriend booked the combination deal (Faim d'Epices + Mythic spa) for me as a surprise birthday present while we were in Marrakech and I'm glad he did! Michel responded very promptly to our email enquiries and Nezha was a very warm, attentive and helpful chef. We definitely learnt a lot from this cooking experience.We would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Marrakech, especially if you are interested in learning about authentic Moroccan cuisine. The team even email you more recipes and a lovely certificate when you get home too - it is ranked number 1 for a reason!

A must-do in Marrakech!!. After seeing all the fabulous reviews on Trip Advisor, I decided to book a day at Faim D'epices. We loved it! The place was very clean, comfortable, lovely company, fresh ingredients, great instruction and a delicious meal. My husband was less than keen to go - unsure of what to expect but LOVED it and still brags about how delicious his tagine was. A great day away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech and hands down one of the best parts of our week long Moroccan adventure!

Nothing can beat this... Booked this after stumbling on it on Trip Advisor prior to our trip to Marrakech, so glad I did! From the first communications with Michel to the handshake at the end of our amazing day with them the whole experience was an absolute pleasure and delight! Arriving after a short trip where we were picked up from our Riad we arrived at the farm and were welcomed by Michel himself, he quickly broke the ice with everyone, explained the course of the day and had us laughing from when we stepped in the door, he has a heart of gold, such a fantastic sense of humour and his musical talent is second to none! (as you will experience when you visit!!) Alongside being very fun and relaxing it is also a cultural learning experience. The dishes you learn to make are all very well explained and demonstrated, varying degrees of difficulty depend on which day you visit, we made a fish tagine as well as breads, marinades, pancakes.. Just a wonderful day filled with so many memories! Thank you to Michel and the team, the food was delicious, the atmosphere amazing and the people were the icing on the cake It truly is worth every single penny! Don't pass on the opportunity to experience this!! Book it now!!

My Fav Experience in Marrakech. I'm not sure I can add more detail than what has already been shared by other excellent ratings, but the overall experience was a wonderful change of pace to busy Marrakech. Michel is a wonderful host and although I am an avid recreational chef, I learned quite a bit of technique and information on ingredients and Morrocon cooking. The meal was wonderful (although way too much for one person to eat) and the day was relaxing. My advice would be to schedule this in the middle of your Marrakech stay as a wonderful retreat. I wish my family was travelling with me as they would have loved it.

Best day of the holiday. After the hustle and bustle of the souk's and the medina this was a welcome respite.We were picked up promptly from our hotel and driven to the olive farm where we were warmly welcomed by our host's. The whole day was fantastic the demonstrations, the spice workshop (loved the purple raybans) the hands on cooking and of course the eating. The tagine was amazing and I hope I'm able to recreate it back at home. Thank you for your hospitality and the photos you sent, a memory of a great day. If you only do one thing in Marrakech do this, you'll love it, even if you're not a good cook you'll make an amazing meal, get to meet great people and eat the fruits of your labour in a fab setting.Frankie and Richard Thomas - Wales

Amazing Experience!. My husband & I visited Marrakech for the first time & joined this cooking workshop becuase of the reviews @ Trip Advisor. The experience is truly amazing. Michel and the teacher is very helpful and approachable. In the few hours, just very relaxing, a lot of fun and you learn a few dishes that certainly can be done at home.This class is highly recommended!

My favourite memory of Morroco!. I learnt to make a Beef, Pear and Candied Orange Tagine (as well as everything to go with it!) at Faim D'Epices - went with a friend and we really enjoyed the day - learnt a lot about Morroco as well as some delicious dishes, as well as all about the spice palette, meaning I can explore other dishes with confidence!A wonderful break from the constant negotiations, hustle and bustle of the city centre - this was a wonderful day- thank you very much to Michel and Nisha for teaching us such wonderful recipes! And thank you for welcoming us and having a lovely relaxing day!

Great fun and top value. If you fancy a day out of the city, you can't do much better than this. Michel, the hardened cynical Frenchman with a heart (and smile) of gold is a charming and informative host, giving good advice, useful tips and keeping everyone entertained in between the main event - cooking. The bread and tagine making was fun, challenging but easy enough for anyone to do. You are closely guided through every stage by the Moroccan chef (whose name sadly escapes me), making sure even the worst cooks don't spoil their meals. A great day out, chilled, interesting and fun, and all for 50 euros per person.Merci Michel et l'equipe!

Fun, interesting and relaxing day.. Such a great day out of hectic medina. Delicious food, the best we had all trip! Michel is very personable and knowledgable and clearly has a love for teaching. Would highly recommend the combination spa package afterwards. Everything is organized for you and all in all it's a wonderful day.

Excellent!. I visited Marrakech for the first time last week and was excited to find out about the cuisine. Michel is a great host and his facility was very well presented. The chefs were obviously very knowledgeable in the art of Moroccan cooking and provided very informative and interesting coaching. We made the local bread, salads and a tagine as well as pancakes for dessert. We got to have a go at all the 'fun' bits whilst being spared the chopping of vegetables and washing up! The food was delicious!! Would definitely recommend this and thought it was good value.We got the package including the spa visit and was also delighted at the spa that we went to as part of the deal!Thanks Michael!

Unmissable - a great experience, great value and great fun. Simply outstanding. Michel is a charming and witty host (in spite of his nationality) and the whole experience was delivered with seemingly effortless style and enthusiasm. All students were attended to with care and attention and we all mingled and exchanged stories and comments about eachother's efforts! Our chef instructor was incredibly patient, competent and above all friendly and smiley throughout. The actual cooking and spice tests and tips were pitched at just the right level, the food we made was delicious and enjoyed with a glass of wine in the sunny garden patio. We took advantage of the special offer to combine a visit to the Hammam - this was of equal quality, style and luxury. Thank you, Michel and the team - c'était formidable!

A Must do! Cooking and Spa day package1. My girlfriend and i went to this through a reccomendation and i'm glad we took them up on it! From start to finish everything was taken care off. Starting from being collected where you can agree a mutual meeting place for the logo'd van to pick you up. Then arriving at site and being greeted by no other than Michel! The host! He makes you feel welcome and very relaxed as soon as you walk in given that you're in a country where its not really something that you can do when out and about in the city centre of Marrakech!You will learn how to cook bread, salads and of course a tagine (which course depends on which day you go) of which then you eat at the end of the day. You will learn about all different spices. Also you recieve the recipe of the meal you cooked that day.Just generally a great day of fun.In addition if you go onto the Faim d'Epices website and talk to Michel direct you can also have a relaxing spa straight after of which you are dirven to when finished eating. The spa is amazing and within walking distance of the Medina.All in all a great day. Cheers Michel and thanks for the photo's! I shall be reccomending you!

Michel, un tour de force. What a wonderfully extensive cooking class to take, from the traditional bread, various salads, a beautiful and delicious beef, pear, and candied orange tajine, and finally the delicious traditional crepes. Most of all I enjoyed the lesson on local spices. It was a pleasure to meet the main man Michel and visit him outside of the city for a little get away to experience something different of Morocco. Very accommodating, very charming man. You will have no regrets signing up with this company, highly recommended.

Must do in Marrakech. We have booked the cooking course together with the spa treatments at the Mythic Oriental Spa and we were thrilled by the whole package!Michel and his colleague picked us up punctually at our Riad and entertained us during the whole drive to the cooking atelier. There, we first had to admire this charming place which is so different from the hectic Marrakech that we had known so far. The atelier itself makes you instantly feel at home.After the traditional welcome tea we were introduced to the Moroccan kitchen and started our cooking adventure afterwards. The whole program is varied and includes a lot of fun. We were spoilt by Michel and his team during the whole time and the time was running very fast. Finally, we were all surprised by our cooking skills: the menu did not only look good, it also tasted fantastically!

Wonderful. We were a group of 10 students from Switzerland and did a cookery course at Faim d'Epices, it was a wonderful experience with wonderful food. They showed how to cook a complete Moroccan meal and at the end we enjoyed lunch in the middle of olive trees. Michel, one of the owner, is a wonderful person which gave us an insight in the Moroccan dishes. Since we asked him for some further information, he was very happy to talk about his business. As a client you feel that he's doing everything with a lot of passion. Also our cook teacher was amazing, she showed us patiently how to prepare Moroccan food. I totally recommend it to everyone who wants to enjoy real Moroccan food in a very pleasant environment. By the way, at the end of the course you get all the recipes, so that you can cook the dishes also at home :-)

Great day with great people.... This is a great day out. We were picked up bang on time, just yards from our riad. The school is about 35-40mins out of Marrakech, in a peaceful olive farm area. The school is well presented and everything is well thought through. Michel and his team were great fun and great company. Teas, coffees, water flowed all day.
