The cookery was great, flat breads and chicken tagine, perfect for a late lunch. The pace of the day was perfect for us, interesting and the spice blind testing was a real eye opener! Well worth the £40 ish pounds per person.

After all that sun, this is the perfect, fun activity to wind down with.. The day consisted of a fun and entertaining structure, charming and informative host and the most delicious recipes. All set in a gem of hide away, way off the beaten track. Very smooth in terms of transport, communication and important small touches that gives this package the edge.

The best way to spend a day while on holiday. Thank you so much to Michel and Nezha (and team) for making this such an amazing day. I booked the special offer with the oriental mythical spa, and am so glad we did. This was the best way to spend a day on holiday. Picked up from our riad my friendly and polite staff. Warmly welcomed by Michel and Nezha. A very informative day, with lots of experiences including the challenging spice test. The course was a relaxed and fun environment and we were given support at all stages. The kitchen was set in a beautiful farm environment which made for a peaceful and tranquil day. We enjoyed the fruit of our labor in the sun with a lovely group of people. The day was filled with brilliant experiences and we left feeling like we had learned so much. Excellent value for money and a must for anybody considering visiting Marrakech!

Fun day trip while in Marrakech. We had a group of 4 (2 couples) take this class while in Marrakech. The all around experience was wonderful! The dishes were simple enough for us to 'master' but delicious enough for us to want to make them again. Michele was a wonderful host and the instructor was lovely and very personable. The intro to spices was my favorite portion of the class. We learned all kinds of tips and tricks to know if what you buy in the souks is real. Take home a bottle of the olive oil if you can! SO amazing!Thanks, Faim d'Epices for a wonderful day in Marrakech!

Great cooking class, great people!. We enjoyed very much the day with Michel and Nezha and team. Great experience from the beginning to the end, everything is well thought through. We liked very much the introduction with the blind testing of moroccan spices, as well as the complete menu we learned that day - moroccan bread, selection of salads, the main dish: Tajine of Lamb and Prunes and at the end a local version of crêpes. The atmosphere was good, Michel and team always made the guests feel comfortable with Tee, Coffee, some musical Interlude and so on. It was definitely one of the highlights of our trip in Marrakech.

A must-have for all cooking-addicts. Thank you very much for this great experience to Michel and Nezha, it was one of our highlights during our stay at Marrakesh! As we are both very fond of cooking, it was very important to have a cooking course in Morocco, and it was so great (although I usually don't like group events - it was great because you got to talk to the other people)!Michel added a great touch of humour to the course, and since Nezha showed us how to make bread, my fiancé wants to make his own bread at home! The Spices Workshop was great (except the fermented butter - *YUK*), and we made a lovely Tajine with chicken, red olives (I left out the olives as I don't like them) and preserved lemons (which we have at home as we already read about Moroccan kitchen)!Thank you very much for that wonderful experience!
GREAT!!. Best price for the best day. HIGHLY recommend. Michel is easy to get on with and the day is informative and fun.......Just go and have a great day......stop reading and book it!!!

great day out with a lot laughs and learning. Well I got the email asking to the write the review on Michel's cooking school and by the looks of it, it has all been said before. So all I can say is I concur with everyone else comments.From our experience, the pick up/drop off is very well organised and makes it all that much easier when you are staying in the Medina.The whole day was just a lot of fun but in the end it was Michel's sense of humour, bongo drums, his lovely wife and his staff's professionalism that makes the day. Every one laughs a lot whilst they also learn a lot and there is not much that than.My partner and I were both suffering the after effects of the previous night's Moroccan hospitality and Michel et al were all very helpful with that to.This a fun day out and you leave feeling that you have had a great time.Gary and Meg

WOW!. The day we spent here was the highlight of our trip to Marrakech. The place where the class is held is very big and light, airy, immaculately clean and relaxed but organized to a T. The first thing on arrival is a welcome drink, which gave us time to break the ice and meet our fellow food aficionados. Next came a demonstration on making Moroccan flat bread by the accomplished Nezha. Afterward we had our blind smelling session guided by Michel, who is very laid back but conveys intense passion for the spices and their uses. Then we got to the hands-on part, donnig aprons and making our own bread and starting on our tagines. The work stations were very comfortable and all the utensils and ingredients were set out, making it easy to follow Nezha's instructions. Both she and Michel came round to check how we were doing and give advice where needed. After that we had a demonstration on how to make salads, followed by last additions to the tagines and baking the bread. My husband, who NEVER goes into the kitchen managed very well (had I known sooner...) and we ate the bread he made for lunch, with our tagines, out on the porch overlooking the olive trees, with a lovely glass of wine and conversation. Just a lovely, lovely day, far from the overcrowded, frantic city.Thanks to Michel, his lovely wife Ilam, Nezha and all the staff. Some day I hope to go and learn another dish (or maybe I'll just send my husband, hmm!).

A great day to remember Marrakech. We booked a cookery day at Faim d'Epices from viewing all the great reviews on this site and we were definitely not disappointed at all! Pick up from the hotel was well organised and comfortable and less than half an hour from central Marrakech to Faim d'Epices. On arrival to the place, Michel the owner of the cookery school greeted us on arrival with great wit and humour along with apple tea or coffee. The humour continued throughout the day with his spice activity and playing on the bongo drums! Nezha is the expertise behind the culinary experience and provided a great session on how to make bread, lamb tagine, moroccan salads and Msemmen. Throughout each session we were provided with refreshments and looked after. The purpose built cookery school is perfectly situated with olive trees and a terrace for eating the Moroccan food you prepare and cook throughout the day. This is a great and memorable experience for understanding the cuisine and excellent value! You are provided with the recipe and tips for re-creating when back home! You also have the opportunity to buy the spices used and various other gifts at a great and reliable price. After spending a week in Marrakech this was by far the best day and would certainly recommend if you need to escape the hustle and bustle of the tourist areas. The reviews for this experience are accurate and definitely deserves to be the number one activity for Marrakech!

Only regret, wish I could attend more classes. Upon the reccomendation of Lisa from our fabulous riad, Dar Charkia we did a day cooking class with L'atelier Faim d'Epices. It was informative, fun and delicious. Michel was a terrific host who is both passionate about spices and his olive trees. I wish we would of had more time to attend more classes I would of loved to take a couscous class. Next time!!PS: the spices I purchased at L'atelier Faim d'Epices are far superior to those I purchased in the souk.

What a nice surprise !. What a nice surprise, great cooking experience !Perfect service, we got picked up from our Riad and brought back!Michel was the perfect host, very witty and one could feel his passion for his olives trees!(I did buy a bottle of olive oil, and it is prime quality!) It was really special day and Michael even played drums while we were cooking!It was funny, interesting a great way to learn about Marroko culture !Also Nezha was a highlight perfect team with Michael!She was a very good teacher, showed us simple tricks and truly welcoming person.Last but not least I specially liked the spice test and all the secrets tips!so 5 thumbs up ! it is for sure worth it!!

Learn to cook authentic Moroccan cuisine. I booked a day at L'atelier Faim d'Epices based on previous TripAdvisor reviews, and am pleased to report another 5* review for Michel and his team. We thoroughly enjoyed our introduction to Moroccan cookery. We were picked up from the medina and driven to the farm on the outskirts. We were welcomed with delicious mint tea before going on to learn how to make a tajine, salad and traditional bread and dining together to sample our efforts. Michel and Nehza are professional, courteous and charismatic and above all know their stuff. The day was perfectly paces and ll our needs catered to including fresh orange juice during the heat of the day. We had loads of fun and would recommend it to anyone wanting to learn the basics on Moroccan ingredients and recipe preparation. Great value for money and h

Great day out. Faim D'Epices cookery course - great day out from the madness of Marrakech. We done the course as part of the spa experience ran in conjunction with Mythic Oriental Spa. Michel the owner of the cookery school picked us up in town and drove us to the school approx 30 mins out of town. We spent the day in the purpose designed school with 7 others and all had our own cookers and equipment. We were given bread making lesson and spice awareness course before making Moroccan bread and lamb tagine. Mezah the chef was great as was Michel banging on his bongos and creating a great atmosphere. At the end o day we ate the food in his garden before getting dropped off in town or in our case at the spa. Very enjoyable day and good value if booked as part of the spa package.

Funny. I was with my friend to Maroc for a trip of a week. We really love to eat the special foods of every country, so we thought to make a cook class in Marrakesh. This experience was really funny, we learned to cook some special foods, like cous cous, tagin or special salads. I suggest this experience to everyone wants to know the local culinary tradicions.

Probably our best day in Morocco. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our class at Faim d;Espices. Michael is very entertaining as well as an excellent chef. He picked us up at our hotel at exactly 9:50 as promised and drove us to the farm. We met an enjoyable mixture of couples from France, Germany, Ireland and Chile. The school was spotless and well prepared for us and somewhat unique ( how many cooking schools have a jukebox?) The blind spice testing was quite a learning experience. We were entertained by Michael's drumming to the music as we pulled and "boxed" the dough for our bread. We made a great traditional chicken tanjine and three different salads. We enjoyed the fruits of our labor at the end of the day and were taken back to our hotel at 5:00. I would recommend this course to anyone interested in an easy introduction to traditional Moroccan cooking. An appreciation of wine wouldn't hurt either.

Fantastic day of food. This was my first trip to Morocco and our visit to Faim d'Espices was definitely one of the highlights! Michel picked us up from our Villa on the other side of Marrakech and drove us to the farm which made a lovely change to the hustle and bustle of the medina. The spice test was fascinating and Michel's tips for spotting fake herbs and oils very useful. Under Nezah's clear instruction we somehow produced delicious tajines, breads salads and crepes which we enjoyed with a glass of wine outside. After the course Michel dropped us at the Mystic Spa for our Hamman and massage. This was the perfect follow up to our meal and after massages ee were lead up to the rood with a pot of mint tea and baklava - heaven!I can not recommended this experience highly enough; thank you Michel and team - we will be back again on Cous cous day :)

The best introduction to Morocco.. This was our first trip to Morocco and I am so glad we booked this on the first day. It was a great introduction to Marrakech and Morocco and it was a great way to ease into the hustle and bustle of the city. Michel was a wonderful host and the entire day was beautifully coordinated. The group of people the day we went were not all English speaking. That did not matter though, the day was flawless and I was very impressed at how Michel and Nezha both were able to explain everything to all of us in both English and French without missing a beat. I really enjoyed the spice lesson and I have already made one of the salads at home. Michel is passionate about his work and it shows in everything from the interior decorating down to the recipe card that you receive when you leave.It was a great way to spend a day and I would recommend this to anyone traveling to Marrakech.

A brilliant day!. I have no hesitation in recommending Faim d'Epices. We thoroughly enjoyed the day which was interesting and entertaining. Michel, the proprietor, is one of life's characters and he ensures that the programme keeps everyone engaged throughout. Instruction is good and everyone spoke excellent English, with idiom.The day is very good value; the price included collection from our hotel, the course, snacks and drinks, and, of course, a late leisurely lunch with the food we had cooked and a glass of wine. We booked through the tripadvisor guide (get your guide) this worked well but I'm convinced that we would have got a better price if we had booked direct with Michel by e-mail.A great alternative to the hustle and bustle of Marrakech.

Fun, informative and not to be missed!. Fantastic experience and a very warm welcome from Michel, Nezha and the team! My boyfriend and I booked this while we were in Marrakech. The booking was really easy and we were promised fun, which is definitely what we got. I’d recommend doing this day before you hit the souks. During the spice test (wicked fun) Michel showed and told us how to spot flake Argan oil and Saffron as well as the prices you should be paying. I did a cookery course at La Maison Arabe (also a fantastic day) last time I was in Marrakech which included a market and spice shop tour. I definitely learned more about the spices and how they were used at L'atelier Faim d'Epices and didn’t have the shop sales pitch at the end. If you’re in the souks you’ll see the meat and vegetable markets anyway, so you’re not missing out. Getting out of the hustle and bustle of the city to the farm is a great bonus!We made bread, Moroccan crepes and a delicious beef artichoke and pea tagine – great and very memorable tips from Nezha with music and drumming from Michel while we cooked. I’d recommend that you have a good breakfast before you go. We sat down to eat our lunch mid afternoon – we had plenty of snacks on the way, but you definitely eat after normal lunchtime. Expected the unexpected and lots of fun. Michel’s purpose with the business seems to be ensuring you have a fun and enjoyable day and learning experience – he certainly delivers. Customer service before, during and after the day is second to none. We felt like we were leaving friends by the end of the day and would definitely go back.

cookery and hammam. Great fun day, lesson on spices and then learnt to cook bread plus lamb and prune tagine. Lovely venue and Michel is great fun - but a bit eccentric! Then dropped off at Mystic Oriental Spa for hammam. Best massage we have ever had. Gorgeous interior tucked away behind a little door down an alleyway in the medina. The staff were really lovely. Fantastic value for money.

Fun, relaxing and DELICIOUS!. My boyfriend and I recently did a class at L'atelier Faim d'Epices just outside Marrakech. Our experience was nothing but delightful from start to finish. They picked us up right where we were staying and drove us to the farm which was so peaceful and beautiful. The cooking class itself was the perfect mixture of learning and relaxation. Nezha (the instructing cook) was brilliant. She was very clear in her explanations and patient with the class. Above all, the food was AMAZING!!! We even had a nice glass of wine while we dined on the patio. I would highly recommend this course to anyone who loves cooking and good food!

An alternative tourist attraction not to be missed!. A truly fabulous day! It was fun from the moment we arrived! A lovely warm welcome from Michel and his staff - Michel is entertaining to say the least! Booking arrangements were very straight forward and our transport to and from the venue was included in the price. This one day course is suitable for those interested in cooking at all levels. The day we took part, Michel was translating everything fluently into three languages - jokes included! A friend had previously attended this course - their recommendation was spot on!Since returning home, I have attempted everything demonstrated on the day successfully. I was so motivated that I went straight to the supermarket to buy the necessary ingredients before attending to my unpacking! The lesson on spices was fascinating and has encouraged me to use more in my cooking. The tip on how to chop an onion at top speed is a skill which will stay with me for life! There isn't much time to fit anything else into the day however we took advantage of the Cooking/Spa deal on offer - an equally good move as I had one of the best massages ever!It was a lovely surprise to receive a follow up email from Michel once we came back with a photograph, certificate and even more recipes. A really nice touch! This business venture has been cleverly thought through!Would I repeat the day on my next trip to Marrakech? Definitely!

Wonderful experience. 4 of us went to this as part of a day package with the Mystic Spa in the afternoon. We all enjoyed cooking the tagine and the bread - Michel was a great host and Nezah was an excellent teacher.We had mint tea to greet us and a 'spices smell test' - which was fun. We had some demos of various Moroccan salads and we were taught in a step by step manner - how to make our tagines and bread. It was a great day of activity and we were sent home with a recipe so we can recreate the tagine at home. The purpose built buildings were immaculately clean, bright and airy. The minibus picked us up at a designated place near our riad and later dropped us off at the spa. I would highly recommend this cookery course.

Excellent activity and extremely good value for money. My boyfriend and I attended this class last week and it was fantastic. Really good value for money - you receive an intimate cooking class, shared by only 8 people, cook on your own cooker to make your own tagine, make breads and side dishes and eat your meal that you have cooked in the sun with your fellow cooks. Michel is really generous and gives offerings of spices and additional recipes at the end of the class. Included in the cost is transport to the cooking school (some reviews have said the cooking lesson should start at 9am - who the hell wants to get up so early on their HOLIDAY?? Being picked up at 9.30 and starting the class at 10am suited us just fine). Michel is a real character and starts with a clever spice test and then onto the cooking, which was incredibly enjoyable and delicious. So glad we did this activity.

Great cooking class but long day if you are short on time. My husband and I really enjoyed the cooking class. Booking was easy and unlike a lot of the other cooking schools I contacted, Michel didn't expect you to send credit card information via email to book which seemed a bit safer to me. Michel was a great host and the Moroccan cook was brilliant. I felt that we learned more than I had in previous cooking classes - actually took some skills away rather than just following a recipe so that was really good :) We made the lamb and prune tagine and everything was lovely. We only had 3 days in Marrakech, so it was a bit long to fit in. The class itself is not too long but it's quite a drive and also there is a bit of down time during at the end of the class. We got back not long before 5pm so we were a bit disappointed as we had planned to visit some attractions that closed at 5.30pm. Other than that one small thing though, it was a truly lovely day. Maybe consider booking one of the classes in the medina if you are short on time like us.

DO NOT LEAVE MARRAKECH WITHOUT DOING THIS COURSE. You don't have to be a five star Michelin chef to attend this course but in the same time if you wish to have a lovely day with a friend, your partner, your family or alone it is the best activity that you can do when in Marrakech. This is a lovely family business run by Michel and Nezha. Michel does the easy bit which is making you feel comfortable. As a true Frenchman with excellent English he will ensure that from booking of the course to the departure back to your accommodation you will feel like a King. During my 7 day trip to Morroco, we booked a day with Faim d' Epices. The response was via e-mail and Michel was able to support a slightly different menu due to my girlfriend not keen on lamb. A shuttle was waiting at our hotel ON TIME ( This is a luxury in Morocco) and we were taken to a nice location about 10 minutes outside the city center. Michel and his team was there to welcome us with his team with fresh mint tea and lovely coffee. In our session we had another 8 people from other countries which made the whole experience really nice. The class was very relaxed, we started with the demonstration on how to make Khobz (bread) by Nezha and we then repeated the steps under her supervision in our own private hob. Each hob is shared between two people so everyone gets involved. After Khobz we did a test of our sense of smell. Michel explained the usage of spices in the local cuisine and we had to sample a few and figure out their names while having our eyes shut. A little bit of challenge for few...... In addition to this Michel did give us a lot of tips on how to chose spices when buying them locally as there are lots of scams ( for example fake saffron) in order to capitalise on the hype. After the spices, we did 3 different salads with Nezha using local materials. The main part of the course is how to do a nice tangine and each day there is a different recipe. We all did Lamb except my gf who did beef and one other fellow who did vegetables only. The meat took some time to cook and under the supervision of Nezha we were able to produce a magnificent dish. At the end we all sat down outside in the garden and shared the food. Desserts and coffee followed up.In conclusion, we were given the recipes, a sample of Ras el hanout, a certificate, photos and lots of good memories. As a customer, there is nothing else left to ask. The team put their heart into this business and this is purely reflected by the comments of their clientele and repeated business. My advice do not leave Marrakech without attending their course ! A must do !

Nice foody day. four of us chose this as our first day in Marrakech. Lots of positives - Michel is a bit of a charismatic charmer and it was very well organised and friendly. A lovely relaxed way to spend a day. It IS a whole day though and our only gripes (small ones) were that it could have been a tad slicker - say 9-2pm rather than 9-4. Also the end food dishes that we all made were a little bit overcooked for our tastes - particularly the vegetables. BUT overall a lovely start to our 4 days in Marrakech.Only other word of warning - if you take the spa add on, then get some commitment in advance that you have a definite timeslot - we were kept waiting an hour and ended up walking out. Not Michel's fault, so I haven't marked them down for this, but....

great introduction to Moroccan culture through cuisine and spices. A well organised & slightly eccentric day of cooking demonstations, hands on practice and talks. Michel is a colourful (mostly purple!) extrovert, but speaks very knowledgably about the spices and other ingredients. Nezha was our teacher. She explained clearly and offered help when needed. We visited as a family with 2 teenage children. There was another family there with much younger children. The staff are very clever and deft at talking in both French and English. The nationalities present were Flemmish, Swiss, English, and German so a truely international event! All enjoyed the day very much.

Excellent experience. This cooking class was really a fantastic, hands-on experience. The food we made was lovely, the teachers were exteremly proficent, and the environment was wamr and welcoming. Definitely highly recomended to anyone who enjoys their Moroccan cuisine!

Fun respite from the bustle of Marrakech. Everything unfolded exactly as advertised. The class started with an education on Moroccan spices [including valuable lessons on how to spot fake saffron + Argan oil in the souks] and had a nice balance of demonstrations and hands-on time. As others have noted, Michel and the staff were friendly, helpful and welcoming. I'd recommend this as a day outside the city to anyone-- whether you are a skilled chef or a beginner. Plan to be away until late afternoon. Also, note that you eat your creation later than the normal lunch hour-- so have a filling breakfast and plan on a light supper.

Excellent experience. Whatever some of the bad reviews might say, I think the cooking class the Faim D'Espices was amazing. During my holiday in Marrakech me and my brother decided to go on a cooking class.The class took place on a farm 30 minutes outside of the centre of Marrakech. The organisers arranged to pick us up from close to our Riad. We were welcomed by Michel and his wife. The course started with an introduction and some mint tea.Afterwards Nezha, the chef, took over to demonstrate how to make traditional flatbread. The only ingredients were semolina, white flour, water, yeast and salt. The rest of the magic was boxing and stretching. We all had the opportunity to try and make our own flatbread. First we prepared the dough and then we left it to rise. In the meanwhile we started to prepare the main dish. On our course on Saturday the main dish was the tagine of red olives and preserved olives. I first thought i would not like this combination, however I have to say it was probably the best food I have had in Marrakech. Once the tagine was prepared, we cooked the bread in a frying pan. During the course we watched Nezha on how to make three different styles of moroccan salad. In-between Michel gave us some information about spices. He also filled us in the secret of how to find out if Argan oil or Saffron are fake. Michel was a brilliant host and always tried to make us welcome. He offered us fresh orange juice and nuts during the course. Everything worked perfectly together and it made the course a brilliant experience. At the end of the course Nezha showed us how to do the traditional layer crepes which are always served for breakfast. The grand final of our cooking class was the meal. The tagine and the flat bread turned out to be fantastic. Michel served us some moroccan white wine. As a dessert he served some self-made ice cream with crepes. For everyone who wanted there was a little shop on the premisses. The prices were fair and the products obviously high quality.Me and my brother loved this cooking class and would like to thank the whole team again for this experience. They really tried hard to make this day very special for everyone involved. This class is well organised and is giving a brilliant insight into the moroccan cuisine. Would I go there again? YES! Would I recommend it to my friends? DEFINITELY YES.

Fantastic. Michel is a fantastic guy and this was one of our favourite days in Marrakech.We cooked an excellent Lamb Tagine, learnt all about spices and we've been cooking and impressing friends and family ever since back in the UK.Go here for a great day and don't waste your money on oils or spices at the souks get the real deals here from Michel at really genuine prices. I'm still using his Ras al Hanut 9 months later and it's great.Best wishes Ryan and Jen

Great fun and a real learning experience. The Faim d'epices cooking class comes out at the top of my good memories of Marrakech. My teenage niece and I both enjoy cooking, so it was no surprise that we really had a great time, but there was at least one self-described non-cooker in our class who seemed to enjoy it as much as any of the rest of us. It was all hands-on, we ate what we cooked, and it was delicious, if I do say so myself. Well organized, well-taught, fun atmosphere. For sure, you should do this.

Brilliant. A fantastic morning, very well organised from the pickup in the morning, the morning itself and the small gifts at the end. Our family of 4 including two boys aged 12 and 15 thoroughly enjoyed the day which is balanced between demonstrations, cooking and a spices workshop. Michel and Nehra make the whole experience great fun - first time I have kneaded bread to the accompaniment of bongos - and take care to ensure everyone is successful with their cooking. Then at the end sitting down to enjoy your food on the terrace. This is a fantastic day - there are other cooking courses offered in Marrakech but I doubt any are as enjoyable as this one.

A fun day's cooking, and good value!. A thoroughly enjoyable day from start to finish - Michel [owner] and Nezha [Moroccan chef / tutor] make a superb team, and we were well looked after from start to finish. We were picked up from our riad, and learned to cook bread, a tagine, salads [various], and pancakes, as well as having a useful spice workshop conducted by Michel. The facilities are superb, and the ambience, based in the midst of productive farmland, congenial. The day ended up with a long leisurely lunch [prepared by ourselves, though with little opportunity to have gone wrong!!] in the garden, accompanied by wine, before heading back to our riad. Highly recommended!
Really good fun. The environment is lovely. The spice class entertaining, the cooking fun and eating yummy. Very inspiring, great fun and very unique.

Amazing experience!!!. It is as good as the rest of the reviews!! Went with my mother and we learnt how to cook Moroccan breads, tagines and Moroccan pancakes as well as a spice workshop! Was picked up at the hotel by the owner who really makes the day!! Great facilities and advice about everything Moroccan. Nezha the cooking teacher is fantastic. A truly fantastic experience and worth 10 times the price!!

Brillant time had by all. We throughly enjoyed our time there and learned a lot.It was brillant to do the cooking with someone and to be able to do it well!!!I think.The hospitality was second to none and the chat was great.I really dont think we could have got a better treatment or a better day with fun people and worked for the pleasure of it.

Great day cooking. We had a fabulous day at Faim d'Epice. Full day learning about spices and cooking tajines, deserts and salads.The team was so friendly and gave us lots of tips to recreate the meals at home.Such a good experience. We had a ball!

Wonderful day for cooking!. My husband and I wanted to do something different and we were glad that we chose this cooking experience based on reviews here. We had a lovely time learning how to make chicken tagine and Moroccon bread. There was a lot of fun and laughter . Our thanks go out to Michel and Nezha! This is a must to do in Marrakesh.

Best day in Marrakech. Spent a lovely day with my family learning to cook tajine, making salads and bread while listening to good music and Michel on the drums...the mood is very light and upbeat. There was a know your spices portion which i really liked. The classroom was bright, spacious and airy. And after the class you all get to eat what you cooked outside which felt like you were on a picnic. Definitely a must go.

I will do it again!. The whole experience was just engaging , fun and superb from the moment Michel met us at the driveway (since we came on our own ) to the time we left. I came with my family of 4 ranging from age 12 to 80+ . Michel got everybody engaged , welcomed and entertained. We came primarily to learn the basics of Moroccan cooking from their fantastic chef Nizha and went home with fond memories of a warm Moroccan hospitality. To sum it all in one sentence going to Faim D'Epices is like visiting a very good friend's house where the place is effusing of warm bread and food cooking , scents of orange blossom from the orchard and great camaraderie and laughter from the wonderful host!I will go back to learn more recipes or just to hang out with Michel and Nizha!The place is the complete antidote if you had to much of the soul and the medina.Thanks Michel for the lovely memory and for the tip where to get an affordable Moroccan teapot.Beya , USA

Great experience. The whole day was brilliant, all the staff were really nice and we laughed the whole day! We got some real inside knowledge about spices, I would recommend to do this before you hit jema al fnna as you will know exactly what you are looking for.

A must in Marrakech!. I recently travelled to Marrakech and after three long days in the souks my husband and I decided to take a break from the hassle and bustle and try out a cooking course. We read soo many fantastic reviews about Faim d'Epices and decided to give it a try. It was by far the best day out of the whole holiday. Michel and the staff were soo lovely and welcoming and we had such a fun day not to mention a big feast at the end. I would definitely recommend this activity for those who want to learn more about how to cook a delicious Moroccan meal! Nadia & Dean

A day away from the souk. I spent a day with Michel and his charming colleagues learning to cook authentic moroccan food. I especially loved the breadmaking part of the lesson and Michel's excellent talk on the many spices used in moroccan cooking. The day was well planned out by Michel and I came away with a lot of good tips on how to make a superb tagine. Getting to the venue was easy, as I was picked up from the main square and dropped off at the same place at the end of the day. I would recommend this to anyone interested in learning to cook the moroccan way. The lesson is suitable for beginners and expert cooks alike!!Naheed - Cardiff

Excellent day. Great way to learn about real Moroccan food and take something worthwhile home. Since returning we have cooked a tasty tagine and been inspired by Michel to try the recipes he sent too. It was a really fun day and Michel was charming and his spice lesson was really helpful.

A 'must' experience in Marrakech. I've had a wonderful day with Michel and his collaborators in a relaxed and nice environment. I had fun, thanks also to Michel being a knowledgeable and attentive host, learned about spices and a few good tips to spot fake saffron and argan oil. But most importantly it was a good learning experience, with a lot of actual practical time spent preparing the food. Nothing too complicated (fish tajine, salads, bread and moroccan crepes) but genuinely traditional moroccan food. Everything was perfect from the pick up at Djemaa El Fna, the location, the atmosphere, the teaching and, of course, the food! Highly recommended!

A superb family activity. We had a ball here. With the children being 13 & 16, we wondered just how they would approach engagement from across the age range. No need to be concerned! From a light hearted education session on spice identification, to the coolest way to finely chop onions, we were ALL captivated from start to finish. Including Moroccan bread making, salad construction, the right way to use the tagine, all resulted in a delicious finale where we consumed the results of our labours in the gardenOur 13 year old son repeated the recipe last weekend to much oohing & ahhhing from our guests. You will find your hosts charming, well informed & focused on ensuring you have a good time.

Just brilliant. Deserves it's number one spot. Right from the start we laughed a lot. Michel is a great host, it's well organised, the menu isn't too complicated (everybody ended up with food that tasted great) and we learnt a lot about spices and techniques. We didn't book the Spa add on but other guests in our Riad did - we were a bit jealous when they told us about it, so go for it and book the whole thing. All in all our favourite day in Marrakesh.

Excellent. So many good reviews of this already. Michel is a wonderful and humorous host and really brings the group together. Plenty of help and guidance is available for the cooking and the whole atmosphere is very relaxed. The tagine we made tasted great, really great. Overall this was my favourite day in Morocco. A nice surprise was an email containing some photos from the day plus some additional recipes, which arrived a week after I got back to the UK.

Wonderful day, host and food. We don't want to repeat what's already been said about how your day unfolds but do want to share our thoughts on what a gracious host Michel was, start to finish, and how we enjoyed the entire event. From the time we were picked up (on time!), welcomed with tea/coffee and introduction to our day and then led through the day in the very well organized kitchen and cooking stations, to our shared late lunch with wine and dessert served by our host, we enjoyed every part of the event. Great to spend time with someone who truly enjoys what he does and shares his enthusiasm with his guests. Michel's assistant, Nizha, was a great tutor and patient with the many questions she had to field.As it happened, we booked the cooking school and spa experience afterward as a package deal through Faim d'Epices. The spa was excellent as well. Cooking school from 10 to 4 or so, then they took us to the spa afterward for a hammam and massage from 5 to about 8. Best day of our whole trip!
a Realy nice day. At This day we had the most famos dish form Marocco, and one of the best days of ourstay. We enjoyed the day laerning and cooking with a lot of information and fun!Thanks

Spicy Day Out. We (three senior sisters, celebrating a big birthday) thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. We were picked up on time and taken to the venue which is set in orange and lemon groves, very peaceful, outside bustling Marrakech. Michel, Nezha and staff were all very welcoming. Each stage was explained very clearly and we all produced bread, a Lamb and prune Tagine, followed by a crispy pancake. The blind testing of herbs and spices was very interesting. Participants were from various countries and we learnt much about different cultures. A fantastic day which I would recommend to anyone visiting Marrakech who has a day to spare.

Fantastic. This was one of the highlights of our trip. We made a delicately flavoured meal with breads and salad. So much fun and really helpful. Well worth spending a day doing especially if you have an interest in food. Great tutors and perfect hosting.

HIGHLIGHT OF OUR TRIP. After reading other TA reviews, we booked our cooking class with Michel. It turned out to be a definite highlight of our trip to Morocco. The facilities were lovely and spotlessly clean. Michel was a wonderful host - very welcoming, informative and entertaining. Nezha was lovely and such a talented instructor and was very patient with us! The blind spice smell test was fun and informative. The tagine of fish we prepared was really delicious. All in all, it was a wonderful day filled with memories of good food, fellowship and new friends. Highly recommend Faim d'Epices!!

Hot kitchen. We were not sure what to expect but the day started well when we were picked up on time.The "school" was down a dusty road but a lovely kitchen training area awaited us. Here we were introduced to Michel and his team, we were given a brief exolanation of what the day would consist of and it was straight into the blind smell test. Our group was of mixed nationalities and as we were all in the dark it made us all come together quickly. The whole day was one of laughter and i am sure none of us expected our efforts to turn out so well as we were not really taking it too seriously. A lovely day that i would recommend to everyone no matter what their culinary skills may or may not be.

Unique Experience. This was a fantastic experience in Marrakech, and if you are visiting for a few days I definitely recommend you book a space. Michel is a great host for the day and really makes you feel at home. The experience is a whole day from about 9am to 4pm including hotel pick ups. The day incorporates a spice class, and then cooking Moroccan bread and the days tagine from scratch. Unfortunately you only get to watch as the cook makes the sides and desserts. Ideally it would be great if they could let guests make these as well, as there is plenty of waiting around on the day. Be prepared to take lots of breaks and soak up the sun in their beautiful fruit garden. The staff are absolutely lovely. There is no pressure to buy anything like everywhere else in Marrakech. Thank you to Michel and his amazing team for a fun day that we will remember for years to come.

The spice of life. We booked a cooking class with Michel and his team after reading good reviews on trip advisor. We were picked up on time and taken out of the city to a very well appointed cooking room located on a farm. Michel greeted us and proceeded to make our experience very enjoyable. He used the blind spice smell test as a method to explain the use of different spices in Moroccan cooking. We were shown how and also prepared our own Moroccan bread as well as a Chicken Tajine and Moroccan pancakes. A great day well recommended.

loved this class. We took this class on our last day in Marrakech. What a great way to end a trip. We learned so much about Moroccan food and had such a great day. It's a bit outside the medina but well worth the trip and of course the food is great.

If you only get to do one thing in Marrakech, make it this!!. Myself and my family read reviews on Faim d'Epices and being self confessed Foodies we decided to give it a go...It was the best decision we made in a while.From the moment you are picked up from your hotel to the moment you are dropped off you get the joy of experiencing Michel's exuberant personality, his drumming skills, get to knead out Moroccan bread, learn the tricks of the trade in identifying spices and get to enjoy the most amazing meal you created for yourself.This is brilliant value for money and not an experience you should miss.I couldn't rate it highly enough!

A different kind of experience. Great way to spend a day in Marrakech. The enjoyment gained from this activity couldn't have been gained in any other way. Providing you book on the right day for the cuisine you want to create, there aren't any other tips to mention.

Highlight of my Trip!!. From start to end this was a wonderful day and probably the best thing I did while on holiday in Marrakech. Michel was very helpful and friendly. The lovely cooking teacher was also a delight and the class was very good! The end result was delicious. (Best food I had while on my holiday) Well worth the money, would recommend- don't hesitate- book now!!

Must-do!. I'm not sure I have much more to add to the previous reviews-- they all speak the truth of what a wonderful time this cooking course is. It is well worth the price paid-- truly a valuable experience. You would pay two or three times the amount in London for what we got here! The recipe we had was amazing (Beef with artichokes and peas), and Michel asks if there are any dietary restrictions or preferences when confirming your booking so I would imagine it would be difficult to be disappointed with the food. All the staff are lovely, helpful and welcoming. We booked the spa experience alongside and while the hamam and message were wonderful, I think the best part of the day was the cooking course.

What a great way to spend a day in Marrakech. We booked this cooking course with Michel after reading the great reviews. We were collected promply from outside the Post Office in the Old Town. On arrival to our destination we were treated to mint tea of coffee and everyone got to know each other a little bit before we headed for the kitchen. Michel is very friendly, witty and laid back and made it clear that the day was to be enjoyed and that there were no time restrictions to worry about. Next on the agenda was the spices workshop which was both fun and interesting, whilst also making you realise how your nose can let you down when trying to identify scents, some of which should be so easy to recognise - our hooters really deceived us at times! The cooking experience itself was absolutely brilliant and very informative, whilst being fun and enjoyable. The end product, a lamb and prune tagine was absolutlely delicious and Nehza was an exceptional teacher who made learning the new techniques very enjoyable - we particularly enjoyed the 'boxing'!. We cooked whilst Michel played his bongos which helped to create a great atmosphere. Once the hard work was done we all sat down together to enjoy our handy work. A truly wonderful day. We would like to say a huge thank you to all at Faim d'Espices!

Fantastic experience at L'atelier Faim d'Epices!. My boyfriend and I went along to this on our last day in Marrakech and it was a fantastic way to spend our last day. It is located on a farm on the outskirts of Marrakech and we were picked up and dropped off again at our hotel, in total spending about 5 hours there. We had a really enjoyable time learning about different spices and cooking a chicken tagine, Moroccan bread and various salads. Michel, the owner, was a very entertaining host and he regaled us with interesting stories throughout the day and even played the bongos for us while we cooked! You will be provided with aprons so don't worry too much about what to wear.This is an excursion suitable for all, and we would thoroughly recommend this if you are in Marrakech. Fully deserves its excellent rating. If we were to go back to Morocco we would do this again.

Fun and Informative. We were faced with a rainy day while in Marrakech and after some research decided to try to book Faim d'Epices, booked over the phone quickly and easy and pick up was arranged for us included in the price.As cooking is a interest of mine I was worried that the day would be a little simple and i wouldn't learn anything. This definatly wasn't the case, we made the lamb and prune tagine which was delicious and tasted very authentic as well as the bread and salads.For me the spice workshop was the most interesting bit - it was fascinating to learn the way to tell good saffron from fake as well as the different types or cinnamon etc.Altogether it was definatly worth the money and I would reccomend to anyone looking for something a little different in Marrakech

Rockin' Morrocan Cookin'. My family and I spent nearly 2 weeks in Morocco, 1 in Essaoiura and 1 in Marrakech. We rode camels and horses on the beach. We drove ATVs on the sand dunes. We shopped in the soukes (of course). But the most entertaining experience we had the entire time was our day cooking class at Faim d'Epices. Fortunately, there is no cooking experience prerequisite required, so I was perfectly qualified. The class is done in such a way that, despite my culinary ineptitude, I felt perfectly comfortable. Nezha was beyond patient with the students and very informative. Michel's wit and banter keep things light and breezy. I would have gone just to get his lesson on spices. Can't wait to fire up the old tajine and put to use some of our lesson. It goes without saying that there will be several family bread making weekends in our future. A Moroccan themed dinner party is already in the initial planning phase. Thanks to Michel and Nezha, the neighborhood will be impressed.

Great day out in Marrakech. Many thanks for a very well organised day out; pick up is very efficient and food was amazing. Was my favourite food out of my whole stay in Marrakech. The setting is very peaceful and quiet and the staff are also very entertaining. Leaves you very inspired for tagine making!
Wonderfully Entertaining. Michel and Nezha are a great team. We learned much about Moroccan food and spice and would highly recommend this to anyone who visits Morocco. A must do for all foodies!

Cooking up FUN!. Many thanks to Michel, Nezha, and the staff of Faim d’Epices for a fabulous day. My friends and I found these glowing reviews on Trip Advisor, signed up for a class, and were certainly not disappointed. Faim d’Epices offered the perfect balance of technique, lightheartedness, and personal interaction. What a fun surprise to see Michel’s email two weeks later with photos and a “junior chef certificate” to commemorate our trip to Marrakech. I will be sure to use it to my advantage to entice my friends into preparing tajine beef on a monthly basis. Highly, highly recommended!

Super day of learning and fellowship. Today was our cooking class that we booked on line at Faim d'Epices. They were to pick us up in front of our hotel at 10:00. We were down a little early and the cab drivers/guides told us that they would take us. No we'll wait. Tours were offered and suggestions made by the cabbies.Within a few minutes up pulled a nice van with the name on the side. We hopped in the front seat and there were three other couples in the back.It was at least a 20 minute ride out of the city, near Timbucktoo, but an interesting ride to see a different part of the city. Highway turned to city road to country road with speed bumps, turned to gravel. No speeding and good driving.We arrived at the farm and the owner, Michel, greeted us and invited us into the lobby where our group of 10 sat as he gathered tea or coffee.We introduced ourselves to each other and decided we would have a fun day. A couple from Manchester a little younger than us, their pregnant daughter and her husband, also from Manchester. A newly married couple from London, first grade teacher and website designer. And a couple Stanford grad students, one lived in California and the other Switzerland.Michel was a bit of a character and entertaining. Originally French it took only a little time to get used to his his accent. He spoke clearly and made sure we understood what he was saying. Very knowledgeable on his spices and we had discussions during the day about the country, politics, and the people of Morocco.He explained we would watch bread making, learn about spices while the dough was rising. Make our bread, watch salads be made, cook our beef tagine (kind of a stew), cook our bread, make crepes, then eat.A lot of moving from our cooking station to the demonstration counter. Our instructor, Nazhel, lives in the city and rides her moped out each day, There were a couple staff that did some food prep and stocked and cleared the stations. Very well orchestrated all day.His color is purple as all the accent colors were purple, his hat band, watch, shoes, cushions, and toilet seats were all purple. Even the blacked out sunglasses he made us wear as he held the different spices under our noses. He showed us real saffron and explained why there was no way they had real saffron at the price they offered in the spice shop we visited in the Souks.We ate our labor (not goat) outside, complimented the chefs, had dessert with our crepes and ice cream. We were delivered back to the hotel a little before 5.An excellent way to spend a day in Marrakech!We received our Diploma and some pictures Michel took of us along with more recipies in an email.When you go . . . wear something PURPLE and you will be the teacher's pet!!

Another excellent review!. There isn't much I can add to all the other brilliant reviews - this was a fantastic day and one of our best in Marrakech. The cooking course and spice work shop in particular were really interesting and fun. The food we cooked was delicious and sitting in Michel's garden at the end of the day with good food, excellent company and a glass of wine is hard to beat! Michel's enthusiasm for Morocco and life in general is infectious and none of us wanted to leave at the end of the day! Would also recommend doing the spa combination deal as that was a great end to a perfect day.

An experience that lives up to expectations!. Easily booked this with Michel over the phone, very helpful, good directions on where pick up was and accurate time. Great day experience, very clean facilities, friendly staff. Lots of banter and laughs. Knowledge of spices and cooking methods in plenty and shared by Michel. Every level catered for, all made to feel very welcome. Great results at end by all. Shared a fabulous authentic lunch with the group of 8, over a glass of wine.You must do this!! Thank you once again to Michel and his team, we had a laugh.Manda and Paul (London)

A "Must Do" Moroccan Experience!. We could not fault our Moroccan cooking experience with Michel and the Team! From the booking through to our transfer back everything ran smoothly and calmly. The recipes we cooked were explained step by step with a practical demonstration beforehand. The introduction to the use of Moroccan spices was very interesting as well as entertaining and proved a useful tool when deciding which spices to take home. The food we cooked was delicious and eaten "al fresco". This experience would suit relative beginners to cooking as well as those more experienced. As well as being a truly memorable day, it was also very good value. It was definitely one of the highlights of our trip.

I can cook!. Whether your good, average or poor at cooking this is a must for all. The day was run brilliantly. Collected from our riad taken to the villa just outside the centre of marrakech. We were introduced to herbs and spices. There were demonstration and practical tutorials. Def have a good breakfast as you will you will be starving once you come to eat. Believe me, if you are average to poor at cooking your meal will still turn out great. They make it simple and easy to understand the technique of cooking allowing you to be confident in what you are doing. It worked, not doing to bad in the kitchen now.

Amazing Experience!. I cannot recommend this experience highly enough! We were picked up from our Riad and driven out of Marrakech to the secluded building surrounded by olive trees where the class is held. We were greeted with tea or coffee by the mad French head of the place who was brilliant! It was us and two other young English couples there that day but we understand groups can go up to around 12. We were shown how to cook, bread, tagine, salads and crepes by a Moroccan lady who was very friendly and spoke very good English. And after we had finished we were finally allowed to eat it all, outside in the sun with a glass of wine! Do not make the mistake we did and book any dinner for that evening, you will not need it! After all this we were given the recipes to take away. A few weeks after our return to the UK we were then emailed yet more recipes and some pictures of us during the class. Perfect finishing touch!

A wonderful visit.. I am a lover of food, but I had never taken a cooking class before, this was all I could have wanted and more. The spices, entertainment, and professionalism of our instructor were all excellent. We were picked up and didn't have to worry about a thing. The dishes were well selected and a nice mix of challenge and approachability. Moroccan cooking is an experience, but more so with such able guides. the class i was in had ten people, but it never felt like visiting a well managed home, and a nice contrast to the city. If you are ever in Marrakech, visit Faim d'Epices.

It passed the second test.... ...I just came back from Marrakech with my boyfriend and we have already cooked the dish we learned at L'atelier Faim d'Espices (see photo attached for proof!) It was just as good the second time and we were very proud of ourselves for cooking it without the expert guidance of the school. Even the bread came out well which we thought might not work in England and involved a bit of a panic in Sainsbury's when we couldn't find "the yellow flour" which in fact is called semolina...I can't fault the school. We got picked up on time from our riad by Michel and spent the day with a great group of people all, coincidentally, from England. The teaching was very well done. We learned the beef tagine and bread recipe as well as two salad dishes and Moroccan pancakes. Delicious! Eating our just-cooked food on a beautiful sunny day in Marrakech in February with a glass of wine to boot was one of the highlights of the trip for sure. Merci, Michel!

Best in Marrakech. Great day. Professional and organised with booking and pick up arrangements. Entertaining, informative and enjoyable course. Michel is a great laugh and we even managed to make some really good tasting food and eat it with a glass of wine in the sunshine. Their olive oil is wonderful too, buy some!

Excellent experience. My husband and I loved this cooking class. The food we made was amazing, the farm was beautiful and Michel was a great host. I can't wait to get home and cook all this amazing food for my friends and family. I highly recommend this class.

Absolutely Brilliant Day out. My Partner and I booked the day here based on the reviews seen here and were not disappointed.The whole day was so nicely done, picked up from the Hotel and taken a little way out of the hustle and bustle. Offered mint teas, coffees on arrival nice and chilled out.Michel is a truly great guy who loves what he does and it shows.You will learn to make truly authentic Morroccan food here and it's suitable for all levels in the kitchen. I personally am a chef myself and was amazed by the amount i learnt here. we learned to cook numerous dishes with the help and support of the great staff here, whilst it still being a fun day to be relaxed and enjoyable. Then sitting down to enjoy the meals we cooked at the end of the day, with a glass of wine in the Sun.I would highly recommend this to anyone, Michel and his team do a great job. You even get the recipes to take home with you.

Great Day. We had a fun and educational day .The staff are nice and very friendly ,Michel is as mad as a hatter but as I am aswell that worked out well He is a funny nice guy and I think that it was a well spent day go try it .

Best Cooking Class in Marrakech. MY partner and I have just returned from Marrakech and I can honestly say one of the highlight of the trip was Michels Cooking day. Always a little dubious about booking things abroad we went based on the reviews on here and were not disappointed. Everything went smoothly from the booking to the return to our hotel and everything was on time.When you get picked up you are taken to a peaceful haven away from the hustle and bustle of the markets and are surrounded by olive trees on a little farm. The cooking house itself is beautiful, very clean. We were offered drinks on arrival and could look round the small shop. however at no point was there any pressure to purchase anything, tip anyone or anything like that. I will say that the shop was very reasonably priced as well compared to the prices in the souks.The cooking class was easy ti understand and the staff very very helpful and made us all feel welcome and at home. We had an education on spices too where we were blindfolded and had to guess what each spice was by smell... Michel explained about what they were used for and gave us some great tips on spoking fake spices too.After the cooking (where we made traditional bread, Chicken lemon tagine and salads we relaxed in the sun and all ate our food together out by the olive trees, it was beautiful. You also get given the recipes you cooked to take home with you.. please please make this a day that you do when you go to Marrakech

Yum Yum. Be sure to add this destination to your planning when visiting Marrakech. The staff is excellent. Michel is a lovely host. The location is a bit of the beaten path, however once you arrive, it is lovely to enjoy looking out over the gardens. The structure of the day is very relaxing and varied with demonstration, instruction and hands on prep along with some musical entertainment thrown in. We were fortunate that the weather was pleasant which allowed us to enjoy the fruits of our labour outdoors under the mid afternoon sun. We combined our cooking class with a spa treatment that was arranged by the cooking school. We were delivered by the driver arranged with the school and escorted right to the door. What a great way to spend the day. Thanks for a great experience.

Authentical cooking course. We had a very great experience at faim d'epices. The driver picked us up as discussed and we were very nice received by Michel. It is a nice location.We started preparing our meal at a desk for our self, had a spice introduction, prepared crepes, interesting salats and watched how to prepare bread. The whole cooking course was very interesting and we felt very welcoming.Thanks a lot to Nezha and Michel. Also thank you for recipes and a bag with mixed morrocan spices.I was regret not buying some oliveoil. That was the best I ever had ;)Nice christmas present, thanky to Sven :)

Husband and wife honeymoon visit. From the off, the tone was set for fun and laughter. Michel was quirky and humourous, and relaxed everyone for the day. The venue is clean, large enough, and perfect for a day's cooking. Michel is very attentive and everyone there was very well looked after.I would recommend this to anyone - its a whole lot of fun, the staff are very enthusiastic about what they do, and the food was gorgeous.Top rated fun.

Excellent cooking class!. My boyfriend and I decided to do the class at Faim d'Epices at the end of our trip to Marrakech in September 2012 and it was a great decision - we had such a great day! It's easy to get stuck with bland tagines and cous cous found in the square but this day just shows how good real Moroccan food is!The minivan picked us up from our riad and took us to the farm house just ourside marrakech centre. There were only four of us in our group for day being oursleves and two Australian girls. We were met by Michel and some fresh mint tea.There are different recipes each day but we made beef and artichoke tagine, and the traidtional bread, salads and sweet pancakes which are similar each day. Nezha, the chef, is a great teacher and expertly shows you the techniqies needed in her demonstation. We each had our own cooking station to prepare our food and follow Nezha's instructions whilst Michel entertained with some traditional drum playing. The spice 'class' we had with Michel was fun and we all thought we had learnt something from it, including how to spot fake saffron which is sold commonly to tourists!Bring able to relax and enjoy what you've made which soaking up the sun looking at the citrus trees of the farm house is a joy! Michel was a great host and was funny (in a dry French way), informative and generous.At the end of the day he gave us all a souvenir of the recipes we had made that day and some Ras al Hanout to use when we prepare the dishes back at home.We we got back to England we got an email from Michel with some photos of us during the day and some more recipes. What a wonderful experience we had which we would definitely reconmmend. It was good value for money, was professionally run and is something different to do whilst in Morocco/Marrakech. We were definitely relaxed at the end of the day and it was a highlight of our trip.

Peaceful Cooking Heaven!. After a few days of the Hustle and Bustle of the Jemaa El Fna and the Souks this course was the prefect antidote...A short trip out of Marrakesh center, Faim d'Epices is a beautiful purpose built open plan building situated in a quiet area in the country side surrounded by Citrus trees. From our arrival and introductions, to taste tests, cooking lessons and food served in the sunshine, Michel made us feel at home and relaxed. We even got some impromptu bongo drums and some useful info on Morrocan culture, property and lifesytle.The Lessons are easy to follow, the food delicious (best meal we had in Marrakesh!) and the day great fun all round. We had such a good time that i decided i would end the day asking my Girlfriend to marry me... Can't say much more really, other than if you are in Marrakesh BOOK IT!

Great Moroccan cooking Workshop Marrakech. My girlfriend and i went to a cous cous cooking class. It was really great. Everyone in L'atelier Faim d'Epices are really nice people. We learned about species and had a great day. Highly recommended

Probably the best thing in Marrakech. Having not really been impressed in the crap that the souks have to offer (second hand teeth, cheap tat etc), I was interested in doing something slightly authentic in Morocco, and cooking seemed like a perfect idea.I cannot fault Faim d'Epices. It was very well run, friendly, warm welcoming, fun - with some wonderfully nice and like minded people on the course. It's a fun and informative day which was easy enough and without the serious or pretentious manner. I visited it on my own and had a great time here.I can't really say anything else which would not replicate what probably many people have already said.

One of the best cooking classes i have been on. Spot on, very professional, reasonable priced. It was a great day and great to spent time with Michel and share our mutual passion for spices. He know a lot :)Would recommend this to everyone going to Marrakesh, its a great way to spend the day. After i went to a spa arranged through them which i will also recommend. a perfect day before returning back to minus 15 in Denmark. And a very nice touch with the pictures. just very very professional with a personal touch.

A MUST! Fantastic food, teaching, experience - made our trip to Morocco!. All I can say is this literally made our holiday!!!! YOU HAVE TO DO THIS FANTASTIC DAY OUT!it was smooth, seemless, delicious, friendly, relaxing, interesting, informative and most of all enjoyable and has left us with brilliant memories of Morocco. The service and friendliness of Michel (the owner) and his team made the daythat bit more special. The day felt like it was personal and just for us which is so so rare especially with many large tour companies.We have just got back from Marrakech having spent a week there in January. We booked this tember via email enquiry in Sep 2012 and everything went to plan. We were picked up from our Riad by Michel who took us to the beautiful farm - being quiet in January it was just us and another couple but the kitchen area was large and spacious and so even if there were lots of you! We had a brilliant lesson of all the different spices and were shown in detail by the WONDERFUL teacher a 3 course meal plus how to make bread! on the day we visited it was fish tagine and its probably one of the best things I have ever tasted!! She was very hands on and really gave personal time to each person ensuring everything was cooked correctly. We enjoyed the sunshine and ate alfresco! We were then driven to the spa and had a lovely relaxing afternoon followed by an hour long massage!!I cannot believe the fantastic value of this day trip - the combination of the wonderful lesson and food followed by an hour long massage was just priceless and for any couple or group of friends I SERIOUSLY SUGGEST YOU DO THIS!!! :) It is 100% worth it and such a treat and it was so nice to get out of the madness of Marrakech for the day!Thank you for leaving us with fantastic memories and a taste of real Morocco - I will be recommending to anyone I know who is visiting! WE WILL BE BACK! :)

A "MUST DO" in Morocco!. My boyfriend and I attended Michel's cooking class on our last day in Marrakech. We were so fed up of the standard tagine, couscous, kebab on offer there that we decided to try and find out if that really was as good as it got foodwise in Morocco!? The answer thankfully is NO! Michel and his team were so knowledgeable and friendly and the food we produced was by far the best we'd had in Morocco! The aubergine salad is to die for!If you're in Marrakech and you want to eat well whilst escaping the madness of the Medina then go see Michel and his team and follow it with a Hammam. The best way to spend a day!

Fun for the Whole Family. I brought my two daughters, ages 9 and 15, to L'atelier Faim d'Epices. We had a wonderful day and they really made sure that my younger daughter felt included. She was able to participate in everything and she was so proud of her meal (and she ate it, too!). The school was kind enough to send us some photographs afterwards, and they sent us home with recipes and a desire to cook more Moroccan food together (now how to fit a Tangine on a Ryan Air flight!). I recommend you book this...you will not regret it!

A fabulous taste of Morocco!. My wife and I attended Faim d'Epices on Saturday 19th January 2013. We were not disappointed! We had researched Morocco before our trip to Marrakech and found this great visitor attraction on Lonely Planet. We then emailed Faim d'Epices (Michel) from our hotel. We were emailed back promptly to arrange what day we wished to attend, and were then collected in their private minibus on the day. On arrival at the farmhouse, some 20 minutes outside the city, we were greeted by Michel and introduced to our teacher for the day, Nezha. Both lovely people! We were made very welcome.The course was a lot of fun! It began with Michel fitting us with dark glasses, and we then had to identify a large number of herbs and spices using the sense of smell. Afterwards we started to cook our meal under the careful guidance of Nezha. This consisted of. Moroccan bread, salads, chicken with red olives & Lemon, and crepes. Whilst we were cooking, Michel provided some entertainment in the form of African music, with which he joined in by playing the bongo's!Later, we enjoyed the fruits of our labours on the patio overlooking the olive and citrus groves. We had a super time, both the food and the company were excellent. Afterwards, we were taken to the Mythic Oriental Spa in the medina for approximately 3 hours of total bliss! This consisted of Moroccan Hammam and massage. I will review this separately later.If you are heading to Marrakech, do this course. It will be a highlight of your visit to Morocco!

Fantastic cookery school, lots of fun!. After a few days in Marrakech we were looking forward to taking a trip out of the city to learn how to make some yummy tagines. We didn't expect to have such a fantastic time! We learned how to make a delicious beef tagine in a really welcoming atmosphere - there was coffee or peppermint tea on arrival and Michel explained the day ahead for us. There was a group of about 10 of us and we generally all spoke English (we got the feeling we'd been put in a group together for this reason) and some people could clearly cook well and others were just there for a day out. I'm not a great cook but I enjoy cooking and Faim d'Epices definitely caters for all levels. We started making our bread after a wonderful lesson with one of Michel's team - they help you every step of the way after the lesson to make sure you're on track. Once the bread was left to rise we started making our tagine. Each of us had our own cooking station (each station has two hobs and chopping space) so my fiance and I could work next to each other. The most entertaining part of the day was the blind 'smelling' test of spices. We were tested on our knowledge of all sorts of regular and exotic spices and given some good (and also hilarious) advice about buying saffron and argan oil etc. Michel is a natural entertainer and the whole atsmophere is really relaxed. We had some fresh orange juice and snacks before learning how to make a range of fresh Moroccan salads and then we finished off our tagine. Our tagines were served on a long table in the beautiful surroundings of olive trees in the sunshine and we were given complimentary glasses of wine. It was such a fun day and we highly recommend this cookery school to anyone who wants a great day out alongside learning how to cook some delicious authentic Moroccan food. We were given our recipes to take away (which is SO useful) and the cookery school has various spices and things to buy as little presents so we bought their amazing olive oil. We would definitely go back! My advice would be eat a good breakfast as the enticing smells whilst you cook make you extra hungry and if you're travelling during winter take an extra jumper just in case. Thank you Faim d'Epices for such a great end to our Moroccan adventure.

Highlight of our trip. A friendly and relaxed atmosphere, we were shown how to cook traditional Moroccan recipes from flat bread to a delicious lamb tagine. The techniques used were new to me but our tutor was very patient. Having cooked the food we ate and shared amongst the group and it was the best food we had in Marrakech.

Great day's entertainment. My husband and I had previously been on a cooking course in Thailand and loved it so we were a bit nervous about this one not being as good...we needn't have worried! Everything was very professional from the word go. We learned to make traditional bread and a tagine which was very practical and hands on. How to make Moroccan salads was demonstrated as well as how to make those delicious little crepes they serve for breakfast in Morocco. Michel delivered an extremely interesting talk about the spices used in Moroccan cooking and some of the scams to watch out for in the souks. The best bit had to be the eating though! At the end of the day everyone was given a copy of the recipes to take home - I can't wait to try it out! Thanks to Michel and his team for a fantastic day - will be recommending to friends!

Marrakech Highlight. My wife and I joined Michel and Nezha and their team and an interesting group of other 'students' for a friendly, instructive and fun day learning to prepare and cook some Moroccan dishes, including one of the best tagines we had while in Morocco. This was genuinely one of the highlights of our Moroccan experience. Highly recommended!

A fun, interesting day in Morocco. We would thoroughly recommend these guys. We were a group of 7 and even the boys really got into it. Michel and his team were friendly and inviting. The day was relaxing, and fun, and easy. Not only did we learn how to make some of our favourite Moroccan dishes, but learnt a lot about the spices we used. And in the end we got to eat our lunch in the garden. The pick-up and drop off from your hotel makes it an easy day out…. And if the offer to tag on 3 hours at the Hammam – don’t hesitate, it was a wonderful end to the day. The whole day was great value for money.Thanks again to the team at Faim d’Espices for the wonderful Christmas day. We had a great time, and your recipes are proudly added to our cook books.

excellent day out. My girlfriend and i spent a great day at Faim d'Epices learning how to cook with a tagine. We also learnt how to make bread and Moroccan pancakes. Great place to go of you feel like you need to get out of the city for a day. I would definatly recommened it to anyone.

"A great day ". My wife and I spent a memorable, Christmas Day, 2012 on the one day cookery class. Michel and his team were excellent teachers. We were taught how to make our own bread, various salads, beef tajine, pears and candied oranges.The course was excellent value for money. We were collected from our hotel and returned there later in the day. It was a full day spent with other like minded international, holiday adventurers. We had lots of fun.We intend to return to Marrakesh, again and another class at Faim D’Espices, will be a must.

yet another happy customer. This cooking school had already got great reviews, and our experience was just as positive . Michel has a quirky sense of humor and the day was both fun and interesting. I was particularly impresses with how well organized it was, and how great my tagine tasted . A must do. My only suggestion is to make a few notes during the day if you are as novice as cook as i am . They give you receipes when you leave, but they didn't have enough detail for me.

Best day in Marrakech. We absolutely loved this course. Host Michel is doing everything to make you feel comfortable and happy during your day of cooking at his atelier, situated half an hour outside the hustle of Marrakech, in a quiet orange grove. Cook Nezha is an absolute expert in the foods of Morocco and also a patient chef. It all worked towards the highlight of eating our own meals in the warm Moroccan sunshine. A deserved top-five attraction in Marrakech.
Brilliant tuition, deliiiicious food. Thanks, Faim d'Epices, for an entirely fun, professional and good value -- and yummy! -- cooking course. I've been cooking tagines at home since ;)

A day to learn and create. A light hearted but informative way to learn a little more about the cuisine and culture of Marrakech. Our children range from 12 - 25 years and all very much enjoyed the experience.

Best food we had in Morocco!. This was a fantastic cooking class and is the best one I have ever done. The staff are lovely and Michel is very funny. The course is very relaxed and professionally done, they cook different foods each day of the week. I really enjoyed the spice tips Michel gave us which came in handy during our travels in Morocco. I recommend this course and if we ever return to Marrakech then we will do this course again.

Highlight of Marrakech. My daughters and I had a fabulous day with the warm-hearted , stylish and generous team at FAIM D'EPICES. We were recieved with grace and warmth and guided through complex Moroccan dishes (cous cous with lamb and vegetables , salads, pancakes) with humor and skill. We ate our delicious meal together in the sun on the terrace overlooking the lovely olive plantation. The organization including transport was punctual and smooth. A true highlight to our fabulous trip to Marrakech. We recommend this charming cooking course highly.

Very impressive and very interactive!. I don't get super impressed very often, but Michel and his team at Faim d'Epices, especially Nezha, impressed me very much. I had purchased the full-day cooking class, including the spa add-on, for my wife as a Xmas gift and she absolutely loved it. We were picked up on time at the meeting spot in Jemaa el Fna square (don't fret if they're a few minutes late) and they drove us out to the farm. We were welcomed with a smile, some tea/coffee, and a very nicely designed "farmhouse" setting. The cooking class went all day which sounds long but it flies by and you're never bored. I won't go into details on the cooking as each day there is a different recipe (we did Friday's couscous with meat/veggies, an excellent classic dish), but during the session you learn plenty about the techniques and the spices.
