Best of all, it's completely interactive; there's only a few times where you're watching them cook, otherwise you're involved with the recipe the whole time. After you're finished cooking, you eat your meal outside in the sunshine - it's complete bliss and the food you make is delicious. What impressed me the most is that Michel followed-up with a thank you email and included a recipe from a dish that I told him I liked. It just shows how much he cares and listens to his customers and that is something that can be hard to come by nowadays.The spa add-on is very nice as well, even if you feel a bit full from eating all your food!I think you will be very impressed with Michel and his team and the cooking class too and I highly recommend it - bon appetit!

A fantastic Moroccan experience. Michel and his staff provided a well-planned, interesting and diverse course throughout the day. The varied activities held our interest throughout the day, although the cooking and spice lesson certainly were stimultating enough in their own right. This was a fantastic course, easily worth the money and Michel is a very gracious host, willing to share his stories and knowledge. I would do this again in a heartbeat. Also, bring some extra money because he sells some spices, oils and other cooking materials and the Olive oil made on the property tastes AMAZING.
Really Great Day". My daughters and I had so much fun. We've already repeated the recipes at home in Santa Barbara. What a wonderful experience!

A taste of Moroccan home cooking. The best thing about the course? Easy. Faim d'Epices doesn't employ professional chefs. Our teacher for the day was an ordinary (though, admittedly, very pretty) Moroccan woman who showed us how to cook traditional Moroccan meals, including tagine of chicken and preserved lemons, bread, salads and crepes (sooo much better than anything you can buy from street vendors!). My advice? Don't take the course if you expect a five star restaurant dining experience because you will be disappointed. But if you're after the real McCoy of Moroccan home cooking in a friendly atmosphere, this is the deal.The package includes a super cool host who takes time to chat with every participant and make them welcome at his school. Hey, he even gives out free tips (in Marrakesh, a very rare feat indeed), including advice on how to tell genuine saffron from shredded animal tendons and how not to get swindled when buying argan oil.

The best day of our holiday.... ...was the last day which we spent with Michael at faim d`epices. We were picked up from our hotel and spent a wonderful day learning how to cook bread, tagine, salads and morrocan pancakes, all of which we ate afterwards. Lovely surroundings, a real treat of a day.

Amazing and memorable experience. Not sure what else you can ask for out of a cooking class. The staff was wonderful. The owner Michel, is an eccentric french man with a great sense of humour. The lady leading the session (extremely nice and helpful) begins with a demonstration, and then you head to your workstations and she leads you through the steps once again, circling around to make sure you end up with delicious tasting food in the end, regardless of your shortcomings as a cook. Refreshments were served throughout the day (freshly squeezed orange juice was my personal favourite) and Michel does a very good job of explaining the traditional ingredients and spices and how they are used in moroccan cuisine. We were a group of about 12 people, but you get sufficient personal instruction. I have taken cooking courses before where you are 3-4 people huddled around 1 workstation and you split the tasks and therefore don't really get the full experience. Here you, you make your own dish entirely so there's a real sense of personal accomplishment at the end! To top it off, MIchel gives you a copy of the recipes for everything you've made that day. My mother and I were both really happy to have taken the class and highly recommend it, its a good relaxing change of pace from the hectic atmosphere of the souks. Lastly, the driver picks you up from your hotel (on time!) and was very pleasant. The fact that the place is a bit out in the country is also nice. ---Excellente expérience. Je recommande fortement cet atelier. Le personnel est chaleureux, les mets qu'ils enseignent sont délicieux et on nous donnes les recettes a la fin de l'atelier. Ils expliquent des ingrédients et comment ils sont utilisés dans la cuisine marocaine. L’ambiance est très relax, ont est bien à la campagne, un bon contraste avec le tumulte des soukhs. Le propriétaire Michel est très accueillant et les dammes qui dirigent l'atelier sont patientes et gentilles. A ne pas manquer!

The best experience in Marrakech. Me and my boyfriend took part on this cooking course one Friday in December and totally found it the highlight of our trip (we also took part on another cooking school's course, but this one was better).Forget those few negative ratings said here on Tripadvisor, because at least I did find them true at all. You don't have to buy anything from the shop (or actually you might want to when you see the argan oil is much cheaper there than in most of stores you see it), THE FOOD you make and eat in Faim d'Epices is so good, the chef Michel is a really nice, easy to get along person, the Moroccon excellent chef named Mouna (? forgive me if I wrote your name wrong) is really good at teaching and the whole day was for us something we will look back with really nice memories for a long time.

Fabulous experience. We had an incredible day with Michel at Faim d'Epices. And we ate some of the best food of our stay thanks to the cooking skills of the team. We found out about the course on the Lonely Planet guide and the review was very accurate. Pick up, spice tests, cooking lessons, drumming ... everything was perfect. A family group joined on our day and the team were brilliant with the children. We also discovered you can get the cooking course and spa package and were able to book the spa at late notice. This was an incredible experience of steaming, exfoliation and massage followed by mint tea and pastries. Perfect way to round off a great day with Michel. Would recommend Faim d'Espices to anyone looking for a cooking experience in Marrakech.

Loads of fun - A must do experience. We booked this on the back of reading reviews on Tripadvisor and we were not let down one bit. We were picked up by minibus from our hotel and drove the 30 minutes out to their fantastic little farm. We had a spice initiation followed by a full day of learning and cooking. Tangine of the day, breads, salads, breakfast pancakes. Everything tasted great and the atmosphere and Michel's attention to detail are great.We combined this with a spa evening combo package and Michel dropped us off in the middle of Marrakech and guided us to the spa.The most fun and yet relaxing part of our trip.

Fun. The cooking workshop was very well set up! We had a nice and tasty day on a very nice location. We were proud of our own home-made Marrocan bread and lamb-tajine!! We have the confidence now to serve this to our friends at home!!

Highlight of our trip. We spent a week in Marrakech, and this cooking class was a real high point of our trip. It was great fun to learn to make bread, Moroccan salads and chicken tagine as the pièce de résistance, and a big bonus was the blind spice test. My only regret is that we didn't take this class earlier, so as to be better educated about spices (especially saffron) to shop for them at the souk. But I really can't recommend Faim d'Epices highly enough.

A Great Day in Marrakech. Our trip to Marrakech was made even better during our day at L'atelier d'Epices. Michele and the staff were wonderful hosts. We learned so much, while having such fun doing it. It was an excellent activity for our family and bridged the city tours and Atlas Mountain excursions perfectly. Even if you only have a few days in Marrakech, I would recommend.

The highlight of our holiday. Spent a fantastic day here learning to cook a variety of Moroccan food, including bread. This was undoubtedly the highlight of our holiday- cant recommend it enough! it is situated in a purpose built just just outside the city so apart from anything else, its nice to escape the hustle and bustle for a while. Lovely surroundings, a lovely, comfortable space, a genial host in Michel and lovely food! It is more than 'just' a cooking course, it is a whole experience( including djembe rhythm from Michel during the bread making!) and we learned more about Marrakech and Moroccan food than we did anywhere else. Everything works very smoothly and there is no pressure to 'work faster' or anything like that! Its almost like being on Masterchef with your own personal work station and everything all laid out for you. We ate the results of our labours in a lovely lunch outside in the sun with the other 4 course participants.I know that many of the riads also offer 'cookery classes' but doubt if they can offer anything on a par with this professional, friendly, inspirational and relaxed operation. This is an absolute must for anyone wanting to find out about genuine Moroccan food and culture.

Fun cooking for the whole family!. Wow! If you do one thing in Marrakech make sure that you book yourself onto Michel's cooking course at Faim D'Epices. My 3 children (15, 13 and 10 years old) and I signed up for the course in October as we were in Marrakech on holiday but my husband had to work for the day and we weren't sure about going round the city on our own. Michel made everything easy for us from the moment we emailed him with our enquiry - he reassured me that the children were welcome and answered all our questions very promptly. He came to pick us up from our riad - in the end my husband decided to come and work on his laptop at the cooking school and Michel could not have made him more welcome, keeping him supplied with snacks and drinks and even sharing his lunch with him! We loved meeting all our fellow students and making new friends and the children really enjoyed the whole experience, especially the blind spice tasting and Michel's drumming. Our youngest was given a special chef's hat to wear and a small drum to play along with Michel. We were all amazed that we could cook such delicious food, mostly due to head chef, Nezha's expert tuition! The lamb and prune tagine melted in our mouths and the homemade breads and salads complemented it perfectly... a great family bonding experience as we compared our pancakes, breads and tagines and debated whose was the best. Everything was spotlessly clean and inspired confidence and we cannot praise the whole experience highly enough. Michel, you take customer service to another level! Thanks for a fantastic day. We combined the cooking course with a spa visit where we and the children were made equally welcome - great value and a real life experience for us all.

A Wonderful Fun Culinary Experience. Michel and his team put together a terrific experience-- part theatre, part cooking and learning and overall good time. He does a session on spices which teaches you about the various ones used and important information about purchasing and storing them. We then had cooking demonstrations and then made our own bread and tangines of lamb, artichoke and peas. The setting (about 30 minutes out from the Medina) was very pretty and filled with olive and lemon trees. After the cooking, we all enjoying dining outside in the sunshine with our delicious food.Highly recommend this cooking event.

Best Day of Holiday. This has to be one of the best things to do on a holiday to Marrakech. Almost 6 hours of great fun and a great meal thrown in!My wife and I signed up for the course and ended up with two other couples. We baked our own bread, cooked a beef and pear tagine, had a blind spice smelling, created Moroccan salads and crepes.I learned so much from the day that I am tempted to try recreating the recipes over Christmas. As for the easy way to finely chop an onion - so simple and a complete revelation. Watch out Gordon Ramsay here I come! Many thanks to Michel and the staff for a wonderful experience.

Relaxing, interesting and fun.. We were picked up from our hotel at the correct time and taken to the cookery school (approx 20 min drive from city centre) We were greated by the owner (Michel) at the doors who welcomed us in. We were with around 8 other people, at first, it was a bit difficult to get talking to that many strangers but we soon settled in and got on well with everyone. We were given a very interesting spice workshop and were taught how to make bread, salads, Morroccan crepes and a lamb and prune tagine. There was a reasonably priced shop there and everything in the building was beautiful and tastfully done. The best surprise was being offered a glass of wine, something we found difficult to get in Marrakech. We were given some amazing ice cream for desert. We had a Brilliant day and couldn't have wished for more! Michel was a really great guy who made us laugh with eccentric personality! Thanks Faim d'epices!

Really nice day!. Michele and the rest of the staff here are excellent! There is a spice lesson, making bread, making crepes and then the main course of the tagine of the day. The farm is gorgeous and there is a really reasonably priced shop there as well. Michele will bang on his bongos and entertain you all day. We booked a combo with the Mythic Oriental Spa as well, so it was an incredible day! Book! Enjoy!

Best day of the holiday. We had a really great day out with Faim d'Epices, picked up at our hotel and driven out to a relaxing farm in the marrakech countryside with olive trees, lemon trees, etc. So relaxing after the frantic Marrakech souks. We made tagine, salads, and our own bread then enjoyed our hard work with a glass of Morroccan wine. I highly rate this day out, well worth the money with a great host and great morrocan cooks to take you through the dishes. In our class there was a wide range of ages including one quite young teenager, who also seemed to really the day. I did a few cooking courses while in Marrakech and if I had to choose only one to do again this would be it.

A party to your senses!. Such a great day! Probably the most relaxing day in Marrakech. Loved the day from start to finish. Michel was funny and welcoming host! Highly recommended. My favourite Marrakech experience.

Great cooking course for those who are interested in Moroccan food. We decided to take the Faim d'Epices half day cooking lesson to really get to know the spices and techniques of cooking Moroccan dishes. The reviews on Tripadvisor were really favorable, and turned out to be true as well :)We were picked up from our riad and driven to maybe half an hours drive away from Marrakech. The course takes place beside a small and beautiful olive garden. The organizer Michel was really friendly and spoke also great English. The course itself was also very well organized, and we cooked tagine, baked bread local style and also some delicious crepes, which were served to us in the garden under the sun :)Highly recommended (cooking lessons are a great way to get to know the local culture) !

I didn't know I could cook until this class!!. I went to Marrakesh with my friends and this was something really Moroccan that I can experience. Teachers were so kind and nice, I could get knowledge about spices that I didn't know, and I could finish whole meal and actually it tasted sooooo good...I couldn't believe that I did it!! So great experience with nice people in calm and peaceful atmosphere. Thank you so much!
Great day out..good food. All in all great experience with good food on a beautiful farm. A nice day out of the craziness of Marrakech.Def worth a try :)
A wonderful day. One of the best days of our holiday, highly recommended. Thank you for sharing your Moroccan hospitality.

All in all great experience, funny and and instructive. I can highly recommend this course!! After this course you will be able to prepare a delicious Moroccan meal; you learn the most important cuisine techniques and everything necessary about herbs and spices. Michel and Nisa were very friendly, funny and instructed us into the world of moroccan meals in the best way you can imagine. Just do it, you will be fascinated too!!

Sadly more of a watching course than cookery course.... We prepared a fish tagine, nice enough. Consisted of peeling a potato, chopping a carrot, one tomato, and a bit of green pepper. The garlic has been prepared and the spices laid out, so no real excitement in that. We also got to make a bread roll to go with said tagine.The rest of the day we watched the chef kneading dough for bread/pancakes and chopping veg to make salads for us to cook.There was an interesting lesson on spices, but I felt it took up too much of the day. It was nice sitting out eating our food at the end, but I'd rather have been eating more of what we had made...A pleasant day, but not a proper cooking course, and much less hands on cooking time compared to others I've experienced.And beware, the journey there can take a long time depending on how many other people are getting picked up.

Great Moroccan experience!. We loved the cooking school. It was a clear highlight of our trip!Really tasty food (can't believe how easy it was to make something nice) and Michel was such a great host; funny, lovely and I loved the drums and music (definitely enhanced the vibe) and Nisa the chef was great too. All in all a great experience you shouldn't miss while in Marrakesh!

YUM! And you actually learn.... We had a great time here. Michel and his team are lovely and really take the time to show cook.It is friendly and funny and altogether a pleasant relaxing day away from the hectic medina! If you are in Marrakech for a week then definitely spend one of your days here.On top of it all Michel sent us photos of ourselves cooking that he had taken as well as extra recipes. Very sweet. TIP: Do not buy any spices in the medina until you visit here.

Great, relaxing, fun, instructive, delicious day. Just do it! Find a day during your stay to visit Michel and his team and prepare the basis of a good Moroccan meal while not only learning the art and techniques of the cuisine, picking up tips about oils, herbs and spices and enjoying the fruits of your labours (superbly complemented with additional dishes prepared on site), but also have fun both with the other guests and with Michel's intriguing Gallic humour and percussive musicianship.The food we produced on the day (bread, beef and pea tagine, pancakes) was delicious - maybe the ultimate test of the teaching will come later as I am told that I will have to produce more of the same at home over Christmas.

Delicious!. Who would believe the best food we would eat in Morocco would be something we cooked ourselves? It really was amazing! Michael and his staff did an incredible job putting this business together: a real highlight of our trip and we'll worth the cost. Don't miss it.

A must do in Marrakech. Thank you to Michel and his excellent team for a great and fun day out. We did the Cous Cous day and the instruction was really good and at a nice easy pace. Lots of local tips as well which helped at the spice market. My wife stocked up on Argon Oil and Michels help and advice was invaluable. Still haven't cooked the pancakes and bread yet but Nehza made it look so easy and tasty we will definitely try this. Tip: the shop at the school is great value and no haggling needed!!!!

A brilliant change from sightseeing !. This was a 'birthday treat with a difference' for my sister. I chose this as we both enjoy cooking and thought it would be good to learn how to cook some authentic Moroccan cuisine. We enjoyed the day SO much, great bunch of people on the course with us and Michel has a great sense of humour! We followed on to the Mythic Oriental Spa - which again was terrific. On the whole, a great value for money day. Highly recommended.

What a great day - a must do!. If you want a day away from the bustle and bustle of Marrakech, I highly recommend a day with Michel at Faim d'Epices. The cookery class was brilliant and Michel and his very talented chef, Nehza, were such entertaining hosts. It was just the right balance of cooking, learning about the amazing spices and, of course, eating! Lovely place, lovely people and lovely food. Michel will even come and pick you up and drop you off afterwards.

Cracker of a day!!!. My Girlfriend and I attended the cooking school in Oct after a disaster of a trip in the Sahara desert. Can I say this really did make our trip finish on a HIGH. The day we arrived was raining so it was perfect. Our Friendly Driver picked us up on time and we picked up a few other groups on the way. We arrived at the Farm and we were offered coffee or tea (Nice Coffee) and introduced to Michel and his staff, And then we were straight into it. It was fun right from the start. I think this is activity is as fun as you make it.. it really is a recipe for a great day out.. they taught us about spices with blind smell tests.. showed us the differences between real saffron and the not so real stuff. we then made our own breads, pancakes.. and of course our tagines, at the end we all sat down as a group and ate. I don't want to spoil the fun too much so i won't tell you anymore.. but this is an absolute must if your in marrakech, its a great day out, its a great way to meet people, and its bloody good value for money!! Michel and all his staff we met were second to none, he runs a very tight ship, everything was clean neat and tidy. I will be returning back to do this again on my Next trip to Marrakech. I also wish to point out that my dish was slightly better than my girlfriends and now she is on dishes for the rest of the holiday. this activity comes with my highest recommendation A++++++++++Thankyou Michel and your team for a great great day out. - Shaun & Erina : )

Tasty Treat. What a wonderful day, me and my partner had cooking and learning about Moroccan cuisine. Our host 'Michel' was fun, knowledgable and helped us relax as we honed our skills making Tagines and bread. The surroundings are fabulous and the staff helped us create our very own banquet. A fabulous day out ending with food eaten alfresco. Highly Recommend

Just do it, you wont be disappointed. I cannot recommend this highly enough. A fabulous day away from the craziness of Marrakech, however there was a little craziness from Michel, but his personality made the day, he was brilliant host, who was funny, friendly and full of stories. I booked our visit last minute by email at 10.30 the night before as we knew the weather was going to be a bit rainy. Michel emailed back promptly and confirmed pick up details near to our Riad for 9.30 the next morning. It was also a taxi drive where you didn't feel you were going to die before you got there!At first, my partner did not intend to cook, and Michel said it would be fine for him to pay a small amount to eat with us, however when we arrived there were children and families cooking, that he decided to partake in the activities and he was pleased he did. The building was spotlessly clean, and was very well organised with preparation happening seamlessly. This is a cooking workshop that is fun and relaxed and for all abilities with Chef Nezha. I was surprised just how much the "non foodie" partners and children enjoyed it. The food we cooked, and subsequently ate as a group was devine, probably the tastiest we ate whilst in Marrakech! We met some lovely people in our group, which also gave us chance to swap tips and ideas for our stay in Marrakech. I honestly cant think of anything I would suggest to improve the day, it was just perfect.

Highly recommended... !!. Faim d'Espices was a fabulous cooking course! A lovely set up with Michel making you very welcome. Picking us up at the hotel and dropping us off again was very reassuring and took any pressure off the day. It is a full day from 0930-1800 which includes travel time and traffic. The whole day was relaxing and calm and great fun. It doesn't matter what level of cook you are this course is for everyone! We learnt alot about spices and how to use them more effectively aswell as discovering some traditional Moroccan dishes. We have done some organised visits to places of interest in Marrakesh but this experience really topped off our trip... The setting, the welcome, the cooking and food was awesome and we have no hesitation in recommending anyone to book! It was great value at £40 pp and very easy to book from the UK with excellent e-mail communication from Michel.... 'Make sure you try their wonderful Olive Oil'... We have some packed !! Thank you to Michel, Nehza and the whole team!

Cooking in Marrakech. I would have no reservation in recommending a day with Michel at Faim d'espices. He was generous, not at all 'on the make' but clearly wanted to share a wonderful experience. The whole day was slick, professional yet relaxed and informative, BUT most of all, fantastic value! My husband and I accepted their package offer of the cookery and spa to follow. It cost us £80 each - fabulous value!!!

A wonderful day's escape from busy Marrakech. If you've been to the museums, palaces and are ready to escape the mopeds and vendors in the Souks, spend the day at Faim d'Epices. They picked us up from our Riad in the morning and drove us out to a lovely farm setting not far from the city. After a welcome mint tea or coffee we started our day of fun and education. Not only did we get to make traditional bread, a fish tajine and crepes, we also learned what to look for when buying spices, how to make some traditional Moroccan salads and how to mince an onion the Moroccan way. Each day a different dish is made so check to see what they are making on the day of the week you choose to go. After we ate our successfully prepared meals we were whisked off to a hammam in the old city. We selected the couples package and were treated to a private hammam, salt scrub, exfoliation and massages. We ended the day relaxed, glowing and well fed. For what we experienced the price was excellent.

Moroccan Cooking Class. I am not a cook, nor do I like cooking. I do like eating and I love my wife who loves cooking. So I, very hesitantly, signed us both up for the Michel's cooking school in Marrakech. It was well worth it. It was fun and I was not bored. My wife considers it the highlight of her trip to Morocco. The staff were very helpful, picking us up at our riad and returning us there. It was great to get out of the city for a day. I highly recommend it, even for those who aren't interested in cooking but especially for those who are.

A must do in Marrakech. You will certainly not be disappointed if you opt to take a cookery class at Faim d'Epices. Michel is a fantastic host and Nezha a very capable teacher and communicator. The day was relaxed with lots of opportunity to learn, but also to just enjoy doing something different and share the time with like minded people from all over the world. I took my eleven year old son for the day, he throughly enjoyed the experience and it was a highlight of the trip for us both. Nothing was too much trouble and from collection to drop off it was very professional. My only tip would be to consider bringing a snack, as lunch is served about mid afternoon - as you have to make it first!

The best day....... We had one of our best days in Marrakesh here, it was so calm and relaxing and we had a great time cooking, laughing with the others in the group and cooking, obviously! They were very accommodating (although a little perplexed!) by the fact I was a vegetarian and even prepared some special vegetarian recipes for me to take home The day began by Michel picking us up, laughing at Moroccan road safety skills and enjoying (relatively) calm drive about 20 mins out of the centre where we were staying. The setting of this cookery course was our on the outskirts of the centre and was a purpose built building in lots of (olive?) orchards. The course lasted almost all day, with lots of activities such as spice tasting and bread and salad making, in addition to the main meal we were preparing. After all was prepared, we had a lovely group meal outside in the sunshine. Food was plentiful and it was possibly the only place we purchased something in Marrakesh without being hassled and over charged - in fact we brought most of our gifts for those back home here.

Amazing Day at Faim d'Epices. From start to finish, this day was a perfect getaway from the city centre, and a great way to really appreciate Moroccan cuisine. Starting with a pick-up by Michel at our hotel, we went out to the Faim d'Epices and had a great day meeting new people, making traditional foods such as bread, tajines, salads, etc. We also had tutorials in spices, which was actually as fun as it was informational, and we ended with eating out creations, which were abosolutely delicious. I recommend coupling this full day event with the spa package at Mythic Oriental Spa, and it will be a day that you will not forget. Merci Beacoup Michel and staff!!!

The perfect introduction to Moroccan cuisine and its spices involving a lot of fun :). Definitely one of the highlights of my trip to Marrakech, the day I spent at Faim d'épices was at the same time entertaining, relaxing and funny....and I learnt a lot!I was lucky to be in a small group (altogether 5 people including me) of very funny people who were genuinely interested in knowing more about Moroccan cuisine and its spices.Michel, the host, and Nezah, the chef and teacher, were absolutely great and made us feel very well during the whole day. Thanks a lot for this!Even before getting there I was impressed by the service: not only did they answer very quickly to all my e-mails, but Michel also asked me if I preferred a vegetarian version, if I had any allergies, etc. I found this very professional.Transport from (and back to) your accomodation to the farm where the course takes place is included in the price. I booked the combined offer with Mythic Oriental Spa, so I was brought there upon completion of the course.We had a very interesting workshop on Moroccan spices, where we had to smell the spices without seeing them and had to guess what spices they were. We had several cooking demonstrations and also prepared several dishes and everything was so delicious. I fell so much in love with the tajine that I even decided to buy a small tajine in the shop.I would love to visit again and try more dishes :)

A genuine host & fun cooking!. Away from the hustle and bustle of the Medina, we ended up doing this tour as part of a spa/cooking package which was a great deal and the perfect day to spend a day in Marrakech with 2 wonderful things Morocco has to offer (but often comes in a pushy touristy form) - Food and some pampering. This was hassle-free, relaxing, and simply delightful. We made wonderful lamb tagine with plums and almonds, bread accompanied by Michel on the drums. Thank you guys for a wonderful time.

Banging Beef Tagine!. After having desperately tried to make tagines at home, I thought it best to go right to the source. Off to Marrakech to learn the art of Tagine. Faim d'Epices was a great day experience with friendly staff and a deliciously cool environment, away from the hustle and bustle of the medina. To start we had a quiz to get our spicey senses tingling. Fake ray bans in abundance, with lenses blacked out, we began learning all the different spices by smell. From that we moved on to making bread (the morrocan way), simmering a sumptuous beef tagine and folding sweet pancakes into squares for dessert. We were shown how to rustle up salads and present them to our future guests.We enjoyed our meal with Michel the founder of the cookery centre, washing down the tagine with a cup of red wine on the house. Delicious. All in all, it was a great day out and I feel confident that I could reproduce this style of cusine at home for friends and family to all enjoy my new found culinary skills!

Memorable, authentic experience. If you want to experience something different from Marrakech medina but still very Moroccan, this is what you need. We booked a package of spa (in Mythic Spa, which we also very good) and cooking class package, and it was really nice day out from central Marrakech. It is a short drive away from the old part of town, situated right next to lemon, olive, orange trees. Very peaceful.On top of making Moroccan bread, tagine, pancakes and subsequently well-deserve lunch time under the sun, Michel and team are very enjoyable company, knowledgable, and FUN. We were non-stop laughing whole day and got along very well with two other girls we never met before.Great atmosphere, great fun. Highly recommended.

Faim d'Epices cookery class. We booked the cookery class in conjunction with a hammam spa package at Mythic Oriental Spa and it was an amazing day for myself and my partner.We truly enjoyed our day at Michel's cookery school - it was brilliantly organised with a pick up from our riad and then a drop off at the spa later in the day, a great lesson on spices, oils and flavours and most importantly, cooking our own tagines and learning how to make Moroccan salads, bread and crepes. We got to eat our creations outside with Michel and the other members of the group which was a perfect way to end the class. We were presented with the recipes and on returning home Michel emailed us our 'certificate', photos from the day and other recipes he uses in his class.A brilliant and worthwhile trip, I would recommend this to anyone looking for a day to spend escaping the craziness of Marrakech.

a wonderful expericence.... We booked this class on the last day of our 7 days trip in Morocco. I must say we saved the best for last! Located outside of Marrakesh, it was the perfect to get away from the pollution and the noise. Plus, the class is very well organized and enjoyable, The host Michel is fantastic, pleasant and entertaining. I was very happy to learn more about the spices and the oils in Morrocco. Learning to cook had never been this fun!

Spice up your life!. Our day with Faim d'Espice was great, and a very relaxing and fun thing to do at the end of a hectic week in Morocco. I would strongly recommend it. All thanks to Michel and Nezha, we can now make some seriously tasty food now that we are back home.Michel was an excellent host, who put the whole group at ease straight away and continued to entertain us throughout the day. The whole thing was well planned, so after Nezha had got us started on making batbout stove top bread, Michel then gave us a blindfolded spice lesson whilst the dough was proving. He taught us all about the spice combinations that are used in Moroccan food, but also passed on some practical tips like how to identify real saffron and Argan oil, rather than the stuff usually found in the souks. Nezha then expertly got on with the serious business of teaching us how to cook in the tagine. By lunchtime we had successfully made a very tasty lamb dish with prunes and almonds and my husband had cooked a layered vegetarian tagine. She had also demonstrated how to make 3 salads including a sweet one made with cucumber and orange flower water. We also tried our hand at preparing moroccan flaky layered pancakes called Msemen, which were later served to us with home made gingerbread ice cream. Everything we tried was delicious, and I feel confident I can attempt to recreate the dishes now I'm home, as the explanations were all very clear and straightforward. We were given a recipe to take home, but I've also since been emailed more to try, and some photos of the day too. So, if you are considering doing this and think it sounds pricey, I can tell you that it was money well spent, and in my opinion good value for money. The price includes transport to and from the farm on the outskirts of Marrakesh, large quantities of food, and lots of little extras too.

Absolute highlight. Cannot praise this experience highly enough. If you have a spare day in Marrakech and love food, then I do recommend you book a day here. Price includes collection from and return to your Riad, lots of fun making bread, preparing and eating your own tagine, making pancakes, eating it all outside on the sunny terrace beside the orange (?) groves, and not least seeing a bit of real Moroccon culture putside the city.I love food but not particularly the cooking of it - I couldn't have enjoyed this day more. Absolute highlight of our trip.

I can cook tagine!. Faim d'epice was a wonderful way to spend a day in Marrakesh. The school is just out of Marrakesh city and has has been built in a grove of lemon and olive trees. From Michael's welcoming mint tea and spice lessons to our fabulous instructor who patiently and expertly taught us how to make bread, pear tagine and pastry dessert it was a colour and flavour filled day.

Moroccan Cooking with Nezha. Jacqueline from our Riad Samsara recommend L'atelier Faim d'Epices and we weren’t disappointed. From the first engagement over email Michel, was very prompt with responses and made booking a day’s Moroccan course very simple and easy. We were picked up as planned by the driver along with other keen cooks, to the premises where we met Michel and our very special teacher Nezha. She was always smiling and loved teaching others how to cook. Which shined throughout the day. Thank you Nezha. Michel greeted us with Moroccan tea, explained the day, we got to know each other and the day began. We learnt about different spices, how to cook breakfast, beef and pear tagine, salads and finished off with a lovely dessert as a treat for all of us. I would recommend Michel and Nezha to anyone visiting Marrakech and looking to learn how to cook Moroccan food!

Fun filled day !!. Michel is a wonderful host, and very entertaining. Learning about the spices and focusing more around the technique used to make Moroccan food rather than the ingredients ensures that you're paying attention to being able to recreate those wonderful dishes once you're home. If you like to eat, and want to learn how to make it, this is definitely the place to do it at. I only wished we had enough time to learn a few more things.

Best Day in Marrakech. A must do when in Morocco.Faim d'Epices takes you on a journey of senses, smells and flavours.Greeted by an animated Michel whose love for the Moroccan cuisine is infectious.From a spice smelling competition which creates a fun and entertaining atmosphere to the professional education on creating your own bread and tagine leads you with one of the most entertaining and enjoyable days.If that is not enough you have demonstrations on how to make crepes and Moroccan salads.You finish with a Grand Banquet with leaves all your senses stimulated.Dont forget to dance and sing when Michel plays his drums for you.Thank you again to Michel and his crew for a Memorable day.

A Cookery Class ++. Learning how spices are used in Moroccan cooking and being shown how to make - and actually making - a tagine dish added an extra dimension to our visit to Marrakech . . . and Morocco. From the moment we were picked up at our hotel to the time we were returned we were thoroughly absorbed and entertained and guided in the ways and means of Moroccan food and cooking. And what's more we got to eat what we cooked plus a lot more besides. This worked out to be the best meal we had in Morocco. Just the best way to spend day if you have any interest at all in Moroccan food . . . . actually it's great way of spening a day even if you haven't.

great place to get a break from the pollution and noice. We had so much fun at the 'faim d'Epice' Altho initially sounds a little overprized from the morrocan standard, but i have to say it's worth it!!! We stayed in Morocco for a week, and we saved this as our last day activity. If you are tired of being followed and sick of the pollution and disorder of the city, this is great place to relax, exchange, to learn about the essential cultural part of Morroco through food and cooking! Michel is very funny, thanks to him that i finally realised that, Relax, i am on vacation, despite the craziness of this city! I will definitely recommend this workshop!

had a relaxing yet fun day. had a half day cooking class at Faim d'Epices. It is 15 mins drive away from the city center. It is away from the busy hassle and bustle medina. You need this quiet time after 3 days fighting in the souk. :) Michel is a good host. He talked about the different spices and we made bread (hand-on), tajine and crepe. We had a lot of fun. I would totally recommend it to anyone.

Marrakech day out. Well if you are looking for a day out and like cooking, this is a must. Not only do you get to cook a great meal, you get to experience a master chef at work and cook yourself. Thank you so much Michel and Nezha for a fab day, tips and the comedy. The Tagine we bought from your shop, got home in one piece.

Best day of our trip!. We stayed in Marrakesh in September and after reading great reviews we booked the cooking/spa day.Well we can honestly say its was the best day of the holiday! Michelle was a fantastic host, entertaining and knowledgeable. We had a blind spices session where we had to guess the spices and then were given very useful information about them.The cooking session was amazing, well taught and suitable for any level cook. and wow the food was amazing! definatly the best we had in Marrakesh (if i do say so myself!)We got to eat outside in the beautiful garden and throughout the staff were so hospitable. the group we were with were lovely and the whole experience so so good, i wished we had returned a few more times.After we went to the spa, as part of the package. Again, the staff were fantastic and my skin never felt so good! me and my husband left feeling the most relaxed we had ever felt, it was hard to leave, was too relaxed!Overall, i would highly recommend to everyone and well done Michelle and rest of staff for getting everything perfect!

a lovely and educational day outside marrakech. Spending the day at Faim d'Epices was a perfect respite from the madness of Marrakech. Michel was hospitable and chaleureux and the cooking instructor Nezha was clearly very skillful but always helpful and easy to follow. We were really pretty proud of our couscous with vegetables! They've created a really lovely environment and program and our afternoon at Faim d'Epices is one of the best memories of our trip.

Awesome!. We spent our last day in Morocco (of a ten day visit) at Faim d'Epices and we loved it! The staff are so wonderful, experienced, and knowledgable. We loved the part about the spices- very informative and fun because you play "guess the spice game"! The food was yummy and having a glass of wine was a beautiful touch.Thank you to Michel and his team!Go! You will not be disappointed. Oh, and it is very affordable!

A must do in Morocco. The cooking school was a highlight of our trip. We did the cooking school on the last day, which was a really nice way to end the trip. The host Michel was very friendly and made sure the day was an experience to remember. It was great to learn how to make the Tajine, flat bread and the salad we had been enjoying on our travels. The course was very hands on and fun. You learn to cook interesting dishes that are easy to recreate at home.

Great culinary experience. L'atelier Faim d'Epices is a fantastic cooking experience and a great way to learn about Moroccan food and spices. I walked away with the confidence to cook Moroccan food at home. The tagine we made was so easy to prepare and tasted fantastic. Also it was so nice to make fresh bread! Michel our host was excellent, generous and very welcoming. His spice appreciation class was informative and very funny. I will never forget sniffing spices while wearing purple sunglasses! Eating the finished meal overlooking the farm was lovely. It was a really wonderful culinary experience in one of the world's most fascinating cities. The only reason I'm not giving it and 'Excellent' rating is that I had trouble seeing some of the cooking demonstrations in the bar area. But I'm short so for most people this wouldn't be problem.

Food for Thought!. Upon our arrival in the majestic city of Marrakech, me and my girlfriend agreed on a trade-off - one day we go with her request to visit an authentic and luxurious Moroccan spa for a hammam and massage treatment (we did, at the breathtaking Palais Rhoul), but on another we embark on trying our hands at another of Morocco's great traditions - its cooking.As a guy who is into his home cooking, this looked an ideal opportunity to hone in on my skills with Moroccan cuisine. To be honest, making a Moroccan meal is one of my weak links as the kitchen goes - I have not attempted any Moroccan dishes for about three years, when I prepared a dinner that tasted more like Stollen. But with lamb in it.Despite being rather apprehensive over this excursion out of the hubbub and into a farm in the middle of nowhere, my girlfriend really started to enjoy herself very quickly. Everyone else in our nine-strong group of aspiring Jamies and Nigellas were all very friendly, with everyone embracing what was an out-of-the-box activity for each of us.The course is hosted by an eccentric and dry-witted Parisian called Michel, who in his expressions or mannerism, could have passed as a Jose Mourinho impersonator (well, in his own words, "for a small fee"). He made all the cooks feel at ease with the preparation process. One of the highlights of the day was Michel's blind ingredient test, where the entire party donned darkened "Ray-Ben" shades and tried to identify key spices, herbs and fruits symbolic with Moroccan cuisine.The cooking itself was carefully taught by a Moroccan chef called Nisa, who demonstarted how to prepare regional crepes, salad and bread (the latter of which we all then tried our hands at ourselves), as well as the star attraction - a Lamb & Prune Tagine. After all our individual tagines and breads had been cooked by each member of the group, we all basked in the sun in the giant garden outside and enjoyed our creations with a well-earned glass of wine. Michel then presented us with everyone with a couple of fantastic farewell surprises.An amazing experience - great fun was had by everyone, and best of all, I feel I can now confidently cook a Moroccan lamb without making it taste like Christmas cake.

A Perfect End to our Moroccan Experience. This truly was one of the best experiences I had in Morocco. My partner and I were met in Marrakesh town centre to be driven in the mini bus just outside of Marrakesh. The course was held in a well maintained clean building, with the charm of a vegetable garden in the grounds. We were greeted by a charming French man who spoke perfect English and offered us a coffee. We then proceeded to me taught about all the different spices used in Moroccan cookery. I won't give too much away- but it was interactive!During the day we were taught how to make bread, Moroccan pancakes and three different salads. The main attraction however was of course the cooking of the tagine. Our Moroccan teacher then talked us through the making of a salmon tagine which was delicious (even if I do say so myself!). We enjoyed the tagine sat outside in the sunshine.The whole affair was very relaxed and welcoming. Couldn't have asked for more.Many thanks Michel- you really made our holiday that bit more special.

Excellent cooking class - a must do in Marrakech. We went on a sunday to try moroccan cooking particularly tagine. The whole experience was amazing. From the hands on and easy to follow cooking class, the spice test and learn, the constant tea and coffee, and the super warm hospitality of Michel and the staff. The whole experience took about 5 hours including travel time with an over-all relaxed pace. We learned about daily life and food in Morocco from Michel which was interesting. After preparing the food- salad, bread and tagine the lunch was perfect as we were able to eat our tagines :-) we had wine and a trio of unique ice cream for dessert which was pretty fantastic. We also bought some safron and spices but without any hassling from the staff. Michel even gave us moroccan spice mix to go for free. Highly recommended!

Lovely afternoon. I was a solo traveler and found Faim d'Epices on tripadvisor. It was clearly very well reviewed and for good reason. I was picked up promptly at the said location, drive was probably 30-40 minutes to their location. Once there, everything was very well organized, informative and fun. I thoroughly enjoyed the experience, and would definitely recommend it. The class was fairly full, and the other people were all wonderful. The food i actually prepared was delicious as we all ate on the terrace after the food was all ready. I coupled the day with the spa services at Mythic Spa - also worth it. The hammam and massage was top notch. Great day.

Definitely a must for Marrakech!. As a keen cook I couldn't wait to drag my partner along to this full day experience (we booked as part of the cooking and hammam package), and we were not disappointed. Even my partner had a cracking time and could not recommend this enough. The food we made was fantastic, all out with the hustle bustle, and smell, of the medina! Michel was an excellent host, and nisa, was the excellent cook! They made a great team.We were catered for all day and michel frequently told us to make ourselves at home!He has a great sense of humour, so don't believe him when he tells you the toilet is at the end of the garden, and he made us feel extremely comfortable during our time!We would most definitely book this again if we came back to morocco, you most certainly get what you pay for and all the surprise extras made the day completely unforgettable! A must do for Marrakech!!!

Never knew tagine was so easy. What a day! Michel is a great host and the class was great. Well structured - free collection/drop-off, spice class and lots of demo. We made bread, lamb tagine and dessert, with demo as to how to make 3 salads. The whole day is very relaxed, with time to get to know each other. What I would offer is have a good breakfast as we didnt sit down to eat until just after 2 and God, were we ready to eat! Perhaps that's the secret to the success?

cooking class at Faim d'Epices. Really enjoyed my experience at Faim d'Epices and highly recommend it. Perfectly articulated introduction to the foundations of Moroccan cooking. The class was structured to appeal to both the novice and the more experienced cook by presenting the techniques in a friendly, encouraging manner with humor and lots of backround information on the ingredients most common to Moroccan dishes. The anecdotal way Michel presented the spice lesson was both informative and engaging. Ending the afternoon with an al fresco luncheon comprised of the dishes we'd made ourselves was a perfect cap. I'm looking forward to recreating the chicken tagine for my friends… once my preserved lemons are ready!

Spicey experience. What a great day learning about all the Moroccan spices and how to cook an amazing tagine of Beef, caramelised orange and pears plus bread, salads and crepes. Thanks Michel and the team for a fantastic day! Now I know how to buy the best saffron in any market. This is a must-do experience in Marrakesh!!

Fabulous.. My day at the cooking school was the best day I had in Marrakech. Michel was a truly wonderful host, so welcoming and instantly putting us all at ease. The day is well organised with free collection and return from my hotel. I booked the hotel in conjunction with the Mythic Oriental Spa hammam deal and found this to be excellent value. The hammam after the cooking school was exquisite and truly refreshing and relaxing after a hard days cooking!! I was escorted directly to the spa from the cooking location and the whole day was a breeze. Even though I chose to do it as a lone woman I felt safe and cared for and had an absolute blast learning to cook tradition tagine, bread, salad and crepes. The recipes and spices that I were given to bring home were a wonderful gift that I will treasure and use for many years to come. I would recommend this day trip to every single person who goes to Marrakech, you will not be disappointed.

Learning can be such fun. Just returned from a fun-filled day of cookery with Michel (and my wife). Thought I had a good nose for spices but it seems not. We were picked up from our Riad at 09.30 and dropped back at 18.00. A full day has never passed so quickly. As well as a blind sniffing experience we learnt and made bread, fish tangine and crepes and also watched 3 salads being prepared. We then sat down for a leisurely meal, Al Fresco on a shady patio overlooking olive and lemon trees. I'm still smiling. Would recommend highly and would be fun for kids older than 12 too.

Fantastic Experience. Me and my wife had a fantastic experience as I had no cooking experience they really took there time with me. I hadn't tasted real Morrocan food until I learnt how to cook my own at the L'atelier Faim d'Epices. Michael is a fantastic host who really knows his stuff. We were picked up and dropped off at our hotel. We booked the combined cooking and spa deal which was an amazing value considering what's included and we were the only ones there. Overall me and my wife had fantastic time at the L'atelier Faim d'Epices.

Entertaining, informative, fun.. Well organized, informative, fun. The technical level is relatively basic and the cooking part proceeds gently; on the other hand it is a very good introduction to an unfamiliar cuisine and manages to cater to those who cant peel a spud properly without patronizing anyone, by means of emphasizing what is particular to Moroccan cooking. Recommended for most levels of cook. Don't be afraid if youve hardly ever cooked anything before and you won't be bored if you are a family & friends dinner party type cook looking to expand your horizons.

Nice moroccan experience. We were trying to find an activity to escape the 45ºc in Marrakech, Faim d'epice was a good surprise. They pick you up in the Medina, then take you to the atelier, Michel is and excellent host and the chef was excellent too. We really enjoy our day at faim d'epices cooking a traditional couscous.Be careful with your timing, they say it finishes at 4:00pm but this is Moroccan time, so you can easily add an extra hour! The last hour was quiet stressful for me, knowing that I was going to be late to pick up my kids!

Great expierence. My boyfriend and I visited the cooking class during August and it was a wonderful experience! Michel made our day - he was a wonderful host and made us feel welcomed and completely relaxed! We were the only ones there because the other couple dropped out and it was great! We were picked up from our hotel (which was wonderful as we were not in the city centre) and spent the day learning about Moroccan cooking - breads, tajine, salads, spices and pancakes and everything tasted great! Michel was very accommodating to our every need! I do not eat fish and it was no trouble to change my tajine to a vegetable one. I cannot express how great the day really was - book for yourself and find out!Michel and his team really do deserve all the wonderful reviews on here - incredible experience : D

Lamb tagine heaven!. I took my second class with Faim d'Epices with my cousin in July and it was definitely one of the highlights of our trip to Morocco. We were picked up and had a comfortable ride to the workshop site and upon arrival we had some tea and got to know the other participants and then began our cooking extravaganza. Michel and his staff were so delightful and knowledgeable and the tagines, bread and salads we prepared were as good as I've had in any restaurant in Morocco.I can't wait to go back and take the couscous class and highly recommend this course to anyone!

What more needs to be said?!. I can think of nothing to add to the hundreds of excellent reviews already written! Other than to say that it was a magnificent day, with wonderful hosting from Michel and easily the highlight of our holiday. Do not hesitate to book a place; I guarantee you won't be disappointed. Go on.... what are you waiting for?!

'Must-do' Marrakech experience. I went to a cookery day with Faim d'Epices with my 2 teenagers. We had a fab day, really enjoyed the flamboyant approach from Michel, the owner -he does it all with some style! We learned a lot: there was a spices masterclass, we learned to bake bread, prepare salads and a delicious lamb tajine : and then we ate it all. It was the highlight of our trip to Marrakech - and my teens loved it too. There are lots of cookery classes on offer in Marrakech - but this was really personal and we didn't feel as though we were on a conveyor belt. Michel and his team make it fun and lively day -highly recommended! Can't wait to try my recipes now I'm back home,

Interesting, entertaining fun filled day!. After having to reschedule our day at Faim d'Epices due to illness, we were picked up at Jemaa el Fna square by our cheery driver. Upon meeting Michel, his passion for this project was clear and because it was low season and Ramadan, we had the place to ourselves. Michel was an entertaining and informed host and the spice sniffing was particularly intriguing. The cooking experience was fantastic and Nezha made everything look so easy. Me and my wife had great fun trying to outdo each other. Michel joined us whilst we were sitting down having lunch and it was delicious. A fantastic discovery and we took this deal along with the spa deal which I will write about separately. Michel, well done on delivering a unique and educational experience!!

Excellent value for money!. At 50 euros per person, this experience proved to be excellent value for money.Safe transport to and from hotel doorstep, a welcoming friendly and accomodating host, a beautiful space to cook/learn, a knowledgable and friendly chef, refreshments of mint tea, coffee, water, fresh orange juice (and wine) served throughout the day, an engaging spice masterclass, the chance to learn how to make your own tangine, bread and pancakes, demonstrations in how to make salads and pastries, a delicious lunch, a lovely shop with items to buy under no pressure whatsoever and photos/recipes/spices/certificates provided at the end of the day. We had an absolutely amazing time, I can't recommend it enough.

Great activity. This cooking class was very pleasant. It is interesting to learn about the culture trough food and to understand what you really eat. The crew is very friendly, and they give you every thing you need to succeed. We were actually in the ramadan and it didn't affect the quality of the activity. I also recommend this to everyone, regardless of wether you have experience or not.

A wonderful way to spend a day in Marrakech. When I traveled to Marrakech with my friends, we had wanted to take cooking classes. A few years earlier we had taken a week long course in french cooking in Provence and wanted to have another wonderful cooking experience together. We decided not to take a full week cooking course as we had before as also wanted to explore Morocco as well. I was very happy to find Faim d'Epices. We had a great day and enjoyed everything from the time we were picked up.The blind spice smelling challenge was very interesting and a great way to start the day. The chef who explained how to make the food was very clear and very helpful. We each made our own tagine and all were delicious. They were very helpful and helped me make a vegetarian tagine as everyone else made one with lamb. Everything was very tastey and the whole experience fun.We also went to the hammam they have a partnership with - after the cooking class. We also had a great experience there. It was a perfect day!

Favourite day of our holiday. I cannot recommend this day highly enough.We were picked up by a Faim d'Espices member of staff in a clearly marked van (which was wonderfully air-conditioned), and transported to the farm,which is just outside of Marrakech. What struck me first was the open plan building, which has been modified for purpose. It is an absolutely gorgeous space, very bright and airy. They grow all their own produce there, including veg and spices. We were greeted by Michel, the owner, and given mint tea and coffee. Michel then took us through a spice demonstration, where you do a blind smelling quiz. My partner was so much better than me, but it was very interesting, and charming.We were taught how to make 3 different Moroccan salads, square pancakes, bread and a fish tagine. We ate them all, after an incredibly relaxing day- delicious.The lovely Nezha is great teacher, who is very patient, and obviously very skilled (she said that she learnt first from Mum, then studied). I was extremely impressed with her. Michel made the day for us, which was casual and fun. He left Paris after realising one day that he wasn't happy. I admire his courage, and from a purely selfish perspective, am very pleased that he did. What a great day.If you are considering having a cookery lesson in Marrakech, please pick this one. It is organic, clean, welcoming and above all else tasty! Thank you.

a fun day out!. we love to cook, all things food and when we travel, we learn about the culture through food. marrakech was no different. thanks to lisa at Dar Charkia's recommendation, we booked in for a cooking class. we were collected from our riad and driven to the farm/cooking school. very friendly welcome. blind spice "tasting" was interesting and educational. i was so hungry during our preparation and cooking...was ready to eat the food we had just made. at the end of the class, we gather together and eat. husband and i agreed was best food we had during our stay! the school was beautifully presented and the teacher was very sweet.

Yummy way to spend a day in Marrakech!. We knew that we wanted to sign up for a cooking class before our arrival in Marrakech, but did not get a chance to do any research or book a class in advance. Fortunately, the owner of the Riad where where we were staying (Riad Cherrata) knew just where to send us and she was able to contact Michel to make all of the last minute arrangements for us. Michel picked us up right from the Riad in the Medina and drove us to Faim d'Epices. From beginning to end, the cooking lesson was a lot of fun and very informative. We enjoyed the spice lesson, cooking tips, meeting other travel and tagine enthusiasts, and of course, the food. The lamb tagine we made in the class ranked among the best tagines we tried in Marrakesh (and we tried quite a few). Michel was a great and humorous host. The cooking lesson at Faim d'Epices was one of the highlights of our trip to Marrakech. We would highly recommend a visit to Faim d'Epices to others visiting Marrakech.

Highlight of the trip. A cooking class at Faim d'Epices is well worth it! The food is delicious, the instructor is excellent and you learn about the spices and ingredients that are used in the cooking. It is also lovely to sit down together and eat what you have cooked afterwards. Highly recommended!

Great experience. The cooking lesson was not only fun but highly informative. The class is very well constructed, with anybody, at any level of skill being able to take something useful and interesting. Everybody will have fun. I particularly liked Michel's lesson on spices, he gave some great tips on how to tell the quality of expensive spices, such as saffron, amongst others. The actual class had great variety, we not only made a traditional tagine (vegetarian option also available), but we also learnt how to make a variety of traditional breads and Moroccan salads. I definitely recommend this experience.

Never had so much fun in a kitchen!. Had a real giggle with Michel and emerged a tagine expert! For someone who has a reputation for being impossibly clumsy in the kitchen, this course was both educational, fun and delicious!!!

A fantastic family day. Collected from hotel by Michel for a drive across the cityArrived at the school which is spacious and well laid out we were introduced to the other two parties that were participating all very friendly and good funI was a little apprehensive as our children aged 8 & 9 had never experienced anything like this before.The staff were fantastic The food was fantastic expertly coached through every procesWhen complete we all sat and devoured our efforts washed down with tasty moroccan wine.

Not to be Missed!. From the moment we were collected from our hotel, we could tell immediately we had made the right decision to book online with Faim d'Epices. The friendly French man, Michel, whom we had read so much about in previous reviews was just as described and helped to set the ambience for what was truely a wonderful experience. The course which was fully booked was fun, lied back, fun, informative, fun and easy to follow even for our 12 year old daughter who despite finding it a chore to boil the kettle at home, was so excited, especially as we had a competitive theme going with the bread making. Incidentally, my husband's bread was superb, closely followed by my daughters, much to her delight! The format of the day was well structured and included a selection a items to do, view and comment on. The 'blind' spice smell test was good fun as was sitting with the group eating our efforts at the end of the session. Incidentally the outside temperature on the day was 48 degrees, however inside in the beautiful, immaculate kitchen it was very comfortable. I would strongly recommend this activity to anyone who wants to try something different in an informal atmosphere who is happy to partake, get their hands dirty and have lots of fun. What an excellent, excellent day for families, couples or solo travellers - thank you to Michel and his team.

Can't cook won't cook... Until now!. What a brilliant time we all had learning about Moroccan cooking.A great class with great teachers. Our host Michal was as mad as a box of frogs which made the whole experience immensely enjoyable!There were 11 people in the class, and at one point we were all dancing around to music while we made our bread!We had mint tea on arrival and coffee before we left. And in between we cooked bread and a chicken tagine which we all ate together around well set tables.There were also demonstrations on how to make salads and flat pastry, and and introduction to Moroccan spices.I thoroughly recommend this to anyone visiting Marrakech.

Wonderful Experience. The overwhelming number of 5 star reviews that L'atelier Faim d'Epices gets speaks for itself. It was excellent from start to finish.I wont repeat everything that has already been said but would say that whilst my wife does not cook at all, I love cooking and we both thoroughly enjoyed the day and learnt new skills that we will put to good use. It really is accessible to anyone. There were two young girls age 7 and 9 on our course. As well as putting us to shame with their knowledge of the spices, they were able to follow all the recipes and, like everyone there, cooked up some fantastic food.Michel is a wonderful host and his enthusiasm is contagious.I have my spices and preserved lemons at the ready for my camping trip to Spain next week!

PLEASE GO HERE ON YOUR HOLIDAY!. Myself and my boyfriend chose to do the Faim d'espices and Mythic oriental spa deal on our week stay in Marrakech....it was the BEST CHOICE we made for our holiday! We just clicked onto www.faimdepices.com and gave Michel a quick email to make our arrangements. He was fantastic and emailed us back the very next day asking our preferences and making sure we understood the itinary for the day. The actual class is incredible and they really pull out all the stops to make it as personal as possible and they add a lot of sweet little touches (such as giving you the recipes at the end all tied up in a scroll) that made this experience incredible. I do just have to give a HUGE thankyou and a lot of admiration to Nezha the chef- what talent! She made it look so easy and yet ensured that she helped you to make yours just as good. Thankyou so much to everyone at faim d'espices- you made morocco my absolute favourite cultural destination! i learnt so much information and culture in just one day, you couldnt ask for better :)

all's well that ends well. or a comedy of errors?. this was one of the very few things i booked before our trip. i chose it primarily because of the 'package' offer with the mythic oriental spa. our riad confirmed the booking, and the pick-up, two days before. they kindly gave us instruction and marked the place on the map. we arrived 10 minutes ahead of time, and waited for 50 minutes. we then returned to our riad. there had, apparently, been several exchanges of calls since we left. a new meeting place was quickly arranged, and we headed off to the post office where we met the pick-up. i was a hot, cross bunny by then.off we went out of the medina and into the countryside, with four other guests. i think the mix worked well - it was a small group and we had some interesting conversations through the day. on arrival at the farm, we were offered coffee and tea, and all sat and had a chat. michel explained the day ahead. we each had our own work station, neatly laid out with ingredients ready weighed and measured. the main dish was cous-cous. it should be noted - cous-cous is the subject on fridays, since it is a typical dish to eat when the family is gathered. much like our 'sunday roast'. i have to confess that cous-cous ranks amonst my least favourite dishes, but i, for other reasons, was limited to doing this on the friday. all other days are tagines. we learned to make cous-cous from scratch, which i did enjoy. it was quite satisfying, if simple, and a reminder of how far our food industry has taken us from our basic staples. i did note that the accompanying recipe sheet said i could buy it in a packet instead..the process involved leaving the grain to rest, or to steam, several times. so, the spice workshop was fitted into these natural breaks. i found the workshop quite interesting, though the teaching methods would win no prizes from modern educationalists! the first rule of training now is 'no tricks, no surprises'. and there were tricks aplenty, and a few surprises.during other breaks to allow the sauce ingredients to cook, we watched a demonstration, and then ate, batbout, a stove-top bread, little yeast-dough pancakes, and two salads. when everything was cooked, we all sat down to eat, and enjoy a glass of wine. after coffee, and more conversation, we set off back into marrakech for our spa appointment.in summary, we enjoyed the day, but there was nothing here to challenge an experienced cook. it was interesting to watch someone cooking in a traditional way, but dicing an onion in my hand is not for me. and we've spent years learning not to over-cook vegetables then these were stewed to annihilation. we were on a trip of ten days. had i been having the more usual four-day mini break, i should not have wished to spend the time on this. the cost and content compares well to similar offerings, there was no hard sell to buy products in the shop, and overall, it was a pleasant way to spend the day.

STARVING FOR MORE SPICES!. I live in Morocco and have eaten tons of Moroccan food, but have not had the opportunity too have things explained to me in the educational and relaxing way that Michael provides. Not only is he multilingual and incredibly aware of the world and all it holds, he is a happy man who exudes this happiness into the experience he offers to travelers. The money is well worth the price of the unforgettable moments you will gather inside your heart and tummy!

the highlight of my trip. we booked a full day course and were delighted with how much fun we had. everything was made easy we were collected from our hotel, and were really well looked after. the staff are brilliant, clearly very knowledgeable but they know how to make things enjoyable. i would highly recommend this course.

The highlight of my stay in Marrakech. Fantastic place, great people, fun half a day! I remembered how much I enjoy cooking.
We made morrocan bread and pancakes, and fish tajine and salads...and then we ate them!

Wish we had done it earlier. We had a great experience at Faim d'Epices. We did our class in English, although I assume we could have done it in French as well.We were picked up near our riad in the medina - there was no confusion as our driver was wearing a Faim d'Epices shirt and the van was clearly marked with their logo.The class is held in a nice, sunny room with huge windows, and went at a relaxed, comfortable pace.We started with a mini-seminar on the spices used in Moroccan cuisine, including how they should smell and how to shop for them. I wish we had had this instruction earlier in our visit, because afterwards I felt a lot more empowered to visit the spice souks and buy the spices we used during the day.We then learned how to cook breads, salads, and of course a delicious tajine. Fresh orange juice and mint tea was served to us throughout. The environment was fun and relaxed, and I felt the team at Faim d'Epices did a good job of delivering the course at a level each person could grasp. An absolute beginner would have a blast at this class, but I also think that the team is so knowledgable, they could definitely discuss the finer points of Moroccan cooking with even the most experienced of chefs.The recipe and ingredients were top notch, and the end result was the best tajine of our visit. When the cooking was done, we enjoyed the fruits of our efforts outside on the patio with a glass of wine. The cost of the class would have been worth it for the meal alone.A great experience. I would recommend anyone visiting Marrakech book with Faim d'Epices. We booked the combination package with the Mythic Oriental Spa, which I also highly recommend doing. The entire day was a great one.

Fantastic day and great value.. Me and my partner visited may 9th 2012 and could not of asked for better we were picked up on time and in the right place which is rare in Marrakech as are riad was hard to find. The course it's self was fun informative and very laid back the staff were great and and even if you knew nothing about cooking they were more than happy to help. I can't really say more than others have we would not have a bad word to say about the day or the host. And as for value for money I would of happily paid more for the day.

A worthwhile day out. Hosted by Michel the charismatic Frenchman, the day was both informative and hands on practical, the team quickly teach the simple skills that are needed for preparing your own Moroccan cuisine once you get home. The premisses are new so very clean and the facilities are all in good order. Our menu covered everything from incredibly tasty salads, hands on bread and tagine making, finishing off with the unique Moroccan pancakes, served with 3 unusually flavoured  homemade spiced ice-creams, all served up at the end on the terrace where the group enjoy the efforts of the days work. A nicely presented printed reminder of the day is given out at the end with all the recipes covered inside. Glad we went.

Best experience in Marrakech. We have just got back from our honeymoon in Morocco and have so many amazing memories. The best experience of the two weeks though was our cookery class at Faim d'Epices. Michel made us feel so relaxed and welcome from the very first moment and ensured the experience was just a lot of fun.There was only one other couple with us (who were lovely) and the whole experience lasted about 6 hours, which was exceptional value for money. We made, breads, pastries and a stunning beef and artichoke tagine (which biastly was the best tasting one I had on our trip).Sitting in the garden afterwards with a glass of wine and eating all of our food we made was fabulous and I could have happily gone back again for another class on the same trip.If you go to Marrakech, you must try this experience!!!! and please do not worry if you can't cook as everything is explained so well and there is always help from Nesha or Michel as you go along. Final thing, don't worry if you burn the bread like me as Michel will help you eat it ; )

Who knew we could cook so well?. Certainly not us but with fantastic guidance from Michel and Nesha we produced a delicious chicken tagine that we will be rolling out now we are back home. This was a most brilliant day from start to finish - Michel really is a star and had us laughing through the day, not to mention teaching us how to identify the different spices. And Nezha - what a cook! Great location away from the hustle and bustle from the city and its a really professional set up - well done Faim d'epices. If you do one thing in Marrakech do this and the Mythic Oriental spa combi day - we loved Marrakech as a result. Thank you to all the Faim d'epices team for making it such an experience.

A really fun and wonderful experience, with a very charming host!!. This was one of the highlights of our trip in Marrakech. The whole thing was incredibly well organised, and we couldn't have asked for a better day out. Our host, Michel (one of the owners), was very charming and funny, and you could tell he had a real passion for what he did. The class was so well organised that you never really felt that you were waiting around for anything, nor did you feel rushed or stressed at any point. Our cooking instructor was very lovely and patient and explained things so well, that even a novice like myself came up with something worth of a Michelin star (if i do say so myself). They bring in only a small group (there were 8 of us including myself and my girlfriend), and they created such a friendly relaxed atmosphere that by the time we got down to eating our meals, we were all chatting and laughing like the best of friends. It's an experience I would highly recommend. To top it all off, we were given the recipes for our meals, and sent very nice pictures and a "certificate" endorsing our new found skills :-) A truly wonderful experience.

a must do trip :). What an amazing trip, I strongly recommend this to anyone who has a spare day or even if you have plans, scarp them and do this experience! The staff are amazing, so kind, and helpful, the chef (Nezha) will assit with any problems you may be having (mine was nearly burning my bread, that will teach me for nosing at the views!)Michel is such a kind and interesting guy, who is a font of knowledge, which I hope to keep in touch with for many years!I have learnt so much about cooking in any style, not just Moroccan, the recipe was a delicious outcome, and look forward to testing the skills learnt at home! :)

Wonderful and super fun experience. We took a long weekend in Marrakech to explore the city, breathe in the culture and of course enjoy their famous cuisine. In spite of having a good Moroccan friend tagging along to show us the best places in Marrakech, it didn't deter us to check out how to make the most of our visit.
