Michel included wine with the meal, which was unexpected, but very welcome. And the chefs also served some a selection of delicious homemade ice cream for desert. More coffee and then copies of the recipes and a complementary bag of spices were handed out, then back to the city. A fantastic way to spend a day and the food was delicious.

great day!. We spent fantastic day at L'atelier Faim d'Epices!!Michel, the owner of the buisness, was extremely nice and taught us a lot of things about cooking and Morocco in general. Great day finished with glass of wine and selfmade tajin at the sunny tarace.

Great cooking experience!. This was a full day experience and lots of fun. They pick you in the morning (@9 - 10am) and then take you back in the afternoon (@ 4 - 5pm) The trip is 15 minutes away from the city center. People are very welcoming and the whole cooking experience is excellent. Reaaly enjoyed it!

Amazing!. I have taken various cooking classes including an Italian cooking class in DC and a French cooking class with the Cordon Bleu in Paris. This was definitely the best cooking class I have ever taken! We had our own stations, nicely set up and really had a chance to understand every aspect of cooking a Moroccan meal. But even more than that, the experience was a lovely relaxing break from the hectic pace of Marrakesh. The farm was lovely, Michel, the owner/manager was very knowledgeable and I learned about Morocco and spices and cooking. A really fun way to spend an afternoon in Morocco. I highly recommend it!

A fantastic way to spend the day. My wife and I really wanted to do a cooking class while we were in Marrakech, but had put off booking one until we got there. Once in Marrakech, we fortunately ran into some other people who had done this class and recommended it to us, and booked it immediately. The class was fantastic. Not only was it fun and educational, but the other people in the class were indcredibly interesting (we are already planning a joint vacation with a couple we met there). Unfortunately our flight was that night, so we were not able to do the spa package, but having done the first part of it, I can say that would be a great way to finish a fantastic day.

Great fun, interesting experience in Marrakesh. We went with our two young adult children, picked up outside our riad by Michel, who spoke our languages, French and English. A half hour trip outside the city, to their new, pleasant one storey, glass walled cooking school. We had fun following their instructions and producing our tagines and crepes and bread. The day was well rhythmed, with cooking, talks about spices, time off in the sun, a common meal with the 8 other students outside. And then a final coffee. I appreciated the sense of giving (with no hidden charges): wine with lunch, coffee at the end. A pleasant day with people who were just looking to make the experience enjoyable, and who succeeded.

Cookery course. Cookery course itself was excellent and the whole family (including our 2 children (8 and 10) thoroughly enjoyed it. It is located about 20 minutes out of the city which gave us a chance to see some more of the Moroccam countryside. The only negative was at the end when the driver who was taking us back to our hotel tried to drop us off further away from our hotel as this was more convenient to his schedule and was not at all happy that we insisted that he drop us off where he picked us up i.e. next to our hotel.

Brilliant day coupled with the Mystic Oriental Spa. Michel picked us up, on time, near our Riad...he made us feel welcome immediately and manoevered his van through the chaos of Marrakech safely and expertly to the destination of the farm 20 minutes away. The blind spice "smell and guess" game was amusing and then the cooking began. As the cooking stations are each for 2 people, it was quite romantic cooking with your other half. The tuition was at a good pace, easy to follow and the results were delicious. We made fish tagine, bread and salad...and enjoyed eating this outside in the sunshine with a glass of wine. Atmopsphere was always relaxed, friendly and jovial. Michel was a great host. Afterwards he took us to the spa which was also fantastic. We have since received photos and "degree" certificate from Michel to remind us of this day. We would definitely recommend doing this activity during your stay in Marrakech, but make sure you book in good time, especially if you want the spa afterwards.

Culinary Delight!. We visited Morocco in October for my birthday and I was definitely not let down by this experience! I loved learning about the different herbs and spices used and the best way to make their delicious cuisine! Michel was an amazing host, full of enthusiasm. A well run business and a hugely enjoyable experience, can't recommend it enough!! Just go.

Wonderful Experience. We had such a great time during the cooking class with Michel. The food was absolutely delicious, we learned a lot about spices and traditional Moroccan food and really enjoyed ourselves. Highly recommended, especially with the partnership with Mythic Oriental Spa - what a wonderful way to relax!

Good day trip from the chaos of Marrakech. Michel and staff offer a relaxing and informative break from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. The cooking course is a good blend of hands on learning and demonstrations. The preserved lemon tajine I made at L'atelier Faim d'Epices was the best I had during my stay in Marrakech. I highly recommend if you are looking for something to do in Marrakech.

Fun, good food, good instruction. We had a group of 11 and were handled very well. From the medina pickup to the introductory tea/coffee to food prep to spice education to cooking to enjoying the meal with our new friends, it was a great day. The staff is very dedicated to the business and the quality of the experience.

Great and fun expereince. It was a really one of the best things we did in Marrakech. It was a fun experience and I am glad that we tried it. Not only you learn to cook a full Moroccan meal (bread, salad, tagine and dessert), but also get to learn all these different spices from Michel. Another great thing is the package includes the transportation. The service was excellent and we had a wonderful time at Faim d'Epices. You will also receive some recipes to bring home! Highly recommended.

Wonderful Cooking Course. Everything about this cooking course was amazing. They picked us up at our Riad in the morning and dropped us off at the end of a fun filled day of cooking. We started with a blind spice test with Michel, the fabulous co-owner. Michel was full of knowledge and incredibly personable, a great person to spend the day with. We learned to make traditional bread with Nezha and chicken lemon tajine. It was delicious! We finished the day in the sun with a glass of wine, traditional Moroccan salads, our own tajine and special homemade ice cream. Simply amazing! When we got home, we received a personalized cooking certificate and pictures of our afternoon at the cooking school. A must do if staying in Marrakech.

Great and fun cooking class, excellent recipes. My wife and I did the cooking class and spa (Mythic Oriental) combo for 1080 dhs per person. Michel was an excellent host. The food we made (chicken tarjine) was one of the best we tasted in Marrakesh. The smelling of spices was very educational. The atmosphere was very relaxed and it was fun meeting other people. Very highly recommended.

Terrific tagines!. We went here as part of a package with the spa and it was a very enjoyable day. It was slick and well-organised and we made a few different dishes. The day was a bit longer than advertised (we finished about 5) and it would have been good for this to be filled with a bit more cooking rather than watching the chef cooking. but other than that, a good time was had by all! Many thanks.

Brilliant Day. I now have a "degree" in Tagine making thanks to our day cooking and eating. great care taken to ensure all is edible. The blind smell testing of spices was fun.I would definately reccomend to anyone.

A true taste of Marrakesh. At a bit of a loss for something to do on our last day in Marrakesh, we found a leaflet for a cookery course. Since it was booked up, our riad manager went online and found Faim d'Épices for us.The day began with a pickup near to our riad. We were slightly startled when a minibus which was obviously full went past us, but then a man approached us and explained that we would be transferred in the Land Rover (we were quite glad of this when it came to going down the somewhat rough road to get to the centre!) On arrival, our first impressions were of a clean, well-equipped and beautifully decorated building, and we were invited to sit down, drink some mint tea and chat with the other people on the course before getting down to work. The day was a mixture of watching demonstrations and doing practical cooking, and the balance seemed perfect. We made 'batbout', the ubiquitous Moroccan bread in stages, first watching a demonstration then progressing to make our own, under the watchful eye of our instructor, who was ready to step in and sprinkle a handful of flour or a little more water in order to rescue our lumpy mush from disaster! The main recipe of the day was a chicken tagine with olives and preserved lemons, and all of the ingredients were prepared and neatly laid out for us: all that was left for us to do was follow the instructions, put them in the tagine, put the lid on and smell the gorgeous aromas... Whilst we waited for them to cook, we had another demonstration, this time of three Moroccan salads, and also learnt to make 'Msemen', breakfast pancakes (which involved us all having a go at rolling and shaping the dough, with varying degrees of success!) Once made, it was time to sample: freshly cooked pancakes with honey and a new product Michel was trialling: cactus flower jam, as well as bread dipped in olive oil from the trees growing outside.Another key part of the day was the spices workshop. Armed with blacked out sunglasses, Michel passed around dishes of typical Moroccan spices, herbs etc. for us to attempt to identify by smell alone. As well as informing us of their culinary uses, we were also treated to interesting facts, such as how to tell if your saffron or argan oil has been bulked out with the addition of other ingredients! By this time, of course, we were quite peckish, and were delighted to be led outside, where a table had been laid on the terrace, complete with wine for those who wanted it and fresh orange juice for those that didn't. Huge bowls of the salads were passed around, along with pickled cactus shoots (an acquired taste, perhaps...). The star attraction was of course our tagines, carefully watched over by our instructor so that they were cooked to perfection. And to finish, a trio of homemade ice creams (mint tea, vanilla and date) served with msemen and fresh fruit, followed by tea or coffee. The food was of course gorgeous, and served in very generous portions. Yet far more important was the friendly and welcoming attitude of everyone at Faim d'Épices, and their attention to detail. Two vegetarians on the course were offered the opportunity to make a vegetable cous cous dish. I was unable to finish my tagine, but they were happy to package the remainder in a tupperware box for me to take away. We were also presented, upon leaving, with a bag of ras-el-hanout (a special Moroccan spice blend: this particular one contained 63 different spices) each, as well as a sheet containing all of the day's recipes. The experience did not end there, however: a few days after returning home we were delighted to receive an email with an attachment containing a large selection of other Moroccan recipes and several photographs taken on the day (someone had even taken the time to pick out the photographs which we were in, rather than sending all of the ones of other people in the group). It is this kind of degree of attention which makes Faim d'Épices stand out. There are lots of courses of this kind in the area, but I doubt that there are any which can surpass Faim d'Épices in terms of the quality (or quanity) of food, the attitude of the people working there or the overall atmosphere. Even the lady who was unfortunately taken ill early on in the day remarked what good care they had taken of her, and how helpful they had been. This course was definitely one of the highlights of our holiday, and I don't doubt that the recipes will become some of our family favourites!

Great fun, Great food, Great atmostphere. I booked this after reading the great reviews. The 4 of us got picked up by Michel from the hotel and there were another 3 people in the car and off we went. After around 30 mins, we arrived at a private house and the cooking area is equipped with AC! Nice and cool inside whilst cooking, warm and sunny outside! Vanessa (review below) was there with us and she pretty much captured everything we did and I agree 100% with her. This is not just a cookery experience, this is a GREAT all-around-taste-of-Marrakech experience. To be honest, there are so many similar experiences out there but Michel's one is the best because he clearly takes care of every single detail to ensure the guests a great time. From the welcoming coffee to the blindfold spice test to the refreshing orange juice midway through our cooking (etc), we felt looked after and not to mention having the chance to acquire a new skill. The best part for me was watching Nezhl (the assistant) cooking and showing us how to make the amazing Marrakech salads, crepes, tagines, bread etc. Afterwards we all ate in the garden and I love, love, love Cous Cous the cat. Everything was amazing. To top this, Michel emailed us after a week with our photos and more recipes. Amazing service. Will return. Don't miss this!
fun and memorable. coming together with so many travelers who are all interested in the same thing. Michel was fabulous host as was Newha our chef. The whole experience was amazing

fantastic cookery school in every way -not to be missed when in marrakech. I did the combined cookery and spa day, this definately is one of those "not to be missed days ".michel is the funniest warmest guy you will meet, a lovely warm welcome after being chauffered to the school by michel and coffees all round.The school is well thought out and looks stunning inside.the blind spice tests were fun and interesting.There was lots of giggling among the group once our part of preparing bread,tagine got underway but chef came round to offer help to those who clearly didnt cook often.:we were all so excited to see our bread turn out just like chefs and the wait to taste our tagines couldnt come soon enough..beef with pears and candied oranges..it was delicious along with the salads we were shown how to make,followed by homemade ice creams,the green tea and mint ice cream was lovely and the red wine offered by michel was a nice end to the mornings work.We all received complimentary spice bags along with the recipes so we can try it at home (i cannot wait to cook it again it was that good).i couldnt resist a bottle of the farms olive oil,having tasted it there it had the most amazing taste,delicious for dipping fresh bread in. I,ve not found olive oil this good in years and very good price too.A great fun day out and even those with few culinary skills would enjoy and learn on this course,if only these courses could be found in more holiday places,well worth the money paid,great value and would definately recommend and visit again in the future.Even couscous the school cat welcomed us and checked all our knees out for the spice tests.A great school Michel,best day of my hols along with mythic orient spa.thank you all so muchVanessa
great. Michel has found his vocation! A great day out. nuff said.

Wonderful Day, Great Food, Great Host!. We visited Faim d'Espices after reading great reviews on trip advisor and we were really glad that we did! We emailed Michel while on holiday and he emailed straight back to confirm our booking. Everything was taken care of and we were picked up bang on time!The cookery course was educational and loads of fun. We learned to cook a variety of Moroccan food and were shown how to make much more that we didnt have time in the day to cook ourselves. The food was fabulous and something you could confidently tackle at home!We were even emailed yesterday with a whole array of new recipies to try which is a really nice touch.We had a great day, learned alot and would whole heartedly reccommend this to anyone who is interested in cooking. It is very much worth the money.

Relaxing, interesting, and delicious. One of the best things we did in Marrakech!. There were 3 of us, joined by 3 others to make a group of 6. I can't think of a single bad thing to say about our day. Michel was great. He entertained all our questions about Marrakech and we had some interesting conversations. Everything was well planned and ran smoothly. We could tell that a lot of thought had been put into making this class the best it can be-- for example we were e-mailed pictures of us cooking, taken by Michel, and additional recipes after coming home from our vacation. And I can't forget to mention the delicious foods from the bread all the way to the dessert taught by our wonderful teacher, Nezha. They were very accomodating to our one vegetarian in the group. It was nice to escape out into the quiet countryside of Marrakech after 2 days of being in the city center. 2 of us ended the day with the spa package while 1 chatted with Michel on the rooftop terrace of the spa and enjoyed some mint tea while he waited. We loved "Couscous," the Faim d'Epices pet cat!

Absolutely fantastic!. I booked with some doubts - my thougts were that if I can already cook why would I need a cooking class, I can just follow a recipe. How wrong I was! Not only have I learnt things that are not mentioned in cookbooks but also I have spent a creative day with great people - Michel is an absolutely fantastic person! I was attending a cooking class alone as my husband was at a conference at the same time and I must go again with him and with the rest of my family.

Best day out in Marrakech - a must do!. We did the combined cooking and spa day and I have to say it was great! Learnt to make bread, tagine, salads. Had a blind spice lesson which was good fun and helped when I was trying to identify all the spices I bought in the souks! After cooking we sat in the sun with a large glass of wine and ate what we had cooked - it was great. Michel and his staff were welcoming and informative. The farm is about 30 mins out of town but its lovely to get out of the madness which is Marrakech. Give it a go.

Great experience that you can bring home to your friends. I cannot give enough praise to Faim d' Epices and all of the staff there. You learn so much about the Moroccan culture and cooking it's unbelievable. Plus you can taking your learnings home with you and cook for your friends and family. It's a very relaxing and laid back experience and best of all they give you the recipes so you don't have to try to memorize it while learning. This is a MUST DO and also the location is out on a farm so you get to see a different area of Marrakech. p.s.~ wait to buy your tajine, spices or spice holder until you go to the cooking class. they offer all of those items for sale there and they are a third of the price that you would pay in the souks and much better quality.

Do not miss this attraction. This was one of if not the best thing I experienced while in Morocco. I learned a great deal. I booked it with the spa package which was incredible as well. The food that we made ourselves was the best meal I had in Morocco. I am so glad I found this event on trip advisor and booked it prior to my arrival in Marrakesh.

A fun relaxing day. This was a brilliant day away from the frantic activity of the souks. Michel collected us from the city and took us to his venue for a great culinary experience. We learnt about spices and Moroccan cookery. Our meal was the most enjoyable of the trip taught by Michel's excellent staff. We had a relaxing informative day followed by a wonderful spa experience which included a mini reflexology session, a hamman bathing experience, salt scrubs and a total body massage completed with mint tea and pastries - wonderful - would love to repeat weekly!

All-round fantastic experience. We visited Morocco in November and were dying to learn some skills of traditional Moroccan cooking to take home with us, and this is exactly what we got from doing this cooking course. Michel picked us up from our Riad on the day and drove us to the venue, it was great to get out of the city for the day. His team were excellent, hospitality was great, well-set out facilities and we felt very welcome. We learnt to make a range of Moroccan dishes and enjoy them all at the end, our favourites being the flat bread and beef, pear and candied orange tajine! Michel emailed us later with photos and extra recipes, which was very much appreciated. An all-round fantastic experience!

Fun and learning. A real cooking class which will give you the possibility to learn some traditional recipes in a relaxed atmosphere. The place is fully equipped and you will be put in full conditions to put into practice your cooking skills. Very friendly and competent. They pick up at the hotel and you will join the cooking school in the countryside with the other "students"; the environment is international and the tenants are very good in creating a team-building spirit amongst the participants.
Good way to experience Morocco. Michel and his team were excellent. The overall experience was both informative and fun, which would be suitable for anyone.

Superb cooking class!. We decided to take a cooking class during our recent honeymoon to Marrakech and it was one of the highlights of our trip! We were picked up by Michel, who is, super friendly and immediately puts the group at ease. Seriously, a fun guy.This class far exceeded my expectations. it was very hands on and we learned how to make bread, 3 salads and a wonderful tagine of beef, candied oranges and pears,that was possibly one of the best meals of our trip! Throughout the class Michel and his staff made sure everyone was having fun and also understanding the recipes (in both French and English). We ended the class eating the meals we prepared outside on the patio. My husband has never taken a cooking class and LOVED it. Michel made sure we had the recipes to take home and even sent extras in the following week. It was a wonderful and fun day! I highly recommend this for anyone, Michel and his staff are great!

Everyone can be a star in the kitchen. Fantastic experience! Michel is the ultimate host. We were picked up promptly at the designated time and taken to the beautiful "cooking school" outside Marrakesh. The day was full of a fun mixture of hands-on cooking, cooking demonstrations, and even a blind-folded spice-smelling session. All of our food turned out amazing...which was a testament to the patience and talent of our teacher! At the end of the day we even got the recipes for the food we made. Overall an extremely enjoyable experience we would recommend to anyone visting Marrakesh.

Fantastic Experience & Excellent Value for Money. We booked the cookery school with Michael directly from his website before we came to Marrakech and we had the most amazing day. I would highly recommend this activity to anyone going to Marrakech on holiday, as soon as we got back to our Raid we where already recommending the cookery course to other guests. A truly educational and yummy experience 10 out of 10 and all the staff where amazing.Thanks Tom & Danielle UK

Learn to make a mean tagine.. Taking a cooking class while on a foreign holiday - if you have the time - is a great way to understand local ingredients and products/produce, the preparation process/timing, and sometimes even visit the marketplace with a local expert. This class was fantastic to do with friends and we cooked up one of the meanest tagines seen east of Casablanca. While I tended to burn several items - this not being unusual - the staff is more than fantastic, informative and loads of fun. Would very much recommend.

Friendly, relaxed and informative - oh and very tasty!. We booked directly with Michel and opted for the package with the Spa in the afternoon. We received confirmation of our bookings from both parties and were not required to pay anything up front. Michel collected us promptly at 9:30 as agreed and welcomed us warmly at the farm.We found the demonstrations very helpful and everything was proffessional yet relaxed.Even though the weather was not great we enjoyed our luch in the fresh air and took home recipes to try. We've also just received some extra recipes from Michel along with some photos of our visit which is a really nice touch and much appreciated.Would definately recommend this experience and the added bonus if you go at the beginning of your stay is that you can get some tips from Michel and the other visitors about things to see in Marrakech.

Great Experience. I wasn't sure what to expect or if it would be worth the day to spend, but found this to be a great experience. As others wrote, the day went by quickly. Michel was awesome! We were able to experience a variety of foods and learned about many different spices.

A spicy surprise. Michel & Nezha give us a look in the spices from Marocco.The reception with the à la menthe till the Ice suprices.The charms of a Parisien en Maroc et la Passion de la cuisine de Nezha will just catch in.1 afternoon well spend.1 advise: " JUST DO IT "

Loved it!. Our day spent with Michele and his crew was well worth it. The warm welcome, the instruction and the best part, the eating! I went with two other friends and we had a fantastic time. I would highly recommend this to anyone who has a few days in Marrakech!

Must do (even if you don't like to cook). Michel picks you up from your hotel and is very friendly. It took us about 20 minutes to get to the location. We were offered tea while the cooks finished setting up. Our class made cous cous and meat and veggies to go along. The class is long, I think we didn't get finished until 4:00 and we were picked up at 0935. It was fun!

Cancelled without warning..... This cookery course was booked and paid for on-line. The only paperwork we managed to print prior to departure was a confirmation that the money had been taken from our given account. When we contacted them by telephone from our hotel (via holiday rep) to confirm the booking; they had no record of our booking and no space on the day we had booked. They did however, contact the rep two days later, suggesting another date, which was unsuitable. The price for the alternative date was considerably less than what we had paid in advance on-line. To date, we have had no refund or e-mail confirmation that this is in hand. The hotel offered a weekly cookery demonstration for free - which unfortunately we didn't make - including sheets of recipes, which with hindsight, was a far better option. Not recommended.

You really must give this a go. We loved it!. Managed to squeeze onto this course last minute and really pleased we didn't miss it. The whole day from beginning to end was fantastic. Michel and the staff there really look after you and answer any questions you might have about Moroccan cooking. Tips on choosing your spices (and how not to get ripped off). Apart with the fish tajine we also made flat bread from scratch and were shown how to prepare several salad dishes. If you've got a spare day you really must give this a go, even if you're rubbish with the old pots and pans. Phil & Rose. Kendal, Cumbria
Highly recommended. I took the package cooking + SPA and it was an amazing day. Michel the owner makes you feel at home and takes care of all your needs.Don't miss!!!

An OK experience. This is an OK experience, but would I say it's the number one thing to do in Marrakech, or the best thing I did there? No. My biggest issue is that the cooking class (including getting to and from the school outside the city) and the meal takes up most of the day, so after a few hours I felt like we were losing precious time during my first trip to Marrakech. I admit I misjudged the time involved. The meal our group prepared was fine, but not as tasty as I had in other places in Marrakech, even at inexpensive restaurants or at the main square. I would say to give this a try if you've seen and done everything else in Marrakech and just don't know what to do with a spare or remaining day. Otherwise as a first-time visitor I recommend that you concentrate on exploring the city and the souks.

Excellent day out. The whole day, from collection to return was very well executed and well run.Michel and his staff are very friendly and the whole day flies by.Although our group was of mixed nationalities everyone interacted with each other and the experience.Lots has already been said in the reviews to give you an idea of what to expect and theres not much more to add, except that even if you are an accomplished cook you will still enjoy the whole experience, from the bread making, spice skill test, to the tagine making. Then to sit down with Michel and the rest of the group to enjoy the meal you've prepared just rounds it all off!Good value for money and the run out to the farm also allows you to see more of Marrakech and its surrounding area.

Delicious fun!. My husband and I had a great day with Michel and the team--we made our own bread (!) and the classic tagine of chicken with preserved lemon and red olives. Everything about the day was lovely, from the drive through the olive grove to the welcome mint tea to the wonderful meal on the patio with a glass of wine. All the little touches made our experience so wonderful--merci & shukran!

Great experience. I had a really enjoyable day out at Faim d'Epices during my visit to Marrakech. Michel and his team were wonderful - very engaging and entertaining, making the day really enjoyable. The spice test was good fun, although I wasn't much good at it, and the opportunity to make our own tagine and Moroccan bread wasn't to be passed up! Great fun and we really learnt a lot - highly recommended!

Perfect Morocco Experience. Michel and the team were amazing. We are great foodies and really appreciated the insight into the Moroccan cuisine. We went to the Souk to kit ourselves out for cooking at home. Thanks

An intimate and engaging culinary experience!. We loved, loved, LOVED our experience at Faim L'Epices! Michele was very warm and welcoming, the instructors equally so, and the food we made (most important of all!) was exquisite!

Ignore any Negative reviews, this place is FANTASTIC. Michel, Philippe and the rest of the team at Faim D'Epices will make you feel incredibly welcome from the moment you get picked up by Michel in his minibus.What i enjoyed most about this experience is that you really feel as though they care about you having a good time, the staff are not just at work, they clearly enjoy what they do and it really does make a difference.Do yourself a favour and make sure you book yourself on this if you visit Marrakech.

Best souvenir!. This is really the best souvenir you can carry home from Morocco, the 'know how' of preparing their wonderful food. I bought also some typical hardware in the souk and I am willing to prepare an exotic meal to my family and friends. Michel and his team are fantastic, very friendly and profesional, the environment and the tools just perfect, clean and new. I really recomend this activity when in Marrakech. It was a wonderful and useful experience. THANK YOU!!!

Friendly and Informative. This was not your usual cooking lesson, for one we were there almost all day 10-4.30 but it absolutely flew by, usually you turn up cook, eat & out in 3 hours . However we not only cooked but learnt a lot about all the different spices, their smells, how to pick them and how not to get ripped off buying saffron! In addition we cooked a full meal, made our own bread, our own pancakes and lerant all the traditional morrocan starters, and i actually feel that i could teach my friends what i learnt! It is a must-do experience in Marrakesh (especially with the spa afterwards!), there was 11 of us in our the class which sounds a lot but it definately didn't feel too many in fact, it was very hands on for all of us and actually all came together like a family for the day (without sounded too corny) which i think is michels influence, really a lovely friendly guy who makes you all feel at ease, even had some morrocan wine with dinner which just topped off a lovely day there, a must do!

It's fun to cook local food!. Liked: We went to a course to learn how to make Berber Tagine (local food cooked in a special moroccan dish with lots of vegetables and meat). During the half they workshop we get to know the local spices and heard lots of stories. In the end of the course we could shop the ingredients and get the recipe as a gift.Not so liked: the fee supposed to include transfer fee from your hotel, but we were picked up in a parking, 10-15 minutes from the hotel and the transfer was late

Brilliant Day! Definitely would do it again.. We booked this trip on the back of a recommendation from trip advisor, from the start of our booking it was easy, they were in touch within minutes asking what day we'd like to attend and what our preference was for food. We were picked up by one of the owners, Michelle who filled our journey with lots of amusing stories and interesting facts about the city. The whole way through the experience the staff were attentive and willing to get involved (as was their cat, cous cous). This was a great experience and not wishing to give to much away the team really went the straight mile. It's a great location, especially if you want to experience a different way of moroccan way of life. From start to finish this was a great day!

Best activity in Marrakech - Don't miss it!. I did this activity with my Mum on the 4th November and it was the best day spent in the city.Michel picked us up at the hotel at the time arranged and immediately greeted us with a smile.You learn to cook various dishes and the atmosphere is relxed, friendly and jovial. The staff here are really kind and go the extra mile to make your day enjoyable.I would thoroughly recommend anyone doing this activity and it is value for money!

The best experience in Marrakech. We had a great day at Faim d'Epices making lamb tagine with prunes and would thoroughly recommend you book this up if you're planning on visiting Marrakech. Michel is a perfect host and the out of town location is the ideal break away from the busy souks and side streets in the centre of the City.

Fantasic Experience. If you want to try something a little different on your holiday, and fancy a little bit of relaxation out of the Marrakech city, I would definately recommend this. You don't need to be able cook to enjoy this - Michel and his colleagues (and of course Cous Cous) are very good at making you feel welcome and making sure you have a good time. The 'RayBans' were cool, and I want a pair! The 'guess the spice' game was fun, and I never realised how little I knew about spices. It was fascinating, enjoyable and totally enlightening! The best part of the day - if you don't like your lunch - you've only got yourself to blame!!! Michel - why is my bread still not rising like it should!!!

a true bite of the Marrakech charm..and yummy grub!. It was my 30th birthday and my other half had organised this as a day activity prior to an evening at a spa. We were picked up by Michael at the exact point that had been communicated via email weeks before, at the right time! The van was comfy and the host was a lovely man speaking an array of languages and ensuring that we were cool enough and that everyone in the van was spoken to and made to feel welcome. It was here I noticed that he had a thing for the colour purple! Anyhow, on arriving at his place (about 10 mins drive) I felt instantly 'at home', it was exactly the kind of place I would love to buy in Marrakech, quirky and with that traditional moroccan charm but far enough away from the mad crowds and those blummin scooters! The day began with a little time for chat and of course....mint tea, of which I politely rejected as, to be frank, i don't like it! so I opted for a glass of ice cold bottled water but Michael was very accomodating to everyones needs, offering coffee etc also. We then had a talk on spices and got to wear some uber fasionable sun glasses for a blind smelling of the herbs and spices and to acquire some knowledge, it was informative and enjoyable but perhaps a tad too long, maybe about 3 mins to long but then this sounds petty! I think it was more to do with me having a dodgey back and i was sitting down so got a little restless! with my bum off the seat we headed over to the well set up kitchen and began our morning of cooking, everything we cooked was demonstrated beautifully by a lovely woman with the nicest teeth ive ever seen! She was very through and she ensured that she spoke in both French and English but to be honest you just had to watch what she was doing and use your common sense. I won't spoil it for you by giving away all the details of what you cook etc, after making our lunch we settled down to lunch alfresco with a glass of vino!! yum! yes, morocco maybe a dry country in some respects but it was lovely to be offered a glass of wine by the host and I fully expected to pay for it as extra to the days charge but that wasn't the case.... a nice touch. In short, this place is amazing, I am ultra jealous and even went as far to say Id happily work there...i most certainly would! Please take some time out and way from the hectic medina and enjoy a chilled afternoon of cooking with loved ones in a tranquil little place such as this. I have done two cookery courses in Marrakech now and I don't want to bad mouth the other one as it was good but out of the two I prefered it here. Enjoy!!!

Appetite for spices totally satisfied. I wanted to organise a cooking class as a surprise for my boyfriend and looked at a few options in Marrakech. In the end I went with the extremely positive reviews for Faim D'Epices on Tripadvisor, and we were not disappointed at all!First, it's a great, purpose build location, set on a farm, in the middle of a vegetable garden and orchard, a bit out of the city, which totally adds to the experience.Michel and his team are very welcoming and make everyone feel at ease immediately. Our group was very international, but somehow in a way we were all very similar, and in the same state of mind; to totally enjoy the experience! The team is very well bi-lingual French/ English and the instructions very well explained.A very fun and educational morning well spent, and rounded off with a nice lunch outside on the terrace, enjoying our own creations!Thumbs up for Faim D'Epices, I am definitely recommending it to all my friends.

I can't believe I can cook that!! Thank YOU Faim d"Epices!!!. Michel is such a nice person, from the moment he picked me up at my hotel up until he dropped me off, he is always smiling, very friendly! Clearly that he loves what he is doing and passionate about it!The cooking class is fabulous, very relaxing atmosphere, friendly staff. We learn so much, from spices, making bread from scratch (without using an oven!!!!!!! I love that coz I don't have an oven) , three types of Moroccan salads and beef tajin with pears and orange juice. Oh! I am so proud of myself!! I have a fabulous day! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!

Book it now!!. This was my first over seas cooking class and I loved it. All the staff were friendly and nothing was too much trouble. We cooked amazing food and it was so easy! I have special dietary requirements that were meet with ease. Once we were home we were emailed more recipes. I can't wait to try out the recipes on my new tagine I bought while over there.We did the package with the spa treatment which was divine.

5* Service in the perfect setting. We went on this cookery course back in easter (2011). I was look for things to do in Marrakech and found the course on Trip Advisor. I called to book and informed them my 5 year old son would be joining me and that mum did not eat beef, which was the meat that we would be cooking. (They cook different meats on specified days, check the website).They had not been to our hotel before (Amanjena), but told me not to worry, I wasnt hopefull, but they arrived on time, luckily as if they had been late we may have been caught in the terrist attack bombing.On arrival we were very impressed with the decor, look and feel of the place. My Mother was given Lamb instead of beef and my son was also taken care of, I did think that he would be bored and did loaded my iphone with games for him to play on, but I did not have to take it out once, as he worked at his own station with Michel and his chef.Michel gave an induction on the herbs and spices, Sounds boring but was quite interesting. We were given a demo and then had to go back to our stations and cook the food as we saw on the demo, dont worry you are not left alone.Once the food was cooked we enjoyed eating it in the beautiful gardens.Tip:Bring money with you as they have a reasonably priced small gift shop with items that I didnt see in the souks/markets.Michel will take of you and your family. I really enjoyed the experience and would like to say a big thank you to Micheal and his team.

A great day had by all..... This was a really great day away from Marrakech city. Faim D'epices come and collect you from your accomodation - for us this was Michel a delightful and engaging Frenchman who owns the cookery school. We picked up 6 other people and were taken out to the cookery school, a purpose built buiding in the countryside.Everything was laid out for us - very Masterchef! During the day we learned about spices (we did a blind testing) we learnt how to cook tagine of beef/chicken with pears and candied orange peel; made and cooked our own flatbread and learnt how to make 3 Moroccan salads and pancakes.It was thorouhly professional and great fun. We then sat down to our own cooked lunch with a glass of wine and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. There was also a very friendly cat called Cous Cous to keep us company.We were taken back to our riad about 4-4.30 after a great day. It was good to meet Michel and the other fellow cooks! I would recommend anyone to do this.

great food, great company - fabulous way to relax away from the souks. My sister and I spent a day with Michel, learning to cook traditional Moroccan tangines. We had an absolutely wonderful day - it was perfect given the weather was quite rainy. We met a lot of lovely people and Michel put everyone at ease from the first moment he picked us up from our hotel. The food was wonderful (who knew we could cook so well?) and we finished it off with a lovely spa at Mythic Oriental (part of the combined package). We would recommend the whole experience - but one tip is that it is worth taking a book to the spa in case you have to wait for the Hammam. Definitely get involved if you get a chance.

Learning and fun at the same time-great!. I did this cooking course yesterday and enjoyed it so much. It is great to get out of the bustle of the city and learn about its culinary delights. The spice workshop was highly informative and was a great start before getting down to the bread making. I felt that we had enough time to ask questions and meet the other people at the class which then made for a sociable lunch on the terrace. Michele is a lovely guy with a wonderful sense of humour and he certainly made our last day in Morocco one of the best we had. If you like food you cannot go wrong with this course!

A very relaxing and enjoyable way to spend a day in Marrakech. This is a great day away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. Upon arriving we were offered tea or coffee which pretty much set the relaxed pace for the day. Our ever friendly tutor was always on hand to oversee what was doing. She managed to rescue my bread when it was on the slipperly slope to becoming glue.The spice tutorial was actully pretty insteresting as Michel entertained us with quirky facts about the spices, such as how to tell whether you have bought fake saffron and what exactly the fake is made of.Our chicken tagines were superb with a glass of wine as were the salads, I'm not sold on the sweet one but it was good to try.The day finished with another tea/coffee before we all got dropped back at our hotels.

A welcome escape from the crazy with good people.. We booked this as we needed to get out of Medina as 5 days in this crazy place is way too much, and we are certainly happy we did.Firstly poor Michael was very patient with us as we were supposed to go to the farm yesterday, BUT as no one informed us that clocks did not go back in marrakech we were waiting at 1030 thinking it was 0930 and as we then thought that no one had come to collect us, I phoned Michael to complain about the fact no one picked us up but as we later learnt it was us on the wrong time! Michael kindly offered to collect us the next day and he was prompt picking us up in a lovely clean mini bus and took us to the farm.The establishment was very clean and well organised. Michael was chatty and lively and we learnt a lot about spices and generally about Morocco. He has a lovely little gift shop on premise too where we bought our tajin pot. The cooking was clear and instructions were easy to follow. Our lunch was delicious and we were stuffed, also the setting was lovely. At the end we were given recipe cards for what we cooked and he also have us a small bag of rare spices.It was well worth it. A lovely day. We are so glad we did not miss it because of the clocks and would recommend this to everyone visiting marrakech.

Lots of Fun & the best food in Morocco!. This was the best experience, I'm not usually one for classes & suchlike on my holidays, I like to just relax, but this was relaxing & it was really good fun!No pressure, just step by step & so simple to follow. We cooked the Lamb with prunes stuffed with roasted almonds & it was better than anything our hotel offered us on our trip!We booked this before we travelled & chose the combined cooking class/spa trip This was the best deal ever!!! A great day A great experience A great place!

We started the day as customers of Michel and ended it as friends. Attending the Faim d'epices school of Morrocan cookery was wonderful. Although ages ranged considerably and three nationalities were represented, it was fun as well as educational. Michel picked us up at our hotel (some way from the centre of Marrakesh) which was a huge bonus. He is obviously very knowledgeable about the locale and we had many interesting conversations during the day ranging from good restaurants to religion! The lovely teacher was patient and so enthusiastic about our efforts which, it has to be said, were delicious! We spent the late afternoon/evening at the Mystic Spa which is offered as a deal with Faim d'epices. Please see separate review for that. Michel is a lovely person and really makes the Faim d'epices experience unforgettable. In case we should forget, he has emailed photos taken on the day. Brilliant!

A day that captured Marrakech beautifully!. My partner booked this trip as a surprise, and I was certainly very impressed with the high standards and fantastic organisation of the outing. For someone who hasn't boiled an egg or chopped a vegetable in over ten years, you can imagine how daunted I felt about cooking traditional chicken tajine! However, Michel (the chief organiser) was so warm, friendly, and incredibly patient that, amazingly, I didn't feel out of my depth at any one point. He and our female instructor were always at hand and ensured that no one felt left behind or made any real errors. We also had a great tutorial on spices which I knew very little about initially but now feel more confident in using. The proof of our success was in the end result - a divine meal cooked by ourselves! The spa visit that followed was exquisite. Most couple treatments are not felt to be very intimate but this certainly was; the decor was very pretty and serene, the treatments were thorough and very relaxing, and we even spent time in a private jacuzzi on the rooftop with full privacy and no sense of being rushed at all. I would thoroughly recommend the full day schedule to all visitors to Marrakech. It's a wonderful treat that will leave you feeling you have had not only a culturally enriching experience but also a very fun and relaxing day.

The best day out we had. A brilliant day out if you enjoy cooking, eating and spas! All of my favourite things! Michel was lovely, very friendly and laid back. The cookery course was so much fun and the food was delicious. The spa was just amazing, I had done sooooo much research looking for the best hammam with so many mixed reviews but this one didn't disappoint (even though the girls were a bit giggly at times). This was the best day we had during our holiday as Marrakech is so full on and this was so relaxing and fun. BOOK IT!

Great experience to add to your trip to Morocco. After looking at the things to do in Morocco on tripadvisor we were very keen to go to a cookery day. We chose this one as they picked us up from the hotel which made it easier for us as we were staying 15 mins from the centre of Marrakech. We had a great day and really enjoyed learning how to make bread, a chicken and olive tagine and also watching moroccan salads being made and the dessert. Michel and the chef were great and made the day, they answered our questions and were very friendly. The cooking was well managed and you didn't feel like you were standing over the stove all day. When we finished and it was time to eat, you were sat at a lovely table with the salads and your tagine and glass of wine, the dessert was accompanied by gorgeous homemade ice cream including one made of the mint tea which you will drink alot of on your trip, this was my favourite, and also we had some cactus fruit which was very tasty. It was lovely being away from the centre of town which made the whole experience very relaxing. We thoroughly enjoyed it and really recommend it.

Amazing Food. We were collected promptly on time near our riad and travelled out to the farm just ouside of marrakech. What a lovely place! The cooking was good and the people on our course were also lovely so there was a good atmopher. Couscous the cat kept a watchfull eye on us all. The blind spice test was very good fun. And the best part was enjoying the food we'd just made all with a glass of wine at the end. Wonderful host and teachers. My partner who went with me does not enjoy cooking but said he really enjoyed this day out.

Definitely one of the top 10 things to do in Marrakech. Whether you're a keen cook or not, it's like being back at cooking lessons at school, you're guaranteed to have fun and remember this trip!We travelled in a group of 4 (two couples), and booked 2 days before via an email to Michel (the owner) on the faim d'epices website. I asked for a day that we wanted to do it, and he replied swiftly, asking us of where we were staying, and as easy as that we were booked in for a 9.35am pick up at a parking place near our Riad in the medina. Michel was the extremely friendly and pleasant French owner, he was very hands-on too, so personally picked us all up from our different locations in Marrakech (whether you're staying in a hotel or a riad), and greeted us with tea/coffee to start with, orange juice mid-morning, and then a glass or wine during lunch.Very knowledgable host, and learnt a lot about spotting high quality spices, (so don't go buying haphazardly in the souks beforehand!) and then cooking at our own workstations with Nezha as our cooking guide for the day. We followed step-by-step demonstrations making our own fish tagines, made our own bread from scratch, and watched live demonstrations of how to make sweet Morrocan pancakes, and 3 different types of Morrocan style salads. We got to eat all of these things on the day, and it was hugely satisfying making our own dishes from scratch, and getting to eat it all for lunch. Was provided with a lovely dessert to finish it off by Michel, three scoops of homemade icecream with sweet pancake. Booking this faim d'epices on their website, in combination with the Mythic oriental spa package is most recommended to be done on the last day of your trip. Great opportunity for you to wind down and relax, and really feel pampered and treated like royalty in the Mythic spa. Can't say much more than this- definitely a must-do in Marrakech- a perfect day to experience the two great things that signify Marrakech- the tagine, and a hammam spa bath!

Had a very enjoyable time, highly recommended!. Having seen this as one of the items high on the list of things to do in Marrakech, I made a booking just a few days before setting off. The booking process was easy (just a few email to confirm time and place) and the business owner Michel was very helpful. On the day Michel picked us up from an agreed location and took us to the Spice Farm (a nice and clean (new) building where the cooking lesson took place) where we learn to cook a moccoran cuisine! (Chicken Tagine) the session was great fun and we made some tasty food (and got to eat it as well :) ). Michel was great and gave us a eductional and fun introduction session into various spices. I highly recommend this for anyone who is visiting marrakech.

Warm, friendly welcome for a cooking session that was informative and fun.. The location of this activity is about a 20 minute drive from Marrakesh. The building was clean, cool and peaceful. We received a warm, friendly welcome and the cooking experience was calm and relaxed throughout, Michel and his staff having the ability to teach people with different levels of expertise. For example, I have little cooking expertise whilst my wife is already a good cook yet we both found it informative and fun. The method of introducing us to the different spices and herbs was unusual and enjoyable. Sitting down with the staff and other people on the course (four others when we attended) to eat the meals we had prepared (with wine included) brought the activity to a relaxing end.Michel and his staff deserve credit for the whole experience, which was excellent and we can certainly recommend this activity as an insight into Moroccan culture as well as providing a welcome counter balance to the 'hustle and bustle' that is Marrakesh!Do take advantage of the reduced priced twin activity with the Mythic Oriental Spa, which Michel takes you to in Marrakesh after the cooking experience. These two activities together were brilliant and made it into a whole day (morning to early evening), relaxing experience.

NICE EXPERIENCE. Hello i was for 4 days in marrakech and i was not so sure of making this cooking course as i tohusht maybe i get bored or maybe i have to cook so much... but i got surprised of this wonderfull experience. i learn much about spices and also about how to cook bread and tagine. The owner michael is very friendy and make you pass the time fast as everything is more than perfect organiced. I reallly recommend it for half of oyur day. Remember you can check in their web side the meal planning because i didnt know so you can chose what to learn.ANA from Spain

Peace away from the madding crowd. Really enjoyed it: was nice to feel like everything was taken care of and for only £45 ish (Dh550) all day. The owner is a character and won't stop smiling- he moved over from Paris to set up this business but he speaks perfect English. You MUST try the olive oil- I hav never tasted any so olivey and it's made on the olive farm where the cooking class is situated.

A great day - highly recommend this for cooks and non cooks!. We decided to go to Faim d'espices on the back of the great reviews on trip advisor. No regrets - it was a great experience - good cooking and great company. We found out when we were there that they do different dishes each day, so it may be worth checking so you can learn something that you really want to be able to cook back home.

the 'must do' activity while in Marrakech. It was thanks to the rave reviews on trip advisor that I booked my visit to Michel's fantastic cookery class, and after such a brilliantly organised and fun day I wanted to add my own review to encourage more people to visit!Michel and his team have thought of every last detail which takes this way beyond a simple cookery lesson. From the fun of the spice lesson (blind testing is not as easy as it looks on masterchef!!), to learning more about Michel's experiences in Marrakech, and our gifts of spices, recipes and photographs, this is a course with a personal touch.Of course the food you learn to make is truly wonderful too - not just a traditional tagine but breads, salads and pancakes too! The menu changes every day so check out the website to see what you fancy best! We cooked a beef and orange tagine - a faim d'epices very own recipe, totally delicious.Following the day we took advantage of the special offer to also visit a spa - and again Michel has ensured the best possible quality in the spa he has partnered with, his recommendation is definitely worth taking note!Thanks Michel and bon chance for the future!!

A must-do experience in Marrakech - learn to cook Morrocan style. We had a thoroughly enjoyable experience at Faim d'Epices, and really learnt a lot about Moroccan cooking.The day started with a pickup from our Riad, and we were taken out to the farm about 10 miles outside the city. There was 7 of us in the group, and we all had our own cooking station. We made a full meal from scratch, including bread, salad, a salmon and vegetable tagine, and then had the pleasure of eating it with wine and dessert.Apparently they do a different dish everyday, so is worth checking what they're making during the days which you're available.In summary, it was a very worthwhile experience and would recommend to anyone interested in Morrocan cooking.

A great way to spend a day in Marrakech. One of the great things about travelling to another country is the opportunity to try the local cuisine. Even better, is being able to recreate it once you get home; which is why we chose to spend the best part of a day learning to cook a Moroccan meal with Michel and his team at Faim d'Epices.Michel picked us up, as arranged, in the morning and after collecting the other participant we headed to his purpose-built atelier on the outskirts of the city. On the menu: chicken tagine with olives and lemon, served with traditional Moroccan bread and three salads. With an olive grove and vegetable garden on site, you can rest assured that only the freshest ingredients are used.First up , the bread making was demonstrated by the chef, Nehza, before we set off to prepare our own. With our dough safely cosseted in a tea towel to do its stuff, Michel then conducted a 'blind smelling' of spices to help us familiarise ourselves with the key ingredients of Moroccan cuisine. Next, we prepared our tagines and while they were cooking Nehza showed us how to make three Moroccan salads. With the tagines ready, we then cooked our bread on the stove before learning how to make the pancakes.With the cooking complete, we sat down to enjoy our lunch with a glass of wine, followed by a dessert of pancakes and local ice cream. Michel gave us a sheet of recipes detailing all the things we had made on the day before taking us to the Mythic Oriental Spa for our treatments (we had booked the cookery/spa combination). A follow-up email with photographs and further recipes was waiting for me when I got back home.If you're looking for a break from the souks and sights during your stay in Marrakech, the combination of Michel's enthusiasm and the relaxed environment of the cookery school makes this the perfect holiday experience.

Great experience for those wanting to learn how to cook traditional Moroccan food. A must-do!!. I had a great day learning how to make some traditional Moroccan dishes. Michel and his team are very knowledgable, friendly and helpful. They instantly made everyone feel at ease and the atmosphere was very relaxed. A great experience for people of all ages.
Highly recommended to all who love food!. Nezha and Michel are lovely and passionate hosts. I enjoyed my stay a lot, did learn a lot and had a great day!Tx. Hermann

Tasty food and great company. This is a great day out and so different from the manic streets of the Medina! Michel and his staff are friendly, relaxed and knowledgeable and made us very welcome. Picked up and dropped off at our riad, we were taken to Michel's farm on the outskirts of the city where we learned about Moroccan spices, then cooked a full meal with a tagine, breads, salads which Michel supplemented with wine and finally local ice cream. All very tasty and cooked by our own fair hands! Thanks to Michel as well for managing to accommodate veggies and meat eaters alike. Highly recommended!

Superb. Michel, firstly I'm so sorry about the mix up - this was 100% my fault - I had presumed because other trips our Riad had organised were paid for through the Riad that yours would be the same - your management of this was superb and shows you are a true gentleman. I had no idea of my mistake until I corrected Patrick regarding our bill at check out - sorry.Our day with you was the highlight of Marrakesh. I loved the spice test - even though i wasn't very good!! The cooking demonstration, food, atmosphere, cleanliness and explanations were excellent. Your passion for Moroccan food is very evident.Thank youLouisePS - Please can I have the Lemon Chicken recipe - my children are desperate for us to cook them this!!

a brilliant day. I would totally recommend this experience. I booked up for my friend as a birthday gift and we weren't disappointed. Michelle was so helpful, really open to finding alternatives for my gluten free diet, and a brilliant host for the day. The atmosphere was warm and relaxed and it was great to finish off the day eating with the group and drinking a glass of wine. We learnt loads along the way too!!! A must do in Marrakech.

Cooking, tasting learning and having a real fun half day. You don't have to be a cooking fan to love this course, but if you do you won't complain either: you'll have a most pleasant time in any case, because the organization is perfect (a french taste in a european professional planning, with moroccan charm). Michel and his professional partner (a real chef) have created an infrastructure purposely built for the courses, and hired and trained the staff for the same goal. The result is magic: in few months since inception they are a top attraction, get 100% satisfaction for every participant, with "above expectations" ratings in most cases: go! I took the course (and added the combo with the spa) spending a whole day out of my only two days in Marrakech, and it was worth it.

Not just a cookery course but a good days dining with friends.. Michel picked us up bang on 9:30am, a few more budding chefs joined us from various locations around Marrakech.Michels laid back manner and the Moroccan chefs direct but pleasant instructions made the cooking easier for those of us unsure of our Tagine skills. The centre looked after our needs all day with the sun beating down outside, Michelkept us watered, and entertained.My wife and i had a brilliant day, not just the cooking but the whole ambience of the place and Michel moves at a slowerpace than all of marrakech, which is nice. After we cooked, we all sat down to our meal and Michel offered us some wineto go with our tagine meal, we could have sat all evening as we were really enjoying the whole atmosphere and Michel wasin no hurry to send us on our way but one couple had a prior arangement so unfortunately we had to go !!!We were tempted to book for a second visit but thought we'd keep it for another time. Great value for an experience whichis hard to come by in this fast moving world of ours.

A fabulous experience - fun, fascinating and informal. Michel picked us up from the hotel at 9.30am. We did this in conjuction with Le Mystique Spa. Michel was the perfect host, friendly, and informative. His Moroccan chef was a quiet efficient lady who demonstrated the dishes and helped, with eternal patience, the preparation of the dishes. This class/experience is great for the enthusiastic chef and the wannabe (or even the one dragged along!). Great introduction to Moroccan cooking and the herbs and spices they use, with excellent tips to find the genuine spices in the Souks. A beautifully fitted out building with a Moroccan touch, courtesy of Michel's previous career and profession for interior design. An experience not to be missed.

Great fun and tasty!!. Went with my partner on September 26th and had a great day cooking. Was just us and one other couple so was perfect.Michel and our instructor (Kneza?) were fantastic - very friendly, fun and informative. We both learned a lot. Made a lovely lamb tagine and Morrocan bread.Also got a spice test and watched them prepare salads to accompany our tagine.Was fantastic to sit down at the end and eat everything that we had prepared with a glass of wine.We loved our experience here and would reccommend it to eveyone.Merci Michel!

Best experience, and meal, of the trip!. As mentioned below the day begins with Michel collecting you from agreed location, heading to the villa, enjoying a mint tea (naturally) and meeting fellow chefs. We were then given a Moroccan spice smell test and lesson (very interesting), shown how to make flatbread from scratch and also how to make three different salads.Now the hands-on bit! We made bread and a chicken and olive tagine with candied lemon peel. Dessert was three gourmet ice creams with crepes. Our 'teacher' was helpful and friendly and the food... well, it was certainly the best meal we had on our visit to Marrakech. We were given freshly squeezed orange juice, a glass of local wine and coffee at the end. Michel chatted to us and gave us a 'thank you' gift of recipe cards and a bag of specially prepared Moroccan spices.All in all a fun experience, great day out (and rest from the madness of the Medina) and an excellent host. Fantastiques!

A perfect day. I´m just so pleased we decided to try Faim d´Epices, it was the highlight of our visit to Marrakech. The combination offer of cooking classes in the morning and spa in the afternoon is just fantastic, everything we expected and more. Michel picked us up at the arranged time and drove us to his beautiful farm, where he´s managed to build a very colourful and at the same time practical work area for us "chefs-to-be".Nezha the cook was very patient with our attempts at following her instructions, and we were all very pleased with the end result (my tagine was wonderful, as I´m sure the rest were, there was´t much left on the plates!). True to his word, Michel sent us some more recipes by email, together with our very own Certificate! Must frame mine...All in all perfect, and I´m looking forward to my next visit to Marrakech so I can cook some more at Faim d´Epices... Thanks for everything :)

wonderfull cooking in beautifull place!. A day at Faim d'Epices was a great experience. Our charming host Michel picked us up in his car and took us to a small place outside of Marrakesh. It was so nice to see a bit of the enviroment. The cooking studio is beautifull and very professional. We were only the four of us and we got a lot of attention and good explaning from our Moroccan cook. She was so kind and patient. The food we prepared (couscous) was just delicicious. We also got lessons in how to make salades and Michel tested us on our knowledge of herbs.I can highly recomment Faim D'Epices to everyone. You will not regret and have a very interesting day and a great meal!Michel and his staff are very very good hosts!! Thanks a lot for the wonderfull experience!!

Cooking up a storm. The venue for the class was great, the class itself great fun with the lady who was teaching us very helpful and patient as we are both useless cooks. We baked bread and then made a veal tagine, we were also shown how to make the salads and had a go at making crepes before we sat down for an interesting spice sniffing session. We finished the day off by eating all we had made with a glass of wine. There was only 4 of us in the class which was nice as well. The best thing about the day though was Michel. He had a great personality, was fun and interesting. He made a real effort to make us feel welcome. His English was excellent and the other couple in our class were french so he translated absolutely everything he or they said for us. He even gave us a gift of a tagine because it was our honeymoon!We would highly recommend this.

A MUST IN MARRAKECH FANTASTIC EXPERIENCE. My wife and I whilst visiting Marrakech had an opportunity to go on the cookery experience course at L'atelier Faim d'Epices.The building were we did the cookery course was approx 20 minute drive from the centre of Marrakech and it was also a pleasure to get away from the busy city for a few hours.We had an absolutely fantastic time making bread and we both made a different tagine.The actual cooking took approxiamtely 2 hours then we had the opportunity to all sit down for lunch and eat what we had made.What a fantastic end to our holiday learing how to cook tradditional Morrocan dishes then having the opportunity to eat what we had made with wine.We had lunch we seven over people and i even met a lady called Jane who i had been sitting on the plane with on the way to Marrakech.what a coincidence i met newly wed Jane and her husband 3 times whilst we were in Marrakech on the off chance.All of our party thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.The whole day was a pleasure and the owner Michel went out of his way to explain everything to us.His assistant who was helping with the cooking experience i forget her name was also very helpful and also went out her way to help us.I would have no hesitation in reccomending this experience to both novice and experienced cooks.I do suggest you take a camera or a camcorder then you will have great memories of your experience.Once again thanks to all the staff for your help we had a great time.

\\Know your Spices? If not, Michel will guide you through. My daughter's dream was to visit Marrakesh, and as an ardent cook, this trip, however short, had to include a class in Moroccan cooking! Although my first thought was that the time would be better spent exploring the Medina, I must say, I found the day delightful and completely worth while.First of all it was made very easy and convenient with essentially door to door transportation. Michel was very punctual and easy to recognize. The class takes place about 20 minutes form town in an airy and spacious room equipped with multiple individual work stations located on a small private farm.After a relaxing tea/coffee we watched and learned how to make the traditional bread by a young Morrocan woman , Michel moderated when necessary. This was followed by a blindfolded smell test to identify the spices. This at first intimidated me as I knew the only smells I can readily identify are skunk and cookies in the oven. It was however really fun and I feel I can now probably identify mint and cinnamon as well.Thereafter we made our own bread, ( not nearly as well), prepared a meal in the tajin of veal, artichokes and peas, again under excellent supervision. Luckily neither of us lost a finger trying to cut onions the Moroccan way!We had a relaxed lunch, consuming our creations, which were delicious , along with a nice glass of wine, and we headed back to town mid afternoon. The spa option had sounded intriguing as well and had we had more time, this would have been a done deal. Next time!!Anyway, Michel is charming ( don't get a big head if you read this) , we learned a lot from him and had a great time.Thank you ladies and man of L' Atelier Faim d'Epices!!Michel was dleightful and a source of information about Marrakesh.For a very relaxed and informative cooking experience I would definitely recommend Faim d'EpicesChristine

Perfect relaxing day at Faim d'Epices. Our cooking course at Faim d'Epices was an interesting and relaxing alternative to the madness of Marrakesh, and we were very pleased with Faim d'Epices. Michel is extremely attentive and accommodating-- happily agreeing to our last minute menu request and pickup location change. He really goes out of his way to make you feel welcome. My favorite part of the day was the blind spice identification, which was an educational/interesting touch. The course is professional but relaxed, and we left with several new recipes and techniques which I am eager to try. Overall, a really excellent experience.

They even taught my hubby to cook!!!!. My husband is a Dutch man that thinks it's acceptable to serve pasta and ketchup to a Sicilan family so I was more than worried when I decided to book us, as a couple, on this cooking class at Faim d'Epices. I relayed my worried to Michel, the proprietor, who assured me that there would be no problem, the teachers were excellent chefs and would be able to help even the most inept of cooks...he also mentioned that it wasn't only about the cooking, it was about having fun while learning. I will say, KUDOS!!!! We had an absolute blast learning to cook, but then to be able to sit down and eat the food we'd made without having Pepto Bismol as a starter was amazing. The teachers were fantastic, Michel was great fun, and the escape into the countryside facilities was a very welcome break from the bustle of the big square. Just before we left for Morrocco, Michel (who had remained in constant contact with us since we first booked) advised us of a special they had arranged with the Mythic Oriental Spa. We booked this special and you can read my review about the hammam when you've finished reading this...but two definite MUSTS when you're booking your vacation to Marrakesh, book the cooking experience with Faim d'Epices and definitely, take the hammam package!

A day at Faim d'Epices - a decision you won't regret!. I traveled to Marrakech with three friends during August 2011. While I was researching things to do in Marrakech, I came across the reviews for Faim d'Epices. I was immediately interested in signing up for the cooking class/spa combination offer. I spoke to my friends about it, and even though they were not interested in the cooking portion, I decided to take the cooking class anyway and just meet them at the spa afterwards. I am so happy that I decided to do this on my own - it was the highlight of my trip! It was great to be able to escape the madness of the medina, and leave Marrakech for a few hours. Michel was a terrific host from start to finish - he picked me up as planned and on time at the agreed upon location, was warm and welcoming at all times, and dropped me off at the door of the spa afterwards where my friends were waiting for me. The entire staff at Faim d'Epices is warm and welcoming, the facilities are spacious, the equipment is clean and very well-maintained, the cooking presentations were informative and interesting, the actual cooking was fun, and the food was delicious! I have some basic knowledge of and interest in cooking, but I think even if you do not, this is definitely something you will enjoy. Also, this is perfectly suited for solo travelers, couples, families, young and old alike. I also found the cost very reasonable for the amount of time and quality of the program. Do not hesitate to take a class at Faim d'Epices - it's a must do while in Marrakech!

A great day out - and Michel is great!. I actually found Faim D'Epices on tripadvisor and after some very efficient comms from Michel we were booked in and everything was explained very well. We met Michel at 10am and after 10 minutes it felt like we were old friends! He is such a nice guy, with an infectious personality and is obviously passionate about what he does. We were driven to a farm about 20 mins away, where we given mint tea and orange juice. Michel explained the order of the day – welcome drinks, spice education and blindfold test, and then cooking bread, a chicken tagine and being shown how to make various salads and a kind of crepe desert. For the cooking class, hamman and massage (there is a package) it was 1080 which is a bargain. All the ladies at the farm were lovely and when I asked for some chilli fr the tagine they simply went to the farm and got some for me! After cooking the bread and tagine, we sat down to enjoy our meals with a nice glass of white wine. Michel then dropped us at the spa around 3ish. A lovely day out, well organised and well worth doing! A few other comments: All staff were lovely, all cooking facilities vrey clean, the farm ws nice and we saw a wild peacock, toilets clean. If you go to Marrakech make sure you do this and you will not be disappointed!Michel – thanks for a great day and we have already made a chicken tagine upon our return to London and my wife even said it tasted just like the one we made with you!

Highly recommended. I don’t normally write Trip Adviser reviews but this cooking school is definitely worth the effort. I echo many of the other comments. We had a fabulous time and Michael was a wonderful host. It was the highlight of our trip to Marrakesh. We initially had reservations about the price but it was worth every penny. If you book this course you definitely won’t regret it.
Excellent. Michel paid attention to every detail. The tagine was the best I've ever eaten. This is a must-do in Marrakech!

Very fun well planned day. 100% reccommend it, even for someone not into cooking.. Lovely set up in an olive farm out of town. Michel and the staff were very welcoming and knowledgable - am excellent way to spend a day !

Great day with a great host. My wife and I highly recommend visiting Faim dÉpices whilst in Marrakech, it made for a really memorable and fun day.Michel the host was entertaining and knowledgable, making a real effort to ensure that we were being catered to.We chose this course over the one offered by the Riad that we were staying in (Riad Monceau) as this seemed to offer better value and a chance to escape from the chaos of the city for a while.If your interested in taking a cooking course in Marrakech then we fully recommend this one, we had a great time, cooked some excellent food, then ate it (wife's was better than mine, think some kind of sabotage took place)

Felt like a tourist trap. This cooking school was recommended by our hotel (separate critique, and my other major disappointment in Marrakech). The morning pick-up was a half hour late, already not a good sign. The facility is quite a distance outside the city. We were met by a French man, who we understood was the owner, but after a few pleasantries he vanished until the end of our session. I got the impression that their large building is geared for large tourist groups (thankfully there were only a few other people there the day we went).
