Best meal in Morocco. The best meal you will eat in Morocco is the one you made yourself. If you visit Marrakech don't miss this experience to learn how to make delicious traditional Moroccan dishes.

Authentic and fabulous cooking experience!. Chef Tarik and his associates couldn't have been more warm, welcoming, attentive and knowledgeable. I loved learning to cook Moroccan food (tagines and salads) and prepare fresh mint tea from the experts. The farm setting was super and chef Tarik's attention to detail made this experience truly memorable. It's a great way to unwind from the frenetic life of the city.
Cooking class. I loved ! The experience of learning in a place you can get your fresh ingretients was very nice ! The people who work are very very nice !Thank you all !!

A Time Machine 40 Minutes Outside of Marrakech. Chef Tarik explained to me, after our private cooking lesson, he had been a young chef working in Marrakesh when he proposed to the owner a new notion: a cooking class based upon an organic garden in an old village where workers return from the field under the midday sun herding cattle through the narrow street. All of the cooking, from herb tea to bread to tagines to vegetables is done over simple wood fires.Is it a skillful cooking lesson in Moroccan cuisine, spices and organic gardening along with a lovely lunch? Is it an amble through a village which has hardly changed over the course of years? Is it an opportunity to understand that traditional in this world can mean hundreds of years? Yes, all those things. And then magically, and almost inadvertently, it is a time machine which transports you into the core of cooking which underlies all of the work we do when we whir and grind and set our timers and download our recipes in our urban kitchens on distant shores.When you sit outside afterward on carpets under the shade of swatches of brightly colored fabrics, eating the remarkable dishes you have made together under the careful guiding hands of Chef Tarik, his assistant Yusef, Fatimeh who bakes bread in a Berber oven and Hussan who teaches you the art of making herbal tea, you look out on the gardens and past them you can see, if you half close your eyes, the centuries of time which you have transcended..We have been to wonderful cooking classes in North and South America, Asia and Europe. This was the first one which included in its equipment a time machine.

A day in the country. We enjoyed our day of cooking using a targine and preparing the ingredients picked onsiteAvery relaxing day enhanced by the kindness of staffPlease visit and escape the bustle of Marachech

Learning to cook in Marrakech. We had a wonderfully organised day in a kitchen garden. The vegetables, meat at herbs were exceptionally fresh and we were brilliantly taught. After preparing lunch, we were welcomed as we walked through a Berber village while our tajines were cooking. We then sat down to a feast of Moroccan food. One of the best holiday excursions we have ever taken.

A fun day. A wonderful half day was spent with Tarik, Joseph and Hasan at the organic farm in a village about 25 mins from the madina in Marrakesh. Tarik was a fun and knowledgeable teacher who guided us through there preparation of tasty local dishes that could easily be created upon return home. Interesting facts were also shared about the traditions surrounding Moroccan cuisine. All the staff were welcoming and hospitable. It was a great day in the quiet of the village away from hustle and bustle of the medina, and the lunch consisting of what we prepared was plentiful. Highly recommended.

Incredible Experience!!. Wow-I cannot say enough good things about this experience. I make it a point to take a cooking class anytime I travel as it is usually a very nice time. This was by far the BEST cooking class I've ever taken. It isn't just a cooking class, it is an entire experience. From the moment we arrived, we were treated with such kindness. It was so evident that Chef Tarik loves what he does and is so passionate for his trade, as well as everyone we worked with that day. We also met and had the chance to work with Hassen, Youssef, and 3imad-all three of these individuals were amazing as well!!! We were in Morocco for 10 days, and we did the cooking class on our final full day. I think this was perfect because by this point, we had ate many tagines and had drank our body weight in Moroccan mint tea!! Because of this, the cooking class was that much more interesting. Tarik did an excellent job explaining all of the different spices, all of the different ingredients, and what goes into making the tea. Hassen was a tea master!! It was excellent. Aside from the tagines and salad, we also were able to see Moroccan bread be made by one of the women in the Berber village-this was so neat and absolutely delicious. It was truly special that the cooking class was located on a beautiful organic farm. It was so neat that and special to cook the food from the land. Tarik had great pride about this and he should have-it was amazing and so fresh! Aside from cooking, eating, and getting educated, Tarik and Hassen also gave us a tour of the garden and a walk around the Berber village. This was also great. By the time we finished, our meals were fully done being cooked and setup for us to eat. The overall setup of the farm was beautiful. We ate under a large tented area that had lovely colored pillows for us to sit under. To top things off, when we finished the class, Tarik let us keep our chef hats and aprons, and he also awarded all of us with "graduation" certificates. It was TOO cute!!! So fun and really rounded out the whole day. They also sent us away with good bags of some nice gifts. This place is a MUST SEE/DO while in Morocco. I would recommend to everyone and hope to be back!! Thank you thank you thank you to everyone at Atelier De Cuisine, Chef Tarik, and all those involved in making our experience so unforgettable! -Rachael, Matt, Rachel & Taylor

A Great Experience. Our time there was amazing. From learning how to make the mint tea, to picking our herbs and vegetables and then making some wonderful dishes, a great time was had. The best part - getting to eat all the yummy food we had created.

Cultural and educational cooking class experience!. What a wonderful experience my friends and I had with Chef Tarik and team. This was our first time in Morocco and the cooking class definitely left an amazing first impression - Our group of 6 was picked up and taken to the organic farm which was in a lovely village about 20-25 min away from central Marrakech. What we love most is that this farm was created to employ and empower the local villagers. We were greeted by big smiles and a picnic set up where we learned about traditional tea ceremony, spice workshop, organic garden tour, bread workshop and tajine interactive cooking. We ended the night with a surprise dessert from Chef Tarik and a final surprise that I won't reveal here. Overall, very memorable experience and definitely a highlight of our trip! HIGHLY recommend for groups big and small :)

Food great; team better. My family visited Tarik's atelier in late July. We enjoyed our time immensely. His team made us feel immediately at home. His program was enjoyably instructional (we all feel we could duplicate the dishes at home) and the dinner (it turns out) was great. Well worth the trip.

Excellent Cooking Class!. My husband, two daughters (15 and 23), and I enjoyed a wonderful experience with Chef Tarik. The beautiful cooking school and organic garden is hidden away off a dirt road in a small village, approximately 20 minutes from the center of Marrakech. It is well worth the trip! We stopped in one morning on our way from the Atlas Mountains to Marrakech, and enjoyed a wonderful cooking class. We learned about all of the spices used to make the various tangines, and then we proceeded to pick fresh vegetables and herbs from the garden for our preparations. We all had the hands on experience of preparing chicken, lamb, and vegetable tangines, as well as a couple of salads. Chef Tarik was most patient in his instruction to my daughters and husband, none of whom have much experience chopping, slicing, dicing, or even general cooking. The food we prepared was some of the best we had during our entire stay (12 days) in Morocco. While the tangines were cooking, Chef Tarik took us on a walk through the local village which surrounds the cooking school, and it was wonderful to see how the local villagers live and to meet the very friendly children. When we returned, we got to see how the bread is made in the bread oven they have at the school (we observed and did not make the bread, which was fine with us; it was so fresh and warm when we ate it!). Of course our lunch ended, just as it began, with a traditional tea service (--we were instructed on how to make the tea as well). It was an excellent experience and I highly recommend it as an unusual way to spend some time in Morocco, and a welcome change from the hustle and bustle of the medinas.

'Hands-on" Moroccan cookery class was a highlight of our wonderful Moroccan trip. We visited a small village on the outskirts of Marrakech - to enjoy a really special 'hands-on' Moroccan cookery class at Atelier De Cuisine Chef Tarik Orty-Ct - an organic farm - run by Tariq and his team. They were enthusiastic, welcoming and most informative. To start we donned a green apron and a tall chef's hat - to look the part! We prepared a chicken, beef and vegetable tagine under supervision. We put each prepared tagine over hot coals to cook slowly. We had to tend each tagine while they were cooking - to stir the ingredients around and to add extra water when needed. We also prepared a number of Moroccan salads.It was extremely helpful to do "hands-on" and to learn the spices relevant to each tagine. After a long walk we returned to our tutors and devoured the dishes we had prepared!

Unique experience!. This was definitely one if the highlights of our trip. My husband, daughter, son, and I really enjoy cooking classes and this one was a unique experience. It was just the four of us and we enjoyed learning about mint tea and the spices in the various tagines. The fresh baked bread with goat cheese and olive oil was to die for!!! And not to leave unmentioned, Chef Tariq and his staff were most welcoming and informative. Loved that it was hands on and well paced. I brought back a tagine and some spices to experiment with!
cooking class morocco. a very enjoyable afternno,nice people very informative and good eating.Great group activity and very good value
Better than i expect. Learned more than moroccan cuisine. Very warm welcome by chef and the staff. Excellent experience...

One of the highlights of our trip to Morocco. We had several wonderful hours learning how to prepare and cook many of the dishes we had been enjoying as we travelled throughout Morocco. The setting was lovely, the pace was relaxed, the recipes were wonderful and the food was delicious. The entire staff was attentive, patient, pleasant and helpful. Thank you for making this one of the highlights of what was already a magical trip.

A fabulous cooking school!. We were a group of 7 and we all had a fabulous day.Tarik was a friendly and informative teacher. The tagines weren't complicated recipes like some you read, but the flavours were amazing. I have cooked them since I have returned home.The setting and organic gardens were wonderful. As was the bread.I highly recommend this experience to anyone who enjoys "foodie" experiences.

Moroccan cooking class. Wonderful experience cooking Moroccan specialities with ingredients from an organic garden. Lessons in spices and making Moroccan tea. Class was very well organized and lots of fun. Chef Tarik and his assistants were great to work with and it is obvious how much they enjoyed passing their knowledge on to us. While the food was cooking, we walked thru the village and returned to our meal all cooked and beautifully presented. What a treat the entire day was!

A highlight of our Morocco trip!. It was wonderful! We had fun, we learned a lot, Chef Tarik was warm, friendly, informative, charming. It was a nice "day off" from sight-seeing, from shopping, from walking. And, the food was delicious! Apparently we learned well - if I don't say so myself, we are all good cooks! :)

Learning to cook like a true Moroccan. As a chef, I thrive on learning local dishes and the secrets to recreating them back home. I teach families and kids how to cook and love simple, seasonal foods. Our day with Chef Tarik, his assistant Joseph, and our tea master, Hassan, was one of the highlights of my two weeks in Morocco. We were joined by two lovely UK friends in our class, first learning how to make Moroccan mint tea from Hassan. I was so thrilled as I'd bought a tea pot and had hoped to teach kids back home this beautiful ceremony! On to spice mixtures--which was taught in such a beautiful way we could all remember...before we dived into hands-on cooking after exploring the beautiful organic vegetable gardens. Tarik is a great teacher, making us all have fun and learn while building our 3 Tagines and beautiful side dishes. A highlight for me was learning how Fatima made her breads (best I ate in Morocco) and seeing the three traditional ovens cooks use for baking breads, cooking Tangia, or making Mechoui bbq. And of course, we relished our gorgeous dishes at the end under a cool tent at a beautiful table (and Tarik's surprise dessert, which I'll also enjoy teaching kids back at home). A beautiful day--so well done by the entire staff. As they say in Arabic, it was "ladiid" from beginning to end, which means delicious, and a big "Chokran bisef" from Chef Hollie from Joyfoodly!

"Delights of Moroccan Culture". Just completed the Atelier.de cuisine It was a very enjoyable and educational experience, especially learning to make mint tea, lamp, chicken tangine from scratch. Chef Tarik and his team are amazing, enthusiastic and passionate. They share there knowledge about fresh ingredients. The class was very hands-on and it was a reward to sit down at the end and eat the amazing food, which us students and chefs had prepared. Thank you for a wonderful time and learning experience.The garden is a paradise. I brought a tangine on my return to the uk and have started cooking Moroccan style. People check this place out and enjoy the journey!!!!! :)

Great fun .. This is a great activity if you fancy a day away from the turmoil of Marrakech and is set in an organic farm which Chef Tariq set up.Chef met us off our coach and led us to an area to explain about the significance of tea making and spices we would use today.Then we donned our hats and aprons to make our tagines. Loved Chef's sense of humour.At the end we ate the results in a covered area set with tables.It really is a good fun activity and you get a certificate to prove we did it!Thanks Chef

What fun!. Chef Tariq and his assistants gave us a memorable experience as we prepared our tagines, were shown the intricacies of Moroccan tea and bread-making. Tariq is charming and has a great sense of humour. Our group of 7 really enjoyed the ambience and found it a rather relaxing and certainly tasty experience in this little haven away from the hustle and bustle! A delightful experience which I thoroughly recommend for a variety of age groups and travellers.

Really fun cooking adventure in Marrakesh. We stopped by for a cooking intro on our way to the mountains from Marakesh and had a delightful time and learned a lot. Started with tea making, a tour of the gardens and then tanginess cooking. The staff were very kind and informative. All in all a delightful day.
Great cooking class. Tarik is an excellent teacher, and I thoroughly enjoyed every moment of his class. I would highly recommend it.

Fun Day. A day out of Marrakesh, in a somewhat well hidden spot - hope your driver finds it - we spent a lovely day discovering and learning some of the tricks of the Marroccan kitchen. The whole program is well presented and mainly fun fun fun to do. I can only highly recommend this for all who have a bit of interest and knowledge in cooking, its also suitable for interested teens. Our only complaint concerns the dull knives - a bit frustrating - but can to a limited extent accept a "safety" excuse. Should you have the time to take a day off, its a lovely change from overcrowded Marrakesh.

Fun in the kasbah. Tarik was an excellent teacher, the recipes seem simple but the food was very tastey. The setting was lovely. I would highly recommend this experience to everyone that has an interest in cooking or just eating excellent food and wants a touch of the local cusine.
surprising creative organic kitchen. We visited the Atelier with a management team, which unanimously were very enthousiastic about the quality and presentation of the food.

A Must Do in Morocco!. What an amazing experience. The spice lesson, the garden, the cooking lesson and the grand finale ... the food. If you are a cook, a food lover or a locavore, this is a must do!

cookery class. We did the cookery class as at atelier de cuisine chef tarik .Part of it was good and we did learn some about Moroccan cooking but a large part was done "on routine" without much personal enthusiasm from the chef tarik.

Excellent staff, great cooking experience in the country with organic food. The day started with a cup of tea and moved into the more serious business of how to make the tea, with a discussion of the best herbs. We then moved around the farm, looking at at various vegetables and gathering our ingredients. Off to watch bread being made in a traditional oven then into our cooking station.The time spent was wonderful and by cooking and learning I think we all felt closer to our understanding daily liife in Morroco. All the staff was from the community and very professional and helpful. I was with my 14 year old son and husband. We had a good time.

Highlight of my visit to Morocco!. A pleasure from start to finish. We were greeted by Chef Tarik and his entourage and then shown the procedure for making Berber whisky (mint tea) which we then got to enjoy (delicious). We then had a tour around the organic farm and watched a local Berber woman make bread which we then got to try (also delicious). Then we got down to the cooking... .Tarik and his sous chef / translator were both fantastic. They were informative, very good teachers, patien and above all very funny and welcoming. We were able to really get stuck in and do the preparing and cooking ourselves under their guidance. We were taken for a little walk around the village whilst our food cooked and then back to the garden to taste our creations! It was all absolutely delicious. We learnt about spices and Moroccan cooking and culture. I would recommend this place to ANYONE visiting the area. EXCELLENT all round!

REFRESHING! RECONMENDED! A MUST IN ITINERARY!. It's worth to put aside some time from the hustle of Jemaa el fna and typical visit to the tourist attraction if you are in Marrakesh.From Tea appreciation to getting ingredients fresh from the garden, cooking lesson and short walk around the village I must say this was one of the highlight of our journey through Morocco and we are honored.Learning ones culture is definitely through its food!We like to thank the chefs for the guidance and time for this wonderful experience.Highly recommended.

Super cooking class!!!. We did the cooking class today and had a really good time on the farm. What sets this class apart is the organic concept, the involvement of the local community and the excellent and professional service. The pickup from the hotel went super smooth and the driver David was even there 15min before the agreed time. We drove roughly 30 min out of town to the organic farm, with the Atlas Mountains in the background. It was only the 2 of us in the course, I think usually it is about 6. The class itself includes an introduction into the moroccan tea ceremony, and the most important spices. Main part is the preparation of 3 different tagines and salads. When the tagines are on the fire to cook, a lady from the village shows, how the bread is traditionally prepared. To spend the time until the tagines are done we took a walk through the village with Samir and Hassan and enjoyed the sun and the stunning scenery, before having the delicious dinner. For the desert Samir has prepared a very fancy fruit-yoghurt cookie arrangement with bananas and a very tasty sauce. Thanks again for this very nice experience!!! It is defiantly a highlight of our trip!
Professional,thourogh,patient and entertaining.. We would recommend travelers visit this facility,enjoy the views,gardens and learn a little about Moroccan quisine.
delightful!. Beautiful venue, charming staff, amazing food and great cooking lessons. A real pleasure. ~~~~~~~~~~

Beautiful, delicious, fragrant day in the Moroccan countryside. We had a wonderful day learning about Moroccan tea, spices, ingredients (including picking fresh vegetables from the garden), under the guidance of our knowledge and friendly chefs. I would recommend this heartily to anyone interested in Moroccan cuisine and in taking a break from the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh. Excellent instruction and service, beautiful surroundings, and delicious food.

An Experience to Thrill Your Senses!. One of my personal highlights of travelling are visiting markets, tasting new cuisines and learning to cook it if there are coking classes available. It's common that cooking classes are combined with visits to the market, but it is very uncommon to combine picking your own ingredients and then cooking with them. And it is because of this reason that we chose to take a cooking class with Atelier de Cuisine Chef Tarik. I contacted the Atelier online, enquired about their availability and confirmed our pick up location at our Riad in a few emails. We are not heavy meat eaters so I requested that we make mostly vegetarian dishes with one fish dish which they accommodated. On the morning of our course a mother and daughter asked if we were taking a cooking course during our stay and we encouraged them to contact the Atelier to see if they could join us. Within an hour of our pick-up the Atelier had arranged for a bus to pick the six of us up and off we went to the farm. The farm is located about 30 minutes out of the city on a farm closer to the mountains. We only had two and half days in Marrakech and wanted to explore both the city and some of the surrounding area and do a cooking class. This course allowed us to make a day-trip out of the city and cook some fantastic dishes in a bucolic environment with the snow-capped mountains framing the backdrop to this beautiful day. A driver picked us up in town and drove us to the farm. We were then welcomed with a traditional tea ceremony and the chefs provided us with an overview of the day's activities (we booked the "standard" cooking class) which included:- tea ceremony and instructions on how to make Moroccan tea- overview of typical Moroccan spices and four main flavour combinations used in tagines and couscous dishes- walk through the garden where we picked some (not all) of the vegetables that we prepared- preparation of three tagines, three salads, and a vegetable couscous under a woven canopy in the garden- snack of fresh goats cheese and bread hot out of the over 1 metre from the table- walk to a neighbouring village in a valley (highlights were walking through the fields and fantastic views of the mountains)- feast on the dishes we made- surprise dessert- certificate ceremony- return to MarrakechThe instruction we received throughout the whole day was comprehensive, thorough, and responsive to our enquiries. All of the staff on the farm were fantastic! They anticipated our needs and provided us with such excellent hospitality. The quality of the ingredients was fantastic and the dishes that we made were the best that we tasted in Morocco. At one point during the day we discussed the feeling of needing to "see things" when you travel, to check off the major sights to make experiences and then contrasted it to where we were - on a beautiful farm, learning from two experienced chefs, and truly celebrating Moroccan cuisine - and what an experience we were making right then. So leave the city behind and strike out for new horizons that will please all of your senses!

A good way to make dinner.. This was a great way to get out of the chaos of the city and enjoy some fresh air and great food. Talk about farm to table! This is the real deal. The chefs were great, the food was clean and the results were delicious! Why take a class in a cold kitchen when you can do it in a lovely outside farm kitchen? Come hungry!!!!!!

A Wonderful Way to Spend Your Day. I normally do not review attractions, but this one was very unique and fun so I wanted to share our experience. This is a cooking class, but also so much more. We reserved the day just for our family. The two chefs are genuinely warm and kind and are very good with kids. I do not want to spoil the experience for you, but you will not be disappointed. When you ask my kids what their one or two favorite activities we did on our two week trip, this was one of them. Thank you for a wonderful day!

Extraordinary Moroccan Cuisine!. We had a wonderful day at this farm in the countryside! The setting was lovely. We gathered the ingredients for our cooking class in the garden. And then we cooked a delicious meal of chicken and preserved lemon tajin, lamb tajin and vegetable tajin. We also had a lesson on spices. The visit to the village and the school was great fun. The children were cute as can be. And loved having pics taken. Chef Samir and Chef Tarik were excellent teachers and most encouraging. All in all, a fantastic day that should not be missed.

The best food & experience we had in Morocco!. We had such an amazing time - the food was phenomenal and they made us feel at home! We loved seeing the spices we'd use, loved walking through the organic gardens, and especially appreciated our short stroll through the village.

Greatest experience. was the best thing i have ever done in marrakech, i had the best food, after this experience all morroccan restaurants food was tastless compared to what we had at the farm>will definitely give it another visit the next time im in marrakech>Not forgetting the lovely hike and sight seeing and clean environment and fresh air and great super polite crew that have accompanied us.
Very good. Lovely day out, the chef & staff were very hospitable.. The food was delicious. Would definitely reccommend this experience & visit again if not for cooking classes for lunch.

Can't cook, won't cook, learnt to cook. If you're going to visit Marrakech you must pay a visit to Atelier De Cuisine. The manager of the hotel we were staying at suggested the trip as my two companions had already been to Marrrakech and were looking for a new experience. This was my first time, so I was happy to go with the flow.After a beautiful ride through the countryside, we arrived at the working farm and kitchen and were greeted by Chef Tarik, his assistant and an elder. The day's activities were explained with Tarik's assistant translating for the Chef. We started with tea making, Morroccan style. Next a tour of the herb garden followed by the main attraction 'cooking Morroccan style'. My partners in crime and myself really enjoyed this experience as we got our manicured hands dirty, chopping and dicing vegetables and meat. There was a host of other activities throughout the day but our final adventure had us all walking to the nearby village. Life is so peaceful.I would advise anyone coming to Marrakech to visit Atelier De Cuisine for a truly unique experience. A day full of fun and learning with a team who make you feel welcome and cared for. Oh, there is a surprise at the end for all us budding chefs.

Best culinary experience ever!. When our travel agent suggested we take a class on an organic farm outside of Marrakech, I wasn't sure what to expect and our day with Chef Tarik and his assistant Samir truly exceeded all expectations. We were two families, with kids ranging from ages 14 to 22. Our time here included learning about all the ingredients, touring the farm, learning about the ingredients/spices we'd be using, hands on preparation of several tanginess and salads, a bread baking demonstration and a walk around the berber village. And then, our delectable meal served to us under the shade of a beautiful tent. We really learned a lot and so enjoyed being on the farm. My 14 year old son declared this as his favorite activity of the trip--a shock since he's never shown any interest in cooking. Bon appetit!

AMAZING COOKING CLASS IN MOROCCO. We spent part of the day with Chef Tarik and Chef Tarik's assistant. This was the highlight of our trip to Morocco. My entire family went (along with another Family) and we just loved this. We learned about teas and making moroccan tea, we toured then picked all kinds of vegetables from their huge garden, we then made multiple Tagine (Chicken, Lamb and Veggie). They were the best Tagine we had in a 10 day trip! We watched as a person working at the farm made us fresh bread and we then feasted on all the food we made sitting outdoors. Chef Tarik and his Chef partner there were so kind and fun and knowledgable about food and ingredients. We had a lesson on Moroccan spices as well. While everything was cooking they walked us to the local village where most of their ingredients come from. In fact the Cooking School/Farm creates many jobs for people in the village.Just an amazing wonderful experience. Probably the highlight of our trip to Morocco.

Oasis in the desert. We stopped here with a large group after a night camping in the desert. Our driver stopped in a village and we got out and looked around and wondered where we were. It didn't look like a place to eat, but then we walked through a gate and into a lovely garden and dining area and were taken back by the beauty and simplicity of the setting. Even before we ate our first bite of the wonderful meal, we knew it would be special. Everything was fresh and delicious. We had a few vegetarians and they were equally pleased with their meal. This was the best Moroccan meal we ate during our entire visit.

Spices and Chopping. The cooking school was a last minute booking on a fairly wet December weekend in Marrakech. We booked it through our Riad and had no real idea what to expect. We were driven for about 30 minutes to an isolated farm near a small village outside the city. Once through the farm gates we glimpsed a well tended organic garden brimming with fresh hers and vegetables. Our chef spoke mostly in French and his assistant translated for us. They patiently and carefully explained the time honoured ritual of tea making, the spices used in the food and how they were used. Next they let us loose with (fairly blunt) knives to chop a prepare the meat and veg for each of the dishes we were making. Very much a hands-on course where you get to eat what you cooked. My advice is not to book a big dinner for the evening - you won't need it. We were the only two people on the course that day so we had the very best of attention. They can cater for larger groups but may need a bit more notice than just the night before.A great experience - and it didn't rain after all!

Loved the cooking class!. A wonderful few hours spent in the Atlas Mountains preparing Moroccan tagines on an organic farm. The cooking class was terrific, the staff was extraordinary and the scenery spectacular. A fantastic family activity!!!

Amazing Experience!. Loved every minute of this experience! Even for someone like me that doesn't cook very often, it was so easy and the results were delicious!A big thank you to the chef, translator and all the kitchen staff as well.......their guidance and enthusiasm was contagious and made the ambience and experience very memorable!!!

Moroccan Delight. An absolute highlight of our Moroccan adventure! We learnt so much about local cuisine and had lots of fun helping prepare our delicious lunch. The cooking school's organic farm is also very interesting growing a wide variety of herbs and vegetables. Three tagines and three salads later we at last began to understand the amazing complexities of this fabulous cuisine. A real food adventure.

“Make this a priority during your stay in Marrakech”. We had a wonderful day at Atelier De Cuisine Chef Tarik Orty-Ct It was lovely to be in the countryside and chef tarik and his staff were great. The facilities were excellent- very clean and bright. The mix of instruction and hands on cooking and tasting was perfect. The spice course was fun and insightful. We enjoyed sitting outside and feasting on our cooked tajines etc . We highly recommend the class.Visited July 2014

L’Atelier de cuisine jardin.potager.bio, with Chef Tarik. Our cookery experience takes place in the Amizmiz Valley, Just a short ride from Marrakech, where the Organic Farm “L’Atelier de cuisine jardin.potager.bio” is located. This elegant eco-farm is set amongst 15 hectares of olive groves, vegetable gardens and orchards, in a traditional Berber hamlet with the imposing silhouette of the High Atlas mountains dominating the landscape.The Chef’s name is Mr Tarik , and before we start to cook, he gives us a general introduction about the Moroccan cooking and the Organic ingredients. What was really amazing is that you could learn many dishes during the courses and get so much information.The Chef Tarik explains everything in perfect style, he was an awesome teacher, knowledgeable, understandable and amusing. I thought the whole experience was very well done and I learned a lot.Definitely this is the best cooking class I've ever been to. Afterwards, we enjoy the food we ourselves have prepared under the shadow of the Olive trees, served in style, accompanied with the Moroccan Tea. YAM

Amazing insight to food, culture and history. Chef Tarik has set up a more than just a cooking class; it’s a demonstration of ecotourism, community enrichment, organic farming, and true hospitality. We sharpened in our skills of cooking understanding the basic flavors for specific Moroccan dishes as we discussed how to enrich the lives of the small village the farm is located in. Chef Tarik has a deep passion for food as well as helping a community create sustainable business and food sources locally. If you head to Marrakesh you must book this experience plan several hours and be ready to have insightful conversation, amazing foods and top notch hospitality.

Something really wonderful and different!. This is a very special place and Chef Tarik is a very special chef. We were in a group of 8 and loved the experience! It is located about 20 minutes from Marrakesh and will worth the travel. It is a beautiful farm/garden that is open to explore, located on a picturesque Moroccan lane. All the people were so lovely and engaging. Beautiful countryside. We did not take a cooking class but had the tea service which was really nice. We explored the garden and the olive groves that surround the restaurant then on to a fabulous lunch. The freshest food, prepared beautifully. I would definitely come back to this place. Chef Tarik and his staff made us feel so at home.

My kids LOVED this cooking class!. The adults and the kids in our group loved the cooking class with Chef Tarik. He was patient and engaging with the kids. And gave the adults wonderful tips and ideas for cooking Morroccan food.His farm is beautiful, and the staff are world-class.

Highlight of Marrakech. I highly recommend a cooking class with Chef Tarik. It was the highlight of our visit. I am not a good cook ! but by the end of the visit i had helped prepare and cook some wonderful Moroccan food. We were greeted with some wonderful Mint tea and sat down getting to know one another. Felt so relaxed, so at home. It was wonderful learning about original Moroccan people (Berbers) Then we participated in cooking a wonderful lunch. We did all the preparation outside under cover from the sun. Whilst the food was cooking we ate fresh hot bread straight out of the clay built oven. Finally our feast was ready. Our food was awesome. This experience is not to be missed . What a talented man Chef Tarik is.
A truly unique experience. While in Marrakech, I highly recommend taking a cooking class with Atelier de Cuisine. I had a wonderful experience, learning about Moroccan cooking.

A taste of Moroccan countryside, farming, olive groves - outstanding. A real taste of Morocco with Chef Tarik hosting our stay - great tea ceremony followed by walk through fresh vegetable farm; walk to olive grove then outstanding lunch of Moroccan appetizers and wonderful tagine! There is also a possibility to take cooking classes if time permits.This was a highlight of our stay in Morocco.....

An amazing taste of Morocco. Our visit to this beautiful farm/cooking school came at the end of a fabulous two week tour of Morocco. Both we and our friends found this the crowning experience of our visit. As we all participated in cooking a delicious lunch of tagines and salad and partook of mint tea, we seemed to be filling ourselves with the essence of this fascinating, complex and culturally rich country. A tour of the farm and a walk through the nearby village rounded out the visit. The very talented, charming Chef Tarik has given us one of our fondest memories of Morocco. If you are in Marrakech, do make the effort to visit " Atelier de Cuisine Chef Tarik."

Give yourself a gift.. Chef Tarik has a vision for creating a wonderful environment to share his love of his country, the food, and the land. He and his staff have designed a wonderful combination of learning, eating,and enjoying a beautiful environment. The experience was truly a gift.

Fantastic Marrakech experience. A 35 minute drive into the Amzemiz Valley takes you into another world from the medina. The property is gorgeous and Chef Tarik is handsome, charming and gracious. He brings his years of international training and experience as an Executive Chef to his mission to teach visitors about Moroccan cuisine and help the village and its citizens. You will experience a tea ceremony,fresh hot bread out of the oven,prepare a variety of dishes and after a relaxing walk around the property, enjoy a feast fit for a king! I cannot recommend this experience enough!

Authentic Cooking Experience in a Beautiful Setting. Our party of 2 adults and 2 children (ages 9 & 11) were welcomed to the class (in a gorgeous hotel) with tea, a visit to the local bread bakery, and an introduction to Moroccan spices. Afterwards we headed to the kitchen for a break making lesson and to prepare our own tagine and salads. I am a vegetarian and they easily accommodated my needs. It was a perfect ending to our Moroccan adventure. Thank you La Maison Arabe for this experience and for the surprise tagine gift at the end of the class.

Brilliant Class. I had a wonderfull experience at the cookery class, the highlight of my stay in Marrakech. Mohammed gave us a wonderful talk about Morocan cooking & spices and brought us to the local community bakery, which was very interesting. We then went to the well equipped kitchen to start our hands on cooking experience. The dada and assistants were very friendly and helpful. We finished by eating our prepared meal in the lovely dining area. All budding chefs were then given a certificate and tagine and recipe cards, so looking forward to trying out the recipes at home!

Fantastic class. We had a fantastic time at this amazing cooking class. The facilities are beautiful and the translator gave a great historical background of Moroccain cooking/traditions/origins. Food was amazing. The Dada was very friendly and talented. They were very professional and the day was seamless. Highly recommend it to anyone wanting a lesson on tagines. There were 2 gas burners per student with a sink between every 2 people and a tv screen for every 2 people so you could see what the Dada was doing. There were assistants wandering the room to help if needed. They had a lovely table set and serviced while we ate our tagines and salads. And the dessert was amazing as well. Beautifully done.

Amazing and informative!. We booked our cooking course at maison a l'arabe in advance of our Marrakech trip, and we're so glad we did! A fantastically equipped modern kitchen, wonderful Dada (chef) giving instructions, and we were each given a little tagine to take home and recipe cards for the food we made. All topped off with eating a lovely meal on the shady terrace in beautiful gardens. Excellent value for money, too!

Fun Family Cooking Experience. Our family group (two grandparents, a parent, and two teenage grandchildren) enjoyed the lunch cooking class together. We learned a lot about Moroccan spices, and made a few dishes. The staff was knowledgeable and so helpful as even as simple eggplant dish required lots of chopping while you couldn't neglect the simmering tagine. Desert, which we didn't make, was delicious as well. We highly recommend La Mason Arabe - their reputation is well deserved!

Beautiful place, excellent instruction, and you get to eat what you have cooked. This is a beautiful place, excellently equipped, and the instructors are superb. Each cooking station has a view of the chef via a large screen just above the station, the ingredients are all set out in advance within easy reach, or provided just as you need them, it couldn't be better organized. The recipes are necessarily on the simple side, but are typical Moroccan dishes, and you get a real feel for how to cook with a tagine, very helpful indeed if you've never done it before, as I hadn't. After the class, you proceed downstairs to the lovely courtyard dining area, and are served the food you have prepared, carried down by the staff. All in all, a very worthwhile and informative experience, I couldn't recommend it more highly.

Amazing. We loved this class. The staff was friendly, knowledgable, and professional. The cooking portion of the class took place in a large kitchen with 12 individual stations so we each had a full up to date station. The directions were clear and it was easy to keep up regardless of your cooking experience. The food turned out well too!! This was a fantastic course. I can't wait to cook some Moroccan dishes for friends and family back home. We loved it so much we want to start taking cooking classes everywhere we go!

Fabulous Cooking School. We have taken short (1 day) cooking schools all over the world and this was the best organized, well run class we have ever attended. There were only 8 in our class and all were from the USA so the class was given in English. The presenter spoke excellent English and presented everything in a clear, carefully prepared manner.This is a very modern kitchen where every participant has their own cooking utensils, cooking stove and wash basin. This obviously has been constructed very recently as everything is sparkling new. You get to cook most of the meal in a tagine. At the end of the class they gave us a small tagine to take home.I probably learned more about spices in this class than in any other previous classes.Of course you eat the food you prepare at the end of the preparation.What a great alternate to another day of touring and shopping!

Best cooking school I have ever taken.. My husband and I loved this cooking school. It was extremely well organized. The time flew and we chopped and cooked with very good directions. Excellent way to understand morrocan spices, their bread baking, their tea service, and their flavours.Highly recommend.

GREAT FUN AND VERY WELL ORGANIZED CLASS. One of our favorite activities when traveling to new places is to take a cooking class. We really enjoy Moroccan food and it was a special delight to take a class at La Maison Arabe. It was very well organized, most interesting and it was a real hands on class. Not only did we learn some good general tips, but they sent us home with the tagine we had used for cooking our dish. The set up was very good with mirrors to help see the chefs hands and after the class our dishes were carried down to lovely dining area to enjoy the meal. The chef was an amazing woman and it was a privilege to meet her. All the staff were very friendly and helpful and it was a real highlight of our time in Marrakech.

Highly enjoyable cooking class. Attended this class with my wife during our honeymoon after having read positive reviews on TA. We both really enjoyed it from start to finish. The venue is beautiful and kitchens of a very high spec and standard. Staff very friendly and hands on, guiding us through each stage of the cooking process and passing on their knowledge. I must say in the end the tagine we made was the best we tasted during our time in Marrakech. Definitely recommended for foodies.

Amazing experience. I didn't know much about moroccan cooking and this course was wonderful. The amount of work that goes into the tea is shocking but totally worth it. The class was in a beautiful room with a professional setup. The grounds are beautiful as well. The food turned out great and we were gifted with a tagines to take home. The instruction was fun and educational. Highly recommended.

Great class. I went with the girlfriend that really wanted to this. Had a great time. Spent an hour learning about the spices and than 2 hours or so cooking and having dinner with what we made. Very enjoyable time. Very informative

Fantastic cooking class. My husband and I really enjoyed this cooking class. The setting was beautiful, the hostess and the dadas were all lovely, informative and friendly. Food was well explained and we had a great time preparing the two salads and tagine. Sharing the meal together at the end was fun and meant we could get to know our group even better. We even got a little present at the end! I would highly recommend this class.

Great experience, highly recommend. We had such an amazing experience. We went to the class in the Medina which they have only recently opened. The kitchen was beautiful and the chef, guide and assistant were all great. The guide gave an introduction at the start which was really interesting. We cooked 2 delicious salads and a tangine. The chef showed us how to make bread and dessert. After cooking, they set up a table fir us downstairs to eat our meal along with bread and dessert. Everyone was really helpful and we were even given a parting gift. Highly recommend

Great cooking class!. We had a blast at this cooking workshop. We were asked to come to the La maison arabe hotel and we're welcomed with a cup of moroccan tea. After 15min there was a car waiting to bring us to the country ranch where the workshop takes place. Must stay it was like being treated as royalty lol! Normally the workshop was planned for us and another couple fornutaley for us they didn't show up so we had a private cooking lesson.We learned how to make morrocan tea, saw how traditional morrocan bread was baked and then it was our turn. We each made 2 kinds of salads and a chicken tagine. The whole experience was a lot of fun and would recommend this to everyone staying in Marrakech looking to learn the real cuisine!

Holiday cooking workshop. This was a lovely day out in our holiday. My daughter and I both enjoyed the experience. The host explained the history and influences of morrocon culture on the food served and talked about the main ingredients we would be using. We learnt how to make bread and mint tea in the lovely gardens, before the main cooking event. Each person had their own work station, equipment and ingredients. There was plenty of help on hand if we got stuck and the dishes were well demonstrated. We then ate the food we had prepared for our lunch in the garden outside. It was a fantastic day.

Fabulous!!! Fantastic!!!. We had a marvelous cooking class with Mohammed Nair and his teamIt was the best meal we had in Marrakesh!!It was an amazing kitchen, so clean and organized. Loved the visit to the spice store and the explanationEverything about the experience was wonderful!!

AMAZING experience learning to cook Moroccan food. Absolutely beautiful location - the kitchen is really breathtaking -wonderful location to learn to cook Moroccan food. It's a very fun group activity - you can cook tajines, moroccan pastries, pastilla, etc. Takes about 3-4 hours but the real fun is eating what you worked so hard in the kitchen to cook!

Excellent Instruction for Exquisite Food. My partner and I had wonderful day learning how to cook and thoroughly enjoyed what we produced. It was a very organised set up which meant that we could see what to do at all times either from looking at our screens or directly at our instructors. Have replicated our dishes many times since our return.

Moroccan cooking class. This was a fantastic experience at La Maison Arabe kitchen. The kitchen itself is state-of-the-art but in Moroccan fashion, the chef was very easy to understand and the staff very helpful. I am an experienced, passionate cook and the class still held my attention even though it is also designed to teach skills to the less experienced. It is completely hands-on. My class had two twenty-somethings, an eighty year old, and everything in between.
A must during your stay. My mother and I did this cooking class while staying in Marrakech I would highly recommend it this is a good introduction to the cooking culture .

Tajine Masters!. My husband and I enjoyed the course immensely. The general information about Moroccan cooking was also very useful. Also enjoyed the trip to the community bakery - wouldn't even have known it was there.

A must do when visiting Marrakech!. We attended this cooking course after reading the great reviews on trip advisor and various travel blogs and we were not disappointed!The set up of this cooking workshop is absolutely fantastic, set in idyllic gardens away from the hustle and bustle of the medina you are introduced to the history of Moroccan cuisine, the spices, herbs and influences.We were shown how to make traditional mint tea, bread and dessert and then started on our own dishes - a tagine, a cooked salad and a cold salad. The quality of the ingredients was excellent, the flavour at the end was incredible, and we were pleasantly surprised to receive a personal size tagine at the end of the day along with our completion certificate!The staff at the workshop were wonderful, they chatted to us all individually and couldn't be more welcoming. The workshop was informative, fun and extremely enjoyable, I would recommend to everyone travelling to Marrakech!Thank you to the team at La Maison Arabe for providing such a wonderful experience!

A Fantastic Experience . My Husband and I joined the cooking course whilst on a weekend break in the city.It was very well organised and we enjoyed ourselves immensely.The staff were very helpful and friendly and the cooking was easy to follow - even for my husband who wished to freestyle! Thank you for a lovely morning- one I'd recommend to anyone.

Wonderful and very professional experience. This was a lovely half-day activity. We met at the Maison Arabe in Marrakech and were transported to their country hotel which is well worth seeing by itself, with beautiful herb gardens. We had an introductory talk about Morroccan culture, food and cooking by our host who was clearly very passionate about her country and her talk was very informative. The cooking school is set up to be fool-proof so anyone can come away feeling like a successful chef! The teaching kitchen is professional with TV screens so you can watch what the chef is doing, and they have assistants who come round and make sure you know what to do. I really enjoyed making my own tagine and the lunch outside was lovely. We had ordered the wine pairings which turned out to be just one small glass of wine which wasn't really worth it. Overall I would highly recommend the workshop as it is taught very well and you will come away feeling like you have achieved something.

Fun experience with a professional touch. This course was very well organised and professionally presented. Wafa our host provided us with lots of interesting information about Moroccan cuisine. The course itself was enjoyable and the food we produced was so tasty. We also got a certificate and a tagine dish before we left, which was a lovely touch. Overall a great experience

Food and fun!. What a fun half-day activity! There were only two couples, so it felt like private cooking workshop. Our dada, Aida teached us to make Moroccan bread, khobz, taktuka and zalouk salads, chicken tagine and milk pastilla. Best meal we had in Marrakech - and self-made! We chose wine pairing, but the wines were indifferent, especially red. In the end they gave us tagine pots as gifts and of course certificates.

Excellent Experience! And A Perfect Way to Escape the Marrakech Mayhem!. Wow! Our group of 8 thoroughly enjoyed our half-day experience. The garden, the kitchen, the instructors -- it was all a delight. This program is well-organized, the kitchen is beautiful and well-equipped, and the instructors clearly enjoy what they do. They will even put a novice at ease. The food was tasty and everyone (even the men!) enjoyed their experience -- and the meal even more. Get the wine pairing. Why not? It's all well worth the price.

Developed and relaxing course. Had a great day out. After meeting at la Maison Arabe, we were surprised it was not here but a 10min drive away. The venue was worth the wait and a calm setting for a great day in the sun. The course was well developed and thought out with plenty of helpers. We took the wine option so ended up getting a bit drunk and it all was a blur after that. Would definitely recommend.

Best mint tea and best tagine in Morocco!!. This workshop deserves all the accolades I had read before booking. I was slightly concerned that I might be getting into an experience with a whole load of frustrated Jamie Oliver's/Mary Berry/Paul Hollywood/Delia Smiths etc. ..........but I needn't have worried! Our lovely group of a young Swiss couple, three French girls, my Mum and I from the UK and six Americans were soon chatting and laughing about the experiences we had already encountered on respective holidays in Marrakech. We were met at La Maison Arabe (if I can afford it next time I visit Marrakech, this is definitely where I will stay - beautiful interior, a real oasis of calm in the middle of the frenetic Medina and so luxurious!). Whilst we waited for everyone to arrive, we were treated to a presentation of a pot of mint tea. In our 4 days in Marrakech we drank a lot of mint tea - nowhere was it as good though as it is at La Maison Arabe - it was honestly amazing - I would be a convert to the drink if I could emulate that quality at home! We were then picked up in two air conditioned mini-buses and we took the interesting drive to the cookery workshop. Set in the midst of beautiful and peaceful gardens, we were welcomed and shown our cookery stations. Immaculately clean, with all the ingredients ready for us, sharp knives and all the implements needed along with the infamous tagine ready for us to start cooking with it. First though we had a very interesting talk about the spices used in Moroccan cooking, an excellent demonstration of how to make authentic and traditional mint tea (not sure I have time sadly to do this justice when at home in the UK!) and then a bread making demonstration which we were all invited to stretch the dough for our own individual flat breads before placing them in the brick oven on hot stones.We then saw a demonstration of pastry sweets being made and again we were invited to help. Then it was on to the real show.........the making of two typical Moroccan salads and a chicken tagine with lemons and olives. You are putting in your own ingredients so if you don't like olives, you don't have to have them. My mother can't stand garlic, so she didn't put it in her tagine.......she was, after all, going to be eating it after it was cooked! The staff who come around and helped you if needed were very encouraging and smiley.We were asked at one point to leave the tagines for a moment and to please sing "Happy Birthday"..........this was in my honour and it was a lovely moment - as too, was the cake and candle that came out when we were about to tuck into pudding after eating our tagines and salad!After we had made our food, the tagines were labelled up and we went and sat outside in the sunshine under a canopy at a huge table. It was like something from a film, everyone very easily chatting away and enjoying the food they had made. Water was provided, with wine a small chargeable extra.There was time to look around the small but very tasteful gift shop and we received our certificates which were presented with applause, along with a gift bag containing a ceramic tagine.I am so glad we trusted the reviews on Trip Advisor as this was definitely a real highlight of our holiday and one we have bored our friends and family with, talking about it and showing them all our photographs!!

Highlight of our trip!. Every moment and aspect of this cooking workshop felt very well thought. It is not simply a cooking class, it is a whole experience including a welcome tea with sweets, an interesting introduction to Moroccan cuisine, a hands-on bread and tea making session, and last but not least the cooking class. The room where the class took place was very spacious with very modern equipment and what amazed us most, especially after having spent a couple of days in the medina, was how spotless the place was!Everyone there was very pleasant to be around, and they all seemed happy to be there, the translator, the dada, the women preparing the bread and tea, and the two lovely girls assisting everyone with the cooking.Finally, we all enjoyed our deliciously cooked meals in the beautiful garden area, and were even treated to two different desserts that the dada (traditional cook) had prepared.Before leaving the grounds, we received a certificate and a tagine (the container not the food) which we thought was very generous of La Maison Arabe.

Highly Recommended. A few days before our short visit to Marrakech we saw that the weather was not looking good and so decided to book ourselves (myself and my 20 year old daughter) on to this cooking workshop for the Sunday morning. We are so pleased we did!From our meeting at La Maison Arabe Hotel where we received mint tea to our eating the delicious meal we had just prepared and being given a lovely tagine to take home it was all perfect and such a fun way to spend a half day.We learnt a lot and met some lovely other people doing the workshop, everyone at the workshop was helpful and friendly and it was a total joy to sit outside, drinking mint tea and watch bread being prepared and cooked in the bread oven before taking on some cooking ourselves.We prepared Chicken and Lemon tagine with expert tuition and also prepared two different salads, we were given a demonstration on how to make Moroccan biscuits which we tasted after our meal (yum!) and had sweet pastilla as dessert after our meal.A fantastic experience which I highly recommend.

One Of Our Favorite Memories. This cooking class will go down as one of our favorite memories in Morocco. First, the instructor does a great job of explaining the history behind Moroccan cuisine, and she even gave us a little tour of spices at a local shop. Additionally, the instructional kitchen is perfect. It's very modern and at each station, you have your own burners, sink, and even a screen that shows what the cook is doing every moment in case you're not near her station. We learned how to cook a chicken tagine, and two salads--one cooked and one half-cooked. Everything turned out so perfectly! As gifts, they even gave us small tagines to take home!

Loved it!. I would highly recommend taking this class. It was very informative and fun! The tour to the neighborhood community oven was very interesting. This is where the locals bring their dough to be baked in a large shared brick oven. We then when back to the hotel to do our cooking. We prepared 3 dishes and the bread. Our chef was able to knit together the history of Moroccan cooking with practical hands on experience which would be difficult to find anywhere else.

personal, friendly, educational, and a great experience!. This absolutely was one of the highlights of our trip! The staff was extremely friendly, professional, and an absolute pleasure to spend several hours with. The cooking stations at the hotel are complete with video and television monitors so that you can see everything that the dada is doing. They took their time to teach and the personal attention was not lost on us for even a moment. The hotel itself is also a delight, and we even liked the gift tagine at the end of the course!

An afternoon learning to cook Moroccan Chicken in a Tacine. La Maison Arabe has one of the best equipped teaching kitchens, I have ever scene. Each student has his own work station completely equipped with the very best items there are to offer. Each station has its own TV Monitor which follows the directions by one of their fabulous chefs. Mohammed Nahir does a wonderful job or organizing your event(s) so that the end result is a masterful job of learning a wonderful way to entertain your guest back home. I have recommended to all my friends to sign up for these classes. This will add immensely to your joy of visitingMarrachech. You will love the staff that enriches your day. Bill Burkhardt

A highlight of our trip. I booked a cookery course for my foodie partner's birthday and decided to tag along. We had to meet at maison arabe in the medina, a beautiful hotel would love to stay there. We were taken out to the country club and cookery school for our course. Stunning gardens, really lush and peaceful. The course was run by Mohammed, he was informative and great fun.I would recommend this course for anyone, experienced, non-cooks, families, everyone.
Good fun. A lovely way to spend a few hours, beautiful setting, and you get to cook your own lunch! Interesting way to learn about Moroccan food.

I loved this experience!. This is an experience I recommend 100%. The place is really nice, the workshop allows you to cook with the assistance of women from the country. The menu is very traditional and delicious. Recommended!

Entertaining delicious respite. Well worth your time in Marrakech! If you love Moroccan food and cooking this is for you. Meeting at La Maison Arabe riad, you go to their gardens, kitchen and firewood oven on the outskirts of the city. Wonderful set up, great intro to Moroccan cooking and we made the best tagine we had while in Morocco. Fun experience.

A great experience. If you are interested in learning a bit about Moroccan cooking then the half day experience at La Maison Arabe could well fit the bill. On the day we took part the class was held at their country club just outside Marrakech. The facilities were excellent and the staff who ran the class were really enthusiastic and helpful. We made a tagine and some salads and watched the chef make some biscuits and a pudding. We also enjoyed meeting the other participants over the lunch we had cooked.

A Treat for the Epicurean. I love to cook, and one of my favourite aspects of travel is collecting new insights into local cuisine. The Cooking Workshops at La Maison Arabe provided just such an opportunity. The experience deftly walks the line between authentic and modern by providing local instructors (and English-speaking translators) in a purpose-built pristine teaching kitchen complete with perfectly organized work stations and television monitors so you don't miss any steps. The whole thing happens at a beautifully kept property just outside town. Highlights of the experience include learning to make bread in a traditional oven (though you get to watch and eat the delicious bread you do not prepare it yourself) and being instructed in the subtleties of the Moroccan tea ritual. I would strongly recommend this experience for anyone with epicurean inclinations.

A Complete (and Wonderful) Experience. This is just a great time. You start at the beautiful Maison Arabe hotel with tea and cookies in the courtyard. And make sure to appreciate the incredible woodwork around doors and trim; some of the nicest that I've seen.Then a 15 minute ride in their van to their classroom kitchen out at the country club. The outside setting is beautiful and calm, with nice brickwork and herb gardens.First, we got a demonstration of traditional bread making in their wood fired oven. The woman making the bread shaped and kneaded the dough with the casual ease of someone that has done this thousands of times. Along with the bread making was a demonstration of making traditional Moroccan tea. And there is a definite technique and art to making this tea. So, at this point, we've had a lovely snack of bread fresh from the oven and a wonderful green/herb/mint tea.Then a tour of the herb gardens and explanations of what herbs are used in Moroccan cooking for what purposes (and what herb not used). And a quick look at their underground oven for roasting lamb (kind of a cross between a tandoori and burying the lamp under ground).Into the kitchen we went and it's just a beautiful, artful, elegant and modern/traditional space. Picture yourself on a cooking contest, with your own station, stove, cutting board, cutlery, and a bunch of ingredients.Before we started cooking, we got a demonstratoin of making a traditional sesame coated cookie, and an explanation (along with smells) of the various spices.Our host, Youssef led us through the various steps, with a chef at the front station demonstrating each thing we had to do. And you had a screen in front of you zoomed in to the chef's station to see exactly what was happening.At our sessions, we made the chicken tagine with preserved lemons (my favorite), a cooked tomato/eggplant salad, and a salad with fresh tomatoes and grilled green peppers.I'll let you experience the details for yourself, but the food came our great. Everyone from the most experienced chef to super beginners produced a result they enjoyed. I have to say it was the best preserved lemon chicken tagine that we had during our week in Morocco.Then we all sat at the long tables in front of the cook stations and enjoyed an leisurely dinner, each chowing down on our individually cooked dishes. With the dinner, we had more freshly made bread, mineral water and (if you choose, and pay extra) wine.If the hub hub and frantic pace of Marrakesh gets a bit much, this is just an amazing and fun experience. Definitely great for family time. The skeptics in our family came away smiling and more than content.

Bring the family!. Anything La Maison Arabe can be trusted, and the cooking workshops are no exception. From start to finish, this operation was thoughtfully executed and made for a delicious experience. Pros: beautiful grounds, high quality ingredients and cookware, educational Cons: if you are short on time in Marrakech, this may not suit your itinerarySuggestions: make this a couple or family experience

wonderful environment with upscale equipments. If you have 4.5 hours to spare and love cooking and Moroccan food then is totally worth it. I was impressed by how well the kitchen classroom is equipped and there were no downtime in the entire experience. Also, it was nice to be away from the city/medina and enjoy the nature. A bit pricey ( 600dhs per person and do not expect the food to taste good) but just for the experience and something to do other than staying in the Medina. At the end of the class you also get a real Tagine pot as a gift but I wonder how they expect travellers to put that into their suitcase when there are so many more attractive souvenir you can occupy your suitcase with. Is a nice gesture but they should consider a smaller gift that is less heavy and fits into the luggage.

Wonderful cooking experience. My wife and I attended a cooking workshop with La Maison Arabe on our honeymoon, and we couldn't recommend it more! The setting--in a little villa just outside the city--was beautiful, and our instructors were delightful. The cooking space itself was amazing--spacious with great equipment and even some high-tech touches like a closed circuit camera to watch what the instructors were doing. The class itself was extremely fun, and not one of those classes where you're just a bystander. We actually did all of the cooking and the spicing ourselves. The lunch setting was great, where we ate our own three course meal coupled with a wine pairing. And, to top it all, they gave us each our own tagine at the end!

Fantastic Experience in a Lovely Setting. This was a remarkably well organized, fun, and useful experience. The staff shared their extensive knowledge of Moroccan cuisine. A definTe highlight of our trip.

One of the highlights of my trip!. This cooking class was so well organized and informative. They go over the spices and some of the history behind them. We baked fresh bread. They even taught us the secrets to making a delicious pot of mint green tea which was one of my questions before arriving to the class. The dish that we made was fairly simple and extremely delicious. The staff was helpful and patience (I can't cook!) so that was an accomplishment. The gift presented at the end was such a surprise and just what I wanted. I highly recommend this cooking class!

Engaging, informative & delicious. We had reserved our places on this cookery class and weren't disappointed by the experience. It was definitely the highlight of our stay. Once all the guests arrived at the main hotel, we were driven in a minibus to another location set in peaceful, well tended gardens, where the class actually took place. There were 14 participants in total. The introduction was informative and we were then shown how bread and tea is made. A cookie making demo followed. Then came the main event, the cooking class. We made a chicken tagine and an aubergine side dish and salad. The cooking stations are equipped with a TV screen so that you can see the chef at the front. There were also chefs walking between stations to help us.It was a fantastic experience and one that is highly recommended.

BRILLIANT Recommend+++++. Well worth the money. Small group start at meeting at a hotel with tea and biccys. Then taken to another place- one you didn't realise existed. Water provided with a sit down chat about the La Maison and Morocco. The lady speaking (forgotten her name) had brilliant English and even added extra to the people on the course who are Americans by saying aubergine and eggplant, herbs and 'erbs!! It was really informative and thorough. Watched the bread making and tea making. Then made enough food to feed double and was sooo delicious. Mention at the start if your veggie as will be eating own food and they will alter your ingredients. The place was spotlessly clean. When all is done you get a lovely gift.This foodshop has made me rethink any trip I do as i will be doing more of them. Just hope they are as good as La Maison (and I don't think anything will compare) Would recommend this workshop to ANYONE of all ages.

Fabulous Learning Experience. Whilst in Marrakech October 2015, we wanted to learn about Moroccan cooking and booked to do a half day course with La Maison Arabe. What a fabulous set up they have away from the city, very serene indeed. Mohammed Nahir patiently took us through the essence of Moroccan cooking, the herbs & spices used and we were shown how to make the mint tea.Then we went into the kitchen and wow, what a set up, very professional and lots of support to learn techniques used in preparing our tagines and the accompanying side salads. It was such a great experience to prepare, cook and then what we had just learnt to do.The staff helping us were just terrific and can't recommend this experience enough, including being presented with our actual tagging at the end. Very good value for money.

Insights into the unique and savory tastes Moroccan cooking with hands on satisfying results1. The workshop is located on a beautiful property outside of the city, filled with herbal gardens and open oven pits. After being treated to the basic secrets of success we were lead into a most beautiful, colorful Moroccan Kitchen environment, with all the technology and tools of the most modern cooking school. The Demonstrations for us to follow were close up and the cooks then came around to help individually and answer questions. We ended up with the most wonderful individually made Tagines and a most memorable experience. We cannot wait to use our Tagine pots and home and try the other traditional dishes we were taught

Culinary delights at cookery school. A huge thanks to the cookery school team :-) Informative website, excellent communication and ease of booking were the best start. However, the day itself inlcluding organisation, staff, itinerary, location and the overall experience surpassed our expectations. Highly recommended for any would be chefs or those with an interest in Moroccan cuisine.

Spectacular Moroccan cooking class. La Maison Arabe Cooking School far exceeded my high expectations! Who would know that in Marrakech there would be such a high tech and professional facility? Not to mention the gracious hostess who taught the class in English and French. And Dada the chef! We prepared an eggplant salad and lamb with couscous and ate our lunch in a beautiful garden setting. It was all wonderful!

Excellent Experience. The other reviewerss have detailed the workshop - all first class so I will elaborate on the staff. We've taken a few cooking classes while traveling all around the world and my husband and I agree that Mohammed Nahir and his staff (the beautiful Wafaa and the clever Dada) were the best. The instruction and the hands-on assistance were excellent. Recipes provided along with an e-mail address for followup (which I've already utilized and received a prompt response). We've ordered our tagine and hope to replicate our experience at the excellent cooking workshop at La Maison Arabe. Oh and the food was good too!

Simple, effective insight into Morroccan cuisine with tasty results in the kitchen!. I attended the cooking workshop from la Maison Arabe: the course was extremely well organised, and the staff were clear, effective and made the atmosphere really friendly!Started with a really good talk from Mohammed on the background basics to Morroccan cuisine, including spices and cultural traditions.We then tasted some freshly (in front of our eyes) baked tafernout (bread) with local dips, and had a class in making the mint tea so central to social life there.Finally we went in the kitchen to cook a chicken tagine, salad, dip and biscuit. Amina who took us through it, and her aids were really efficient and clear, and although I would class myself as a confident cook, I learned new techniques, as well as the recipes. The results were incredibly tasty (far more so than I expected).We then all had lunch together, and were given a copy of the recipes, along with a gift from La Maison Arabe.Finally back home, I had a couple of questions for Mohammed, so emailed him, and got a friendly and very prompt answer to all of my questions!All in all, I would say that regardless of experience, this was a fun, and very useful activity, and would thoroughly recommend it!

I love my Tagine. Took the cooling course off site of the hotel in a beautiful setting and in a clean kitchen...equipped with everything needed.After the course we were able to all sit together and taste our creation.We were also given the Tagine to take home.I bought all the spices in the Medina and have made Chicken Tagine a few times and the delicious smells remind me of that wonderful day!

Fun way to spend an afternoon away from the crowds. Fun cooking class not at La Maison Arabe, but offsite. We met at the hotel, which is lovely and worth seeing, and were transported with a small group to the cooking class. Loved dining on what we'd prepared and enjoyed the Moroccan wine pairings with our meal.

Bought ingredients at Marrakech medina then cooked, Moroccan style.. Karisma took us to the market to buy fresh chicken spices and vegetables. We then went to her rhiad and cooked a chicken tagines with supervision, learning much more about Moroccan life as we did. Karisma was friendly gentle and fun, and we were pleased we had done it.

Great experience . My friend and I attended this wonderful workshop. We were greeted by very friendly staff and given an introduction into marrocan cooking. We were given print outs of the recipes we were to prepare and pencils and pad to take notes.We then went into the beautiful kitchen with your own work station with a TV so you could see everything the dada was doing. We made chicken bastillia and an aubergine salad. Which I would never have tried off of a restaurant menu so I was grateful as it was lovely, and very filling. My friend doesn't like egg and she let them know, she was given an alternative recipe of a traditional chicken and preserved lemon tagine. Whilst the food was cooking we went to watch and participate in making bread in an outside beautiful bread oven. Then we had a tea ceremony and tasted the bread with argon oil, honey, or olive oil dips. We then had the food we had prepared for our lunch. Followed by a pudding the dada had made and some biscuits.At the end we were given a certificate and a little tagine.

An informative and interesting day in fantastic settings and great teachers!. We went for a cookery class at the beautiful "secret" country club of Maison Arabe. We had a great day in their exquisite gardens with a variety of activities including sampling and cooking local breads, tea tastings, and cooking and eating chicken and preserved lemon tagging with a courgette salad. All delightful, so nice we came back for our final day to relax at the country club!

Cook your own tangine and flatbread.. Fabulous way to spend a morning. Watch them baking flatbreads in the oven then cook your own tangine and salads. Great facilities, everything in perfect English and you get a certifcate afterwards and your own tangine. Cannot recommend highly enough.

A must do in Marrakech!!!. Having read the reviews my husband and I decided to do the cooking course. It was an amazing experience from start to finish. They explain the history behind the ingredients and the traditional moroccan cooking method. They start by making delicious fresh bread in an olden style clay oven and mint tea. They show you where they grow their spices. Then they take you in to the state of the art kitchen that has a beautiful morrocan theme and tv monitor at every work station so that you can clearly follow the cook. You don't have to be a great cook, the class is very well taught step by step by the dada (chef). You'll be wanting to try the recipes at home by the end of the class!

Great activity - learnt so much!. For food lovers this is a must! I did think it was a little pricey but you get so much for your money.
